title: What to do: Cases reverting to Unassigned Status
content: Sometimes a ticket may switch to an "Unsassigned" Status, even after an agent has handled it. Like the example below: ​ What is the reason for this? After an agent handles the case, they have to complete the necessary ACW. If they do not, the case will get unassigned until the case handling has been finalized (no matter which status was inserted, even awaiting response). This happens because any agent can handle the case later, it doesn't stay with one person only. The only exception is if we are pending on the customer, and they reply in less than 8 hours. If this is the case, it system will automatically re-assign the case to the same agent as before.

title: Logistic Claims
content: Emma Learning Hub Training: here (do not use until further notice) Release Note: this article replaces "Claims: Logistic claims". Added guide on how to register a logistic claim . Added ​Logistic Claim: How to verify if the order was shipped incorrectly TABLE OF CONTENTS Logistic Claim: What ​ Logistic Claim: How to register How to: Submit a Logistic Claim in Sprinklr Claim Reasons Lost In Transit Incorrect Shipment Damages Carrier Misbehaviour Documentation Needed Logistic Claim: What Logistic claims are complaints of the customers related to inconveniences experienced during the delivery/return of the products that they’ve ordered. Claims can lead to a cancellation, return, replacement, or even monetary compensation (which is a possible refund of a certain amount of the cost paid by the Customer, based on the country-specific Compensation matrix). ​ ​ Claim Reasons Customers may reach us for multiple reasons, whether it be a carrier misbehavior, or due to an item never being received (as a lost item by the carrier, for example). IMPORTANT: a delay in delivery should not be logged as a logistic Claim, but instead, under WIMO category. First Decision to take: What is the reason of the customer claim? You can find below the reasons you may face when handling a logistic claim and an explanation of when to use each of them. In the dropdown you'll be able to under ​ Lost In Transit When the customer may get a notification of receiving the product, but they contact us informing that they didn't received (a whole parcel is missing (not part of a product - that would be a product claim ). There is a miscommunication between both parties and we need to take the required actions depending on the situation. ​ 1. Types of Lost In Transit cases: Lost or stolen: A tracking number is available in the OMS and it works on the carrier website. However, the tracking update states "delivered" but the customer didn't received the product or one of the items they should've ( OBS : here we consider items under the same fulfillment and tracking number, meaning: items that should've arrived altogether ). ​ Lost in transit: In that case, a tracking number is available in the OMS and it works on the carrier website. However, the latest update on the carrier website was over 10 days ago (e.g. the website says that the parcel is in transit). ​ No tracking possible : A tracking number is available in the OMS and it works on the carrier. However, there has never been any update on the carrier website (e.g. the website says that the order information has been transmitted and status is like this for >10 days ago). ​ Market exception: For CH orders please consider a timeline of 20 days instead of 10 to accommodate special operational delays related to customs & warehouse expeditions in the country. No supplement should be created for Lost in Transit and No tracking Possible before the 20 days. ​ 2. Actions to perform: Identify if the parcel can be considered lost: check the parcel status (and the time that it's stuck on it) in the carrier tracking portal or Order Status Page. Pay attention if there's any sort of observation related to the order, e.g: incorrect address, or an attempt of delivery that failed and they will try to reship the product. If so, this shouldn't be considered a claim. Just clarify with the customer what happened and the next steps. ​ Check the proof of shipment/delivery if the customer didn't received the item and the tracking says "delivered": legally, carriers must deliver the product only for the buyer or authorized people to receive it, with a signature available upon delivery time. This document should be available to our Customer service teams. Where to find this document can vary depending on the market partner's website. If no proof of shipment is available, we must consider the claim of the customer valid and assume the shipment was incorrectly delivered. ​ If the proof of shipment is available but it has no signature/signature is not clear, send what we have to the customer and check if they recognize it. If they do, it's not a logistic claim. If they don't, also assume that the shipment was incorrectly delivered. ​ Actions: On incorrect deliveries, we require a legally binding declaration signed by the customer (RVE Template). You also must attach the proof of shipment - a screenshot of the delivery status as per the reference by the end of this article (Parcel Perform screenshot). If you need to manually add the documentation to the ticket and don't know how: review the article Sprinklr: How to handle tickets. ​ ​ Please contact the carrier if the parcel is stuck in the same status for >10 days. Ask about the order using this link . If carrier replies with a delivery date, inform costumer accordingly (once the order arrives, customer may be eligible for compensation - check the rules). If it doesn't reply or status don't change in 2 business days, please follow the same process of the items that have the status "delivered" but never arrived. ​ If the item is considered lost: please check with the customer if they would like us to re-ship the item by creating a supplement (check here ).  The other option would be to cancel and to do a full refund. For this, please refer to the following table: Fluent – Fulfillment Status Order Status Action and team ON FLUENT COMMERCE: Ready for dispatch/Dispatched/ Arrived at sorting center/Out for delivery/Requested for delivery option/Lost order/Delivery delay/Picked up/AT_DEPOT BUT THE CARRIER TRACKING WEBSITE SHOWS: Lost or Missing ​ Shipped Open a Jira here Use the Refund Topic "Cancel and Refund" with the reason for refund "Cancellation" Make sure to attach the proof of order being Lost (screenshot of carrier tracking or carrier confirmation). ​ ON FLUENT COMMERCE: Complete Complete with Proof of Delivery (screenshot of Proof of Delivery from carrier) Open a Jira here ​ ​ Use the Refund Topic "Refund Initiation" with the reason for refund "Cancellation" Make sure to attach proof of Delivery and clarify why it's not valid or if not available at all, validating the claim from customer. IMPORTANT: it’s mandatory to attach any proof that the order was Delivered and claimed Lost by customer, or proof of it being Lost by the carrier on their page, otherwise OM and Refund team will reject your request. ​ Incorrect Shipment When an incorrect SKU is delivered to the customer. How to verify if order was shipped incorrectly Request label pictures from the customer Compare the SKU on the label with the one listed in Fluent: ​ According to your findings, follow one of the scenários below: A. Same SKU - Correct shipment If it’s the same SKU → Correct product shipped, the order was shipped correctly . Do not supplement, as the same item will likely be sent again. If the customer does not want to keep the item → process a return with refund. B. Different SKU - Incorrect shipment If it’s a different SKU → the wrong product was shipped, order was shipped incorrectly .​ ​ For minor issues (e.g., color variation), offer compensation, for the customer to keep the item. If customer accepts, request the refund via Jira to ARD2C 1 . ​ If customer does not accept the compensation , or it is not applicable: Check stock for the correct item (same SKU) 2 . If there is stock , supplement the correct product if customer agrees If there is no stock Check the replacement matrix for a similar SKU 3 , and check it's stock: If there is a similar SKU and stock is available → offer the customer the possibility of supplement similar Sku. If they accept it, process the supplement and create a return without refund for the original item; If there is a similar SKU , but stock is not available → return with refund ​ If customer does not wish to receive a supplement: Process a return with refund, if they are still within the trial period 4 Note : Anything that falls outside this flow, please raise to your supervisor (note: make sure you followed every available step before raising the case) Need help with any of the steps? Check the dropdowns below (third-pane view, only): How to: issue Logistic Claims Compensation via JIRA 1 How to: Check Stock Availability 2 Ref: Replacement matrix 3 How to: check if order is within trial period 4 ​ ​ ​2. Actions to perform If something was delivered wrong, we need to make sure the wrong item is returned to our warehouse and the proper ordered one is reshipped as a supplement order (zero cost for the customer). ​ Damages Logistic Claims related to the quality of the package during the delivery time. ​ 1. Types of Damages: Product & Box damaged/Product damaged during assembly : when the box/package is damaged and the product inside as well, it means that the damage happened during the delivery and the item will need to be replaced by a new product. If the product was damaged during the assembly, the process is the same. ​ Package damaged, product intact : if only the box is damaged, we guarantee the quality of the product and it should not be replaced and customer should not be compensated either . For exceptions, please ensure you follow your market-related guidelines. ​ OBS: If the box is intact but the product inside is damaged, we consider it a quality issue, which falls under product claims. ​ 2. Actions to perform: Please refer to the article [Online: D2C: EU] Product & Logistic Claims : Damage & Incomplete item(s) . Carrier Misbehaviour When the carrier inappropriately or fails to comply with expected standards during the delivery or handling of the goods. 1. Types of Carrier Misbehaviour cases: Additional service not provided : The extra service was not provided by the carrier (dis-/assembly service, old mattress removal, room of choice delivery, did not show up to pickup/return appointment). Carrier unprofessional behavior: The customer complains about rude or unprofessional behavior from the carrier which does not cause any monetary damage (e.g. confrontations or inappropriate interactions with customer). Delivered to wrong address/wrong person but customer received the product : The product was initially delivered to a different person or different address but the customer received the product in the end. Property damaged - financial cost : The carrier damages the customer's property during the delivery or collection of products, resulting in monetary damage. Property damaged - no cost : The carrier damaged the customer's property during the delivery or collection of products, but the customer does not provide an invoice and does not suffer from monetary damage. Returned without delivery attempt : Customer claims the carrier did not ring the bell or leave any note. No re-delivery attempt. The carrier did not ring the bell or leave any note or there's no re-delivery attempt. 2. Actions to perform: Is the costumer claiming a cost/asking for a reattempt? If the answer is yes : For property damage : the customer will need to sign an RVE (Legal Binding declaration) template, to provide a picture of the damage, a picture of the repair and an invoice for the repair costs. Also, when filling the claim in the Guided Workshow in Sprinklr, you'll also be asked to input a screenshot from the carrier website of current status. As soon as it's done, you'll need to open a ticket on the ARD2C Jira. If the repair <100€ (invoice), supervisor can approve, for repair >100€, please Emma internals to get approval before promissing payment to the customer. Please leave notes of the case. For additional service not provided : If the service was expected to be provided (e.g., requested by the customer or advertised by Emma), please contact the carrier to ensure its fulfillment. If that happens, we don't offer compensation. But, if the customer contact us explaining that the carrier did not assemble the product but he did, please offer a maximum value of 25 euros in compensation by filling a ticket to the ARD2C team. Please leave a note on the case mentioning which service was not provided, when, why it wasn't provided, if the customer was contacted by the carrier and how the case was solved. For returned without delivery attempt : please review the Tracking information on Order Status Page or the Tracking website of the carrier. If the carrier failed to provide/provided inconsistent information for the customer and the item was Returned to Sender, proceed with supplementing the order. ​ If the answer is no : it generally means that the customer is upset by the carrier standards but there's no damage in the product. In that case, we don't offer compensation, but you should still create a logistic claim for incident report and leave notes on Sprinklr (what happened, when, where, specify in which way did the carrier behave unprofessionally) Please apologize the customer for the unmet expectations and thank them for bringing the topic to our attention. Inform them that we will leave the records of the claims in our system and that our logistic team will take this up and improve the services. ​ ​ Logistic Claim: How to register Logistic claims must be logged using the Guided Worfklow in Sprinklr. ​ ​ ​ How to: Submit a Logistic Claim in Sprinklr ​ Documents and templates Legally Binding Declaration (RVE Template): ​ What is it? It is a signed statement from the customer that is used to officially confirm events such as: non-receipt of products, damaged or tampered packages or unauthorized charges or deliveries. Once signed, the person becomes responsible for the accuracy of the information and could face legal consequences if it's false. When to send the RVE to customer? When the customer claims the product has not been delivered and if the tracking doesn't clearly state that the parcel was not returned to the sender. How to send it? RVE forms can only be sent and received via email, and will need to be sent to and received from the same email address that is connected to the order in question on OMS. Each market will have a document in your customers' language to attach to the Logistic Claim, please find the RVE forms: here . Notes: BR market can be covered by the PT Template AU market can be covered by the EN Template MX; CL and CO markets can be covered by the spanish Template ​ ​ ​ Proof of Shipment What is it? A proof of shipment is a screenshot (of "Track Order" on ParcelPerform or the status part on the Carriers Tracking Page) that confirms the delivery. When to use it? If the customer signs a legally binding declaration, you should always attach the Proof of Delivery as well when filling the Logistic Claim. It will look like this: Market exception : For FR, a picture of the customer's ID is also required. However, in these cases, the unnecessary details on the ID card should be redacted/covered, since we only need the name and signature to open the carrier investigation. ​ pdf Claim Management - Logistic (final).pdf 0.22 MB png M6.3 Logistic Claims 2.0.png 0.09 MB

title: [Content Block] - Product Quality Validation Guidebook - Mattresses
content: Validation guide Best practices for mattress claims If a customer contacts us about a mattress not inflating or its smell, please: Inform them that mattresses can take up to 72 hours to fully inflate . Advise that the smell can take up to 72 hours to dissipate. These timelines are based on quality tests. If the specified time has not yet passed, ask the customer to wait. We do not validate claims before this period to avoid unnecessary replacements. If the issue persists after 72 hours, we will support the customer further. General View Product Foam Core Fabric Cover Springs Air Grid Layer Inflation & Recovery issues Claim validation guide Dimension Deviation Claim validation guide Smell Plastic Foil Open Sagging/Dipping Broken / Holes Claim validation guide Dirty / Color issue / Discolouration Glue / Gluing issue Threads coming out Dirty Holes Zipper / Handles breaking Dirty / Rusty Springs visible on top layer Dirty / Color issue / Discolouration Scoping questions On what type of bed are you using the mattress? How old is the bed? Oftentimes, what seems to be an issue with the mattress, is actually caused by an issue with the bed. To address the root cause, we need to be sure the product issue is not caused by a bad state of the bed. Please put the mattress on a flat floor. This is needed to ensure we can a) spot any deviations, and b) be sure the issue is not caused by the bed. Please take off the cover of the mattress. This will help us spot the product issue more clearly. New Tab Content New Tab Content

title: How to: Use compensation Matrix (Product Claim)
Product Claims: (How to Determine the) Outcomes of the Product Claim
content: Release Note: 11/11/2025 - replaced link to replacement matrix folder with tab with files per market (decision point 4) Table of Contents 1. Possible Claim outcomes 2. Deciding the Outcome 3. How to: Process the Outcome of the Claim 1. Possible Claim outcomes There can be five outcomes to any product claim Claim Rejected by Agent : The product claim was not valid. Compensation Request Created : The customer accepted a monetary compensation for the quality issue. Supplement Created : Only possible in the case of a spare part. Refund Request Created : This option should never be selected for Product Claims Return and Supplement Request Created : The customer will receive a replacement item. This can also be spare parts. Replaced with the same SKU Replaced with a comparable SKU Return and Refund Request Create : The customer will return the faulty item and will receive a full refund. 2. Deciding the Outcome of the Claim To know which one you should do, it is important to follow the below steps in the correct order. Decision point 1: Is the product's usage affected? Depending on the description and the images you received, use common sense to determine if the product is still usable. Offer the customer two options: Option 1: Compensation Offer the customer a compensation, according to the compensation matrix . Explain to the customer that "The raised issue does not affect the usage of the product." Because the product didn't match the customer's expectations, you can offer them a compensation. Outcome of the claim = "Compensation request created" ​ Option 2: Offer a replacement Especially if you notice the product's usage will likely be affected, offer the customer a free replacement for their faulty product. Initiate a return to have the customer send us back the faulty item. Outcome of the claim = "Return and supplement created" If the product is no longer usable Proceed to the 'Decision point 2'. Decision point 2: Can this issue be resolved by sending a spare part? You must first decide if this issue can be resolved by sending a spare part. For instance, a broken bed stand can be replaced by a new stand - no need to send an entire bed. ​ ​Not sure if a spare part is available? Check the Product Quality Guidebook We currently have spare parts available for mattress covers (depending on your market). In Belgium, Netherlands, Germany, Austria, Switzerland and France, we also have spare parts for Box Bed v5 (BBv5), Storage Bed and the Slatted Frame bed. Option 1: Spare part avalailable Proceed with the process for sending a spare part . ​ Outcome of the claim = "Supplement request created" ​ Option 2: No spare part available If there is no option to send a spare part, proceed with checking if a replacement is available. Decision point 3: Is the same SKU available in stock for sending a replacement? You must be sure that we have a replacement SKU available in stock. That way, the customer will be sure to receive a replacement. Option 1: Same SKU is available for replacement Replace the faulty item with a new one, by Creating a supplement, AND Initiating a return of the faulty item. Need a reminder how to create supplements? Review the information here . ​ Outcome of the claim = "Return and supplement created" ​ Option 2: No supplement is available Go to the next decision step 'Is a comparable SKU available'? For detailed instructions how to check for stock, review the below content. Decision point 4: Is a comparable SKU available in stock? - Under Discussion Check if you can replace the faulty item with a comparable item, using the file corresponding to your market below. Option 1: Comparable SKU is available for replacement Replace the faulty item with a new one, by creating a supplement using a comparable SKU. Initiate a return for the customer to send us back the faulty item. Need a reminder how to create supplements? Review the information here. ​ Outcome of the claim = "Return and supplement request created" ​ Option 2: No comparable SKU supplement is available Proceed with a full refund for the customer. Outcome of the claim = 'Return and refund request created' 3. How to: Process the outcome of the claim Claim rejected by agent Compensation request created Supplement Created (Spare part) Return and Supplement Request Created Full refund Log the outcome of the case in Sprinklr as 'Claim rejected by agent'. Ensure all claim information is logged on the case. Close the case. That's it. Give the customer a compensation, according to the compensation matrix . Submit the compensation via the AR D2C Jira Portal . Use the following fields: 'Refund topic': Refund initiation 'Reason for refund': Compensation - Product claim Need a refresher about compensation requests, visit this page . See instructions on the page ' Product Claims: Spare Parts ' blabla New Tab Content

title: Product Claims: Customer Instructions for Product Claims
content: Introduction Currently one of the challenges you as an agent might face, is how to explain the customer what and how to take the proper product pictures for a valid Product Claim. ​ Here you can find all the templates to send to the customer on how to take properly the pictures for their specific product claim topic. To make it simple we have it available in several languages, therefore the breakdown will be per language per topic. ​ Note: We have also added example of the label pictures, these can't be shared with the customer but will help you explain to the customer how they llok like ​ Please note: It's mandatory to use this templates when requesting pictures to the customers ​ Release Note: 03/11/2025 - Added tab & file for The Netherlands | 05/11/2025 - Added additional files for The Netherlands ​ Label picture is not available In case the label is not available is the product make sure to follow the steps bellow: ​ Step 1: Customer Cannot Provide Label Photo If the customer states the product label is missing or unattached and cannot provide a photo, proceed to the next step. Step 2: Send Legal Form Share this legal form: ​ docx Dutch - Ontbrekend productlabel.docx 0.13 MB docx English - Missing product label.docx 0.13 MB docx French - Étiquette du produit manquante.docx 0.13 MB docx German - Fehlendes Produktetikett.docx 0.13 MB docx Italian - Etichetta del prodotto mancante.docx 0.13 MB docx Portuguese - Etiqueta de produto em falta.docx 0.13 MB docx Spanish - Etiqueta de producto faltante.docx 0.13 MB Instruct the customer to fill out and return the completed form. Explain that this form replaces the product label photo in the claims process. Step 3: Customer Refuses to Sign Legal Form If the customer refuses to sign or return the legal form: Clearly explain that the form is required to process their claim internally. Emphasize that this is a standard requirement when the product label is missing. Step 4: Customer Remains Adamant & Refuses to Sign the Legal Form If the customer continues to refuse after your explanation: Accept the claim without the product label photo or the signed legal form. ​ Only proceed in this way if: The product label is genuinely unavailable, and The customer explicitly refuses to sign the form after being informed of its necessity. Step 5: Document the Interaction Record in the claim notes: That the product label was unavailable. That the legal form was offered and refused. That the claim is being processed without the label photo or signed form due to customer insistence. Step 6: Proceed with Claim Processing Continue with the standard claims process, ensuring all other required information is collected and documented. ​ These are the topics available: ​ Microfibre pillows, duvets, bedding & mattress protectors Foam pillow Beds & slatted frames Issues with inflation or recovery of the mattress Dimension deviation of length, width or height - title: Product Claims: Exception for moldy mattress
content: UK - Moldy Mattresses If any new customers contact us to report that they’ve received a moldy mattress , please escalate the case number directly to  your team lead and tag the Performance and Quality Managers (@Carolina Luz and @Newsha Afkha) on the Case Notes. We’ll be coordinating the collection process internally to allow for a deeper investigation into these cases. key-words Mold; Moldy; Product; Claim ​ ​ What to do: Report the case to EMMA: Tag @Carolina Luz and @Newsha Afkhami on the Case Notes * Open a JIRA ticket to us. You may use the following template: ​ Hey team, We’ve received a Product Claim reporting Mold. Sprinklr Case Nr: XXX Claimed SKU: XXX Please find the pictures of the issue attached Thanks Reply to customer using the template below Offering a Resolution If customer insists on receiving a replacement, we are entitle as per legal advice, not to offer a replacement for these customers, then you will send the following statement:  "Please note that instead of offering a replacement or a repair, we can instead opt for issuing a refund, if we find that it would not be possible to replace a specific product due to a lack of available defect-free stock. As such, since this is what is happening in your case, we will be providing you with a full refund for this item and the previously mentioned additional compensation." Newsha might ask you to hold the return so we can collect the mattress for inspection, so please make sure to tag us as soon as the case arrive to receive instructions for next steps. Template for customer first contact Dear [Customer's first name] , Thank you for reaching out to us and bringing this issue to our attention. Firstly, we would like to start by offering our sincere apologies for the experience you have had with one of our products. We completely understand how upsetting it can be to deal with an issue like this, and we truly regret any inconvenience this may have caused you. Please rest assured that we take our customers’ satisfaction and our quality control very seriously. As such, we are already actively addressing this matter internally, to ensure that our products maintain the highest quality standards. In order to resolve this without further inconvenience, we are trying to organize a collection of your Emma insert product designation: mattress/pillow/etc with our carrier. If this proves impossible within a reasonable time frame, we will let you know and work with you to find an alternative way of removal and disposal of this item. Nonetheless, we would like to assure you that a full refund for this product is already being requested with priority status. Finally, as a gesture of goodwill for your patience and understanding on this matter, we would like to offer you an additional compensation of 10% of the amount paid for this item, on top of the full refund we have already requested for it. Please note that due to the way our system is set up, these transfers can take up to 14 working days to clear in your account. Once again, we truly apologize for the experience you had with this order, and we look forward to hearing from you soon, so that we can assist you further in sorting everything out. Kind regards, FAQ Session: (Will be filled soon)

title: Product Claims: Extensive End-to-End Description of the process (training guide)
content: Table of Contents Visual Overview of the Process, end-to-end Explanation of subprocesses under the Product Claim Flow Information you need to ask from the customer Verify if the images are legit Validate the pictures against the Product Claim Guidebooks Determine the outcome of the case Logging the outcome of the case using the Guided Workflow in Sprinklr Process the outcome of the claim Still have questions? 1. Visual Overview of the Process, end-to-end ​ Figure 1: Flowchart for how to handle a Product Claim case (source - Emma Process team only: here ). 2. Explanation of subprocesses under the Product Claim Flow 2.A) Information you need to ask from the customer Ensure all the below information is logged on the case before you close it. Pictures of the Defect 1 photo of the overview of the product: The whole product must be visible, including the affected area. 1 Photo of the affected area specific. More information and example images can be found in the guidebook related to the product type. The Fulfilment Article Reference (FAR) Pictures of the Product Label Clear and readable pictures of the item's product label. This can be taken either from the product box or from the product itself. Examples can be found in the Product Quality Guidebook, for each product type Description of Defect It is mandatory to leave a note on the ticket with a clear description of the issues the customer encountered with the product. This note should always start with "CLAIM DESCRIPTION:" and should be as complete as possible. Examples : Example 1: "CLAIM DESCRIPTION: Customer had the product for 3 days, used it and then noticed that, due to sweat, the foam was getting stained." Example 2: "CLAIM DESCRIPTION: Customer unboxed the product and immediately noticed that the pillow had a yellow stain on the cover." If you were unable to obtain the above information, please inform your supervisor on how to proceed. 2.B) Verify if the images are legit Always double-check what kind of photo is being provided. Ask yourself these questions: Step 1: Is it an Emma product? Does the photo provided match the product the customer ordered? You can check this with Fluent Commerce / Magento. Step 2: Is the photo scrapped from the internet? Does this photo look like something taken off the internet? Suspicious behavior If you suspect the photo may be a photo that was scrapped (taken off the internet), there is a simple way to check that: Open Google Reverse Image Search Click on the "Search by Image" option (camera icon): Select the "Upload an Image" option, and select the photos provided by the customer Once you have done this, Google will show you if there are any visually similar images on the internet, which may lead to the conclusion as to if they are legitimate proof of claim. If you find that the pictures are not original or not from an Emma product, reject the claim and inform your supervisor. 2.C) Validate the pictures against the Product Claim Guidebooks Note: Need a refresher on the product claim categories? Slatted Frames Tools Dirty/Rusty/Mouldy Beds, Sofa Beds & Slatted Frames Tools Missing Part Beds, Sofa Beds & Slatted Frames Tools Part doesn‘t fit How to use the Quality Guidebook? Each instruction page contains the following items Claim Component : The part of the product that is affected Claim reason : Classification of what is wrong with the product Description​ : Description of the defect reason Acceptance Range​ : If the issue from the customer is within the range, the product is not faulty and you must reject the claim (look at the 'Note' section). If the issue is out of the acceptable range, we must accept that the product claim is valid. Note​ : A description of what you can tell the customer to explain why we can or cannot reject their claim. Pictures : Example pictures of the information you need to collect to process the product claim case. Click on ' View ' to see the whole Guidebook If the product claim is not valid , reject the product claim. Describe to the customer why we cannot accept the raised claim as a defect. If you are unsure if the product claim is valid , contact your supervisor to discuss. Mattresses Beds Accessories Spare Parts : We have spare parts available for the Box Bed v5 (BBv5) bed. Before supplementing, always check if we can supplement only the spare part. See the instructions in ' Product Claims: Spare Parts ' 2.D) Determine the Outcome of the Case To know which one you should do, it is important to follow the below steps in the correct order. Decision point 1: Is the product's usage affected? Depending on the description and the images you received, use common sense to determine if the product is still usable. Offer the customer two options: Option 1: Compensation Offer the customer a compensation, according to the compensation matrix . Explain to the customer that "The raised issue does not affect the usage of the product." Because the product didn't match the customer's expectations, you can offer them a compensation. Outcome of the claim = "Compensation request created" ​ Option 2: Offer a replacement Especially if you notice the product's usage will likely be affected, offer the customer a free replacement for their faulty product. Initiate a return to have the customer send us back the faulty item. Outcome of the claim = "Return and supplement created" If the product is no longer usable Proceed to the 'Decision point 2'. Decision point 2: Can this issue be resolved by sending a spare part? You must first decide if this issue can be resolved by sending a spare part. For instance, a broken bed stand can be replaced by a new stand - no need to send an entire bed. ​ ​Not sure if a spare part is available? Check the Product Quality Guidebook We currently have spare parts available for mattress covers (depending on your market). In Belgium, Netherlands, Germany, Austria, Switzerland and France, we also have spare parts for Box Bed v5 (BBv5), Storage Bed and the Slatted Frame bed. Option 1: Spare part avalailable Proceed with the process for sending a spare part . ​ Outcome of the claim = "Supplement request created" ​ Option 2: No spare part available If there is no option to send a spare part, proceed with checking if a replacement is available. Decision point 3: Is the same SKU available in stock for sending a replacement? You must be sure that we have a replacement SKU available in stock. That way, the customer will be sure to receive a replacement. Option 1: Same SKU is available for replacement Replace the faulty item with a new one, by Creating a supplement, AND Initiating a return of the faulty item. Need a reminder how to create supplements? Review the information here . ​ Outcome of the claim = "Return and supplement created" ​ Option 2: No supplement is available Go to the next decision step 'Is a comparable SKU available'? For detailed instructions how to check for stock, review the below content. Decision point 4: Is a comparable SKU available in stock? - Under Discussion Check if you can replace the faulty item with a comparable item, using the file corresponding to your market in this ' SKU Replacement ' folder. Option 1: Comparable SKU is available for replacement Replace the faulty item with a new one, by creating a supplement using a comparable SKU. Initiate a return for the customer to send us back the faulty item. Need a reminder how to create supplements? Review the information here . ​ Outcome of the claim = "Return and supplement request created" ​ Option 2: No comparable SKU supplement is available Proceed with a full refund for the customer. Outcome of the claim = 'Return and refund request created' 2.E) Logging the Outcome of the Case using the Guided Workflow in Sprinklr Need a refresher on how to use the Guided Worfklow in Sprinklr? Visit the article ' Claims: How to Manage Claims (for both Product & Logistic Claims) '. There can be five outcomes to any product claim Claim Rejected by Agent : The product claim was not valid. Compensation Request Created : The customer accepted a monetary compensation for the quality issue. Supplement Created : Only possible in the case of a spare part. Refund Request Created : This option should never be selected for Product Claims Return and Supplement Request Created : The customer will receive a replacement item. This can also be spare parts. Replaced with the same SKU Replaced with a comparable SKU Return and Refund Request Create : The customer will return the faulty item and will receive a full refund. 2.F) Process the outcome of the claim Claim rejected by agent Compensation request created Supplement Created (Spare part) Return and Supplement Request Created Full refund Log the outcome of the case in Sprinklr as 'Claim rejected by agent'. Ensure all claim information is logged on the case. Close the case. That's it. Give the customer a compensation, according to the compensation matrix . Submit the compensation via the AR D2C Jira Portal . Use the following fields: 'Refund topic': Refund initiation 'Reason for refund': Compensation - Product claim Need a refresher about compensation requests, visit this page . See instructions on the page ' Product Claims: Spare Parts ' blabla New Tab Content 3. Product Claim Flow (Step-by-step) Please check the PDF bellow to access the step-by-step guide for the Product claims Flow pdf SubmittingaClaimforProduct.pdf 3.4 MB 4. Still have questions? Visit the FAQ for Product Claims

title: Product Claims: Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ) for Product Claims
content: 1. What if the customer does not have a product label on their product? Mattresses or Toppers should have 3 Product Labels, one on the core, one on the foil and one on the box, they all look the same. If none of them is available, the customer should take a picture of the Cover Label. Beds or Slatted Frames should have a Product Label on every Packaging Box and an additional Label on the main assembly parts (Bed Base, Headboard, Slatted Frame). The customer should take a picture of one of it. ​ ​ Foam Pillows should have 2 Product Labels, one on the foam product and one on the Cover, both need to be provided. If the customer cannot find them, they should take a picture of the Label on the Box. Microfiber Products, Bedding Sheets, Smart Sleeves and Weighted Blankets should have 1 Product Label, on the Product itself. If the customer cannot find them, they should take a picture of the Label on the Box. 2. Why do we need to ask the customer to share so many pictures and details about the defect? All information from the customer about the defect will be used by the manufacturing supplier to identify the root cause and implement preventive actions. The picture of the label is needed to verify and hold the supplier accountable for their products. If we do not have pictures to forward to the supplier we cannot improve the quality and more importantly cannot claim back the money from our manufacturing suppliers for defective products. Claims Flow FAQ 1. If required is it possible to upload video format files? Yes, any data type can be uploaded during the flow including video files 2. If there is a claim regarding more than 1 item, will the agent need to open more than one claim? Yes, it's one claim per item, the only exception will be for logistic claim (Carrier misbehaviour), but for Product claims always one claim per item 3. What information is expected to add to the "Claim comment"? Add any additional relevant information shared by the customer besides the claim reason 4. Is it still needed to complete the tagging, barcode/FAR during the ACW? No, these are now inserted during the claims flow and not during the ACW. 5. Is it possible to see the pictures inside the claim? Yes, as long as the claim is still pending, in that case agents can update the claim, once they select the previous claim they will see all the information about the claim including links for the previous pictures submited. Note: If you select the option to update a claim, you will need to resubmit the previous pictures otherwise they will be deleted from the claim

title: Product Claims: General Guidelines for Product Claim Validation
content: When a customer reports an issue with the quality of their Emma product, it's considered a product or warranty claim . Properly handling and logging these claims is crucial for Emma. This ensures our product quality team can track and enhance the quality of our products. Not all claims can be accepted. To determine which claims are valid, please refer to the Product Quality Guidebooks. It's essential to follow these guidelines precisely. Table of Contents Assessing the claims with the Validation Guidebooks Link to sample Instruction Images to be Shared with Customers Verify if the images are original, using Google Image Search Required Data Privacy Statement (GDPR) ​ ​ 1. Each instruction page contains the following items Claim Component : The part of the product that is affected Claim reason : Classification of what is wrong with the product Description​ : Description of the defect reason Acceptance Range​ : If the issue from the customer is within the range, the product is not faulty and you must reject the claim (look at the 'Note' section). Pictures : Example pictures of the information you need to collect to process the product claim case. Click on ' View ' to see the whole Guidebook If the product claim is not valid , reject the product claim. Describe to the customer why we cannot accept the raised claim as a defect. If you are unsure if the product claim is valid , contact your supervisor to discuss. Mattresses Beds Accessories Spare Parts : We have spare parts available for the Box Bed v5 (BBv5) bed. Before supplementing, always check if we can supplement only the spare part. See the instructions in ' Product Claims: Spare Parts ' 2. Sample Instruction Images to be Shared with Customers See the article ' Product Claims: Customer Instructions for Product Claims '. 3. Verify if the images are legit Always double-check what kind of photo is being provided. Ask yourself these questions: Step 1: Is it an Emma product? Does the photo provided match the product the customer ordered? You can check this with Fluent Commerce / Magento. Step 2: Is the photo scrapped from the internet? Does this photo look like something taken off the internet? Suspicious behavior If you suspect the photo may be a photo that was scrapped (taken off the internet), there is a simple way to check that: Open Google Reverse Image Search Click on the "Search by Image" option (camera icon): Select the "Upload an Image" option, and select the photos provided by the customer Once you have done this, Google will show you if there are any visually similar images on the internet, which may lead to the conclusion as to if they are legitimate proof of claim. If you find that the pictures are not original or not from an Emma product, reject the claim and inform your supervisor. 4. Data Privacy - Canned response To ensure that we comply with the data minimization principle, and we do not collect unnecessary personal data from our customers, we should properly inform customers beforehand when addressing product claim requests/inquiries. When faced or working on a ticket related to product claims, make sure to send the following disclaimer to the customer before asking them to send the photos. Canned Response for Data Privacy regarding Product Claim cases (English version) Dear [Insert Customer's First Name] , Thank you for reaching out to us. We are very sorry to hear about the issue you encountered with your order, but we can assure you that we are fully committed to resolving this as quickly as possible, to avoid any further inconvenience. At this point, so that we can better understand the issue, and provide you with an appropriate solution, we would kindly request that you follow the picture guidelines we have attached to this email, and send us the pictures or videos requested there. Please ensure that these images or videos clearly capture the issues you encountered, as this will help us expedite the review process. Important guidelines for submitting photos or videos: 1. No personal data: Please do not include any personal data in the photos or videos you will send us. This includes: Faces or voices of individuals; Any identifiable information such as names, addresses, or contact details. 2. Privacy presumption: By submitting photos or videos, we presume that you have ensured no personal data is included. This measure is in place to protect your privacy and comply with data protection regulations. 3. Use of photos and videos: The photos or videos you provide us will be used solely for the purpose of assessing and resolving your product claim. We will not share these files with third parties except as necessary to process your claim. Disclaimer: By submitting photos or videos, you grant us the right to use these materials for the sole purpose of evaluating and resolving your product claim; Additionally, by submitting the photos or videos, you declare that they do not contain any personal data of any individuals. Thank you for your patience and cooperation on this matter. We look forward to hearing from you soon and remain available in the meantime if you should require further assistance. ​

title: Product Claims: IE defective Emma Hybrid
content: Introduction We currently have a situation where some defective mattresses are being shipped to Ireland customers, however to prevent customers to keep receiving defective mattresses, we are following a new process to offer an alternative replacemnet for this instances. key-words Ireland; IE; Defective; mattress; Hybrid; Process Defective product Name: Emma Hybrid Luxe Thermosync (Previously Luxe Cooling v1) Defective product SKU: EMALC_AAA Market Impacted: Ireland The issue is related with improper inflation, make sure that customers wait for 2 weeks (Information shared in the website) before proceeding with a claim and replacement or refund. Replacement product Name: Emma Hybrid Thermosync Replacement product SKU: EMALC_AAB Product Top Selling points vs defective product: Latest version of the Thermosync family. 4 Layers of foam instead of 3. 7 pocket spring zones instead of 5. 27 cm height instead of 25cm Use the product selling points of the replacement product to clarify the customer on the differences. FAQ The customer is pushing for replacement with the same product they have. In that case proceed with a supplement of the original SKU Can we inform the customers this is a general issue with this SKU? No, this is not allowed ar all, the argument for offering the new mattress should be considered as an upgrade/compensation for the issue with the previous mattress

title: How to: Cancel an item/ order
content: TABLE OF CONTENTS Cancel an item/ all items / bundles Video Cancel an item - Step by Step Late Cancellation & Refuse at door cases - Submit a Cancellation request Process for Late Cancellation cases Process for Refuse at door cases Market Specific links Cancel an item / all items / bundles Customer may reach out customer service team for editing or cancelling their items after it has been placed on our online store. E.g. they order the wrong size of the mattress, or they placed the order twice by mistake. This article will guide you through the steps of canceling an item in the Fluent Commerce system, which will vary depend on the fulfillment status: Identify the Fulfillment status Assigned / Waiting for stock Cancellation button is enable - follow the cancellation steps below processing the cancellation Cancel item - Step by Step Submitted to FL and its following statuses up to Ready to dispatch Cancellation to be submitted to the warehouse. Request should be done via Jira Portal to Emma Order Management team. Submit Cancelation request via Jira portal and manage customer expectation as per steps: Submit a Cancellation request Once Dispatched and upcoming status Not possible to cancel as the parcel is already in the carrier hands. Customer should refuse the item upon delivery . Once the customer Refused the order upon delivery and the Fulfillment Status changed to "Return_Sender_Complete", the agent should open a ticket via Jira to the Refunds Team as per steps: Refuse upon Delivery Process (at the end of the page). Cancel an item/ all items / bundle Video Check the step-by-step Video below, and you can find the detailed information afterward. Cancel an item - Step by Step Items can be canceled via Fluent Commerce any status before Submitted to FL (fulfilment location) status. The cancellation option will be enabled in the case is still possible to proceed with it. Step by step: 1. Access the order page and click the kebab button. 2. click on the button Cancel order items. A cancellation window will populate for the next steps: 3. Select item(s) you would like to cancel 4. Provide Reason for cancellation 5. Confirm the cancellation by clicking on Submit A confirmation window will pop up. The order status will be updated accordingly, together with the Updated Date. A Credit memo will automatically be created and a refund of the customer will automatically be triggered after the cancellation is confirmed. No manual request is needed. In case of an error, the case will be forwarded to the customer service team by our Emma Refunds team. Note on Bundle* Cancellation : It is NOT possible to cancel separate itens in the bundle. In case of bundle cancellation, all the products included will be cancelled and refunded. Bundle* Definition: Group of products sold together. You can review the Refunds / Credit memo label and logic by accessing How to: Refunds & Credit memo article CHILE: please be aware, credit memo are not automatic for CHILE Orders, ensure you follow up your original procedure - Cancellation article here. Late Cancellation & Refuse upon delivery cases Process for Late Cancellation In the image above, you can check the status in which the order has been transmitted to the warehouse already. Once that happens, our internal Emma team will try to stop the item's journey by requesting a late cancellation to the warehouse directly. The process is: Submit a Jira Ticket with the cancellation request. Once submitted, you must manage customer expectations in at least 5 business days. In case cancellation is confirmed by the warehouse: a cancellation email will be sent via email in the next 48 hours and a refund will be issued automatically (a credit memo will be created with cancellation). For ALL MARKETS (except Brazil**): Open a JIRA ticket to Back-Office team, as indicated below: From now on, all Front-Office agents can open a ticket to the Back-Office Team ONLY for requests RELATED TO LATE CANCELLATION. Access: Escalation - Central Europe Portal [ **For Brazil , please keep using the current file you have until further notice] Process for Refuse upon delivery In here, the image shows that after "Dispatched" the warehouse is no longer able to proceed with the late cancelation. Then, you must ask the customer to refuse the product upon delivery . The process is: Inform the customer that order cannot be canceled in the system and that customer must refuse the delivery; Ask customer to contact us once the order has been rejected; Reply to customer and manage expectations about the refund: 3.1 -> You must check the order in the OMS and if the status is already updated to "return_sender_complete", please proceed to create a JIRA for a Refund in the ARD2C Portal . 3.2 -> If status is not updated to "return_sender_complete", you need to confirm with the carrier the refusal of the delivery. And manage customer expectations by explaining that first, the carrier confirms in the system that the order was refused, and only after this the refund can be triggered. If the Fulfillment Status is not updated to "" return_sender_complete" in the next 48h after the refusal date, please contact the carrier. IMPORTANT: Do NOT create a Return with a Refund. Access: ARD2C

title: Return to Sender process
content: Key-words Return; Return to Sender; Unable to Deliver; Delivery Rejection In this article you'll find information about how to deal with customers reaching out about fulfillments with a Return to Sender status (often associated with Late Cancellations, Rejected Delivery or Unable to Deliver cases). Table of content Definition Instructions Closing the loop Definition A shipment is considered returned to the sender when the delivery failed, and the carrier was not able to complete successfully the shipment. An order can be sent to the sender (fully or partially) for several reasons: Late cancellation : customers changed their mind about the purchase when it was too late to cancel it on Fluent. Delivery rejected: customer could reject the delivery for the reason above or because they were not the recipient of the order. Impossibility to find the address/ customer not home: some details were wrong or missing, or customer was not at home when the delivery was. For all the scenarios above, we are willing to refund customers for the value of the order that they haven’t received. As this is not an automated process, it’s important for the customer support agent to identify correctly these cases to provide a seamless and smooth refund experience for our customers. For all the scenarios above, no supplement order should be created. Exceptions If it’s a return to sender case and the customer still wants the order, claiming they didn’t receive any information about the delivery or attempted delivery, please check Parcel Lab, the Order Status Page, and the tracking link to verify what information the carrier has provided. If the carrier did failed to provide clear information to the customer or in the system, proceed with the supplement process under the Logistic Claim flow (it can be due to lost parcel or carrier misbehaviour if it's not customer's fault). If you feel like your customer has an exceptional situation and needs further escalation, please with your Supervisor if you should involve Emma Internal team. Instructions Validate the fulfillment status Most of the cases, when an order is returned to the sender it will be reflected on Fluent, under the fulfillment tab with the input “return_to_sender_complete” (it will appear on where there's the "picked_up" highlighted in green). If this status is not updated on Fluent always make sure to check the tracking page of the carrier , to confirm if, at least on their website, the information is updated. If it is (carrier page confirms the return was return to sender) , please take a screenshot that will be needed to inform Order Management (OM) team (delivery rejected, returned to sender) to cancel the order/fulfillment. If is not , and the tracking doesn’t show the order as returned, please contact the carrier to have updates on this delivery. Only when you receive a written confirmation that the order was returned to the sender, then you can move forward with opening the Jira to correct team. Action to take For the returns to sender process, based on the information you have available on Fluent and on the tracking page of the carrier, you’ll need to reach ARD2C team or OM team with their proper Jira. Please follow the table below: Fluent – Fulfillment Status Order Status Action and team ON FLUENT COMMERCE: Ready for dispatch Dispatched Arrived at sorting center Out for delivery Requested for delivery option Lost order Delivery delay Picked up AT_DEPOT BUT THE CARRIER TRACKING WEBSITE SHOWS: Delivery rejected Returned to sender Shipped Open a Jira here Use the Refund Topic "Cancel and Refund" with the reason for refund "Cancellation" Make sure to attach the proof of order being Returned to Sender (screenshot of carrier tracking or carrier confirmation). ​ ON FLUENT COMMERCE: Complete Return to Sender complete Complete with return to sender proof (screenshot from carrier page) Return_to_sender_complete Open a Jira here Use the Refund Topic "Refund Initiation" with the reason for refund "Cancellation" Make sure to attach proof of order Returned to Sender (screenshot of status showing in Fluent Commerce) Important note: it’s mandatory to attach any proof that the order was returned to sender, otherwise OM and Refund team will reject your request. Closing the loop If you’ve followed correctly the process, OM and Refund team will take care of the refund request. At this point, you can simply inform customers that the refund request has been triggered, and you can close the case.

title: Claims: How to Manage Claims (for both Product & Logistic Claims)
content: Release Note: 11/11/2025 - added notes for mandatory comments on Composite SKUs under "Important" on "How to manage the claim" Table of Contents General Information How to Manage the Claim Managing Claims in Sprinklr using the Guided Workflow The Outcome of the Claim Related articles General Information At Emma, we support customers with two types of claims: Logistic Claims : Complaints related to delivery issues such as delays or product damaged during transport or delivery. For more info, check the Logistic Claims folder . Product Claims : Complaints related to the quality or production defects of EMMA products. These are guarantee claims. For more info, check the Product Claims folder. How to Manage the Claim Correctly logging and storing data regarding claims is critical for Emma. Via correctly documenting the information about claims, we can improve our production and delivery processes to reduce related issues, reduce costs, and maximize the customer experience. Managing Claims in Sprinklr using the Guided Workflow All claims in Sprinklr need to be logged using the Claim Logging Guided Workflow. For step-by-step instructions, please review these instructions: Logistic Claim Logging step-by-step : pdf Submitting a Logistic Claim Step-by-step.pdf 3.4 MB Product Claim Logging in Sprinklr step-by-step: pdf SubmittingaProductClaimStep-by-StepGuide_PDF_Final.pdf 3.05 MB IMPORTANT: Mandatory Step for Logistic Claims Logistic Claims due to DAMAGES must be reported within 5 business days to the carriers. Notes on Composite SKUs : Specific part must be added to the comments on FluentCommerce (imagine a bed with a broken zipper). add SKU of broken part on notes. Insert SKU of damaged product (gathered during the normal process of gathering info with the customer) Release Note: 26 September 2025 Updated Managing Product Claim for Magento Managing Claims in Magento (Step-by-Step Guide) Product Claim logging for Magento pdf 150925_CLTStepbyStep_Magento_v0.pdf 0.73 MB The Outcome of the Claim Claims are registered in Sprinklr, but orders are managed in Fluent Commerce. Possible outcomes include: For more detailed guidelines for how to determine outcome of the claim, review the respective guidelines in the articles for logistic and product claims If a full supplement order is to be sent to the customer, ensure the return is only initiated after the supplement has been successfully delivered (request customer to contact back once suplement is received). This prevents the customer from being without the product while awaiting the replacement. title: How to check for available stock of an SKU
content: You might sometimes need to check if a particular SKU has stock. This might be for instance when you plan to create a supplement. The instructions for how to find out if a particular SKU has stock in a warehouse in your market are outlined in this article. In what scenarios should you use this article? Product and/or Logistic claims : Before creating a supplement for a claim, you need to ensure there is stock for the item. Is no stock available? Inform the customer that we cannot provide a timeline for the delivery of the supplement, and if they would prefer to cancel / return the item. WIMO where Updated Delivery Date = 'Invalid date' REMINDER: You must never create a supplement to unblock an order that is stuck or delayed. TABLE OF CONTENTS How can I check if the product has stock? Important note about bundles 3. FAQ 1. How can I check if the product has stock? Navigate to the Virtual Catalogue in Fluent Commerce Select the stock for your market (in this example, we use 'Poland') Select the Base Virtual Catalogue for your market. That is the bottom line from the options you see for your market. In this example for Poland (PL), it looks as follows. On the page with stock, filter for 'Ref' Then, search for the SKU that you need to supplement. Check if the SKU has: Location Ref : This will indicate the warehouse that has the stock. ATS (Available Stock to Sell). The thresholds are: ATS for Mattresses > 15 ATS for Beds and Accessories > 20 If the answer to step 6.2 is yes, then we have enough stock to create a supplement. If the answer is no, then we cannot promise the customer a supplement. TIP! Don't know the products and SKUs used in your market? Check the article about the 'Products Overview per Market folder' 2. Important note about bundles Are you seeing an SKU that starts with 'XEM'? For instance: XEMBDWDB180200_00150:EBDOW180200SIA? The part before the ':' mark is only to indicate this SKU is part of a bundle. To review the stock for this item, you must only search for the last part of the string. In this example, that is 'EBDOW180200SIA'. 3. FAQ What does the Updated Date mean? The updated date can be ignored. It currently does not give accurate timestamp of the last updated date, and must not be used as a reference. The stock value is updated hourly, independent from the 'updated date' that is represented on the page in Fluent Commerce. How often is the stock updated? The stock value is updated hourly, independent from the 'updated date' that is represented on the page in Fluent Commerce. How do I know which warehouse I need to check? As long as you correctly selected the country, any warehouse in that virtual catalogue can serve that market. How do I know which SKU to look for? Check the article about the 'Products Overview per Market folder'

title: What and How to: The Fulfilment Article Reference and Where to Find It
content: The Fulfilment Article Reference (FAR) is the unique identifier of the item that has been sold to the customer. You can think of it as the 'barcode' of the product. For claim cases, adding the FAR to the case is mandatory . Format of the Fulfilment Article Reference: The FAR always has the same format, that is: 8 numbers, followed by an underscore, followed by an alphanumeric string of 7 characters. As an example: '12345678_A1B2C2' Where to find it? In Fluent Commerce, the FAR is called the "Article Reference". You can find the Fulfilment Article Reference via the following steps: Open the order On the order page on FluentCommerce, click on the "Fulfilments" tab: Click on the ID number: Then the Fultilment Article Reference will be under "Article Ref": Good to Know The FAR is mandatory when logging a Product Claim. You must insert the FAR in the dedicated section under 'Properties' on the support case.

title: Logistic Claims & Order Delays Compensation Matrix - European markets
content: ​ Release Note: 21/10/2025: This article is now Logistic Claims & Order Delays only: references to Product Claim compensation Matrix removed ​ Introduction In this article, you can find an explanation about what is the Compensation Matrix for all European markets and how to use it. The EU Matrix was created to set a standard and manage the compensation values that Emma offers to customers in specific situations. Also, now we have 2 versions of the Compensation Matrix: one for regular cases that the CS agents handle; and the second one ONLY to be used by HLE/PRIO1 agents that handle the cases from the High-Level Escalations queues. Additionally we also have the compensation feature for Delivery delay claims. (Live since April 24th) ATTENTION : The compensation should be given per order (or item/SKU, if it's the case), but not per complaint . If there are multiple complaints, the most severe complaint should be chosen. The only exception is when there's a Logistic Claim and a Product Claim (check on the FAQs). Reasons to offer compensation Before starting using the Compensation Matrix, it is necessary to understand which cases and scenarios are valid for a compensation to be offered to the customers. ​ Logistics Claims compensations A logistics claim can only be made if the customer complaint is regarding a damaged packaging and/or product, products lost in transit, carrier misbehavior during delivery or during the collection of products, or incorrect shipment . Logistic Claims - Compensation Reason Reason Category Discount Discount condition Damages Package (only) damaged NO Product damaged YES compensation matrix If the customer keeps the damaged product Incorrect Shipment Wrong Product/SKU Shipped YES compensation matrix If the customer keeps the item with the wrong SKU. No replacement / no return. Lost in Transit Lost or stolen NO Incomplete delivery NO Carrier Misbehaviour Returned by carrier NO Additional Service not provided NO Pick up point no notice NO Wrong address/person NO Property damaged YES to be defined by the supervisor based on the damage. ANYTHING ABOVE 500€, contact EMMA INTERNAL (Perf. Manager) Order Delays compensations Some reasons why an order can be delayed: product out of stock, warehouse delay, carrier delay, etc. Please always use the correct calculator for CS or HLE (if it's the case) in order to make sure the amount to be given is correct. Order Delays - Compensation Delays All reasons YES Compensation Feature in Sprinklr ​ ​ Compensation Matrix Steps Step-by-Step Before starting, ensure these three Golden Rules : 1. Always check Fluent commerce comments before proceeding with a compensation. 2. It’s mandatory to always authenticate the customer before starting the compensation feature. 3. Make sure the order Reference matches the order where compensation is applicable ​ ​ Sequential Steps - Eligbile Items Select Compensate button. Select Proceed . Select the eligible items that require compensation. Click Generate Preview . If everything is okay, click Compensate . Review and if accurate, click Finish. ​ Ineligible Items 1. Are marked as Yes under Already compensated . OR 2. Order is not delayed beyond limits for compensation eligibility. Release Note: Updated : 4 August 2025 European Compensation Matrix The Matrix is divided into 2 main tabs: 1) Compensation CS Agents: ONLY for the first-level cases handled by CS agents. Access CS COMPENSATION HERE ​ 2) Compensation HLE Agents: ONLY for the High-level cases or PRIO 1 cases that are handled exclusively for the agents in the HLE queue. Access HLE COMPENSATION HERE Note: For Order Delays, compensation should be applied using the Sprinklr Feacture starting on the 24th April ​ ​ Compensation Feature Sprinklr Applicable to only Delivery delay . ​ Step 1: Start the flow by selecting the compensate Button ​ ​ Step 2: You will be taken into the overview of the order details - Select proceed ​ ​ Step 3: You will be presented with a list of Eligible items - Tick the items that require compensation and click “Generate Preview” ​ ​ Step 4: You will be presented with a preview, this will allow you to inform the customer of the compensation amounts - If everything is OK click “Compensate” ​ ​ Step 5: Once completed you will be prompted with final view - click “Finish” to close the flow. ​ ​ With this the Flow will be completed. ​ ​ What in cases where customer cannot be compensated? ​ Example 1: In this case the order was already compensated, therefore marked as “Yes” under the “Already compensated” field ​ ​ ​ ​ Example 2: In this case the order is not delayed beyond limits for compensation eligibility ​ ​ ​ Frequently Asked Questions Should we compensate the customer for a delay after or before they receive the order? Always when the customer receives the order. Please don't mention %s, just calculate the full value with the OD calculator (as we can do regular updates on the minimum and maximum values). What's the step-by-step process for providing compensation for an order delay? When an order is delayed, we should inform the customer of the new Updated Delivery Date (if applicable). If there is no UDD information (invalid date), we should warn them that we don't expect the order to arrive in less than 8 weeks. Always let them know that we offer compensation after 14 days of delay. If they are willing to wait and be compensated, ask them to alert us as soon as they receive the order so we can calculate the compensation. Please avoid mentioning specific compensation rates. ​ Should we roundup the compensation values (ex. if it's 61.77€, offer 65€): Only cents, for example: if it's 35.62, offer 36€. Ideally we should always offer the exact values that appear in the OD calculator. What to do if acustomer ordered a product with assembly included and the carrier didn't assemble during the delivery? The correct process is to contact the carrier in order to schedule a new assemble. If that happens, we don't offer compensation. But, if the customer contact us explaining that the carrier did not assemble the product but he did, please offer a maximum value of 25 euros in compensation. Can I provide the maximum of compensation for Order Delays whenever I believe the customer should have it? No. For Order Delays, taking into account the compensation percentages in each bucket and the maximum values, the compensation will always be the lowest value between the two. Example: if the compensation value is 45€, but the maximum value for the bucket in the file is 50€, we will still pay 45€. Can the customer cancel the order due to a delay? Yes, but if they have received compensation for a delay, this must be deducted from the full refund. Should we offer compensation for the entire order or on a per-item basis if only one item (SKU) is delayed? If the situation is not with the entire order and we have the price split per item in OMS, we should be able to compensate on an item specific level. One example is a customer that bought a bundle with a bed, mattress and pillow. If there's a delay with only the pillow, the agent needs to specify the SKU that requires compensation in the Order 2 Cash Jira portal in order for us to compensate the customer just for the pillow's delay. What to do when the order/item value is low and therefore offering the minimum compensation is still a lot? On W26, 2024 we decided to lower the minimum values to address this situation. An example is a $30 order where the reward for scenario 2 is 5% ($1.5). Considering that our minimum payout is $5, we should still pay $5. Do we have to transfer the tickets to the HLE queue? No, you shouldn't need to transfer it. As stated, we should provide compensation ONCE the order is delivered to the customer. We understand that the prior process was to proactively compensate customers on some countries. For complaints that happen before June 5th, if repeating WIMO for +3 times (3 wrong updated delivery dates) in the same order, it's possible to transfer to the HLE queue. Before transferring it, please ensure that the item is not phased out (if applicable to your country) and write an internal note explaining why the ticket was escalated to the HLE queue. What if the customer doesn't accept the compensation values? The compensation values are final and if the customer don't agree he can always cancel the order and get a full refund. The only exception is if it's a regular CS case but it's a legal threat. If this is the case, please escalate the situation to your TL and If he agrees, please open the ticket explaining that it's a legal threat, then it's possible to use the HLE Compensation Matrix instead of the regular EU CS one. If we have initiated a compensation and the customer wants to cancel their order, do we refund them the full amount or do we deduct the compensation value from the full price? We will deduct the compensation value from the full price. Will HLE initiate the compensation or will they reassign the ticket to our queue with an approval? They will initiate the refund. If the customer was promised an incorrect amount by a previous agent according to the previous policy, what do we do? Send proof in Jira that the date of the promised compensation is before May 25th, 2024. If a wrong product was shipped and there is a price difference that should be refunded to the customer, what should we do? If a customer places an order for $1,000 and mistakenly receives a similar product that costs $800 and wants to keep the product, we will refund the difference between the two ($200) plus the compensation for the $800 product. If the customer doesn't want to keep the product, they can return it as normal. ​

title: How to: Edit an order
content: TABLE OF CONTENTS Edit an order General Information Edit Delivery Information Up to Booked status - Step by Step Edit Delivery Information in or after Order Processing - Step by Step Edit an order General Information We are only able to edit customer; invoices or delivery details - up to order Booked status . Customer name Email Contact number Delivery address Invoice address Products, prices, and payment methods are not editable. For any change related to it: the order should be canceled, and a new order should be placed. Edit Delivery Information Up to Booked status - Step by Step Up to Booked status means the order has not been transmitted to the warehouse yet. Delivery Details: proceed in Fluent Commerce When it comes to Delivery Details , we are able to edit them directly in the Fluent Commerce Platform: The option to customize Delivery Date is NOT possible in COS. This was an option in Magento only. Edit Delivery Information in or before status Order Processing - Step by Step If the Order status is moved to Processing, modification is not possible within our system, so ensure you follow up by step: 1. If there's no delivery label (tracking label/number), it's never possible to request the carrier to change the address.  If that's the case, kindly ask the customer to wait for the tracking number to arrive (status in OMS = “In transit”). 2. Once / If there’s a tracking label/number available: 1 . Leave a Comment in the order to document the change. Comment Guideline in Fluent Commerce: Currently, Fluent Commerce has a 200 characters limitation for comments . In this way, comments should follow the pre-defined template. Please find below the meaning of each abbreviation: AGT: ___________________ (Agent's name, as shown on Freshdesk) GDPR: Y/N ("Y" if the customer was authenticated, or didn't require authentication / "N" if the customer was not authenticated) TN: ____________________ (Ticket Number) ENQ: __________________ (Enquiry) ACT: __________________ (Actions taken) If the agent requires more than 1 entry to leave complete notes, these should be divided into PT1 (part 1), PT2, etc. 2. Contact the Carrier and inform the changes directly to them. While replying to the customer, let them know that: You are going to follow up on the request but that they’re also able to contact the carrier quicker by themselves by using the options / carrier portal available in the email or HERE ). They can also find the carrier contact information on the Order Status Page. Due to the logistics of the order process, the order might change status once a request to change the address has been made. The address change is never a guarantee. Use the following macro (Template) to contact the carrier: Subject : Address correction - 0003-YKQ9HD Hello customer service, We would like to inform you of the following address change for: Order: 0003-YKQ9HD Tracking number: ZZZZZZZZZZ Current delivery address: Anne Dumberg Xu Filled Schalk 10 2024 AH Haarlem New delivery address: Anne Dumberg Xu Leidsevaart 3 2017 HP Haarlem Thank you and do not hesitate to contact us if you have any questions. Carrier contacts for address changes in AT/BE/NL/DE/CH (Frontoffice) Please use the macro above to contact the carriers. If, after 1 day the carrier don't answer in the thread, please search for the subject of the email in Sprinklr or use the tracking link from the carrier to see if the change was done. If the delivery info is missing (e.g: door number), the wrong address was provided or the customer couldn't be found, they'll report it there and our support needs to reply in a timely manner. Supervisors and Backoffice (for now) are the responsible for managing those requests. Please check the articles for GLS and DPD to understand how to do it. Portal accesses: Portal Login Password GLS 2760307166-cs EmmaCS2023 DPD EmmaCS.SD VBonxU5nVmqs%9w,gc[A last update: GLS email & DPD logins updated on the 07/010/2025 Some scenarios: In case the carrier contacts us reporting an incorrect address: Update the carrier with the correct info.
