title: Emma Services (Trial, Guarantee, Friend Referral..)
content: Table of Content Customer Inquiries & Freshdesk Ticket Type Guarantee Request Friend Referral Store Location Website Issue Old Mattress removal Bulk order pricing Marketing / Seasonal Campaign information Customer Inquiries & Freshdesk Ticket Type Customers may reach us to understand the Services we offer at Emma before their purchase. Today, the requests may be divided into: Trial Period Guarantee Friend Referral Store Locations Website issues Sustainability Old Mattress-removal Bulk order pricing Marketing/ Seasonal Campaign information Freshdesk Ticket Accuracy Ensure you always provide the related Ticket type & subtype based on the customer request . Trial Period Request Even most of the inquiries related to the Trial period requests may be assigned as a post-delivery topic (which means: after the customer receives their product), the customer may reach us to gather information regarding it before they decide to buy our products. What is the Trial Period? The Risk-free Trial Period is an exclusive benefit offered to our Emma customers. Depending on the country, you may find policies that cover different products: 200-nighs, 100-nights, or 50/30-nights for accessories. You can review the Trial Period (100-night-trial, 50-night-trial...) article here If a customer would like to request a return under the Trial period , ensure you follow our workflow for post-delivery: Return Request (trial period) . Please note : if the request is related to a product defect or damage during the delivery time, it should be handle as a Guarantee request (product or logistic claim as per Guarantee request indication below). Country related article: If you would like to review the country-specific Trial period policies, you can always access its Emma website. Further information can also be found below: Guarantee Request As per the trial period topic, c ustomers may reach us to clarify questions under their guarantee rights before they purchase our products. At Emma, we guarantee the quality and durability of our selling products. We work with several guarantee durations and they vary accordingly to the product type and the country. The most common guarantees offered are: The 10-years guarantee, is related to mattresses, and the 2-years guarantee is related to accessories. In case the obligation is not fulfilled , for example, the product arrives defective or damaged to the customer, Emma is responsible to replace the product, or the money pa id as consideration will be refunded to the customer . Mostly, a guarantee request will be handled as a post-delivery topic, as customers may reach us after receiving the product and may need support with certain unexpected issues. But, if you may need to handle a guarantee question or request: Country related Guarantee Ensure you are checking/following up on the country-related Guarantee website page: Review the article Emma website - Navigation to check how to guide the customer to find information Guarantee Claim reason identify what is the reason for the customer guarantee request and follow the related workflow to provide information. The reason could be under: Product claim Related to a production/ quality defect of the product Access Product claim article here Logistic claim The product was damaged/arrived damaged due to the logistic process Access Logistic claim article here Proof of claim: validation criteria If the customers want to avail of the guarantee, they need to send us photographic proof of the issue so our customer service team can investigate if it qualifies and the claim will be validated under the guarantee conditions. If Return (Trial Period request): Not a Guarantee claim If the customer claims to wish to know about a replacement or a refund due to wrong size order (mistake), or comfort preferences (did not adapt to the mattresses), those requests are not valid under a Guarantee request, it should always be handled under the Return (Trial Period Request). Review a Return (Trial Period Request) article here Country Related link Whenever they reach us to get information, ensure you have the information regarding your Country . You can find related articles below: Friend Referral Friend referral is a loyalty campaign we have available to all of our customers. The program tent to motivate customers to refer Emma products to their friends and by doing so, both get beneficiated from it. On one side, the customer who is referring wins a Bonus, on the other side, the "friend" buying a new product has a discount. Customers may reach us to get information on how to participate in the program, recommend new friends, understand expected deadlines, and refund conditions. Review all conditions of the program in the Friend Referral Program article Specific information regarding currency or country expected deadlines can be found in the articles below: PT Article related Store Location Customers may reach us to ask where they can touch and feel our products before buying them. title: The Guarantees
content: Table of Content What is a guarantee? Warranty and Guarantee The 10-years guarantee (Mattresses) Validation criteria General conditions (mattresses) The 2-years guarantee (Accessories) Validation Criteria Guarantee General conditions Whenever you would like to understand the guarantee of the products of a related country, ensure you access the Guarantee page available on the country-related website. Conditions may differ in accordance with countries' legal policies. What is a guarantee? A guarantee is defined as the promise for the after-sales performance of a product or service . At Emma, we guarantee the quality and durability of our selling products. In case the obligation is not fulfilled , Emma is responsible to replace the product, or the money pa id as consideration will be refunded to the customer . Emma works with several guarantee durations and they vary accordingly to the product type and the country. The most common guarantees offered are: The 10-years guarantee, is related to mattresses, and the 2-years guarantee is related to accessories. Please, check your country folder for more specificities regarding products and their guarantees. Warranty and Guarantee A warranty is a legal requirement and a Guarantee is what the company is offering as a promise to ensure the warranty is available to the customer. A guarantee is closely related to a warranty, as a guarantee is the promise included in the formal (and legal) warranty. As an example, legally in Germany, any company that sells a mattress is required to offer a 2 years warranty over the product. At Emma, we grant an extended guarantee of 8 years on Emma mattresses in addition to the statutory of 2 years, therefore a total of 10 years guarantee . There is a total guarantee, free of charge, for the first two years after purchase (based on the Warranty conditions). From the third, or fourth year of usage, the guarantee may be reduced for a certain percentage of the purchase price. The conditions may vary from country to country. The 10-years guarantee (Mattresses) This guarantee starts on the day of the delivery and covers the first 10 years of use. If the customers want to avail of the guarantee, they need to send us photographic proof of the issue so we can investigate if it qualifies. The guarantee does not renew or reset if the customer receives a replacement mattress under the guarantee. Validation criteria The Guarantee can only be validated under the following conditions: Sags or dips Permanent sags or dips greater than 2.5cm and visible to the naked eye. Cracks or hollows to the foam No proper inflation Not inflating to the correct size with a deviation of over 2cm. The mattress needs to be given 2 weeks to fully inflate. Cover damage Cover damage, like faulty zippers and stitching, or any manufacturer-identified issues. Where possible, Emma reserves the right to send a new mattress cover only instead of replacing the entire mattress General conditions (mattresses) Customers are entitled to a maximum of 3 replacement mattresses within the 10-year period. If the 2 exchange or replacement mattresses also develop a fault within the 10-year period, the customer is entitled to a full refund of the purchase price upon collection. The guarantee is non-transferable and is only available to the recipient of the mattress. The guarantee only covers products sold on the official website, marketplaces, and retails. This does not extend to secondhand products bought from unofficial channels. The 2-years guarantee (Accessories) This guarantee starts on the day of delivery and covers the first 2 years of use. If the customers want to avail of the guarantee, they need to send us photographic proof of the issue so we can investigate if it qualifies. It is applied mainly to Emma accessories, please check your country folder specificities. In this case, the customer is responsible to send the product to exchange. Validation Criteria The Guarantee can only be validated with photographic proof , picture example: Guarantee General conditions The Guarantee policies do NOT extend to: Normal wear and tear or any condition resulting from misuse or abuse of the product. Commercial use (e.g. hotels) Standard softening of the mattress foam resulting from regular use. Comfort preference after the Trial period , including preferences of firmness and/or heat retention levels. Damage ca used by mold, odor, mildew, or discoloration caused by abnormal care such as liquid spillage, improper ventilation, or excessive humidity. Mattresses that have been damaged or soiled due to improper use. Cleaning the cover at excessively high temperatures; Faults or damages that have occurred due to the mattress not being unboxed within a reasonable time frame (up to six weeks after delivery). Mattresses that have been transported outside of the country's or our serviced delivery areas. Please, in case the customer contests the guarantee policies, be aware: Customers agree to these terms when they complete an order by clicking on "Checkout", as stated in our terms and conditions.

title: Trial Period (100-night-trial, 50-night-trial..)
content: Table of Content The Trial Period Returns Refunds The Trial Period The Risk-free Trial Period is an exclusive benefit offered to our Emma customers. Depending on the country, you may find policies that cover different products: 200-nighs, 100-nights or 50/30-nights for accessories. The specific trial policy can be checked on your country's related website according to each product category. Always refer and apply the trial policy that is being indicated on the website. The benefit starts on the day the item arrives at the customer's shipping address . For bundles: in case the bundle items are delivered in different parts and arrives to the customer on different dates, it is still considered a bundle, and if the market considers the highest trial period, the time of the trial will start counting from the last item delivered. Some exceptions can be made in extenuating circumstances. For example, a delivery is marked as compiled but the customer has not received it yet. However, these are rare cases. Important information This is a condition that applies simply to the decision of the customer to return the mattresses. It is the right of the customer to decide to keep or not the product, in accordance with their experience with the product. The reasons may be: Wrong size ordered Ordered Twice Too firm Too Soft Too Warm Medical/ allergy issues Wrong quantity Not required anymore Whenever we face any of those return requests, we can always try to improve the customer experience with us by approaching each topic with the right argumentation, such as time adaptation, an example. You can find more information about our Return deflection procedure in the Return deflection: Making Impact over returns . If the product has presented a defect, or the return is requested due to any delay or logistic issue , the return request should be handled by the Customer Service team as a Claim , not as a return under the trial period . Returns If the Customer service team was unable to deflect the return, and the product does not attends the expectations, we will collect the product at the delivery address at no cost and the full amount will be refunded with no hi dden fees. A courier will contact the customer between two weeks after the request, and schedule an appointment for the pickup. The customer needs to send us proof of pickup , and we can trigger the refund via our Order Management system which will happen in 30 business days at the most, depending on the payment method. Accessories should be sent by the customer through the post office. They should create the label via our Self Portal or request it from our Customer Service team. Please consider the following articles for a better understanding of Returns : HERE Refunds Emma will only be able to refund up to the full amount that was charged, under the 100-night-trial period . This means that if we've previously processed a rebate or discount for the customer, that amount is already added to their refund. Rare instances of refunds done outside of the original payment method happen, but these are usually prompted by the Refunds team. For example, refunding customers for sales tax. Please consider the following articles for a better understanding of Refunds : HERE

content: Important: The invoice of a purchase is issued when the status of the order is changed to DELIVERED. ​ It is an automated process overseen by our finance team. If the order is yet to be delivered - there is no way to issue an invoice in advance. Customer will have to wait due to financial requirements . The invoice will be sent directly to the customer' order email. Need to help to see if the email was sent? 1. Access the order page 2. In Fluent Commerce sroll down to the Notifications section. 3. You can advise the customer to check their inbox (including spam/junk folders) based on the timestamp shown in the Notifications section . 4. You can also resend the invoice. To do this go to the ' Related' tab on the order page and click on RESEND EMAIL

title: Manual Invoice Creation - Magento
content: TABLE OF CONTENTS Overview Capture Online vs Offline Invoice for Capture Online Steps in Invoice Creation Overview Invoices should automatically be created in Magento once the products have been shipped; however, there are instances where the invoice is not available in Magento and the order requires to be refunded via product return (i.e. late cancellation). One of the critical requirements for an order to be refunded is for the order to have an invoice. The reason for this is that a credit memo (refund) will be charged against the invoice of the order. If an order has no invoice, refund will not be successful. Here are some of the reasons why invoice is not available: item on the order was not yet shipped failed automatic invoice creation in Magento after the product was shipped This article will show the instruction on how to create an invoice for orders that required to be refunded. Capture Online vs Offline Capture Online means that the order will also captured in the Payment Method website to trigger the charging to customers. Capture Offline means that invoice will be created only in Magento. Some other PSPs do not need orders to be captured in PSP to initiate the charge to customers. Invoice for Capture Online There are instances that invoice can be captured online. Invoice can be captured online if these payment methods were used by the customer: Rechnungskauf (Payolution/Unzer) Klarna Pagarme Credit Card PayPal Express (AU) *Note: If capture online fails, create the invoice via capture offline. Steps in Invoice Creation Reminder: Only shipped/delivered products should be invoiced. 1. Open the order in Magento. Click Invoice. You will be routed to invoice page. 2. On the lower right side of the Invoice page on Amount field, choose Capture Offline on the dropdown. Note: In case Capture Online/Capture Offline dropdown is not available, just click Submit Invoice. 3. Once Capture Offline has been chosen, click Submit Invoice . 4. You will see a notification that the invoice has been created. 5. Invoice tab will show the invoice that you've created. It usually takes 2-3 minutes before the invoice reflect in Magento; you will need to refresh the page for the invoice to show.

title: Free Replacement
content: ​ ​ ​ Version up-to-date as of: 25 September 2025 Purpose : This article provides front-line agents with clear, step-by-step instructions for executing Free Replacements, ensuring customers receive timely and compliant solutions when their original order cannot be fulfilled as planned. It also highlights the key differences in process and agent actions required by country, supporting both reactive and proactive approaches during the pilot phase. ​ ​ Article Use Case(s ) ​ ​WHAT IS A FREE REPLACEMENT? A Free Replacement is when a customer’s original item is swapped for another product at no extra cost for them. It's done via a tool available in Fluent Commerce. It can only be used in the early post-purchase stage (before the delivery, while fulfillment is pending/waiting for stock). Typical triggers: original product is phased out, out of stock (OOS) with no UDD or UDD >14 days after PDD, or customer requests a change in color/characteristics. The customer’s invoice is updated with the new item, but they pay nothing extra. ​ ​ Key differences between Replacements & Supplements ​ Aspect ​Free Replacement (Pre-Delivery) Supplements (Post-Delivery) Purpose ​ Replace with better or updated item Add to solve an issue ​ Conditions ​ Tool can only used on a pre-delivery scenario, until fulfillment status is "Pending" or "Waiting for Stock" Items needs to be a standalone - not composite (beds, sofa beds).  If an order has both, only the standalone items can be replaced. Agents should not replace an item more than once . Escalations or special cases should be reviewed by Emma internals. Refurbished products should not be replaced. ​Tool should be used after or during a delivery process Agent's shouldn't place a supplement more than one time. If there's an error, it should be reported for Emma internals ​ ​ ​Invoice Impact ​ Invoice updated with new item ​Not shown on invoice ​Scenarios ​ Order Delay with no UDD or UDD >14 days after PDD, phased out, color or feature change (e.g: wrong color, same RRP cost) ​Claims, returns ​ Table of Contents ​ Table of Contents ​ Global Process & Workflow Summary: Respective steps to execute the replacement tool process. ​ ​ Notes and Exceptions Summary: Identified differences in the BE & FR/IT markets processes. ​ Frequently Asked (Agent) Questions Summary: None listed. ​ ​ ​ Global Process and Workflow ​ Global Process and Workflow / Market specifics : Is your market present? Yes : Click your Market tab, ignore Global Process. No : refer to the Global Process and Workflow. Global Process and Workflow The tool can be used in two different scenarios: Reactive: customer contacts Emma with an issue Proactive: mass/ad-hoc communication offering a replacement is sent to customers by Emma internals (orders with phased-out items). ​ Free Upgrade Replacement Tool - Reactive Flow ​Customer contacts us with an issue. After analyzing, agent asses that it's one of the following 3 scenarios: 1. Order is blocked as some or an item is Out of Stock (OOS) and there is either no UDD or the UDD is more than 14 business days later than the Promised Delivery Date (PDD); 2. Order is blocked as an Item is phased out OR 3. Customer changed their mind about the product color (wrong color, the same RRP cost) ​ Follow the next steps to check availability/create a free replacement: ​ 1. Open the tool Open the Order View in Fluent Commerce Check comments in Fluent and in Sprinklr and review if there's any previous replacement in the item that you're planning to offer the replacement. Agents should not replace an item more than once. Escalations or special cases should be reviewed by Emma internals. If there's no comment/info, click on the 3 dots bellow your user icon Click on "Free Upgrade Replacement" 2. Start the Replacement Open the side menu and select the item to replace ​ Choose a reason Delivery delay (OOS, UDD >2 weeks from PDD). Original item phased out (SKU delisted). Customer change of mind (wrong color, but same RRP cost). ​ Important : Trigger the replacement flow for each SKU separately. The total quantity will always be replaced (if SKU is >1, all the items of the same SKU will be reaplaced). 3. Select the Replacement Copy the SKU of the original item Open your Market’s Replacement Matrix and check if there is a possible replacement SKU listed there. You'll find some option/options on the dropdown of the tool. Those are all options with the same cost or higher, but to define the correct one you need to use your market's file. Enter the match SKU in the tool. If it has more than one, you can also include it for comparing the options ​ 4. Review Product Details Once you included the SKU, it's going to show: Product cost Stock warning PDD (webshop PDD, if an order of this item is placed immediately) Product link Obs : For the Customer change of mind process, the condition is that the COST NEEDS to be the same of the original item . for viewing that, the agent needs to check in the RRP (image above). 5. Validate the Replacement Check stock availability ( see Stock Check Instructions ). Check the Phased-out File (if applicable). Present options to the customer and get written consent . 6. Offer the Replacement to the Customer Use macros for communication (change of mind, phased out, etc. - check the macros below). Checklist before offering: Stock available (>15 units) Not phased out Listed as valid match in market replacement file 7. Next Steps After sending the email , set tool status to “Wait for customer" (this is important for us internally to compare how many customers we offered the replacement vs how many accepted/never replied) On customer reply: If accepted: re-trigger tool, select item, click on "Next Step" and choose “Replace with selected product” (re-check stock before that). ​ ​ ​ Once you click on this, the final overview screen is going to be presented: ​ Agente confirms the replacement and informs the customer of the outcome and the PDD. Agent leaves a NOTE in Fluent Commerce and Sprinklr explaining which item was replaced and when. If declined : re-trigger tool, confirm that they declined and why and then close flow. ​ 8. No Stock or Suitable Replacement If there's no item available on the Replacement Matrix, then inform customer of the following options: Delay: wait (compensation if >14 business days), or cancel. Phased out: cancel order/item. Change of mind: cancel order and repurchase, or keep original. Important: Canned responses for offering a replacement When a customer comes to us with a WIMO request (Where is my Order), the agent needs to investigate the situation. If the conditions of a replacement is met, the agent should apologize to the customer and offer the options: replacement, compensation or cancellation (if they don. ​ WIMO / phased out: Hi [Customer's First Name], Thank you for your patience. We must confirm that your item has been further delayed and is now expected after [DATE 1/WEEK 1]. We sincerely apologize for this situation.  After looking into your request, we found the following free replacement/upgrade options for the [Insert Product Name] (PRODUCT LINK): - [Insert Product Name] (PRODUCT LINK) – available in [Insert Colour/s]; - [Insert Product Name] (PRODUCT LINK) – available in [Insert Colour/s]; Could you please let us know if you would like to use one of them as a replacement for the one you originally ordered? Please be aware though that we will only be able to reserve this product for you once we have received your confirmation. As such, once we hear back from you, we will reconfirm stock availability, amend the order accordingly, and share the estimated delivery date with you. If, in the meantime of your response, your original item moves status (=progresses), unfortunately this offer will expire. ​ Other options If you prefer to wait for your original item to be available, we can provide a compensation as a goodwill gesture on our part. If this is your case and you are willing to wait for the order, please reach out to us once you receive the order so we can calculate the compensation. Otherwise, if you'd like to cancel the item/order, let us know so that we can assist you further on this matter. ​ We look forward to hearing from you soon. Best regards, Agent’s First Name (automatic) ​ Change of mind (wrong colour): Hi [Customer's First Name], Thank you for your patience. After looking into this, we are happy to inform you that the [Insert Product Name] (PRODUCT LINK) is currently available in [Insert Colour] colour in the same size of your original order. Would you like us to make this change in your order? Please be aware though that we will only be able to reserve this product for you once we have received your confirmation. As such, once you hear back from you, we will reconfirm stock availability, amend the order accordingly, and share the estimated delivery date with you. Keep in mind that if, in the meantime of your response, your original item moves status (=progresses), unfortunately this offer will expire. We look forward to hearing from you soon, so that we can assist you further on this matter. Best regards, Agent’s First Name (automatic) ​ Free Upgrade Replacement Tool - Proactive Flow ​ 1. Scenario Setup Emma internals will trigger a comms informing customers that some items will be discontinued. The communication is going to state that the customer has 2 options: free upgrade replacement (Item Y) or order cancellation. Customer must reply within 5 business days (otherwise, order is cancelled) Performance Manager will equip BPOs with: A control file with affected customers and possible outcomes (replacement create, in blank or cancelation created) A replacement SKU with stock confirmation The sendout date of the comms 2.  Agent actions All customer replies will create an email case. If customer accepts: Open customer's order, click on the replacement tool ​ ​ select item, reason: Original item phased out. ​ Enter provided SKU (no need to check stock/files). ​ Complete flow, confirm replacement, reply to customer with the PDD, update control file. If customer asks for a cancellation : Process cancellation, reply to customer, update control file. If no reply after 5 days: No manual action needed; order cancelled by Order Management. 3. Key Differences from Reactive Flow Key Differences from Reactive Flow SKU is predefined by Performance Manager. Only one upgrade option is offered. No stock/replacement file checks needed. No follow-up if no reply in 5 days. ​ Process Completion Replacement is processed in the system, and the customer is informed of the outcome and the PDD. Agent leaves a NOTE in Fluent Commerce and Sprinklr explaining which item was replaced and when. If no suitable replacement is available, or the customer declines, alternative resolutions (cancellation, waiting, or keeping the original item) are offered. ​ Frequently Asked (Agent) Questions You can help expand this: reach out to your trainer with your questions. ​ FAQ ​ What is a supplement? Supplements are used to add something to an order to solve an issue after or during delivery, at no extra cost. Typical triggers: logistic claim (delivery issue), product claim (product issue), or return deflection. Supplements do not appear on the customer’s invoice. ​More info here . What happens when it's a WIMO phone case? When a customer comes to us BY PHONE with a WIMO request (Where is my Order), the agent needs to investigate if / why there's a delay. A replacement can be evaluated if: there's a UDD and it's more than 14 Days from the PDD there's no UDD ​ Say to the customer in the call is that : "Unfortunately there's a delay of X amount of days and that we'll analyze internally if there's any possible replacement options for his order. We will get back to them via email with two possible outcomes: If there are some options, we will share it with the link for them to check in the webshop and they like it, they will need to reply to us providing consent for the replacement. If there's no replacement available, we will inform them and let them know that they can always wait and be compensated for the amount of time that they waited or cancel the order as they wish. For compensation, once the order arrives, they need to contact us. ​ Should I offer a replacement or a compensation, if it's applicable on the case? If NO UDD or UDD > 14 days, you can offer both, if there’s a match on stock SKU on the replacement file. ​ Can a customer have a replacement and then be compensated? No. The options of replacement and compensation are not cumulative. We also cannot provide a compensation due to the time that they waited for the replacement to arrive. ​ What happens if, while I'm waiting for customer's response about a replacement, the original item status progresses it? Then the offer expires. This is a condition that appears on the offer's canned response. ​ ​ What's the main difference between proactive and reactive replacements? The main difference is that: For the reactive replacements, agents respond to customer requests and must validate and offer the replacement options, while For proactive replacements, bulk approach with a single predefined replacement and automatic cancellation if the customer does not respond within five days. ​ ​ ​ ​ Previous Versions: Last update: Summarize the last update and relevant changes.

title: Discount Codes
content: TABLE OF CONTENTS What is a discount code? Types of Discount Codes How to identify the different types of Discount Codes? Other specifics discount codes Common Codes inquiries from Customers 1) Code typo by customer 2) Discount information/ policy 3) Code not working How to handle when a Discount Code is not working? What to do with VALID Discount Codes? What to do with NOT VALID Corporate Discount Codes? What is a discount code? We have different ways to push customers to sales. Marketing teams from countries may create different campaigns to give a discount on the products/ order to incentive customers to close the deal with us. The coupon code can vary from campaign to campaign and usually go from 5 - 10%, depending on the specific strategy of the country. In some special cases, even more amounts of discounts can be offered. Types of Discount Codes As explained above, Emma can have different discounts active according to each country's team sales and marketing strategy. Some examples are: - Codes for Influencers; - S pecific seasonal campaigns (such as summer sales, or a specific holiday campaign); - Corporate Discount Codes; - Codes for Affiliates; - Marketing campaigns in media (as radio, tv, outdoors, etc). Or any other reason the marketing team may be able to use to engage customers with the DEAL button! How to identify the different types of Discount Codes? Specific discount codes The other discount codes mentioned above are created sporadically by our Marketing Team for promotional engagement actions or company partnerships. For example, the Corporate Discount Codes can be identified by starting as "CORPXXXXXXX"; and influencer codes can be with their initial or even entire name, like "TATAXX%". The Marketing Team of each country is instructed to update our internal Newsletter to keep you informed about any new discounts. You can find more by checking the related links: AU Newsletter Australia NZ Newsletter New Zealand DE Newsletter Germany CH Newsletter Switzerland NL Newsletter Netherlands AT Newsletter Austria BE Newsletter Belgium BR Newsletter Brasil DK Newsletter Denmark SE Newsletter Sweden ESP Newsletter Spain PT Newsletter Portugal These are sent to customers directly in different ways and not by our customer support team. However, you, as an Emmie, may need to help a customer that has an issue with one of these codes. Common Codes inquiries from Customers It may happen customers reach out to us to claim the discount code is not working and the discount expected has not been applied to the order. Today, the requests may be divided into: Code typo by customer; Discount information/ policy; Code - not working. Freshdesk Ticket Accuracy: Ensure you always provide the related Ticket type & subtype based on the customer request. Let's see in detail the 3 most Common Code questions from customers: 1) C ode typo by customer Some customers might reach out to us claiming the discount code is not working but this might be because they made a typo when adding the discount code. You should check if the customer is using the right coupon code, is the customer typing it properly? If not, provide the related valid one. 2) Discount information/ policy Some customers might reach out to us regarding the policy of the discount - what is the coupon code giving them as a benefit? How long is the discount code valid? Is the campaign for the coupon code still live? If not, explain to the customer the campaign has already finished and the discount code is not valid anymore. Check with your marketing strategy to check if you can proceed with a discount (price match). Follow the market procedure related to it. Specific policies: If the discount code is not valid to apply over an existing discount, explain the discount is not cumulative . Active coupon codes: Customers may reach out to know if there is any active discount code. As an example, you can always advise customers to subscribe to Emma's newsletter and they will be up to receive directly the promotions we do (some countries also include a code for subscription). 3) Code not working Some customers might reach out to you claiming the discount code is not working. It can happen eventually that the code is properly typed, but the customer doesn't see the discount reflected on the cart in the website. In those situations, we have to do some verification, but after checking that it's all right, we can provide a discount after the purchase for the customer. But first, let's check below all the steps to investigate the problem and the steps to handle Discount Code Issues. How to handle when a Discount Code is not working ? How to check if the Discount Code exists and is valid? If the customer claims the Code is not working, we need to understand if is a valid code. A "valid code" means that: 1) The code exist in our systems, so it was created by some team inside Emma; 2) It is still active; 3) It's being applied according to the Terms & conditions of the Code. To check all the 3 situations mentioned, you need to follow the process below: Option 2: If not found in Magento, check it on Talon.One ( How to find discounts in Talon.One ) Ans if it doesn't appear in Talon.One, it means that the code doesn't exist in our systems (it can mean that is a fake code, unfortunately). In the end of this article, you will see what to do in case the discount code that the customer has it's not valid. What to do with VALID Discount Codes? Even if the code is valid, it may not work for the customer and this will make them ask for your support: Step 1: Simulate a purchase on Emma's website (abiding by the code's T&Cs), apply the customer's code, and check if the discount is redeemed in the cart. Step 2: If works for you, but not for the customer, ask the customer to clear cookies & cache or try to access through an incognito window. Step 3: If after this, the code is still not working for the customer, ask the customer to send us the picture of the discount not applying , so we can validate and report the issue to the related team. Step 4: Once we receive this information and have confirmed that the claim is valid, we can advise the customer to go ahead and proceed with the order without the discount code . Make sure to explain to the customer that after the purchase, they should contact us, provide the order number and, once we verify that the order placed meets the voucher T&Cs, we will issue a partial refund in the amount that should have been given as a discount by the voucher. Step 5: After receiving the order confirmation, trigger the related discount manually the OMS (Magento or FluentCommerce). Review how to trigger the discount: Magento: what and how to or Fluentcommerce . Step 6: Send the discount confirmation to the customer after triggering it in the OMS. Manage customer expectations regarding refund time. IMPORTANT: The refund can only be done if the customer makes a purchase under the same conditions as indicated in Magento/Talon.One for the voucher. For example, if the code's conditions state that it can not be used with a product already in sale, the customer's order must not contain any products on sale, otherwise the refund cannot be issued. What to do with NOT VALID Corporate Discount Codes? Now, let's check what to do if it's confirmed that the code is not valid and non-existent in our system : Situation 1 - The code is invalid because it doesn't show in our systems: Answer to the customer: "Unfortunately, after checking our system, we were not able to find the code in question. As such, we would r ecommend you to contact the site/company that provided you with this code, in order to clarify this situation". Situation 2 - The code is invalid because it has expired (the customer contacted us after the expiration date): Answer to the customer: "Unfortunately, after checking our system, we can confirm that the discount code in question is no longer valid, as it could only be used until XX/XX." Situation 3 - The code was valid, but expired between the customer contacting us and our first reply. -> In this case, as a gesture of goodwill, we can advise the customer to go ahead and make the purchase. Explaining that after this, they should contact us, provide the order number and, once we verify that the order placed meets the voucher T&Cs, we will issue a partial refund in the amount that should have been given as a discount by the voucher.

title: Miles programme or credit card points
content: TABLE OF CONTENTS Introduction Does Emma provide a miles programme or credit card points? How to handle customer request for associating purchases with miles/credit card points? Example of how to reply a customer Affiliate's list Introduction This articles explains what to do in case a customer asks about associating an Emma purchase with miles programme and/or credit card points. Does Emma provide a miles programme or credit card points? Emma has partnership with some affiliate companies that allow their customers to associate a purchase done at Emma's website in their respective miles or credit card points programmes. However, this service it is not provided by Emma, it is provided by the affiliate , so we don't have access to connect a purchase with any of those plan options. How to handle customer request for associating purchases with miles/credit card points? We have received some requests from customers asking to link their purchases to their miles or credit card points. It is crucial to handle these requests with empathy and clarity. Here’s how you should respond: Acknowledge the Customer's Request: Start by thanking the customer for their Emma purchase and for reaching out; Explain Our Policy: Clearly explain that associating purchases with miles or credit card points is not a service that Emma provides directly. This is managed by our affiliate company; Guide the Customer: Direct the customer to contact our affiliate company’s customer service for assistance with their miles or points. Provide any relevant contact information if available; Express Understanding and Support: Apologize for any inconvenience and assure the customer of our support for any other issues or questions they may have about the Emma product. Example of how to reply a customer: "Thank you for reaching out and for your recent purchase with us. I understand that you would like to associate your Emma purchase with your miles or credit card points. Unfortunately, this is not a service that we directly provide. We have a partnership with [Partner Company] , and they are responsible for managing the creation and allocation of miles and points. To ensure that your purchase is eligible for miles or points, I recommend contacting them directly. They will be able to assist you further and provide the necessary steps to ensure your purchase is appropriately credited. If there is anything else we can assist you with or if you have any further questions about your Emma product, please do not hesitate to reach out." Affiliate's list appliesAt this moment, we have compiled the list below for a few markets. However, if you work for different market that is not on the list, the affiliate process mentioned above still apply. title: VAT Exemption under UE Tax Law
content: TABLE OF CONTENTS Introduction VAT context VAT exemption conditions Guidelines for VAT exemption Introduction In this article, you will learn the correct procedure regarding VAT (Value Added Tax) exemption and how to deal with customer requests for exemption under the UE Tax Law exemptions. VAT context The customers that make a purchase on Emma's website have the option to input their VAT in the order for fiscal purposes. This is possible if is someone buying for their own use, or if the person represents a business and it's buying for the company. According to the UE Tax Law, when purchasing from a company from a different country, people can ask for a VAT exemption and have the VAT cost refunded. BUT this cannot be done at Emma! Let's understand better the reason why. VAT exemption conditions The VAT exemption can be done if the invoice given to customers is going with another country's VAT number than the one the customer is shipping the products to - again, not the case at Emma. This would only happen in case we allowed customers to buy on a country's website to deliver in a different country and that is not allowed on our checkout. Invoices are not being corrected automatically on OMS and workarounds for this are not compliant (not to mention the tax on the refund). Guidelines for VAT exemption -> Under NO circumstances we should accept VAT exemption at Emma under the UE Tax Law. -> Emma only allows website sales to be delivered to addresses of the countries for the correspondent markets. -> Once the VAT on the invoice will be on the same market, it makes it a non-intracommunity purchase. -> If the customer request further clarification, we can guide them to the website of VIES (VAT Information Exchange System): here

title: Website navigation: Guiding customer to conclude the order
content: TABLE OF CONTENTS 1. Product Category 2. Add to cart 3. Go to cart 4. Checkout page 4.1. Email Address 4.2. Billing Information 4.3. Shipping Information 4.4. Shipping Method 4.5. Payments Methods 4.6. Confirming Payment 5. Confirmation Email Step-by-step video In this article, you will see a step-by-step guide about how the customer purchase an Emma product, from the selection of the item until the payment confirmation. Depending on the country, the Emma website can have different layouts and setups. Those differences are based on user experience and market strategies. Even though, the customer buying process has always followed the same order. Please check below, how to guide a person in every step: 1. Product Category Chose the Product Category on the menu and click on it to see the options available. 2. Add to cart Here the customer can check the price , the materials, and more details of the products. Depending on the product, they will have to choose the size . After this, just have to click on Add to cart . 3. Go to cart Now, 2 pop-up windows will appear: the central one suggesting other products to purchase, and the small one on the corner with the item added and the option to Go to cart and finish the order. 4. Checkout page On the cart page, they can see the product selected, the price, and icons with the payment methods. If the customer has discount code and didn't include it yet, in this step we can check if the discount is applied and if not, just click on "Add Promo Code". To go forward, they have to click on Checkout . 4.1. Email Address Inside the Checkout page , they can only go forward after filling up the topic before. The 1st step is to put an Email Address : 4.2. Billing Information On the Billing Information all the spaces with a star (*) on it are mandatory to be filled. They can also choose to create an account or not, but it’s not mandatory to have one. Before clicking on “Save and continue”, they can tick if the delivery will be for the same address as the billing one. If it’s, they just have to click on the box; if not, they will be able to add another address on the next step. 4.3. Shipping Information This will be already filled up if the billing and shipping address are the same and the customer just has to click on “Save and continue”. If it’s not, they have to include the new details of the Shipping Information and then continue. 4.4. Shipping Method Then, on the Shipping method customers can choose their preferred delivery option based on what is available in each country. 4.5. Payments Methods In the area of Payment methods , every country has different options. The example below refers to Portugal. In this step, depending on the option selected new fields will appear or the customer may be redirected to another page. Please check the market-related article about payment methods here . 4.6. Confirming Payment Finally, on the Review order the customer will be able to double-check the products selected and all the information filled in the previous steps. They will have to mandatorily accept Emma’s Terms and Conditions before finalizing the request by clicking on Pay securely here . 5. Confirmation Email After the website part is done, the customer will receive the Confirmation Email with all the details of the request, including the Order Number . Step-by-step video Also, you can check below the video of how to order via Emma’s website: How to buy on Emma website - step-by-step by Mariana Oreiro

title: (Magento) Refund Follow-up - Product Return
content: TABLE OF CONTENTS Overview Checking the refund status in Magento Refund status is "Refunded" Refund status is "Pending" a. Return status is not yet "Complete" b. Refund status is not tagged properly c. Check if the invoice is available Refund status is "Error" Refund status is "Without" Refund Timeline Overview Once a customer has completed the return of their product, refund will be processed by Refunds Team in Magento within 3-5 business days; however, there are instances where a refund is still pending after 5 business days, thus, having refund follow-up tickets from the customer. This article will help the Customer Service Agents to handle refund follow-up for Product Return. Checking the refund status in Magento These are the possible reasons in Magento why customer has not received their refund: Refund status is "Pending" - pending refunds will be refunded by Refunds Team within 3-5 business days Refund status is "Without" - this is not reflected on the pending list of Refunds Team, thus, will not be refunded Refund status is "Error" - an error has occurred in Magento due to some reason and refund has to be made manually Return status is not "Complete" - order is not yet due for refund since the return of the item is not yet complete; this is not reflected on the pending list of Refunds Team, thus, will not be refunded Order has no invoice - product return refund needs an invoice in order to create a credit memo for the refund If you have received a refund follow-up inquiry from the customer, go to Magento and check the return status. Refund status is "Refunded" If the refund status of the item returned is already tagged as "Refunded", this means that the refund was already processed and the amount should be received by the customer within 14 business days (except when using a credit card which takes 2-3 weeks). Please use a market-specific canned response to answer the customer's inquiry, if available. If the refund is still not received by the customer within 14 business days after the refund was processed in Magento, escalate the ticket to Refunds Emma. N ote: You can see the date when refund was processed in Magento by clicking "Show History" in Actions Column If a failed refund note is seen on the comments history, escalate the ticket to Refunds Emma. Refund status is "Pending" Once the product return is created, the default refund status is "Pending". The Refunds Team will process the refund for the pending product return in Magento within 3-5 business days. If upon checking the refund status in Magento and the refund status is "Pending" for more than 5 business days, there are a few things you should check before escalating the ticket to Refunds Emma. a. Return status is not yet "Complete" If the return status not yet "Complete" in Magento, you should check first if the return is already completed. If yes, update the return status in Magento; if the return is not yet done, coordinate the return of the item with the carrier. Once the return is complete, the refund will be processed in Magento within 3-5 business days and refund will be received by the customer within 14 business days. b. Refund status is not tagged properly Refund requests will only be received by the Refunds Team if the refund status is set to "Full Refund"/"Partial Refund" and "Pending". If this is not the case, update the refund status accordingly. The refund request will be received by the Refunds Team once the status is updated and will be processed within 3-5 business days. c. Check if the invoice is available One of the possible reason why the refund is not yet processed is because the invoice is missing for the returned item. If the invoice is not available in Magento, manual creation of invoice is needed. Follow this article on the steps to create an invoice in Magento - Manual Invoice Creation - Magento . If all of the requirements above are met, Refunds Team will process the refund in Magento within 3-5 business days and there is no need to escalate the ticket. If the refund is still pending in Magento after 5 business days or the amount is not yet received by the customer after 14 business days (2-3 weeks for credit card orders), escalate the ticket to Refunds Emma and use the Refund Request Template . Refund status is "Error" For automated refunds in Magento, there are some instances where the refund is not processed successfully from Magento. For these cases, escalate the ticket to Refunds Emma to manually refund the order. Refund status is "Without" If a refund will be done via bank transfer. If the refund will be coursed through the original mode of payment (not bank transfer), setting the refund status to without will not reflect on the pending list of the Refunds Team, thus, will not be refunded. Refund Timeline The table below shows the refund timeline after the refund was completed in Magento:

title: [Online:D2C:EU] Price-match
content: Introduction This article will help you assist customer's requests for a price match—typically after they’ve placed an order and noticed the same item is now listed at a lower price on our website. This process is not applicable to CH , for this country please reject any price match request TABLE OF CONTENT ​ What a price-match is Why we price-match? ​ Important points before proceeding ​ ​ STEP 1 - Check the order status Order not yet delivered Order already delivered STEP 2 - Request the refund ​ Market Specific Guidelines ​ What a price-match is A price-match request is when a customer who has already placed an order (or attemped)—whether or not the items have shipped/delivered—discovers that the exact same product (identical SKU, colour, size, model, etc.) is now advertised on our website at a lower price. The customer reaches out and asks us to refund the difference so their final cost reflects the new, lower price. This situation typically occurs when the order was placed before a promotion went live and the markdown appears afterward. ​ Why do we price-match? This is a retention tool: it keeps the order (and the customer) with us instead of driving them toward a cancellation or return. The one-question test If the customer cancelled/returned today, could they immediately reorder the same identical item from us at a lower price? Yes → We should price-match. No → A price-match isn’t applicable; Honouring the lower price up front is more cost effective—and far friendlier—than processing a return shipment or cancelling the order. IMPORTANT points to consider before proceeding Trial-period only – We honour price-match requests solely within the customer’s trial window (e.g., the 100-night mattress trial). Exact item, no bundles/packs or give aways – Match the price only for the identical SKU. Bundle deals, free-gift promotions, are excluded. No external or store pricing – For now we don’t match prices from third-party retailers or Emma stores ( Except NL , check market specific guidelines) Market-specific rules – Some countries have additional conditions or caps. Always check the Market-Specific Policies section before confirming a match. Multiple drops, multiple price-matches – If the price drops more than once during the trial period and the customer requests it each time, grant every valid price-match request. Document in Fluent – Add a clear note for each refund Follow refund guidelines– Process the adjustment exactly as outlined in the refund guidelines to avoid rejections. Price matching covers only reductions in the item’s price. We compare what the customer originally paid with the current price for the identical SKU—nothing more. If a customer simply forgot to apply a promo code, that is not a price-match case and should be handled under the standard guidelines. No senior or supervisory approval is required; however, if a situation falls outside these guidelines, please escalate it for further support or authorization. By default, refunds are back to the original payment method and may take up to 14 business days to reflect in the customer’s account, from the moment the refund is issued. If the original payment method is clearly unavailable (e.g., a closed account), note this in the Jira ticket and ask the Refund Team to issue the refund via IBAN instead. Inform the customer that they will receive an email requesting their IBAN details. STEP 1 - Check the order status Order not yet delivered First, verify the payment status. Then follow the appropriate price-match steps for Approved, Pending, or Rejected payments, as per below: Payment status What to tell the customer Actions Approved “Your payment has cleared. We can adjust the total to today’s lower price.” Request the price-match refund Rejected “The payment didn’t go through. Please try again with another payment method or contact your bank. Once the new order succeeds, we’ll match the lower price.” No price match until a successful payment.* Pending “Your payment is still processing. Let’s wait up to 24 hours. I’ll follow up then.” Re-check in 24 hours: If approved → treat as Approved . If declined → treat as Rejected . *If an order is initially rejected—say, because the payment fails and the order is cancelled—but the customer later manages to complete the purchase, you may honor the lower price shown on their first attempt once the new payment is confirmed. Ask the customer to place the new order at the current price, then contact back so we can refund the difference. Order already delivered Confirm whether the item is still inside the trial period Within the window: request a refund to the price-match. Outside the window: explain that the eligibility period has passed and a price match is no longer possible. STEP 2 - Request the refund Click the steps below 1. Jira Ticket Open a JIRA ticket * trough this portal. ​ *BE ; NL ; DE and AT : For these supporting markets with Jira integrated in Sprinklr, the refunds should be requested through Sprinklr. Email subject line: Price‑Match Request Emma Online (D2C) – Price‑Match Request Bestseller eCommerce – Price‑Match Request ​ NL Market Only: Email subject line : [Retailer Name] – Price‑Match Request Reason for refund: Discounts - Price Match 2. Price check and screenshots You will do a price check*: Open Fluent and your customer's respective country's Emma website to check both prices (original price and current price). Take one screenshot of the price paid by the customer on the original order, visible on Fluent, and the current discounted price, by checking on the Website. Take screenshot(s) that shows the following: Original price – the amount paid as displayed in Fluent. Current price – the new promotional price obtained by you simulating* the order on our website. Note: *When you run the price check, select the exact same SKU, size, colour, and region . Ensure each of those details is clearly visible in the screenshot. This image is the proof the Refund Team needs to approve the adjustment without delay or rejection. ​ Example: Fluent screenshot Website screeshot Note: For a second price-match on the same item, it’s refund value will be the difference between the first price drop’s (in practice, the second price the item had) and second price drop (in practice, the third price the item had). See an example below ​ How to calcute the refund sum: Example of multiple price-match requests for the same product Same SKU, within the 100-day (or your market's equivalent) trial period: Original price - 600€ 1st price drop - 550€ | Price-match refund: 50€ (original price 600€ - 1st price drop 550€) 2nd price drop - 520€ | 2nd Price match refund: 30€ (1st price drop 550€ - 2nd price drop 520€) For more details on refund check : How to: Refunds & Credit Memo ​ ​ Market Specific Guidelines UK & IE - If the customer is requesting a price- match against a give-away/bundles/pack item eg: The mattress now comes with a pillow for examples, please escalate to a senior/supervisor for a 10% promo-code. DE,BE,AT,PT & ES - If the customer is requesting a price- match against a give-away/bundles/pack item eg: The mattress now comes with a pillow for examples, please escalate internally for a final decision. NL - Price matching is available for e‑commerce retailers; please include the retailer’s name in the subject line of the refund request. If a customer requests a price match against a giveaway, bundle, or pack item (e.g., a mattress that now comes with a free pillow), please escalate the case internally for a final decision.

title: [UK Process]- Divide Buy Refunds
content: Introduction Divide Buy is a Credit platform that allowed its customers to buy products such as Emma products and make the payments by stages, however in 2024, Divide buy was bought by another company and as now started a liquidation process, meaning they no longer have Consumer payment handling capabilities, meaning they cannot manage transactions. How does this impact you? This will imply a change on the refund process for Divide Buy (DB) orders dated before April 1st. 2023 . Note: for orders after the 1st April of 2023 the process doesnt change and you will proceed with the refund process as usual. What is the new process? Refunds will be processed via bank Transfer. Information needed: Account Number + Sort Code + Beneficiary Name Requests in Magento: Should be set to pending only when the IBAN is available so our Refunds Team can proceed with the bank transfer Requests in Fluentcommerce: Request should be made as " Return without Refund ", and a Jira ticket should be opened  on the " AR D2C Porta l" for a refund request with the bank details of the customer. Note: This orders will always fall outside the Trial period considering they were opened more then a year ago, so make sure to follow the correct processes when a customer requests a refund.

title: How to insert the Refund amount (AR D2C Jira)
content: Introduction When opening a Jira ticket for a Refund request at the AR D2C Portal, one key field that needs to be properly inserted is the refound amount, to ensure a quick and standard process we have created the following explanation for you. Insert Refund amount: Numerical Value only regardless of currency : Sample 220.23 / 1,600.21 / .10 for Centavos Use "," to indicate Hundreds, Thousands value Use "." to indicate Centavos No words, no percentage in Amount Fields Some correct examples: Good use of period (.) and Comma (,) ​ ​ Some incorrect samples: Amount in words Wrong usage of period (.) and Comma (,) ​ Using percentage Using currency symbols or words

title: How to: Refunds & Credit Memo
content: ​ Lastest update: 15/10/2025 - Added " Steps to Send a Credit Memo to the Customer " ​ Re: IBAN / Refunds Team Please do not request an IBAN. If this is required, the Refunds team will request it directly from the customer via a form. Table of Content Credit Memo Steps to Send a Credit Memo to the Customer Definition Status Database Details page Refunds for: Compensation/ Discount follow-up/ Composable products cancellation Credit Memo Definition When a cancellation is done in Fluent commerce, automatically a credit memo is created in the system. You can immediately find it by accessing the Credit memo section in the Menu bar, as per How to: Navigating Fluent Commerce article . A credit memo is a financial term for a monetary transaction, e.g. a refund to the customer. Each credit memo has a unique reference number: For a return WITH REFUND, the credit memo is created only after the status of the return is updated to Complete , as per related article: How to Return an item Credit Memo Status The credit memo status will reflect the status of the transaction: Created The credit Memo has been created Aw aiting for Submission Credit Memo is waiting for its submission Requested Credit Memo has been acknowledged PSP Pending Credit Memo is processing Completed Credit Memo is completed Failed Credit Memo has failed View of Credit Memo Status on Fluent Commerce You may find it under Returned Orders WITH REFUND. Credit Memo database ​ Credit Memo details page Steps to Send a Credit Memo to the Customer ​ Locate the order the customer is contacting us about. Go to the "Related" tab, you’ll find the "Credit Memo" section there, at the end of the page. If a refund has been issued, a “Resend Email” button will be available. ​ Check the status of the credit memo: If the status is "Awaiting Submission" , "Requested" , or "PSP Pending" , it means the refund has not yet been issued . → In this case, please open a Jira to ADRDC for further investigation. If the status is "Complete" , the refund has already been issued. If the status is "SENT_TO_CUSTOMER , ask the customer to check their junk/spam folder, as the email may have been filtered there. If the customer still hasn’t received the proof of refund , you can click “Resend Email.” Inform the customer that the email can take up to 8 business hours to arrive. If they still haven’t received it after that time, ask them to contact us again for follow-up. ​ Full-page Screenshot ​ Important Note: In some cases, the "Credit Memo" or "Resend Email" button may not be available. This usually happens when a supplement was offered instead of a return, meaning no refund was triggered. ​ Refunds for Compensation & Discount follow-up requests Currently, whenever you need a refund of a specific amount for compensation, you are yet not able to perform this on Fluent Commerce. For partial refunds (compensation / discount follow-up or composable products cancellation refunds: you should proceed with the manual request via our Order-2-Cash Portal to our Emma Refunds team. ARD2C JIRA Portal Attention: starting from 13/05/2025 Every time a refund is applicable and the agent needs to request it through the ARD2C Jira (manual refund), agent needs to: 1. Confirm if the email that the customer is contacting is the same as in Fluent Commerce. If not, confirm with the customer is the email in there is accurate and change it if it's not. 2. Send the following macro: ​ Hi [Customer's first name], Thank you for your patience. We have now initiated your refund request which is currently being processed by our internal team. If the account details and personal information we have on file are complete and correct, the refund will be processed accordingly. In this case, you can expect to receive it within 14 working days. However, if there is any missing or incomplete personal information in our system, due to GDPR rules, our Refund support will contact you directly via email and ask you to fill a form providing the new IBAN and all the necessary details in order to process your refund. Once again, we do appreciate your patience and understanding throughout this process. If you have any questions in the meantime, please feel free to contact us. Kind regards, [Agent's first name] Release Note: As of 18 September 2025: Please do not request an IBAN. If this is required, the Refunds team will request it directly from the customer via a form.

title: Refund Follow-up - Order Cancellation
content: TABLE OF CONTENTS Overview Checking the Order Status in Magento Order Status - Canceled Order Status - Cancel Requested w/ Invoice or Shipped Order Status - Cancel Requested w/o invoice and not shipped Refund Timeline Overview For order cancellation with refund request in Magento, orders will be cancelled in 3-5 business days and customers will receive the refund within 14 business days (2-3 weeks for credit card orders) depending on the payment method used. (Refer to the table below for the refund timeline.) This article will help the Customer Service Agents to handle refund follow-up for Order Cancellation. Checking the Order Status in Magento If a follow-up ticket was received from the customer regarding refund for order cancellation, first thing you should check is the current order status. For order cancellation, there are different possible order status: Canceled Cancel requested Handling of the refund follow-up depends on the order status. Order Status - Canceled If the order status is already "Canceled", it means the refund was already done and the refund should have received by the customer within 14 business days (2-3 weeks for credit card orders) depending on the payment method used after the refund is processed in Magento. Confirmation of refund can be seen on the comments history: If the refund is still not received by the customer within 14 business days (2-3 weeks for credit card orders) after the refund was processed in Magento, escalate the ticket to Refunds Emma and use the Refund Request Template . If a failed refund note is seen on the comments history, escalate the ticket to Refunds Emma and use the Refunds Escalation Template . For partial cancellations, order status will revert back to Payment Received order status after the partial cancellation is processed. If this is not the case, escalate the ticket to Refunds Emma to revert the order status back to Payment Received. Order Status - Cancel Requested w/ Invoice or Shipped Once the order cancellation is initiated in Magento, order status changes to "Cancel Requested". If the order status is stuck in Cancel Requested for more than 5 business days, there are two possible reasons: Order has an invoice - if the order for cancellation and the invoice was already created, the refund cannot be processed via cancellation. A product return (PR) refund request has to be created. Once the PR refund request is created and all of the PR refund requirements are met, the refund will be processed within 3-5 business days. Order is tagged as shipped - if the order for cancellation and the order is already tagged as shipped, the refund cannot be processed via cancellation. An invoice ( Manual Invoice Creation - Magento ) and product return (PR) refund request has to be created. Once the PR refund request is created and all of the PR refund requirements are met , the refund will be processed within 3-5 business days. Order Status - Cancel Requested w/o invoice and not shipped Once the order cancellation is initiated in Magento, order status changes to "Cancel Requested". The refund for the order cancellation should be processed within 3-5 business days; however, there are instances where the cancellation is not automatically processed by Magento. If the order is on "Cancel Requested" status for more than 5 business days or customer still hasn't received the refund for more than 14 business days, escalate the ticket to Refunds Emma and use the Refund Request Template . Refund Timeline The table below shows the refund timeline after the refund was completed in Magento:

title: Refunds Process
content: ​ ​ ​ Version up-to-date as of: 10/11/2025 - Only IT & PT markets remaining (removed markets that had just a link) | Added context to ARD2C action on refund requests. (navigate to 1.3 → Below Macro) Purpose : This article covers refund requests, follow-up, order cancellations, discount, product return, and credit memos. ​ ​ Article Use Case(s ) Refund follow-up Refunds and Credit memo Refund requests Product return Inserting a refund Discounts and order cancellation ​ ​ Article Dashboard ​ Issues Article Addresses Potential Outcomes Market-specific webshop landing pages Refund to customer ​Credit Memo ​Escalation to Refunds Emma > customer refund ​ Friend referral ​ ​Jira portal ​ ​ ​ Table of Contents ​ Table of Contents 1. Global Process & Workflow ​ 1.1 Refunds for Compensation & Discount follow-up requests 1.2 Credit Memo 1.3 ARD2C JIRA Portal 1.4 Friend Referral Program ​ ​ Frequently Asked (Agent) Questions ​ ​ ​ ​ Global Process and Workflow Global Process and Workflow / Market specifics : Is your market present? Yes : Click your Market tab, ignore Global Process. No : refer to the Global Process and Workflow. Each of the market tabs includes the webshop landing page. Global Process and Workflow Friend Referral Program IT PT Magento 1.1 Refunds for Compensation & Discount follow-up requests Currently, whenever you need a refund of a specific amount for compensation, you are yet not able to perform this on Fluent Commerce. For partial refunds (compensation / discount follow-up or composable products cancellation refunds: you should proceed with the manual request via our Order-2-Cash Portalto our Emma Refunds team. ​ 1.2 Credit Memo When a cancellation is done in Fluent commerce, automatically a credit memo is created in the system. Each credit memo has a unique reference number. For a return WITH REFUND, the credit memo is created only after the status of the return is updated to Complete. 1.4 Friend Referral Program Terms and conditions for the Friend Referral Program may vary depending on the market and the individual customer. If the customer finds any part of the conditions unclear, please ask your supervisor to raise a request to the internal market POC. If you sense that the customer is satisfied with the support they received and could be considered a promoter, feel free to suggest the Friend Referral Program as a way for them to earn additional rewards from Emma. Friend referral is a loyalty campaign we have available to all of our customers. ​ What is needed from your side? We will only need you to know some basic information about this process in case the customer reaches out. If you sense that the customer is satisfied with the support they received and could be considered a promoter, feel free to suggest the Friend Referral Program as a way for them to earn additional rewards. ​ Friend Referral Process (How does it work) Upon finishing the purchase process, the customer will be informed about the referral program and the benefits for both parties. The customer in this case will be considered the "Advocate" and will create a personalized code for their referral code. ​ How can the Friend use the code? By Link sharing, the Advocate can send their friends the referral link. By using the Advocate personalized code. Friend referral is a loyalty campaign we have available to all of our customers. "Hey, do you know Emma? I have a mattress and I have been sleeping much better after I bought it. Have you consider buying a new one? I have a referral code that I can share with you for a discount!" ​ The program tends to motivate customers to refer Emma products to their friends and by doing so, both benefit from it. On one side, the customer who is referring wins a Bonus, on the other side, the "friend" buying a new product has a discount. Webshop Landing Page ​ https://www.emma-materasso.it/presenta-un-amico/?situation=customer-support COD Refunds / Bank Transfers For order placed with Cash on Delivery(payment no longer availabe)/ Bank Transfer option, a bank transfer is the only option to make a refund. In order to do so, please ask the customer to provide the IBAN and complete name of the account's owner (it should be in the name of the person that made the order). ​ Once you get the information from the customer, add a comment on Magento with the IBAN provided under "Customer Inquiries". Then open a JIRA requesting for the refund to be made, specifying that the IBAN is already registered in Magento. ​ Soisy Refunds For order paid via Soisy, since we no longer have a partnership with this provider, please report to your Supervisor all the request of refunds for order placed with this payment provider. ​ N.B. If a partial refund is needed, please specify the exact amount we need to refund customer for, and ask to recalculate the installments. ​ Webshop Landing Page ​ https://www.colchaoemma.pt/referir-um-amigo?situation=customer-support ​ 1.1 Refunds for Compensation & Discount follow-up requests Currently, whenever you need a refund of a specific amount for compensation, you are yet not able to perform this on Fluent Commerce. For partial refunds (compensation / discount follow-up or composable products cancellation refunds: you should proceed with the manual request via our Order-2-Cash Portalto our Emma Refunds team. ​ According to Portuguese law (DL n.º 24/2014, dated 14 February - Article 12 - image below), Emma needs to make the refund within 14 days of the customer notifying us of his intention to withdraw from the purchase contract. ​ These 14 days are NOT working days, so weekends and bank holidays will be counted as well. ​ 1.2 Credit Memo When a cancellation is done in Fluent commerce, automatically a credit memo is created in the system. Each credit memo has a unique reference number. For a return WITH REFUND, the credit memo is created only after the status of the return is updated to Complete. 1.4 Friend Referral Program Terms and conditions for the Friend Referral Program may vary depending on the market and the individual customer. If the customer finds any part of the conditions unclear, please ask your supervisor to raise a request to the internal market POC. If you sense that the customer is satisfied with the support they received and could be considered a promoter, feel free to suggest the Friend Referral Program as a way for them to earn additional rewards from Emma. Once a customer has completed the return of their product, refund will be processed by Refunds Team in Magento within 3-5 business days; however, there are instances where a refund is still pending after 5 business days, thus, having refund follow-up tickets from the customer. ​ If the refund status of the item returned is already tagged as "Refunded", this means that the refund was already processed and the amount should be received by the customer within 14 business days (except when using a credit card which takes 2-3 weeks). ​ If refund is not received within 14 days after processed in Magento, escalate the ticket to Refunds Emma. One of the possible reason why the refund is not yet processed is because the invoice is missing for the returned item. If the invoice is not available in Magento, manual creation of invoice is needed. Follow this article on the steps to create an invoice in Magento - Manual Invoice Creation - Magento. ​ 1.2 Credit Memo Status on Fluent Commerce Status: You may find it under Returned Orders WITH REFUND. ​ Created The credit Memo has been created Awaiting for Submission Credit Memo is waiting for its submission Requested Credit Memo has been acknowledged PSP Pending Credit Memo is processing Completed ​Credit Memo is complete Failed Credit Memo has failed ​ 1.3 ARD2C JIRA Portal When opening a Jira ticket for a Refund request at the AR D2C Portal, one key field that needs to be properly inserted is the refund amount. Every time a refund is applicable and the agent needs to request it through the ARD2C Jira (manual refund), they must send the following macro to the customer: ​ Macro Insert Refund amount Hi [Customer's first name], ​ Thank you for your patience. ​ We have now initiated your refund request which is currently being processed by our internal team. If the account details and personal information we have on file are complete and correct, the refund will be processed accordingly. In this case, you can expect to receive it within 14 working days. ​ However, if there is any missing or incomplete personal information in our system, our Refunds team will contact you via email, and ask you to complete a form providing all the necessary details. ​ Once again, we do appreciate your patience and understanding throughout this process. If you have any questions in the meantime, please feel free to contact us. ​ Kind regards, [Agent's first name] Numerical Value only regardless of currency : Sample 220.23 / 1,600.21 / .10 for Centavos Use "," to indicate Hundreds, Thousands value Use "." to indicate Centavos No words, no percentage in Amount Fields ​ ​ ARD2C monitors Refunds processing and for failed refunds, they will either: Reprocess it ; or Send the Outbound Bank Details Form, requesting customer’s IBAN to process the refund manually. ​ ARD2C will then leave a comment in FluentCommerce with the Refund’s details: Date; Amount refunded and IBAN used for it. (initial 4 and last 4 digits of the IBAN, due to GDPR). ​ ​ Frequently Asked (Agent) Questions You can help expand this: reach out to your trainer with your questions. ​ FAQ ​ Are there any amount restrictions? Not at the moment, and we don’t expect this to change. The customer is experiencing issues — where should we escalate? Please collect as much relevant information as possible and ask your supervisor to raise the issue with the Emma Internal Team. The customer's discount code isn’t working — can I generate a new one? No. These codes are generated by our partner’s tool and must be tracked by the Internal Teams. Please do not create a manual code. Does the discount code apply to bundles? This depends on the market. If this question comes up, raise it with your supervisor for further guidance. ​ ​ ​ ​ Previous Versions: Last update: Summarize the last update and relevant changes.
