title: Delivery Carriers FAQ
content: QUESTIONS ​ How to check which carrier is responsible for delivering the order? ​ ​ What differenciate the carriers? ​ What to do if there’s no tracking updates? ​ How to proceed with carrier misbehavior? ​ ​ What to do if the status in OMS is delivered but customer says he didn’t receive the order? ​ ​ How to proceed if carrier refuses to deliver at the door because there wasn’t a lift? ​ ​ How to proceed if a customer complains about damage in the order’s box or in their houses during assembly? ​ ​ How to proceed if the products sent were incorrect? ​ ​ How to proceed if part of the product is missing (ex. the feet of a bed)? ​ ​ How does the Reject at the Door process work? How to check which carrier is responsible for delivering the order? Open an order in Fluent Commerce Go to Fulfillments section, then click in "Fulfilment location". On the red circle you'll be able to to see the carrier assigned to the order. On the left you're able to see the the tracking label (that can be used to track the order). ​ If the tracking number/carrier info is not available, it's because a carrier hasn't been assigned to the order yet. What differenciate the carriers? Some of them are one-man handling and others are two-men handling carriers. ​ 1MH: when there's just 1 person responsible for delivering the order (e.g: accessories, box beds and mattresses <40kg). There's no scheduling service for delivery of 1MH items. Troubleshooting issues with 1MH carriers here . ​ ​ 2MH: when there's 2 delivery people (e.g: most beds and all the mattresses >40kg). There's scheduling service for delivery of 2MH items, therefore the carriers call the customers/send email and align a delivery date. When it's 2MH, the customer has direct contact with the carrier and can request address alterations or a cancellation by themselfs. That's what it means in the matrix bellow"Yes - self service (call or email)". Troubleshooting issues with 2MH carriers here . ​ What to do if there’s no tracking updates? If there's no updated for more than 3 working days, please inform customers that they can reach out to the carriers by using the contact information available here .  If they come back saying that they didn't had any reply, please open a ticket to Backoffice under "Carrier issues" and Backoffice agents will contact the carrier. How to proceed with carrier misbehavior? Check the process here . What to do if the s tatus in OMS is delivered but customer says he didn’t receive the order? Check the process here (Logistic Claim and carrier misbehavior) How to proceed if carrier refuses to deliver at the door because there wasn’t a lift? Always open a Jira to OFC informing this so we can discuss the situation with the carrier, but the process is here (Carrier Misbehaviour). How to proceed if a customer complains about damage in the order’s box or in their houses during assembly? Check the process here. How to proceed if the products sent were incorrect? If the customer doesn’t want the product that arrived, find the process here . If the customer wants to keep the product, then the process is to refund the difference between values and offer compensation. Check more details here . How to proceed if part of the product is missing (ex. the feet of a bed)? Create a supplement by following this process . How does the Reject at the Door process work? Process is described here with details. Some highlights: once the customer rejects the order, they need to inform us. In about 48h, the carrier will change the status of the order in OMS to “ return_sender_complete ” * . Once this is done, the agent needs to open a JIRA for a Refund. It’s important to inform the customer from the beginning that this whole process may take around 20 business days to be completed as it’s not automatic . * If the status is not updated to "return_sender_complete" in the next 48h after the refusal date, please open a Jira to Backoffice (if Central Europe) or contact the carrier directly (other markets).<

title: Last Mile Carrier Contact Information Guidelines
content: When to Contact a Carrier? ​ Check here the conditions to BENADACH + UK. Rule of thumb, only contact carriers IF: Your question can't be solved taking a look at the tracking website or Carrier Portal (login below), Parcel Lab or at Emma's Order Status Page. Some extra cases: If you need the proof of delivery and it's not in the tracking website or in the carrier portal. If you were unable to get the proof of delivery from the carrier, please open a Jira here. It's a address correction with a 1MH carrier and the order is already with them. Understand the difference here and you can see how to troubleshoot 2MH carrier issues as well. Order is already with the carrier and status doesn't move in 5 business days (Order Stuck w/ Carrier). If the issue falls outside of these guidelines, please direct the customer to contact the carrier directly. Find the customer contact information for each carrier here . title: DPD Undeliverable Order Issue Resolution - AT, BE, CH, DE, NL (BENEDACH)
content: DPD keeps track of orders that they could not deliver. This might be because the address doesn’t exist, or the delivery driver was unable to reach the address. For those issues, someone needs to troubleshoot the address issue and update the delivery information within DPDs system. TL;DR, Who does what? Team leads or Supervisors : Will extract the orders that require attention from the DPD portal and will update the Excel file. They will distribute these orders among their agents to investigate. Agents : Will investigate the orders, contact the customers, and log the outcome on the Excel file. Table of Contents For Team Leads: How to extract all tickets Extracting the orders What to do with the Excel file Link to the Excel file For Agents: How to resolve DPD undeliverable order issue Troubleshooting and resolving the issue Log your actions in the Excel file Link to the Excel file FAQ If the customer did not reply on the first day, where should I log the outcome in Excel? For Team Leads: How to extract all tickets Extracting the orders Find the list of orders in DPD’s platform Login to DPD’s platform at: https://business.dpd.de/login.aspx Use the credentials provided for you to log in Field Value acccount EmmaCS.SD password VBonxU5nVmqs%9w,gc[A Every day, export all open orders to Excel and add them to the tab for that day Step-by-step instructions can be found in this PDF: pdf ExtractUndeliverableOrderIssuesfromDPDportal_PDF_2024-11-12161115.975155.pdf 1.42 MB What to do with the Excel file Every day, the Excel file needs to be updated to capture the order issues and their resolution. Create a new tab, name it according to the date in the format dd-mm-yy Copy the Template table and paste it into the newly created tab Add all exported orders from the DPD overview in today's tab Step-by-step instructions can be found in this PDF: pdf UpdatingtheDPDUndeliverableOrderIssuesinExcelfile_PDF_2024-11-12161657.680893.pdf 0.85 MB Link to the Excel file Find the file here: Masterfile - 2024-11 - DPD Undeliverable Order Issue Resolution.xlsx For Agents: How to resolve DPD undeliverable order issue Troubleshooting and resolving the issue Find the order in DPD’s platform Login to DPD’s platform at: https://business.dpd.de/login.aspx Use the credentials provided for you to log in. Troubleshoot why the order couldn’t be delivered and correct the delivery information Review the contact details in Fluent Commerce. Check if the address details match the information in the DPD portal. Is the info in Fluent and DPD portal the same? If YES , change the address info in the DPD portal and resubmit the delivery. DPD will attempt to deliver at the updated address. If NO , contact the customer to explain DPD couldn’t deliver due to an undeliverable address issue. Update the address in Fluent Commerce, AND Update the address in the DPD portal, AND Resubmit the delivery on the DPD portal. DPD will attempt to deliver at the updated address. Log your actions in the Excel file On the Excel file, you need to log all of the following columns: ' Customer contact created at ': Note the day and time in the format 'dd-mm-yyyy hhHHmm' ' Customer contact channel ': Select one of email/phone/chat ' Customer replied at ': Note the day and time in the format 'dd-mm-yyyy hhHHmm' 'Customer replied channel ': Select one of email/phone/chat 'Address matches Fluent?' Was the address in the DPD portal already the same as in Fluent Commerce? Answer by filling in 'yes' or 'no'. ' Root cause ': Leave a brief description based on the customer's reply, what was the actual issue that led to the address being uncorrect in DPD? Link to the Excel file Find the file here: Masterfile - 2024-11 - DPD Undeliverable Order Issue Resolution.xlsx Why is it important to log all information in the Excel file? This way, we can find underlying issues that are causing issues with the delivery of orders. This can help us to find a opportunities to improve our website, integrations or processes so we can ensure most orders get delivered correctly on the first attempt. FAQ If the customer did not reply on the first day, where should I log the outcome in Excel? Always log the outcome on the current day. If the order first appeared on the list on November 1st, and the customer was first contacted on November 1st, you will log the first contact on the file called 01-11-24. If that same customer only replied on November 3rd, you will log the resolution of this order on the file called 03-11-24. This way, we can track the time it takes for customers to reply.

title: How to: Check Updated Delivery Dates
content: TABLE OF CONTENTS Introduction Updated Delivery Dates When to check this? How it works? When the update was done? Introduction In this article, you can check how to verify the information about the option inside FluentCommerce that shows Updated Delivery Dates . This new feature will be available globally, for all orders from Emma's website (D2C / non-wholesale). Updated Delivery Dates When to check this? Whenever a customer contacts us asking "Where is my order?" and after checking the order in FluentCommerce you see a red banner or the "Promised Delivery" in the past already. How it works? Every time there is a change in the delivery estimation for an order to arrive to our customers, this will be updated and reflected in the system: The Updated Delivery Date is shown in the " Order Item" list at the Order details page; A red notification banner appears on the Order details page; And the message on the banner says "See Updated Delivery Date" and it is hyperlinked to the ‘Order Item List’ section below. The image below shows in blue the "Promise Delivery date" , and next to it, in orange, the "Updated Delivery Date" with the new estimation of the delivery arrival to the customer. Note for Wholesale orders: this new column will only show up for non-Wholesale Orders as Wholesale already has an entity called Expected Delivery Date . When the update was done? It is possible to verify when the field "Updated Delivery Dates" was last refreshed. You can check this to make sure this is a recent update and to assure the customer about it. Click on the SKU of the item 2. Go to the section "Attributes" and check the information at the option that says "deliveryDateCalculatedAt". The date indicates the last day the delivery was updated in the system.

title: List of similar SKUs per Market
content: This article provides guidelines on how to identify similar/equivalent SKUs in case the ones that customers requested is unavailable. For example: A customer has a legitimate product/logistic claim but the original SKU is Out of Stock or Phased Out. There's a delay, the SKU the customer ordered is Out of Stock, and the customer, wishing to cancel, is open to a suggestion of a similar item to repurchase instead. How to find the similar item: In this link you'll find your market's file with all the current sold SKUs. In the first column you have the SKU, in the second and third columns, you'll find the equivalent items. Confirm the stock availability of the "replacement" products ( click here ) to ensure we’re not suggesting an item that is also out of stock. OBS: In some cases, the products listed may not be a direct replacement but an upgrade. If this happens, check with your supervisor to see if you can offer a coupon to the customer in this scenario.

title: Parcel delivered to Parcel Shop
content: TABLE OF CONTENTS Delivery to Parcel shop What is a Parcel shop? Why and when is a parcel delivery to a Parcel shop? How is the customer informed? Deliver parcel from parcel shop to customer's address Parcel delivered in Parcel station / Parcel locker Delivery to Parcel shop This article is to clarify what a parcel shop is, when is the parcels delivered to a parcel shop, and how the customer is informed. What is a Parcel shop? A parcel shop is a store, gas station, or similar where the carrier can deliver parcels for the customers to pick up whenever it fits them. It is always marked on the store which carriers they collaborate with as in the picture below for a GLS parcel shop. Why and when is a parcel delivery to a Parcel shop? Normally a parcel is delivered to a parcel shop when the carrier has tried to deliver the parcel to the customer's address and the customer was unavailable or not home. The carrier does not wait outside the customer's house and we cannot expect the carrier to call the customer when arriving to the customer's address. If the customer was unavailable for the delivery the carrier will sometimes deliver the parcel to a parcel shop near the customer's address. We cannot guaranty the customer that the parcel will be delivered to a parcel shop if the customer is not home when the carrier tries to deliver the parcel. If the tracking says it was delivered in a parcel shop then that is the case If the tracking does not say delivered in parcel shop and the tracking does not say returned to sender, then the carrier will try and deliver the parcel to the customer's address again one of the next working days, The customer can go to the parcel shop in it's opening hours, which they can find on google, to pick up the parcel. How is the customer informed? The customer will receive a notification either via SMS or email directly from the carrier. In this notification, the customer will find the tracking number, address of the parcel shop and other necessary information the customer needs to pickup the parcel. Deliver parcel from parcel shop to customer's address It is not possible for the carrier to pick up the parcel again once it has been delivered in the parcel shop. This is because the parcel is already marked as delivered in our and the carrier's system. It is therefore not possible for us or the carrier to redeliver the parcel. Parcel delivered in Parcel station / Parcel locker When a parcel is delivered to a parcel station or parcel locker, it means the same as when delivered to a parcel shop. The difference between these locations is: Parcel shop = store Parcel station / parcel locker = no human service provided Notification differences: Parcel shop = notification via SMS or email Parcel station/parcel locker = notification via SMS, email, or psychical note in customer's mailbox. No matter the type of notification, the customer will always receive the notification from the carrier directly and it will contain all the necessary information to pick up the parcel. Parcel shop. The customer gets the parcel with the help of a human. Parcel station / parcel locker. The customer gets a code in the notification from the carrier , goes to the station/locker, types the provided code, and the "door" will open and the customer can collect their parcel.

title: WIMO - Delivery is Delay
content: TABLE OF CONTENTS Introduction The journey of an item: Unhappy Path Delivery is delay Why the order is delayed? Order Stuck Order Out of Stock Warehouse and Last Mile Delays Unable to Deliver Introduction In this article, you will learn what to do when items are out of the promised delivery date, and consequently, the order is delayed. Whenever you face a delayed order, you are responsible for providing clear information to the customer about the status of the order and what will happen next In order to do that, you must follow investigation steps to identify what is the root cause of the delay and manage the customer expectations regarding the solution and delivery time. Review: Make sure to also read all the related WIMO articles, such as WIMO - What is it? and WIMO - Delivery is On Time . The journey of an item: Unhappy Path As explained in the article What is WIMO , we have different phases that the item goes through after it's purchased and before arriving to the customer. During this journey, unexpected issues can happen that could cause a delayed delivery. Delivery is delay We will always try our best to minimize the negative impact of the delay and appreciate the customer for choosing Emma. If information is available about the delay, give an explanation, and be transparent with the customer. Always show a willingness to help and to ensure the customer receives their item at the earliest convenience. The image below shows with blue dots the phases in which we can face problems and the arrows indicate which can be the issue: Order Stuck: Problems with the transmission of the order like address errors, payment issues, or system bugs. Order Out of Stock: The item is out of stock and the order has yet not be fulfilled. Or is delayed, but already fulfilled. Warehouse delays: Order dispatched with delay by the warehouse. Last mile delays: These happen with unable-to-delivery scenarios or due to Logistic Claims (parcel lost, partial delivery, etc). Why the order is delayed? Step 1: Investigate the order in detail After being contacted by a customer asking about their order, you will have to open the order in the case and look at the details of it to understand what exactly is happening. It's possible that only one item was not delivered, or that we are having an issue at the warehouse. So, before determining the reason and taking further action, please check carefully the order in the system. Check the "Promised delivery date": expire within 2 days or it is already in the past? Check the "Fulfilment status" of all items of the order Item by item identification: which status is each item at? In FluentCommerce -> Click on the link here and then under the bottom "Guide me" to have these steps in a side window that will guide you while navigating in FluentCommerce: HERE In Magento -> Click on the link here and then under the bottom "Guide me" to have these steps in a side window that will guide you while navigating in Magento: HERE Step 2: Identifying the reason for the delay Whenever you face a delayed order, you are responsible for providing clear information to the customer about this order. In order to do that, you must first investigate the case to clarify what is the reason for the delay and manage customer expectations about the outcome and the expected arrival of their item. Identifying the reason is necessary as based on that you will know exactly how to handle to support the customer. We have 4 different scenarios that can cause a delivery to be delayed and each one of them has distinct resolutions. Let's check in detail each one of them: Order Stuck The Order is Stuck when is not being transmitted in the system, normally due to a Payment Issue , Address typo , or System bug . Those cases happen between the phases "Purchase" and "Order Confirmed" and when the Order Status is at Unknown or the status is for more than 05 days stuck in one of the following: For Magento: Packing; Prepared for Export. For FluentCommerce: Assigned; How to work on it? Check OMS (Order Management System); Identify that the order status is unknown; Open a ticket to Back-Office team (for Central Europe countries) or to OM team (for all other countries) informing them the status is stuck and asking them to review the order; When the team responsible gets back to you, you check the delivery date update and send it via email to the customer. ​ Order Out of Stock We may face situations where the product purchased by a customer is facing an out-of-stock situation. For those cases, the order will not go to "Order Confirmed" and will neither be "Submitted to Warehouse". The Fulfillment or Barcode status will show as " Waiting on Stock" . ​ How to work on it? Check OMS (Order Management System) Identify that the status is "Waiting on Stock"; Check if there's an Updated Delivery Date and follow the instructions . Warehouse and Last Mile Delays ​ After the Order is Confirmed it will be "Submitted to Warehouse" and later will be "Dispatched", since the carrier will pick-up the item to make a delivery. Those are the Fulfillment/Barcode status that you may see: For Magento: Order submitted to warehouse Order received by warehouse Waiting for Delivery date Parcel data submitted / ready for shipping Arrived at sorting center Out for deliver For FluentCommerce: Submitted to FL Received by FL Picked & Packed by FL Ready to Dispatch Dispatched Arrived at the sorting center Out for delivery ​ How to work on it? Check OMS (Order Management System); Identify which is the status (if order with Warehouse or with order with carrier); Check the Last Mile delivery times article and the Excel sheet there; The file gives an estimation time of how long an order stays with the warehouse and how long stays with the carrier based on the SKU of the item; After checking those dates, please use the Canned Responses of WIMO (number XX) to inform the customer accordingly about the delivery date. Unable to Deliver ​ IMPORTANT : Once the order is at the hands of the Carrier we still may face some situations in which the delivery is not successful. If this is the case, please make sure to read the article WIMO - Unable to deliver .

title: WIMO - Delivery is On Time
content: TABLE OF CONTENTS Introduction Order is under promised delivery time Order on time: but will be delayed How to identify that the order will be delayed? How to escalate? How to manage customer expectations? Introduction After understanding What is WIMO and how to identify the Order Status, in this article you will learn what to do when the order of the customer is under a Happy Path and the Delivery is On Time. Additionally, we will see how to identify if the order can potentially be delayed and how to act on it. Order is under promised delivery time First, let's recap how to identify if the Order Status is going as expected: -> Access the related Order Management System (Fluent Commerce or Magento) and: Identify the promised delivery date Check order status Check all items (fulfillment) status If already under the status "Shipped" , check the delivery tracking link -> if no tracking link, access the delivery partner portal and check the delivery status. Now, after checking all the information, you confirmed that the order is shipped and in the hands of the delivery company and is estimated to arrive within the promised delivery date. GOOD NEWS! This means the order is on time! The final step is replying to the customer: Make sure to provide accurate information regarding the delivery of the order and educate the customer where to track the information by themselves in the future. Order on time: but will be delayed Preventing issues: it's necessary for us as well to take a look carefully at the promised delivery date and be able to identify if indeed the order will arrive, or if not, and then we can anticipate an issue and act on it to reduce customer dissatisfaction. How to identify that the order will be delayed? You checked the information in the Order Management system and the items ordered by the customer are showing still under the promised delivery date. But, you may face 2 situations that need to be looked into in detail because it means that the order will be delayed : 1) The item is not under "Shipped" status and it's less than 2 days from the expected delivery time: If promised delivery date will expire in the upcoming 2 days and barcode status shows the item has not been shipped: Escalate the case. 2) The delivery date is under the expected time, however, the Barcode/Fulfillment status is showing "Out of Stock": If available for your market, access the country-related Out of stock replenishment plan information that shows the prediction of item in the warehouse, and delivery expectations. If not available for your market the replenishment plan, please Escalate the case following the instructions below. -> How to escalate? The escalation means that another team needs to work on the case to understand the problem and take actions to guarantee the order can be delivered, or at least to provide a new delivery time. Escalation for Central Europe countries: JIRA ticket via CECE Portal Escalation for remaining markets: JIRA ticket via the Order Management Portal -> How to manage customer expectations? Manage customer expectations regarding the escalation process: The teams will give you an answer in the upcoming 24 hours; and for the customer, you inform that an answer will be provided within 48 hours.

title: WIMO - Unable to Deliver
content: TABLE OF CONTENTS Introduction Why the order was not delivered successfully? How to solve Unable to Deliver issues? Address Issue No answer from customer Lost Parcel Rejected Parcel Introduction As mentioned in the article WIMO - Deliver is Delay , after the Carrier has the items of the customer's order some circumstances can cause the delivery to be completed successfully. In that stage, as it's the Last Mile moment, we consider those Delay issues under Unable to Deliver. In this article, we will see what causes an order to not be delivered correctly and what actions you can take accordingly. Why the order was not delivered successfully? A few situations can happen upon delivery that can result in the product(s) not being received by the customers. Those are the 4 reasons of Unable to Delivery scenarios: Address issue; No answer from customer; Lost Parcel; Rejected parcel (due to delay; or advised by CS (late cancellation); or Parcel damaged). How to solve Unable to Deliver issues? Address Issue This may happen due to the customer's address being incomplete or incorrect, resulting in the carrier company not being able to find the location and complete the delivery. In those cases: If it's a 1MH carrier (accessories and mattresses <20kg), they will inform the customer via email that it wasn’t possible to deliver the order. If this happens, they are going to send the order to the nearest parcel shop (information is sent by email or SMS). If the customer doesn't pick up in a specific period, then the item is going to be returned to sender. If it's a 2MH carrier (beds and mattresses >20kg), the carrier always tries to contact the customer directly via phone number and email in order to solve the issue and finish the delivery, or re-scheduling a new date. If no feedback from the customer, proceed as follows: The carrier will email the CS team to report the address issue; CS agent tries to contact de customer to ask for the complete address; (Canned Responses B4.1) CS agent need to send a reply maximum in the next 72h or delivery will be canceled: If we have information from customer, CS agent replies to carrier email with the new address; If no reply from customer, CS agents reply to the carrier informing no info and asking them to cancel the shipment and to return the items. Once the Order appears with the shipment as canceled on the system, CS agent can proceed with the refund to customer. ​ No answer from customer In this scenario we have an unresponsive customer, that is not answering the door and/or neither the phone. This can happen due to carriers not having the correct phone number of the customer; or if the customer is indeed not at the location to receive the delivery. In those cases, the carrier always tries to contact the customer directly via phone number and email first, but in case of no answer from them, please proceed as follows: The carrier will email the CS team to report the customer does not respond to the carrier's attempt to deliver (no answer from the door or phone); CS agent tries to contact de customer to ask for contact information/ to be attentive to the delivery (Canned Responses B4.3) CS agent needs to send a reply maximum in the next 72 hours or delivery will be canceled: -> If we have information from the customer, CS agent replies to the carrier email with the new contact info; -> If no reply from the customer, CS agent replies to the carrier informing no info and asking them to cancel the shipment and to return the items. Once the Order appears with the shipment as canceled on the system, CS agent can proceed with the refund to customer. ​ Lost Parcel The Lost Parcel cases are for if the order is not delivered completed. Here we have 2 different possibilities of who informed the loss and we also have 2 different ways of handling it: 1) Carrier informed about Lost Parcel: In those cases, the carrier probably lost the item between hubs and inform us immediately. -> How to handle: The carrier will email the CS team to report the issue and to confirm in the email that the loss is their responsibility; CS agent needs to create a Logistic Claim, attach the carrier's emails, and then inform customer via email about the situation (Canned Responses B5.1) CS agent creates a Supplement Order and send email to the Carrier - maximum in the next 48h - informing about the new order and the item number Carrier will hold the order until the supplement item arrives at the hub and then make the delivery completely to the customer; Once the system indicates a new delivery date, CS agent can inform the customer via email about it (Canned Responses B5.2) 2 ) Customer informed about Lost Parcel: Here, it is the customer who contacted us to report their order was not delivered in full. They can have noticed during delivery but not able to resolve with the carrier; or they only noticed during assembly and decided to contact us. How to handle: The first step is to email back the customer apologizing for the situation and explaining that we will investigate the case (Canned Response B4.4) Then, the procedures of Logistic Claims and Lost in Transit must be followed accordingly in order to check proof of delivery from the carrier or to request binding documentation from the customer. Please refer to the article to handle the case correctly. Depending on how the case evolves, you need to keep the customer informed via email. For this please use the appropriate Canned Responses from B4.5 onwards. ​ Rejected Parcel Due to delay: This can happen when a customer is unhappy with a significant delay in the delivery date, but didn't inform us in advance and upon arrival decides to reject the delivery. (Ticket categorization: Cancellation >> Cancellation Due to Delay) ​ -> How to handle: The carrier will report the cancellation of the shipment via email to the CS team. The agent needs to open a ticket to Refund team to ask for the customer to be reimbursed. DO NOT open a return request. ​ Advised by CS (late cancellation): Usually, this will happen in cases in which the customer could not cancel due to the order being too far in the process, and it was instructed to reject the delivery. (FD ticket categorization: Cancellation >> Reject Delivery) ​ -> How to handle: The carrier will change status of the fulfillment to "return to sender complete". The agent needs to open a ticket to Refund team to ask for the customer to be reimbursed. DO NOT open a return request . Due to parcel damaged -> Please follow the Logistic Claims procedure

title: WIMO - Updated Delivery Dates
content: TABLE OF CONTENTS Introduction Updated Delivery Dates Scenarios Scenario 1: Updated Delivery Date = Empty Scenario 2: Updated Delivery Date = "Date" Scenario 3: Updated Delivery Date = "No UDD available" Guidelines for handling the customers What if the customer wants to Cancel the order because of this? Introduction ​ In this article, you will learn how to proceed and what to inform customers based on the information shown in the option "Updated Delivery Date" (UDD) in FluentCommerce. You will know there has been an update on the order by the red banner that will appear at the top of the order page in FluentCommerce. ​ ​ REVIEW: Please read first the article " How to: check Updated Delivery Dates " . REMINDER: Also check the Fulfillment stuck s article to double-check the next steps Updated Delivery Dates Scenarios Every time an order is placed in the system, once is Booked we should have a "Promised Delivery Date" (in blue at the image) informed there, which indicates the precision of when the customer will receive their items. However, if the order is facing any delay, a new estimation of the delivery arriving to the customer will appear at the field "Updated Delivery Date" (in orange). ​ ​ The field Update Delivery Date (UDD) may show 3 different types of information, let's see below each one of them: ​ Scenario 1: Updated Delivery Date = Empty If the field doesn't have any information, it means there is no update and you can assume the Promised Delivery Date will be met. -> How to inform the customer? Explain that the delivery is estimated for the promised delivery date that they also received via email. In case of any problems, ask the customer to contact us again. Scenario 2: Updated Delivery Date = "Date" If the field shows a new date it means that we had a delivery delay and now we have a Update Delivery Date to be provided to the customer. Scenario 3: Updated Delivery Date = "UDD is not available" We may face some cases where is not possible to calculate the Updated Delivery Date , even though there is an update to the Promised Delivery Date. In those cases, we cannot determine yet the new delivery date, but we will still have the description of what happened. ​ -> What to do in scenario 2 and 3 depending on the Updated Delivery Date Description? ​ It is mandatory that we never mention to customers that the product is "out of stock", due to legal reasons. Please explain that we are facing logistics issues that is impacting the order delivery. If the Order Is Delayed, we provide compensation but only if it's > 14 days delayed from the promised delivery date. There's no more upfront compensation. More info here . ​ Updated Delivery Date Description Guidelines for "UDD = date" Guidelines for "UDD is not available" 1. Replenishment planned 2. Stock available / Progressing as expected 3. No stock available 4. No stock available in the cluster 1. Apologize for the delay. 2. Explain that unfortunatelly we're having logistic issues with some item(s). 3. Let the customer know about the UDD . Remember that either way, the customer can always: a) Wait and get a compensation for the Order Delay (in case the delay is longer than 14 days) - read more ; b) Cancel , get the full refund and, if he wants, re-purchase a similar item (read more ) that you confirm that is in stock ( check here ). *Before offering the suggestions above, make sure to check if it's a bundle (because if it is, the whole bundle needs to be cancelled) and if your market has a coupon that can be applied to this situation. 1. Apologize for the delay. 2. Explain that unfortunatelly we're having logistic issues with some item(s). 3. Provide the customer with the lead time in the website (example of a random product): If there's no stock in the website, explain to the customer that we expect the item to be available in about 8 weeks and once we have the exact date, he will receive an email about it. Either way, the customer can always: a) Wait and get a compensation for the Order Delay (in case the delay is longer than 14 days) - read more b) Cancel , get the full refund and, if he wants, re-purchase a similar item ( read more ) that you confirm that is in stock ( check here ). *Before offering the suggestions above, make sure to check if it's a bundle (because if it is, the whole bundle needs to be cancelled) and if your market has a coupon that can be applied to this situation. 1. Blocked by other OOS items in fulfilment 1. Apologize for the delay. 2. Explain that unfortunatelly we're having logistic issues with some item(s). 3. Let the customer know about the UDD of the item that says "replenishment planned" and inform that the order is progressing. At any time the customer can always: a) Wait and get a compensation for the Order Delay (in case the delay is longer than 14 days) - read more; b) Cancel , get a refund and, if he wants, re-purchase a similar item ( read more ) that you confirm that is in stock ( check here ). *Before offering the suggestions above, make sure to check if it's a bundle (because if it is, the whole bundle needs to be cancelled) and if your market has a coupon that can be applied to this situation. 1. Apologize for the delay. 2. Explain that unfortunatelly we're having logistic issues with some item(s). 3. Provide the customer with the lead time in the website. If there's no stock for the product missing in the website, explain to the customer that we expect the item to be available in about 8 weeks and once we have the exact date, he will receive an email about it. Either way, the customer can always: a) Wait and get a compensation for the Order Delay (in case the delay is longer than 14 days) - read more b) Cancel , get the full refund and, if he wants, re-purchase a similar item ( read more ) that you confirm that is in stock ( check here ). *Before offering the suggestions above, make sure to check if it's a bundle (because if it is, the whole bundle needs to be cancelled) and if your market has a coupon that can be applied to this situation. 1. Stock available - possible stuck 2. Possible Stuck 1. Open Jira to Order Management (OM) under Order Stucks ( check this article ) and they'll investigate the case. 2. Reply to the customer "there seems to be an issue with the progression of your order, we will investigate internally and get back to you". 3. Put case on hold, with the status "Waiting for 3rd party". 4. Once OM provides an answer, reply the customer accordingly. At any time the customer can always: a) Wait and get a compensation for the Order Delay (in case the delay is longer than 14 days) - read more; b) Cancel , get a full refund and, if he wants, re-purchase a similar item ( read more ) that you confirm that is in stock ( check here ). *Before offering the suggestions above, make sure to check if it's a bundle (because if it is, the whole bundle needs to be cancelled) and if there's a coupon that can be used in this situation. ​ 1. SKU Delisted Cancel and suggest re-purchase a similar item ( read more ) that is in stock ( check here ). Check if your market offers a coupon for the customer in that situation. Also, make sure to check if it's a bundle (because if it is, the whole bundle will need to be cancelled). 1. Data problem 2. No information available TBD ​ What if the customer wants to Cancel the order because of this? Please proceed with the cancellation ! The customer is entitled to cancel their order at any point. Especially for the cases in which we don't have any estimative for replenishment, we should not try to deflect a cancellation . We don't want to make the customer more unhappy with their experience with us. ​ Canned Responses Below you can find an example of statement: ​ "Unfortunately, after checking your order [XXX], we must confirm that it has been further delayed and is now expected after [DATE 1/WEEK 1 . We sincerely apologize for this situation. ​ In case your order has been delayed more than 14 days after the original delivery date, we can provide a compensation as a goodwill gesture on our part. If this is your case and you are willing to wait for the order, please reach out to us once you receive the order so we can calculate the compensation. If you prefer to cancel your order at this time, we can suggest you a similar item that is in stock (IF MARKET HAS A COUPON THAT WE CAN USE ON THIS SCENARIO, then add : If you wish to do that, we can provide you a coupon that can be used on your purchase ). Please let us know by responding to this email and we will assist you in doing so. We want to emphasize that we take these issues seriously. Our team is working closely with partners to resolve these issues and improve our services.  Thank you for your understanding. We look forward to providing you with a better experience in the future."

title: WIMO - What is it?
content: TABLE OF CONTENTS Introduction Why do customers contact us? Understanding the journey of an item The Happy Path journey The Unhappy Path journey Identifying the Order Status How to identify the order status? In FluentCommerce In Magento Tracking link issues Website Self-Service: Order Status Bar How to do the WIMO Freshdesk Ticket categorization? Introduction About 80% of all Emma orders are delivered on time. We globally dispatch various trucks loaded with products every day. The remaining 20% of orders might incur delays due to various reasons, such as production or logistic capacity, unforeseen events impacting infrastructure or resource availability, and system issues. However, the delays are the top driver reasons for the most negative experience for our customers. Due to that, this article supports you in identifying what is happening with the customer order, what to do next, and how to correctly and empathetically reply to our customers in case they reach out to you asking: "Where Is My Order? " Why do customers contact us? In WIMO inquiries, we should always understand if it is a Happy or Unhappy path scenario, both we will see in detail further down in this article. The first step is to identify the contact reason, which will determine the actions and processes that you will have to follow. So, the customers can reach out to us asking "Where is my order?" in 2 different scenarios: 1) Everything is fine with the order, delivery is on time & customer needs additional information -> Happy Path. Order is on time, and everything flows as expected, but somehow customer can not follow the order path or just need a confirmation of the delivery date. Here, the customer experience is crucial as they need our support for guidance and indication of the next steps, since there is a lack of visibility from customer side about the order. 2) There is an issue with the order & customer wants information and a solution -> Unhappy Path . When something went wrong with the order, and a resolution is needed. In this scenario, the service is out of our standards and caused the order to be delayed. contacts The customer has no visibility of what will happen next, and contacts us looking for clarification and a proper solution. Understanding the journey of an item Once completing the purchase on our website, we want to ensure all communication is properly set and the customer has a seamless experience with us, with the right expectations set and the item arriving under the promised delivery time. Ideally, with all this in place, the customer should not need to contact our customer support. Review: For more details, please read the articles focused on the the orders journey for Magento and also for FluentCommerce . The Happy Path journey Under a Happy Path, even if the order is flowing properly in our supply chain, we may receive contact to have a better visibility of some stage that somehow customer is lacking. For example, the customer had an email issue or the tracking link was not working properly. The Unhappy Path journey Although, for an Unhappy Path, we have different phases of the process we can face an unexpected challenge, that could lead to a delayed order, and consequently a possible customer inquiry. In the image below, the blue dots highlight the moment of the journey in which those problems can happen. Issues between steps 1 and 2 ( between order submitted and order confirmed), we may face some scenarios such as: Order Stuck : Problems with the transmission of the order like address errors, payment issues or system bugs. Order Out of Stock: The item Item is out of stock and the order has yet not fulfilled. Or is delayed, but already fulfilled Issues between steps 2 and 3: Once in the hands of warehouse partners, we can face an unexpected delay by their side, preventing the order from being dispatched under the expected time. Warehouse delays: Order dispatched with delay by the warehouse. Issues between steps 4 and 5: Some occurrences during the delivery of the order, once in the hands of the last mile company, may also influence the delivery time; such as a logistic claim, or an unable-to-deliver scenario (no answer from the customer, or wrong address provided). Last mile delays : These happen with unable-to-delivery scenarios or due to Logistic Claims (parcel lost, partial delivery, etc). Identifying the Order Status Now it's the moment to identify if the order and respective items are under expected delivery time and will be delivered on time, or if there is an issue going on and the order will be delayed . How to identify the order status? Access the related Order Management System (Fluent Commerce or Magento) and: Identify the promised delivery date Check order status Check all items (fulfillment) status If already shipped, check the delivery tracking link -> if no tracking link, access the delivery partner portal and check the delivery status In FluentCommerce -> Click on the link here and then under the bottom "Guide me" to have these steps in a side window that will guide you while navigating in FluentCommerce: HERE In Magento -> Click on the link here and then under the bottom "Guide me" to have these steps in a side window that will guide you while navigating in Magento: HERE For Magento ONLY: Currently, in certain cases in Magento is possible to see updated messages regarding the delivery date. When these messages appear, it's an indication that the delivery was delayed, the system identified and corrected to the new dates. Also, the customer is informed about it via e-mail. This is how it will look in the system: How to read the Delivery Sign: 1. " Previous updated delivery date -> This means what the customer has been informed about from outside, so you have a history of automated communication related to delivery time updates. 2. " Promised Delivery Date " -> This was the date shown to the customer when they ordered. If today is still within this range , it means the order is not delayed ! 3. " Updated Delivery Date " -> This means a new delivery date due to delays. This information is visible to the customer. Tracking link issues When investigating where is the order of the customer, you should always access the order-related carrier portal to track the order. In case there was any issue during the delivery, such as the customer being unreachable during the delivery, or a delay during the dispatch, you will be able to find this information on the carrier portal and properly manage the customer expectations. You can find the tracking link under the Order details, purchase orders section in the Order Management tool: You can find the carrier portal knowledge article HERE . When checking the status, please take into consideration the time-frame for the delivery to be completed: If by the moment the customer contacts us, the delivery date to less than 1 week : Order is on its way! If by the moment the customer contacts us, the delivery date for more than 10 days : Order can be delayed > 1 Week for delivery: reach out to the delivery company and ask for further information. Website Self-Service: Order Status Bar The order status bar is a customer-facing section on the website, that displays the status of each barcode within a given order number. The customer can access the status bar by clicking on the link on the homepage ( https://www.emma-matratze.de/bestellstatus/ ) and inserting the order number and associated email address The information contains Order status Barcode status Parcel Perform status WIMO (where is my order) Dates, also called "updated delivery dates" What does it look like? How to do the WIMO Freshdesk Ticket categorization? One important step regarding WIMO tickets is to correctly categorize it in Freshdesk, so we can keep data updated and accurate regarding delivery issues. Customer Inquiries for Where is My Order? can be listed as: Categorization: WIMO -> Delivery Still on Time Categorization: WIMO -> Delivery Delay Freshde sk Ticket Accuracy Ensure you always provide the related Ticket type & subtype based on the customer request , according to what is indicated in the article "Freshdesk - Ticket categorization list" Make sure to consider the Promised delivery date, if one business day has passed since the promised date we should use the categorization "WIMO -> Delivery Delay".

title: UK Retail - Issue Reporting
content: ​ Ope Scope: This SOP outlines what steps need to be taken to escalate a Warehouse, Last Mile or Return Collection specific issue for Offline UK and IE orders Topic Details POC Warehousing Issues DB Schenker- Tamworth ​ @Dipta Chopra ​ Last Mile Issues DPD UK UPS Rhenus Home ​ @Dipta Chopra ​ Returns Collection Issues UPS Rhenus Home ​ @Dipta Chopra ​ NOTE: Use this SOP only to report issues that deal with warehousing (stock issues, wrong orders sent, transmission issues, warehouse specific escalations) or last mile and returns issues (no orders updates from carriers, tracking link issues, complaints, carrier specific escalations) Link to the Issue Reporting File: Issue Reporting- MasterFile.xlsx PLEASE NOTE: - The Issues Listed Here Will Be Checked Once A Week On Fridays - Kindly Use Your Best Discretion To Only Report Issues If They Are Relevant For The Last Mile Manager To Intervene And After You Have Already Tried To Solve The Issue On Your End And It Has Not Helped. Please categorize your issues correctly as: WH- Warehousing (related to the DB Schenker UK- Tamworth) LM- Last Mile (related to UPS, DPD or Rhenus) RL- Reverse Logistics (related to returns collection requests) Once you add the issue, please change the status to “ OPEN ”. Once The Logistics Manager has picked up the issue with the related stakeholders, they will change it to “ IN PROGRESS- LM ”. Please do not use this status. If there is an issues that no longer needs attention, please mark it as “ CANCELLED ” instead of deleting it from the file. If more documentation/ information is needed from the customer/ retailer to action an issue, it will be marked as “ PENDING CUSTOMER INFO ” If you or the customer needs any kind of information from the Logistics Manager, please mark it as “ PEDING LM INFO ” When it is finally complete, it will all be marked as “ CLOSED ”. NOTE: Please ensure to always keep issues in the right statuses to keep proper traceability and to keep the list clean.

title: High Level Escalation - Overview (HLE)
content: TABLE OF CONTENTS Context What to Expect Resolution Process Step-by-step guide Targets summary (SLA's) Supervisor (Sorting task) Step-by-step guide E-learning available here Context Emma CEO and other employees are currently getting messages from very dissatisfied customers via their personal accounts such as LinkedIn. The unsatisfied customers will be forwarded to our CS priority Group known as "XX(Country ID)HLE ", via a ticket raised in Jira. This is where you and your colleagues will come in to manage with top-quality and eye-to-detail cases that are already on a high level of complexity and some details might have been left unattended. What to Expect There are several reasons that can lead a customer to reach out Emma employees outside the proper channels, however the most common is the length of their ongoing issue, some cases drag for months without a proper solution. Most common reasons are due to order delays and refund delays. Example Resolution Process Once the Ticket arrives in the High-level escalation Group " XX(Country ID)HLE", open an outbound email ( Outbound Ticket ) and reply to the customer within 1 business hour after receiving their case, following the guidelines in step 2. Apologize for what has happened and confirm we will get back to the customer within one business day - use the canned response "HLE first response" and personalise where needed. (Outbound Ticket) Reply on the High-level escalation ticket following the template below and change the status to "In Progress". GDPR: Yes/No Ticket Number: ____________________ (HLE) / ____________________ (Outbound Ticket) Customer Inquiry: __________________ Actions taken: __________________ Please categorize the ticket accordingly with the customer topic/request as per usual. Investigate what caused this customer to escalate: The High-level escalation ticket should contain the customer claim for guidance Analyze historical tickets as often in these cases the customer already contacted recently about the same topic Request further information to the customer (Note: this might have a further negative impact as customers don't appreciate having to repeat the same information several times therefore only proceed with this step if it's really necessary) Resolve the case accordingly: If compensation is needed, ask your supervisor what the supervisor compensation is available for this case and follow it If you need support from another team to resolve the case, escalate it via the dedicated Escalation Jira Portal and change the status to "Waiting for third party" Make sure you manage the customer expectations properly: If you need longer than one business day after the first reply to solve the case, update the customer in writing that you are still investigating and we will get back to them within one business day. (Outbound Ticket) If you need longer than one business day after the second reply to solve the case, update the customer in writing that you are still investigating and we will get back to them within one business day. Repeat this till the third working day. (Outbound Ticket) Once the case is resolved, provide feedback to the customer. (Outbound Ticket) Keep the ticket that was created in the High-level escalation Group up to date during the complete process until the case is resolved. * NOTE -> If the customer does not reply, the ticket will automatically be closed after 7 days on "Waiting on customer" status. Make sure you use and follow the detailed step-by-step guide below! Step-by-step guide: Targets summary (SLA's): First response time: 1 hour Additional follow up time (when no additional information/action is required from the customer): once a day for 3 business days Additional follow up time (when we require additional information/action from the customer): only one time, 2 business days after the original email requesting for more information or actions was sent Average resolution time: 3 business days Quality Score: 90% Agent CSAT: 90% Supervisor (Sorting task) In some rare circumstances, mostly related to in-person claims presented at our offices, the office management will provide our ce.complaints@emma-sleep.com email address as a last resort. What does this mean to you as a supervisor? This means that tickets will fall into the Global Escalations queue regardless of the market they're related to, therefore they will need to be sorted and assigned to the correct market HLE queue. If you don't have access to the particular market queue the ticket should move to, please contact bpo.management@emma-sleep.com for assistance. Queue should be at 0 tickets at all times. Targets are the same applicable to the HLE queues! (Frist response maximum within 1 business hour) Step-by-step guide:

title: AR D2C (Former Order 2 Cash) - Escalation
content: What is New: - New Structure - Split between Billing and Payment - New Priority Levels Table of Contents (Escalation Reasons) Order to Cash can support you on: How the Portal looks like: Breakdown of Ticket topics: Billing Refunds Global Payments Order Management Priority or Reason for Escalation Best Practices Order to Cash can support you on: Invoices Invoice Request Incorrect Invoice Refunds Refund Request Proof of Refund Global Payments Fluent Order activation (Order status not updated 2 after 2 days prior to payment) Shopify Order Activation Payment Concerns/Issues Order Management Access Request to Fluent (Supervisors only) Cancel Without Refund Edit Order Request Bulk Orders Creation Request Manual Supplement Creation Order Stuck Concerns (Before Transition to Warehouse) How the Portal looks like: Below how the Portal currently looks like and all the main topics available, continue reading for further details of each on of the topics. Breakdown of Ticket topics: Billing Invoice Request: Fullfilment status is complete but the customer didn't received the Invoice. Incorrect Invoice: The customer Received an Invoice but the details are incorrect and adjustment is required. Refunds Refund Request: Non-Magento orders only, Refund requests for discounts, compensation and partial refunds. Cancellation with Refund requests. Refund topics below: Refund Initiation Refund Follow-up Failed Refund VAT Refund Lawyer Fees Return and Refund Cancel and Refund Proof of Refund: Customer needs proof of refund for credit memo with completed status. Global Payments Fluent Order activation (Order status not updated 2 days after payment). Shopify Order Activation. Payment Concerns/Issues: Customer paid to Emma instead of a 3rd party such as Klarna or Unzer incorrectly. Order Management Access Request to Fluent (Supervisors only) : Request for new or additional access to Fluent Commerce. Cancel Without Refund: in case refund is needed the cancellation should be done under Refund Request. Edit Order Request: Modifications such as Customer Name, Address and Email address Bulk Orders Creation Request: Mainly for retail operations. Manual Supplement Creation. Order Stuck Concerns (Before Transition to Warehouse): Applicable only to the following order status, Booked Without Fulfilments, Created, Pending and Pending_Fraud_Check. Priority or Reason for Escalation We have a new field named "Reason for Escalation" Usual customer Requests should fit under the P2 requests, these are known as the business as usual types of requests. For P1 Requests proof of urgency is required P1 – Suspicious Customer Transaction / Fraud – Customer is claiming fraud situation, proof needed such as screenshot of the interaction and claim of the customer. P1 – Issue escalated to Emma top-level management – Make sure to provide the High Level Escalation Ticket. P1 - Issue is affecting Emma's Reputation through Social Media – Provide a screenshot of the social media page with the customer’s comments affecting Emma reputation. P1 - Issue is being escalated with legal threats – Provide proof showing the customer is threatening to take legal actions, mainly if related with the 14-day compliance matter. Best Practices Not all Order stucks need should be escalated to O2C jira portal , the O2C team is responsible for the order stucks related with payment issues, the moment the payment went through and the order was handed over to the warehouse if you face fulfillment orders stucks you need to open a ticket to Order Fulfillment Concerns here . Example: When escalating a cancelation request mkae sure to open the correct ticket considering if its a request with or without Refund. Make sure to complete all relevant fields to prevent tickets to be incorrectly closed. Priority Levels are to be complied, make sure to provide proof when selecting level P1 of Urgency. Responses on O2C Escalations There will be a notification sent on your email on every change made on the ticket that you've escalated. You may also check the responses from Refunds Team in the JIRA ticket.

title: ONLY BACKOFFICE: Order Management Team - Escalation
content: Table of Content Escalation Reasons Flow of Escalation Freshdesk Jira APP Jira Portal Access Order Management Portal Order Management Portal Important Information - Jira Portal Escalation Reasons Order Cancellation Request Barcode Stuck concerns Supplement/ Logistic claim creation requests Rollback requests Flow of Escalation Access Rights What you can and cannot do There are two options to escalate a ticket to the Order Management team. One is via Freshdesk Jira APP (directly from the Freshdesk tool) and the other, is via the Jira Portal (website portal). The option will depend on the country-related setup. Freshdesk Jira APP Review how to use the Freshdesk Jira app here . title: Data Breach: What is it & best practices
content: TABLE OF CONTENTS Introduction What is a Data Breach? Best practices to avoid data breaches and data security issues Examples of data breaches and prevention measures Introduction At Emma, the security of customer data and sensitive information is of utmost importance. As our customer support, you play a crucial role in identifying and reporting potential security incidents, data breaches, and phishing emails. This article explains what is a data breach and best practices to avoid it from happening. What is a data breach? This is not the same as a DSR or a GDPR request. A data breach is an incident where confidential, sensitive, or protected information is accessed, disclosed, or used by an unauthorized person or entity . This can happen due to various reasons such as human error, cyber-attacks, or system vulnerabilities. Best practices to avoid data breaches and data security issues Verify Customer Identity: Always follow Emma’s guidelines to verify the customer’s identity. Data Minimization: Only collect and use the data necessary to fulfill the customer’s request. No CC or BCC: Agents are not allowed to use the CC (carbon copy) or BCC (blind carbon copy) fields when sending emails to customers. All communications should be directed to a single recipient at a time. Confidentiality: Treat all customer information as confidential. Do not disclose any customer information to unauthorized parties ( REMEMBER : family and friends are unauthorized parties unless the customer provides consent to share the data with them!). Accurate Information: Double-check all information before sending to ensure that it pertains to the correct customer. Attachments: Ensure any attachments are meant for the intended recipient and are free from viruses or malware. Order Confirmation: Verify the order details and customer information before sending a confirmation email. Examples of data breaches and prevention measures Misaddressed Email: An agent sends an order confirmation to the wrong customer, revealing order details and personal information. Prevention: Verify the recipient’s email address and order details before sending. Implement a system of checks to catch mismatches. Incorrect Attachment: An agent attaches a file containing another customer’s order history to an email. Prevention: Verify attachments before sending. Ensure the file name and contents match the intended customer’s information. Unauthorized Access by Former Employees: A former employee still has access to the email system and customer information, which they use maliciously. Prevention: Immediately revoke access to all systems and data upon employee termination. Regularly audit access logs to ensure only authorized personnel have access. Data Entry Error: An agent mistakenly enters another customer’s information into a customer’s account, leading to a mix-up of orders and personal details. Prevention: Implement double-checking procedures for data entry.

content: TABLE OF CONTENTS Introduction Cases examples of Data Breaches How to handle potential data breaches Introduction Make sure to start your reading about Data Breach by the article Data Breach: What it is & Best practices . How to handle potential data breaches Check below the mandatory procedure to be followed in case you discover a potential data breach: Please report it immediately, by sending an e-mail to: privacy@emma-sleep.com. ATTENTION: Make sure to provide the Legal team with a clear and detailed description of the situation using the list of questions: What happened? When did it happen? How did it occur? Who was involved and affected? What actions were taken? When was the data breach detected and reported? Other relevant tickets, documents, information.

title: Data Breaches: Customer claims and how to handle
content: TABLE OF CONTENTS Introduction Customer claims regarding data breaches How to handle if a customer reports a data breach Introduction Make sure to start your reading about data breaches on the article Data Breach: What is it & best practices . In this article, you will find information on what to do when a customer contacts to report a data breach. Customer claims regarding data breaches Sometimes customers and other individuals may reach out to Emma to report data breaches or security incidents, for example: Customer claims he had unauthorized access to customer data or confidential information; Claims of data leaks or accidental exposure of sensitive information; A customer claims the accidental exposure of his/hers personal data to unauthorized parties; Customer claims inadequate security measures leading to data breaches. ​ How to handle a customer reported data breach -> If you receive a ticket related to a data breach or data security incidents, immediately escalate the issue to Emma's Legal & Compliance team: privacy@emma-sleep.com Make sure to forward the thread including the report/claim and please provide us with any information received along with a clear and detailed description of the situation (including the relevant ticket number and/or document, what happened, when it happened, who was involved and affected, the relevant email thread, what actions were taken, when was the data breach detected and reported, etc.) You should inform the reporter or the customer that we have received their message and that you have escalated it to the relevant department. Please use the following canned response ⬇️ Dear [Customer's first name], ​ Thank you for your email. We have forwarded your inquiry to the relevant department, and they will respond to you in due course. ​ IMPORTANT NOTES: Besides the above canned response, do not respond or confirm anything about the issue until the Data Protection Team provides you with guidelines and an appropriate response. Please refrain from sending/forwarding blank emails that are not relevant to the Legal & Compliance team.

title: Data Breaches: Phishing attacks and how to handle
content: TABLE OF CONTENTS Introduction Phishing Attacks Definition Examples How to detect Phishing Attacks How to handle a phishing e-mail Introduction Make sure to start your reading about Data Breach by the article Data Breach: What it is & Best practices . In this current article, you will learn how to identify phishing attacks and how to act. Phishing Attacks Definition A phishing attack is a type of cyber-attack where attackers impersonate legitimate institutions or persons to trick individuals into providing sensitive information, such as passwords or credit card numbers, through deceptive emails or websites, and may cause a data breach. Examples Examples of fishing attacks may include: An agent receives an email that appears to be from a legitimate customer asking for account details or other sensitive information. Fake login pages that attempt to steal usernames and passwords. Emails claiming urgent account issues and requesting immediate action. Spoofed emails pretending to be from well-known companies or government agencies. Emails promising prizes, rewards, or financial benefits in exchange for personal details. How to detect Phishing Attacks Suspicious Sender: Check if the email is from a legitimate source. Be wary of email addresses that look similar to the company's but are slightly altered; Urgency and Threats: Phishing emails often create a sense of urgency or threat, such as claiming your account will be locked; Links and Attachments: Do not click on links or download attachments from unknown or suspicious emails; Request for Sensitive Information: Legitimate companies will not ask for sensitive information via email. How to handle a phishing e-mail Do Not Respond: Do not reply to the email or provide any requested information; Report : If you receive a ticket related to phishing emails and happen to click on it, you should immediately report it to your supervisor. Your supervisor should urgently report it to the Emma IT team; Delete: Delete the phishing email from your inbox; Monitor: Keep an eye on your accounts for any unusual activity and report it immediately. NOTE: Before opening a ticket in case of doubt, please reach out to your supervisor for support.

title: Handling Customer Identification and Third Party Inquiries
content: TABLE OF CONTENTS Instructions to confirm Customer Identity and reply to Third Party Inquiries Steps to Confirm Customer Identity Introduction and Explanation Request for Identity Confirmation Verification If Details Match If Details Do Not Match When a Different Person is Asking for Information Real-Life Example Scenarios Correct Identity Confirmation Incorrect Identity Confirmation Third-Party Inquiry Third-Party Delivery Request Third-Party Refund Request Heir Requesting Data of a Deceased Person Instructions to confirm Customer Identity and reply to Third Party Inquiries In order to protect our customers' personal data and comply with GDPR, we must confirm the identity of any customer requesting information about their purchase. This ensures that we only share personal data with the correct individual. Note: as of 31st of March 2025, all customers with an order in Fluent need to be authenticated through the Authentication flow. ( Not applicable for Magento orders. ) ​ Find the step by step guides bellow : pdf NoOrderNumber.pdf 1.96 MB pdf AuthenticateCustomerOrder-Final.pdf 3.14 MB pdf NoOrderNumberNoEmailaddress.pdf 2.08 MB Steps to Confirm Customer Identity: Introduction and Explanation: Script: "Hi, thank you for contacting Emma. To protect your personal data and comply with GDPR, we need to confirm your identity before providing any information about your purchase. This is to ensure that your information remains secure." Request for Identity Confirmation: Ask the customer to provide the following details: Order Number: "Can you please provide your order number?" Email Address: "Could you confirm the email address used to place the order?" Full Name: "May I have your full name as it appears on the order?" Delivery Address: "Can you please confirm the delivery address for the order?" Verification: Check the provided details against the information in our system. Script: "Thank you. Let me quickly verify these details." If Details Match: Script: "Your identity has been confirmed. How can I assist you with your order today?" If Details Do Not Match: Example Script: "I'm sorry, but the details you provided do not match our records. For security reasons, I cannot provide any information about the order. You may want to check the information and try again." When a Different Person is Asking for Information : Example Script: "For privacy and security reasons, we can only provide order information to the person who made the purchase. If you have their consent, please ask them to send an email from the address used to place the order, authorizing us to share the information with you." Real-Life Example Scenarios -> Correct Identity Confirmation: Customer: "I would like to know the status of my order. My order number is 123456, my email is john.doe@example.com, my name is John Doe, and my delivery address is 123 Sleep Lane, Dreamtown." Agent: "Thank you, Mr. Doe. Your identity has been confirmed. Your order is currently being processed and will be shipped within the next two days." -> Incorrect Identity Confirmation: Customer: "Can you tell me about my order? My order number is 654321." Agent: "Can you also provide the email address used to place the order?" Customer: "Uh, I'm not sure. Maybe john.doe@example.com?" Agent: "I'm sorry, but the details you provided do not match our records. For security reasons, I cannot provide any information about the order." -> Third-Party Inquiry: Caller: "I want to check the status of an order placed by my friend. The order number is 123456." Agent: "For privacy and security reasons, we can only provide order information to the person who made the purchase. Please ask your friend to email us from the address used to place the order, authorizing us to share the information with you." -> Third-Party Delivery Request: Husband: "Hi, my wife ordered a mattress and I want it delivered to a different address. The order number is 789012." Agent: "For privacy and security reasons, we can only change the delivery address if your wife, who made the purchase, sends us an email from the address used to place the order, authorizing this change." -> Third-Party Refund Request: Father: "I am calling on behalf of my daughter. She ordered a pillow and wants the refund to be processed to my bank account. The order number is 345678." Agent: "For privacy and security reasons, we can only process refunds to the original payment method. If your daughter wants the refund to be processed to a different account, she needs to email us from the address used to place the order, authorizing this change and providing the new IBAN." -> Heir Requesting Data of a Deceased Person: Heir: "Hello, I am the son of Jane Doe, who recently passed away. I need information regarding her recent purchase from your company. The order number is 987654." Agent: "I am very sorry for your loss. For privacy and security reasons, we require certain documentation before we can provide any information. Could you please send us a copy of the death certificate and a legal document proving you are the executor or authorized person handling her affairs? You can send these documents to our email address [ email@example.com ]. Once we have received and verified them, we will be able to assist you further." Important Note: Always maintain a polite and professional tone. Ensure the customer understands that these steps are necessary to protect their personal data and comply with GDPR regulations. Additional Resources: For any questions or further clarification, please refer to our internal GDPR compliance guide or contact the data privacy team at privacy@emma-sleep.com. ​ Files to share with customer on the outbound contact: ​

title: Injuries with Emma Products
content: TABLE OF CONTENTS Introduction Cases of injury to be shared with L&C How and when to inform L&C Which templates to use What to do after the matter has been sorted (mandatory) Introduction Every time you face a case where the customer has informed us that an injury has happened by an Emma Product, it is MANDATORY that the Legal & Compliance (L&C) team is informed about it. So, in this article, you will find examples of cases that need to be forwarded to them and how to do it. Cases of injury to be shared with L&C Below you can check all situations which the L&C team needs to be aware of: Any type of physical injury - (reasons: eg. needles, malfunctioning of the product that ends up in an injury, etc); Any type of rash, allergy, etc caused by the product; Any type of situation where the customer went to the hospital; Any type of situation where the customer is requiring chemical analysis (called "REACH regulation"); Situations where a PRODUCT claim escalates into a legal threat; Product Claims where the customer requires restitution or compensation ( NOT A REFUND ). [not a refund of the product value, but an extra value of money due to the injury - compensation]. Note : If t he customer cut her/himself while opening a package this is not at all a reason to request a refund, unless the cut was inflicted using Emma's proprietary cutter. The agent will need to input the type of the claim, the product related to it, the product's SKU, the country where this was purchased and the Sprinklr ticket number. Please note that t he agents will need to handle these cases normally. The escalation to L&C via JIRA is only for visibility , as the L&C team will not handle the cases, but the must be informed about it.
