title: Influencer Returns
content: TABLE OF CONTENTS Introduction Influencer Returns: Step-by-step Guidelines per country IMPORTANT: This process is ONLY for the Control Tower Agents. Introduction At Emma, we work with Influencers who promote our products. Whenever an influencer wants to return their item, internal partners (marketing managers for example), can open a request for influencer return order creation. They can do this through th e Influencer creation Jira porta l. These tickets will have all the information needed to create a return using OMS and Magento. However, the process can vary from country to country. For this reason, you will find a list below with the return process and, if needed, additional information. Influencer Returns: Step-by-step Get ticket from the Influencer creation Jira porta l; Find the order in Fluent or Magento and open the return, according to the info provided in the ticket and the process described in the KB below; 2.1 - In case the return is done manually, redirect to the appropriate channel and retrieve the tracking code; After you created the return and informed the customer, leave a note on the Jira ticket mentioning you created the return; Move the Jira ticket to resolved. Guidelines per country Country Method What to be careful of Guide and KB DE / BE / NL / AT / CH Simple return opening in fluent There is a system quirk, where some of the info will not be copied to the return e.g.(email). So please pay attention to all the info in the return pop up. Helpdesk : Emma Sleep (freshdesk.com) FR Simple return opening in fluent Helpdesk : Emma Sleep (freshdesk.com) MX Arrange pick up https://emma-sleep.freshdesk.com/en/support/solutions/articles/75000087440 CO Arrange pick up Loading... CL Arrange pick up Loading... PT Arrange pick up Loading... ES Arrange pick up Loading... IT Arrange pick up Loading... DK / SE Arrange pick up Helpdesk : Emma Sleep (freshdesk.com) IE WIP PL WIP UK WIP Don't forget to copy the email from the order, as Fluent does not copy emails on Influencer returns.

title: [Supervisors] How to open a ticket for Learning and Knowledge Team
content: TABLE OF CONTENTS How to access the JIRA ticket of the Learning & Knowledge Team? What you must know before opening a JIRA ticket to Learning & Knowledge Team? How to open a JIRA ticket to Learning & Knowledge Team? Best Practices Collab with us and help to improve and boost your CS Knowledge Base! Knowledge Base article update New topic article request New CS training request Process clarification needed If you have any of the requests above, please create a ticket by following the steps indicated below. How to access the JIRA ticket of the Customer Excellence Team? -> LINK TO CREATE A JIRA TICKET: Customer Excellence Team Jira What you must know before opening a JIRA ticket to Learning & Knowledge Team? 1) Before opening a ticket with us, please make sure that your request belongs to one of the Types of requests below: Process or Tool knowledge Product clarification Training request 2) Understand that each type of request has a level of Priority, and this will define what you have to fill in the Jira field of "Urgency": Type of Request Priority Urgency on JIRA Process or Tool knowledge High Product clarification Medium Training request Low 3) Only Supervisors, Team Leaders, Quality Analysts, and Trainers can open JIRA tickets to the L&K Team. If you are an agent, please reach out to your supervisor to address your issue or suggestion. 4) Please make sure that in your ticket you include the KB article as a reference and/or any Freshdesk ticket number. How to open a JIRA ticket to Learning & Knowledge Team? The presentation below will guide you step-by-step on how to open the JIRA ticket and how to fill in all the fields to make a proper request: Best Practices Knowledge Base article feedback Let us know if you found the articles helpful or not, we count on your feedback to improve. At the end of each article you may find the following question: Attention: If you found an article not helpful, please let us know what we can do better, open a Jira ticket!

title: [Supervisors] How to open a ticket for Performance Management Team
content: TABLE OF CONTENTS Introduction Title Title Title for important Topics Introduction Title Need to report a Webshop Issue Need assistance with an escalation case If you have any of the requests above, please create a ticket by following the steps indicated below. How to access the JIRA ticket of the Customer Excellence Team? -> LINK TO CREATE A JIRA TICKET: Customer Excellence Team Jira What you must know before opening a JIRA ticket to Customer Issue Management Team? 1) Before opening a ticket with us, please make sure that your request belongs to one of the Types of requests below: Need to report a Webshop Issue Need assistance with an escalation case Note : for Learning & Knowledge Team, please follow this KB article . 2) Only Supervisors, Team Leaders, Quality Analysts, and Trainers can open JIRA tickets to the CIM Team. If you are an agent, please reach out to your supervisor to address your issue or suggestion. 3) Please make sure that you have checked and followed the process in the KB article before the JIRA is opened. How can I open a "Webshop Issue" JIRA? You must use this JIRA everytime you want to r eport a problem on the Emma website. Examples of issues: Reporting a typo/outdated information with FAQ/product description; Customer reporting an issue at checkout - wrong price, promotional code not applying, wrong information on the FAQs Make sure the JIRA is correctly filled: Summary : Date of report (automation? + Short description on the issue type Description : Make sure you have briefly explained what is the issue you are reporting and why is this considered an issue ADD EXAMPLE Market : Always add the market you are reporting so that we can understand where should we check the issue Link : Same as for the market, always add the URL link Attachment : This is important to help highlighting where the issue is located How can I open a "Assistance with an escalation ticket" JIRA? You must use this JIRA everytime you have a ticket where: Customer is threatening with legal actions or to take the case public Claim: +2 supplements already created and no solution Overly complex tickets where process was followed and there is no resolution/stuck No process Make sure the JIRA is correctly filled: Summary : Date of report + Short description on the issue type T icket Category : Please select the same as in the Sprinklr ticket category - you have a drop down manu with all options available Description : Make sure you have briefly explained what is the issue you are reporting and why is this considered an issue. Example: Hey team, I need your help with the issue above. (Add chronologic ticket summary. Include a short summary about the process followed and why was the ticket not resolved yet/ what is customer expecting) Thanks! ADD 2 TICKET EXAMPLES (PRE AND POST DELIVERY) Clarify what is expected from Emma : Why are you contacting us and what is the solution you are hopping for Order Number : Customer order reference Sprinklr Link : Please add the ticket Sprinklr URL link JIRA link connected : Kindly add here is there is already another JIRA link opened that may be connected to the same issue - specially for market level issues (Ex: O2C, OFM, IT Service Desk) Store Order : Only to mark if this is in regards to an offline store order. Check HERE how to identify one Market : Always add the market you are reporting so that we can understand where should we check the issue Priority : Understand that each type of request has a level of Priority, and this will define what you have to fill in the Jira field of "Urgency": SLA for the 1st reply Number of people affected Priority Urgency on JIRA 8 Business Hours Market level (group of people) P0 - High 16 Business Hours >1 customer P1 - Medium 24 Business Hours 1 customer P2 - Low

title: (SUPERVISOR) Escalation: Fluent Commerce
content: This article is to be followed by a supervisor TABLE OF CONTENTS Overview Escalation Options Overview As you know, we are migrating systems, and due to that we may find challenges in our new platform. If your team identified an issue, and you need to report this to Emma Order Management product development team, this is the right article for you. This portal will be dedicated to a ny technical issues you are experiencing with Fluent Commerce . All the issues raised here will go directly to Emma tech team, so please be mindful when creating a ticket. Escalation Options Fulfillment Stuck Concerns Order stuck - not moving forward Fulfilment stuck - not moving forward Order Creation Request Order paid but not on Fluent Escalate to the Order-2-Cash Portal - Jira Service Management (atlassian.net) Other Requests: Emails not being received System bugs / Issues identified We are reviewing the right portal for it, meanwhile you can raise to your Learning and Knowledge team and we will redirect it to our TECH team. Please follow the guidelines below: FLUENT BUG/ISSUE: (and title of the problem) Always include: Clear explanation of the issue Orders as example Screenshots, screen recording to show the issue (those items are crucial to our investigation and solution) Before creating a ticket please confirm if the issue has already been raised by someone else from your team, and a work around is in place. Verify knowledge base articles to see if anything is explaining the scenario and already in place .

title: [EMEA] Q-Grid v3.0: Frontline Agents (2025/2026)
content: TABLE OF CONTENTS Introduction Quality assessment grid for frontline agents File for download Introduction This article contains the v3.0 version of our quality grid for frontline contacts. This grid will go live on Sprinklr for all EMEA markets on the 3rd of November, 2025. It is used in EMEA markets for frontline Customer Service quality audits. ​ ​ Quality assessment grid for frontline agents Q-Grid - Frontline v3.0 (2025/2026) ​ Category Outcome Description/Pass Fail N/A Alerts/Tips Bucket Split % 0. Audit Selection Assignment Method Randomized (Normal) Manual (Replacement Audit) Manual (ZTP - BPO Find) Manual (ZTP - Emma Request) > Randomized (Normal) - When the audit was assigned followed the normal randomization process. > Manual (Replacement Audit) - When the audit was assigned as replacement audit for a normal one that did not have enough/compliant content for assessment. > Manual (ZTP - BPO Find) - When the BPO finds a ZTP infraction in a ticket that wasn't assigned for auditing initially. > Manual (ZTP - Emma Request) - When a ticket is being audited at Emma's request, due to a ZTP infraction. 1. Legal & Privacy Customer Authentication (O) ZTP Pass/Fail/NA Agent authenticated the customer correctly, following our guidelines. Agent did not authenticate the customer when the contact was about an order or Emma account. Agent asked the customer to authenticate himself when this was not required. If the contact is not about an order or Emma account. AUDIT CRITICAL Failing this category will automatically result in the agent failing the entire monitor. Note: Agents should avoid asking the customer for more information than what was required to authenticate the customer. 30% ↪️ Authentication Flow (O) Pass/Fail/NA Agent ran the authentication flow as expected when performing customer authentication for GDPR purposes. Agent failed to run the authentication flow as required when authenticating a customer contacting us about a Fluent Commerce order. Agent did not run the authentication flow at the same time the authentication process was taking place. Agent selected the incorrect outcome on the authentication flow. When no customer authentication was performed, or when the order in question was from Magento. This metric will only appear if "Customer Authentication" was not marked as "NA". 10% Data Privacy & Legal Requests (O) ZTP Pass/Fail/NA Agent handled DSR's and official requests (courts, lawyers or legal entities) correctly. Agent did not follow the process for legal related requests. When the contact is not about a legal request. AUDIT CRITICAL Failing this category will automatically result in the agent failing the entire monitor. 30% Data Breaches (O) ZTP Pass/Fail/NA Agent assured data was not shared incorrectly and that reported data breaches were acted upon as per our procedures. Agent incorrectly sent information pertaining to another customer. Agent shared Emma internal contact details that were not for customers. Agent failed to act when receiving a report for a data breach. If no data breach occcurred or was reported. AUDIT CRITICAL Failing this category will automatically result in the agent failing the entire monitor. * NOTE: Mistyping or inserting the wrong order number in an email reply does not constitute, by itself, a data breach. 30% 2. Information Filtering Data Collection (O) Pass/Fail/NA Before starting to assist, the agent asked the customer about the contact reason and collected all relevant information to be able to understand what the customer's issue was. Agent failed to ask all the right questions to understand what the customer's issue was. Agent failed to ask the customer to clarify the issue when this was not 100% clear or when key information was not shared. Agent assumed something without this being confirmed by the customer. When all the information required to assist the customer has already been previously provided. 40% Active Reading / Listening (O) Pass/Fail Agent understood what the customer was referring to and replied / took action in a way that reflected that. Agent asked for information that the customer had already provided in a clear way. Agent made contradictory statements that were not aligned with what the customer said/requested, showing that he did not pay enough attention to what the customer said/wrote. Agent spoke over the customer or interrupted the customer without a valid reason. Agent addressed the customer by the wrong name. 40% Rephrasing  (O) Pass/Fail/NA Phone / chat -> Agent recapped the customer's enquiry topic/s and obtained acknowledgement that what the agent understood was correct. Email -> Agent recapped the customer's enquiry topic/s every time a new topic/request was mentioned. Phone / chat -> Agent did not rephrase the contact reason in the beginning of the contact and before putting the customer on hold to start working on his topic/request. Email -> Agent failed to rephrase the customer's query every time the customer mentioned a new topic/request. Agent rephrased the same issue in two consecutive emails to the customer. Email: When the audit is not assessing the first reply and no other topic was brought up by the customer until the end. On chat, agents should make sure to keep the rephrasing short and simple. 20% 3. Documentation & Notes Ticket Categorization (O) ZTP Pass/Fail Agent selected the correct ticket categorization on Sprinklr. If the original categories were incorrect, the agent changed them accordingly. Agent categorized the ticket incorrectly. Agent failed to amend the ticket category when the original one was incorrect. Agent changed the original ticket categorization to adapt to a new query from the customer. 40% ↪️ Others - Others (O) ZTP Pass/Fail/NA Agent used "Others - Others" for the ticket category and this was the correct categorization for the ticket. Agent used the "Others - Others" category without a valid reason to do so. Agent used the "Others - Others" category and did not leave the mandatory comment. When the contact was not categorized as "Others - Others". GROUP CRITICAL Failing this category will automatically result in the agent failing the "Documentation & Notes" group. 5% Ticket & Customer Profile Data (O) Pass/Fail Agent inserted correct  data (Order reference, LOB, Market, etc.) during ticket handling. Agent inserted correct and compliant profile notes. Agent inserted the wrong order reference number in the ticket. Agent failed to change or amend the market in the ticket when this was originally incorrect. Agent failed to leave correct and compliant notes on the customer's profile when this was required. 5% Case Status (O) Pass/Fail Agent selected the correct case status on Sprinklr while running the ACW. Agent selected the wrong case status while running the ACW. If the agent was removed from the ticket by a system error, and no ACW is seen in the activity log, the metric should be marked as a pass. 5% OMS Notes (O) Pass/Fail/NA Agent left internal notes in our order management tools (Magento/Fluent Commerce) as per our internal procedures and using the correct template. Agent failed to leave notes in the OMS tools. Agent left notes on the order but these did not use the correct template or were incorrect/incomplete. When the contact is not related with an order. Note: If the original order was on Magento, but the supplement order was on Fluent Commerce, the agent should leave the OMS notes on Fluent Commerce and not on Magento. 40% ↪️ OMS Notes Compliance (O) ZTP Incorrect/Not Present Incorrect: Agent left notes in the OMS but these were either incorrect or incomplete. Agent left notes in supplement instead of the original order. Not Present: Agent had a contact (inbound or outbound) with a customer about an order and failed to leave notes in the OMS. When the contact is not related with an order. GROUP CRITICAL Having "Not Present" in this category will automatically result in the agent failing the "Documentation and Notes" group. This metric will only appear if "OMS notes" was marked as "Fail". 5% 4. Communication Greetings & Goodbyes (O) Pass/Fail Initial Greeting: Phone -> Agent greeted the customer, confirmed they contacted EMMA + Market (Emma Spain, Emma Germany, etc.), gave his/her name, asked for the customer's name and enquired about the contact reason. Email / chat -> Agent greeted the customer, used the customer's name (if available), thanked the customer for contacting us. Wrapping Up: Phone  -> After the initial contact topic had been handled, the agent showed availability to assist further and, if the customer had no other question, pitched the phone survey, thanked the customer for contacting us, and wished the customer a good day. Email / chat -> After the initial contact topic had been handled, the agent showed availability to assist further, in case the customer had other queries in the future. If no additional issues were present, the agent wished the customer a good day. Agent did not respect the initial greeting and wrapping up guidelines. Agent did not thank the customer for contacting us and/or did not show availability to further assist the customer with any future queries/issues at the end of the contact, after the initial contact topic had been fully addressed. Pitched the CSAT survey after saying farewell to the customer. Did not pitch the phone survey correctly, using Emma's standard template. Pitched the CSAT survey on phone, email or chat, asking the customer to give a specific score. 10% Empathy and Cognitive Harmony (S) Pass/Fail Agent showed empathy in a truthful and impactful way. All statements/reactions made during the contact felt genuine, were appropriate to the situation at hand and showed a willingness to connect with the customer. Agent failed to react to the customer's state of mind, especially when the customer was disappointed. Agent said/wrote things/used emojis that were in cognitive dissonance with the customer's state of mind and the situation at hand. Agent failed to apologize for Emma not meeting the contact SLA's, when applicable. When confronted by the customer, the agent failed to acknowledge that he had recently handled a query from this specific customer. Agent's empathy statements/reactions should resonate with the customer. The goal here is to amplify a positive occurrence and minimize a poor experience. 20% Emma Tone (S) Pass/Fail Agent communicated with the customer using the Emma tone of voice. As such, the agent displayed a positive and engaging attitude throughout the interaction, showed genuine willingness to help and was always professional, even if the communication style was informal (unless market decided to have a formal approach). Agent was numb or overly cold throughout the contact. Agent engaged in negative communication or negative reinforcement. Agent was over-apologetic and/or hyper-empathic, coming off as insincere. Agent used an overly informal communication stance. Even in a pre-sales context, professional communication standards must be maintained. Note: Agents should always address the customer in an informal way, unless the market specifically requested for a formal approach to be the standard or if the customer had a negative reaction to an informal approach. 15% Personalization (S) Pass/Fail Agent personalised any written communication with the customer and did not just use unadjusted canned replies. Additionally, the agent did not repeat the same sentences/expressions, throughout a chat or in an email, and avoided redundancy. Agent did not follow the internal contact guidelines regarding communication structure. Agent sent the same introductory or closing sentence in two or more consecutive emails. Agent started three consecutive sentences using the same word. Agent failed to adapt any canned responses/text used to match the specifics of the case. Agent gave redundant information throughout the contact. Agent gave the customer information/content that was unrelated to the case by mistake. Agent failed to adapt the language used when the customer was clearly having difficulty understanding what was being said. Agent added unnecessary information to an email or chat (example: Emma contacts). Agents should avoid over-branding (mentioning Emma too many times). 20% Oral Communication (S) Pass/Fail/NA Agent communicated with the customer in a clear and professional way. Agent did not use slang or jargon. Agent spoke too fast. Agent failed to adapt volume and discourse speed when the customer complained about it. Agent did not communicate with the customer in a clear way. Agent used terms, technical or not, that the customer could not understand. Agent's sentences were confusing or poorly structured. When the contact being assessed is only an email or a chat. 15% Written Communication (S) Pass/Fail/NA Agent used proper grammar, syntax and punctuation in the written communication sent to the customer. Agent did not use slang, jargon and abbreviations. The text was also properly formatted (font, colors, background, spacing, etc.). Agent's sentences were confusing or poorly structured. Agent had two or more grammar/syntax/punctuation mistakes. Agent used slang, jargon or abbreviations. Agent did not use paragraphs to group information pertaining to the same topic. Agent used different font types in the same email. Agent overused caps and bold/italic. Agent had incorrect/inconsistent spacing throughout the email. Agent used too many emojis during the communication with the customer. Agent used emojis in an email without the customer doing so first. Email signature was not separated from the email body by double spacing (1.5 or 2.5 spaces are acceptable). Agent changed any part of the signature except the final greeting right before the agent's name. Agent misspelled the customer's name. When the contact being assessed is only a phone call. Email: Emoji usage is completely optional, but on email cases it should only happen if the customer sends emojis first. Chat: It is ok to use emojis in chat, as long as the agent is not doing it too often. 15% Respect (S) ZTP Pass/Fail Agent was polite and respectful throughout the contact. Agent did not raise his/her voice and was not passive-aggressive with the customer. Agent left notes in our tools that, although accurate, described the customer respectfully. Agent was disrespectful or rude towards the customer. Agent made inappropriate comments. Agent laughed/made fun of the customer. Agent left notes in our tools that characterized the customer in a diminishing fashion. AUDIT CRITICAL Failing this category will automatically result in the agent failing the entire monitor. 5% 5. Problem Solving Correct Solution (O) Pass/Fail Agent opted for the right solution for the specific query/request from the customer. Agent did not offer the correct solution to handle the situation at hand. 20% Execution (O) Pass/Fail Agent executed the proposed solution correctly, as per our internal procedures. Agent did not follow the correct procedure for the solution offered to the customer. Agent sent email replies from the wrong email address. 40% Expectation Setting (O) Pass/Fail/NA Agent set expectations correctly: explained actions taken (or to be taken), clarified the expected outcome and the timelines involved. Agent failed to explain to the customer what would happen next and when. Agent told the customer a parcel delivery or item pick up would happen on a specific date or within a specific time frame. When there are no future actions happening, that require expectations to be set or a timeline. 15% Customer Education (O) Pass/Fail/NA Agent displayed full knowledge of Emma products, webstores and services and, when required, informed the customer accordingly on these and explained any public facing processes. Agent took the time to educate the customer when the query could have been resolved by the customer without contacting us. Agent provided incorrect information on Emma products, webstores and services. Agent told the customer he/she was not able to provide information on Emma products, webstores and services, when this information was available to the CS team and cleared to be shared with customers. Agent did not educate the customer on an Emma procedure and this may result in the customer reaching out again in near future. A tracking number or a tracking link was provided, but the agent did not provide clear and complete instructions on where and how the customer could use these. Agent failed to provide the product link when suggesting a product or products to a customer. When the contact did not require the agent to discuss Emma products, stores or services. When the contact reason could not have been handled by the customer (self-service) if the customer had knowledge to do it. Also not applicable if there was no tracking number or tracking link provided to the customer. 10% Escalation (O) Pass/Fail/NA Agent escalated the case to the correct parties as per our internal procedures. The agent's escalation included all necessary and relevant information, and was done in a clear way. Agent escalated the issue to the wrong team/POC or did it using the wrong channel/platform. Agent failed to escalate a contact when the internal guidelines demanded it. Agent left out relevant information from the escalation. Agent's escalation was unclear. Agent failed to update an escalation when new and relevant information was available. When no escalation is done, either via JIRA or to another team/POC. 15% ↪️JIRA Integration (O) Compliant/Not Present/NA Agent ran the Sprinklr JIRA integration flow as required, if this was needed as part of the solution provided to the customer. Agent failed to start and complete the JIRA flow on Sprinklr when the ticket resolution asked for it. Agent created the JIRA ticket directly on JIRA and not on Sprinklr. When no JIRA escalation was required. This metric will only appear if "Escalation" was not marked as "NA". 0% 6. Sprinklr Flows Claims (O) ZTP Pass/Fail/NA Agent ran the claims flow as required, if this was needed as part of the solution provided to the customer. Agent made sure all information inserted in the flow was correct and process compliant. Agent failed to start and complete the claims flow when the ticket resolution asked for it. Agent completed the claims flow but the information inserted there was incomplete or incorrect. When the ticket was not a injury/logistic/product claim. When the ticket was a claim but the claim flow had already previously been done by another agent. AUDIT CRITICAL Failing this category will automatically result in the agent failing the entire monitor. 75% Compensation (O) Pass/Fail/NA Agent ran the compensation flow as required, if this was needed as part of the solution provided to the customer. Agent made sure all information inserted in the flow was correct and process compliant. Agent failed to start and complete the compensation flow when the ticket resolution asked for it. When this flow was not required as part of the correct process for handling the customer's enquiry. 25% 7. Professionalism Ownership (O) Pass/Fail Agent took ownership of the situation in a positive way and did not assign blame to colleagues, other teams or logistic partners. Agent also followed through with any promises made, like future contacts or follow-ups. Agent transferred the case to a colleague without a valid reason and permission from the agent's Team Leader. Agent sent a follow-up email to a customer without a valid reason for it. Agent unassigned himself/herself from the ticket or disconnected the call. Agent closed the ticket without replying to the customer, when the customer still had questions/issues. Agent assigned blame to a colleague or Emma partner. Agent made unflattering comments to the customer about Emma as a company. Agent did not contact the customer again after promising to do so, or did so after the expected deadline had expired. Agent apologised for something that was not caused by Emma or Emma's partners. Agents should not transfer cases to other agents without a valid, and documented, reason for it. 75% Time Management / Hold (S) Pass/Fail Agent took only the time required to handle the interaction. Agent was also respectful of the hold options rules. Agent took longer than expected to handle the situation at hand. Agent put the customer on hold without informing the customer first and allowing them to accept or object to it. Agent did not put the customer on hold by mistake and the conversations in the production floor's background could be heard. Agent did not put the customer on hold and just stopped talking while investigating the situation in question. Agent did not thank the customer for the time on hold after returning to the call/chat. Agent took longer than 2 minutes (4 minutes for chat) before returning to the call/chat. Agent stayed connected on a phone call long after the customer disconnected. While on hold, agents need to give the customer feedback every 2 minutes. If the agent feels the situation will take longer than expected to sort out, the agent should give the customer the option to receive a follow-up contact at a later date. Chat hold time can be up to 4 minutes. 25% 8. Added Value Perfect Service (O) Pass/Fail Agent passed all the Quality assessment metrics and the customer was visibly impressed and the reviewer agrees the case was the embodiment of the Emma's level of excellence, without any improvement opportunities identified. When the agent made any mistake and/or the QA thinks that there were improvement opportunities indentified in the ticket handling. When the customer didn't make a comment stating the case was very well handled by the agent in question. Only exceptional contacts shall receive a pass here. 100% 9. Special Projects Special Assessment Compliance (O) Pass/Fail/NA Agent was compliant with the process that was currently being assessed as a special project. Agent was not compliant with the special topic being assessed. When there is no special assessment ongoing at the time of the review or when the ticket does not fall under the scope of said project. QA must insert the mandatory tag for the ongoing project in the comment section of this metric. 10. Knowledge Base Feedback Knowledge Base Article Status (O) KB Article: correct / KB Article: incorrect / KB Article: not available This section is supposed to provide feedback on the KB article status for the process relevant for the ticket being assessed. QA must leave comments if the KB article is not correct and updated. These comments must include the article's link, if the article exists but is incomplete/incorrect. If the article for said process does not exist, then the QA must write a small summary of what process is not mapped/available on the KB. 11. Final Summary QA Comments (S) This section is to be used for the Quality Analyst to provide overall comments on the audit (positive and negative). Passing score ≥ 85% NOTE: Whenever a Quality Analyst marks a metric as a "fail", it is mandatory to leave a comment in the comment box for said category. This should include what the agent did incorrectly and, when applicable, what should have been the right course of action. ​ File for download xlsx Frontline Q-Grid v3.0 - BPOs (Live Sprinklr).xlsx 0.03 MB

title: Quality Grid: Back-office Agents (CECE)
content: TABLE OF CONTENTS Introduction Quality assessment grid for back-office agents File for download Introduction This article contains the most up-to-date version of our quality grid for back-office contacts. At the moment this is only being used for Central Europe back-office quality audits and is not yet integrated in Miuros. Quality assessment grid for back-office agents Q-Grid - Back-office (v1.5) Metrics Result Description Guidelines Alerts Weight Categorization Pass / Fail Agent checked if the ticket categories were correct and, if not, sent the ticket back to front-office. 12 Assignment Pass / Fail Agent checked if the ticket was assigned correctly to his team and, if not, reverted the ticket back to the unassigned queue. Failing this metric will result in automatic failure of the monitor. 5 Correct Solution Pass / Fail Agent followed the correct procedures and provided the right solution. If the agent provided the solution merely as an internal note this will result in automatic failure of the monitor. Agent should not change the status to "done", while the escalation is still ongoing. 15 Detailed Information Pass / Fail Agent provided the solution including all relevant information and KB article (if applicable) to the handling of the ticket. 8 Escalation Pass / Fail / N/A Agent escalated the ticket with the correct team. If "Escalation" is N/A, "Notes" should also be set as N/A. Pass: When the agent escalates the case because it needs to be escalated. Fail: When the agent escalates a case that did not require escalation or when the agent did not escalate the case when it required escalation. NA: When there was no escalation and none was required. 15 Investigation Pass / Fail Agent investigated the situation efficiently and in a thorough way, while gathering all relevant information. This is reflected by having the correct barcode information in the ticket notes. Agent should ask for all relevant information in the first reply. 15 Notes Pass / Fail / N/A Internal notes were detailed and complete (following our template), including all relevant information. I have already tried: Barcode status: Barcode date: I have checked the address (Y/N): 10 Civility and Feedback Pass / Fail Agent did all requests with civility. Additionally, if no feedback had already been provided, agent gave feedback to the front-office team when the ticket was escalated and/or solved. Started with "Hi/hello" and ended with "Thank you/thanks". Must be done as if it was an email reply, respecting grammar/syntax rules and having proper spacing. 10 Follow up Pass / Fail Agent followed up on the ticket within a reasonable time frame, without compromising or delaying the ticket resolution. 10 Deadline Pass / Fail Agent handled the ticket within the agreed time-based deadline (1 business day). 10 Passing score ≥ 85% File for download vnd.openxmlformats-officedocument.spreadsheetml.sheet Q-Grid Back-office v1.5.xlsx 0.013386726379394531 MB

title: Quality Grid: Offline Agents
content: TABLE OF CONTENTS Introduction Quality assessment grid for offline agents File for download Introduction This article contains the most up-to-date version of our quality grid for offline (B2B) contacts. At the moment this is being used in all markets for normal B2B quality audits and is fully integrated in Sprinklr. ​ Quality assessment grid for offline agents Q-Grid - Offline v1.0 (2025) Category Outcome Description/Pass Fail N/A Alerts/Tips Score Split Total % 1. Legal & Privacy Customer Authentication (O) Pass/Fail/NA Agent authenticated the customer correctly, following our guidelines. Agent did not authenticate the customer when the contact was about an order or Emma account. Agent asked the customer for more information than what was required to authenticate the customer. Agent asked the customer to authenticate himself when this was not required. If the contact is not about an order or Emma account. AUDIT CRITICAL Failing this category will automatically result in the agent failing the entire monitor. 34% 4% Data Privacy & Legal Requests (O) Pass/Fail/NA Agent handled DSR's and official requests (courts, lawyers or legal entities) correctly. Outbound calls were only recorded with the customer's permission. Agent did not follow the process for legal related requests. Agent recorded an outbound call without permission. When the contact is not about a legal request or when no outbound call is recorded. AUDIT CRITICAL Failing this category will automatically result in the agent failing the entire monitor. 33% Data Breaches (O) Pass/Fail/NA Agent assured data was not shared incorrectly and that reported data breaches were acted upon as per our procedures. Agent incorrectly sent information pertaining to another customer. Agent shared Emma internal contact details that were not for customers. Agent failed to act when receiving a report for a data breach. If no data breach occcurred or was reported. AUDIT CRITICAL Failing this category will automatically result in the agent failing the entire monitor. 33% 2. Information Filtering Active Reading / Listening (O) Pass/Fail Agent understood precisely what the customer was referring to and replied / took action in a way that reflected that. Agent asked for information that the customer had already provided. Agent made contradictory statements that were not aligned with what the customer said/requested. Agent failed to verify all available and relevant data and, because of this, gave wrong information to the customer. Agent interrupted the customer without a valid reason. 40% 15% Investigation / Troubleshooting (O) Pass/Fail/NA In case all the information required to tackle the issue was not provided, the agent asked for clarification or requested additional information. Agent failed to ask the customer to clarify the issue when this was not 100% clear or when key information was not shared. Agent assumed something without this being confirmed by the customer. When all the information provided by the customer was clear and sufficient for us to pinpoint the issue and assist. 30% Rephrasing / Issue acknowledgement (O) Pass/Fail Phone / chat -> Agent recapped the customer's query and obtained acknowledgement that what the agent understood was correct. Email -> Agent acknowledges the contact reason and the context in writing. This is done by contextualizing the reply in light of the situation at hand, addressing all points made by the customer. Phone / chat -> Agent did not rephrase the contact reason in the beginning of the contact and before putting the customer on hold. Email -> Agent failed to acknowledge the context in the email reply sent to the customer. On chat, please make sure to keep the recap simple and short. 30% 3. Documentation & Notes Ticket Categorization (O) Pass/Fail Agent selected the correct options in the categorization window on Sprinklr. If the original categories were incorrect, the agent changed them accordingly. Agent categorized the ticket incorrectly or the categorization and/or additional data was incomplete. Agent changed the original ticket categorization to adapt to a new query from the customer. Agent selected the wrong market/group for the contact. 50% 15% Internal Notes (O) Pass/Fail/NA Agent left internal notes in our tools (Sprinklr, JIRA and Magento/Fluent Commerce) as per our internal procedures. Agent failed to leave notes on one or more of our tools as per the correct procedure. Agent left notes but these were not in the correct format or were incorrect/incomplete. When the contact does not require any notes. 50% 4. Resolution Offered a Solution (O) Pass/Fail Agent offered the customer a solution for the query at hand. Agent did not offer a solution to the customer's query. GROUP CRITICAL Failing this category will automatically result in the agent failing the "Resolution" group. 10% 20% Correct Solution (O) Pass/Fail Agent opted for the right solution for the specific query/request from the customer. An adequate response was provided according to the customer's issues/requests. Agent did not offer the correct solution to handle the situation at hand. Agent provided wrong information to the customer about the topic in question. 60% Execution & Expectations (O) Pass/Fail/NA Agent executed the proposed solution correctly, as per our internal procedures. Agent set expectations correctly: explained actions taken (or to be taken), clarified the expected outcome and the timelines involved. Agent did not follow the correct procedure for the solution offered to the customer. Agent failed to explain to the customer what would happen next and when. Agent told the customer a parcel delivery or item pick up would happen on a specific date or within a specific time frame. Not applicable if the issue at hand does not require the agent to take any actions internally or if there will be no additional actions from Emma or Emma partners that will occur in the future and require expectations to be set. 30% 5. Communication Empathy and Cognitive Harmony (S) Pass/Fail Agent showed empathy in a truthful and impactful way. All statements/reactions made during the contact felt genuine, were appropriate to the situation at hand and showed a willingness to connect with the customer. Agent failed to react to the customer's state of mind, especially when the customer was disappointed. Agent said/wrote things that were in cognitive dissonance with the customer's state of mind and the situation at hand. Agent's empathy statements/reactions should resonate with the customer. The goal here is to amplify a positive occurrence and minimize a poor experience. 20% 25% Emma Tone (S) Pass/Fail Agent communicated with the customer using the Emma tone of voice. As such, the agent displayed a positive and engaging attitude throughout the interaction, showed genuine willingness to help and was always professional, using a formal communication style. Agent was numb and/or robotic throughout the contact. Agent had a negative approach to the case and/or engaged in negative communication or negative reinforcement. Note 1: Communication should be fluid and feel like an actual conversation. Note 2: Agent should not engage in negative communication or negative reinforcement. Note 3: Agents should always address the customer by "Mr"/"Mrs", despite the conversational tone. 15% Clarity (S) Pass/Fail Agent communicated with the customer in a clear and precise way. Additionally, when required, agent adapted the language used to match the customer's level of fluency. Agent failed to communicate in a clear and precise way. Agent failed to adapt the language used when the customer is clearly having difficulty understanding what is being said/written. Agent used terms, technical or not, that the customer could not understand. Agent's sentences were confusing or poorly structured. Agent spoke too fast. 20% Personalization (S) Pass/Fail Agent followed the contact opening and closure guidelines. Agent personalised any written communication with the customer and did not just use the canned replies. Additionally, the agent did not repeat the same sentences/expressions throughout the contact (and email thread) and avoided redundancy. Agent did not respect the guidelines for contact opening and closure (see tab "Contact Opening-Closure"). Agent changed any part of the signature except the final greeting right before the agent's name. Email signature was not separated from the email body by double spacing. Agent sent the same introductory or closing sentence in two or more consecutive emails. Agent failed to acknowledge that he/her had recently handled a query from this specific customer. Agent failed to adapt any canned responses/text used to match the specifics of the case. Agent gave redundant information throughout the contact. Agents should avoid over-branding (mentioning Emma too many times). 20% Written Communication (O) Pass/Fail/NA Agent used proper grammar, syntax and punctuation in the written communication sent to the customer. Agent did not use slang, jargon and abbreviations. The text was also properly formatted (font, colors, background, spacing, etc.)  and followed our internal communication guidelines. Agent had two or more grammar/syntax/punctuation mistakes. Agent used slang, jargon or abbreviations. Agent did not use paragraphs to group information pertaining to the same topic. Agent used the same word to start 3 or more sentences in an email. Agent used different font types in the same email. Agent pasted text/content in the email that was unrelated to the case by mistake. Agent had incorrect/inconsistent spacing throughout the email. Agent used emojis that were not adequate to the situation or used too many emojis during the communication with the customer. Agent used emojis in an email without the customer doing so first. Agent should not use overly informal communication stances. Even in a pre-sales context, communication standards must be maintained. Phone: Not applicable. Two mistakes or more will result in the agent failing this metric. Emoji usage is completely optional, but on email cases it should only happen if the customer sends emojis first. 20% Respect (S) Pass/Fail Agent was polite and respectful throughout the contact. Agent did not raise his/her voice and was passive-aggressive with the customer. Agent left notes in our tools that, although accurate, described the customer respectfully. Agent was disrespectful or rude towards the customer. Agent made inappropriate comments. Agent laughed/made fun of the customer. Agent left notes in our tools that characterized the customer in a diminishing fashion. AUDIT CRITICAL Failing this category will automatically result in the agent failing the entire monitor. 5% 6. Professionalism Ownership (O) Pass/Fail Agent took ownership of the situation in a positive way and did not assign blame to colleagues, other teams or logistic partners. Agent also followed through with any promises made, like future contacts or follow-ups. Agent transferred the case to a colleague without a valid reason and permission from the agent's Team Leader. Agent unassigned himself/herself from the ticket or disconnected the call. Agent closed the ticket without replying to the customer, when the customer still had questions/issues. Agent assigned blame to a colleague or Emma partner. Agent made negative comments to the customer about Emma, Emma products or Emma internal tools. Agent did not contact the customer again after promising to do so, or did so after the expected deadline had expired. Agent apologised for something that was not caused by Emma or Emma's partners. Agents should not transfer cases to other agents without a valid, and documented, reason for it. 50% 10% Knowledge & Customer Education (O) Pass/Fail/NA Agent displayed full knowledge of Emma products, webstores and services and, when required, informed the customer accordingly on these and explained any public facing processes. Agent took the time to educate the customer when the query could have been resolved by the customer without contacting us. Agent provided incorrect information on Emma products, webstores and services. Agent told the customer he/she was not able to provide information on Emma products, webstores and services, when this information was available to the CS team and cleared to be shared with customers. Agent did not educate the customer and this may result in the customer reaching out again in near future. When the contact was not about something that the customer might have found out/resolved without contacting us. If a tracking number is provided, the agent should also provide clear and complete instructions on where and how the customer can use of it. 25% Time Management (S) Pass/Fail Agent took only the time required to handle the interaction and apologised when our reply took longer than the promised SLA. Agent was also respectful of the hold options rules. Agent took longer than expected to handle the situation at hand. Agent did not apologise to the customer when our reply came after the SLA expired. Agent put the customer on hold without asking for permission first. Agent did not put the customer on hold and just stopped talking while investigating the situation in question. Agent did not thank the customer for the time on hold after returning to the call. Agent took longer than 2 minutes (4 minutes for chat) before returning to the call/chat. Agent stayed connected on a phone call long after the customer disconnected. While on hold, agents need to give the customer feedback every 2 minutes. If the agent feels the situation will take longer than expected to sort out, the agent should give the customer the option to receive a follow-up contact at a later date. Chat hold time can be up to 4 minutes. 25% 7. Escalation Escalation Assignment (O) Pass/Fail/NA Agent escalated the case to the correct parties as per our internal procedures. Agent escalated the issue to the wrong team/POC or did it using the wrong channel/platform. Agent failed to escalate with a Team Leader when the customer was asking to speak with one. When no escalation was done. 50% 10% Escalation Accuracy (O) Pass/Fail/NA Agent escalation included all relevant information. Agent left out relevant information from the escalation. Agent's request was unclear. 50% ​ 8. Special Projects Special Assessment Compliance (O) Pass/Fail/NA Agent was compliant with the process that was currently being assessed as a special project. Agent was not compliant with the special topic being assessed. When there is no special assessment ongoing at the time of the review or when the ticket does not fall under the scope of said project. QA must insert the mandatory tag for the ongoing project in the comment section of this metric. 9. Knowledge Base Feedback Knowledge Base Article Status (O) KB Article: correct / KB Article: incorrect / KB Article: not available This section is supposed to provide feedback on the KB article status for the process relevant for the ticket being assessed. QA must leave comments if the KB article is not correct and updated. These comments must include the article's link, if the article exists but is incomplete/incorrect. If the article for said process does not exist, then the QA must write a small summary of what process is not mapped/available on the KB. 10. Final Summary QA Comments (S) This section is to be used for the Quality Analyst to provide overall comments on the audit (positive and negative). Passing score ≥ 85% NOTE: Whenever a Quality Analyst marks a metric as a "fail", it is mandatory to leave a comment in the comment box for said category. This should include what the agent did incorrectly and, when applicable, what should have been the right course of action. title: Quality Grid: Online Reputation Agents
content: TABLE OF CONTENTS Introduction Quality assessment grid for online reputation agents File for download Introduction This article contains the most up-to-date version of our quality grid for social media/online reputation contacts. At the moment this is being used in Central Europe but can be used in other markets as well. This grid is fully integrated in Miuros. Quality assessment grid for online reputation agents Q-Grid - Online Reputation (v1.2) Category Outcome Description/ Pass Fail N/A Alerts/ Tips Value 1. Contact Opening Initial Greeting (O) Pass/ Fail Review platforms/ Public comments -> Agent greeted the customer, used the customer's name and thanked the customer for contacting us. DM -> Agent greeted the customer, used the customer's name, introduced himself and thanked the customer for contacting us. Agent did not greet the customer completely as per our internal guidelines. Agent called the customer by the wrong name. Addressing the customer by a different name than the one that was given, will fail this category. 10 2. Data Processing Authentication (O) Pass/ Fail/ NA DM -> Agent authenticated the customer correctly, following our guidelines. Notes: Only applicable when information regarding an order or an Emma account is involved. Agent did not authenticate the customer when the contact was about an order or Emma account. Agent asked the customer for more information than what was required to authenticate the customer. Agent asked the customer to authenticate himself when this was not required. Agent provided information regarding an order or Emma account in a Review platforms reply or Public contact on FB or IG. When it's a Public contact or a Trustpilot contact. Failing this category will automatically result in the agent failing the entire monitor. 5 Outbound Calls (O) Pass/ Fail/ NA Review platforms -> In case of an outbound call, the agent asked the customer for permission to record the call and, if there were no objections to this, proceeded to record the contact. Agent recorded an outbound call without permission. For public comments and FB/IG. When the agent does not do an outbound call. 5 3. Information Filtering Active reading/ listening (O) Pass/ Fail Agent understood precisely what the customer was referring to and replied/took action in a way that reflected that. Agent asked for information that the customer had already provided. Agent made contradictory statements that were not aligned with what the customer said/ requested. Agent failed to verify all available and relevant data and, because of this, gave wrong information to the customer. Agent interrupted the customer without a valid reason. 10 Investigation/ troubleshooting (O) Pass/ Fail/ NA In case all the information required to tackle the issue was not provided, the agent asked for clarification or requested additional information. Agent failed to ask the customer to clarify the issue when this was not 100% clear. Agent assumed something without this being confirmed by the customer. When all the information provided by the customer was clear and sufficient for us to pinpoint the issue and assist. 5 Rephrasing/ issue acknowledgement (O) Pass/ Fail Phone -> Agent recapped the customer's query and obtained acknowledgement that what the agent understood was correct. Review platforms , DM and public contacts -> Agent acknowledges the contact reason and the context in writing. This is done by contextualizing the reply in light of the situation at hand, addressing all points made by the customer. Phone -> Agent did not rephrase the contact reason in the beginning of the contact or before putting the customer on hold. Review platforms , DM and public contacts -> Agent failed to acknowledge the context in the written reply sent to the customer. On chat, please make sure to keep the recap simple and short. 10 Use of Hold Option (O) Pass/ Fail/ NA Agent got permission from the customer to be put on hold and thanked the customer for holding after returning to the call/DM. Phone/ DM: Agent put the customer on hold without asking for permission first. Agent did not put the customer on hold and just stopped talking while investigating the situation in question. Agent did not thank the customer for the time on hold after returning to the call/DM. Agent took longer than 2 minutes before returning to the call/DM. Phone: Agent did not put the customer on hold and kept actively talking to the customer while looking for information. Review platforms : Not applicable. While on hold, agents need to give the customer feedback every 2 minutes. If the agent feels the situation will take longer than expected to sort out, the agent should give the customer the option to receive a follow-up contact later in the day. 5 4. Case Handling Correct Solution (O) Pass/ Fail An adequate response was provided according to the customer's issues/requests and the right procedure was followed. Agent did not follow the correct procedure to handle the situation at hand. Agent provided wrong information to the customer. 15 Expectations Setting (O) Pass/ Fail/ NA Agent set expectations correctly: explained actions taken (or to be taken), clarified the expected outcome and the timeline for a resolution. Agent failed to explain to the customer what would happen next and when. Agent told the customer a parcel delivery or item pick up would happen on a specific date or within a specific time frame. When the customer just gave positive feedback. 10 Knowledge (O) Pass/ Fail/ NA Agent displayed knowledge of everything Emma related (website, products, awards, etc). Agent showed a lack of knowledge of Emma related topics when questioned by the customer. Agent gave incorrect information on Emma related topics (website, products, awards, etc). When the agent is not questioned on Emma related topics (website, products, awards, etc). 5 Ownership (O) Pass/ Fail Agent took ownership of the situation in a positive way and did not assign blame to colleagues, other teams or logistic partners. Agent also followed through with any promises made, like future contacts or follow-ups. Agent transferred the case to a colleague without a valid reason and permission from the agent's Team Leader. Agent assigned blame to a colleague or Emma partner. Agent made negative comments to the customer about Emma, Emma products or our internal tools. Agent did not contact the customer again after promising to do so, or did so after the expected deadline had expired. Agent did not include the Freshdesk ticket number in the Trustpilot reply when an outbound email had been sent regarding the case. Agents should not transfer cases to other agents without a valid, and documented, reason for it. Note 1: In case the customer was not aware of a procedure or feature, the agent should take the time to educate the customer. Note 2: If a tracking number is provided, the agent should also provide clear and complete instructions on how the customer can use of it. 10 Ticket Categorization (O) Pass/ Fail Agent selected the correct options in the "Properties" tab on Freshdesk. If the original categories were incorrect, the agent changed them accordingly. Agent categorized the ticket incorrectly or the categorization was incomplete. Agent changed the original ticket categorization to adapt to a new query from the customer. Agent wrote in the "Suggest a topic" box when using a categorization that was not "Others/others". Agent selected the wrong group for the contact. Note 1: Filled out "Order Number", "Category", "Phase", "Topic", Sub-Topic", "Suggested topic", "Logistic claim", "Product claim" and "SKU" tabs, when applicable. -> Mandatory for OR: "Status", "Priority", "Group" and "Social Media Contact". Note 2: When selecting "Others / Others / Suggest a topic" to classify the ticket, agent must always indicate an appropriate category for future consideration. Nothing should be entered in "Suggest a topic" if the case has not been tagged "Others / Others". Note 3: For Review platforms cases, agents also need to fill in the "Initial rating" (if applicable) and "Final rating" tabs. 10 5. Communication Emma Tone (S) Pass/ Fail Agent communicated with the customer using the Emma tone of voice. As such, the agent displayed a positive and engaging attitude throughout the interaction, showed genuine willingness to help and was always professional, even if the communication style was informal. Agent was numb and/ or robotic throughout the contact. Agent had a negative approach to the case and/ or engaged in negative communication or negative reinforcement. Note 1: Communication should be fluid and feel like an actual conversation. Note 2: Agent should not engage in negative communication or negative reinforcement. 15 Emoji Usage (S) Pass/ Fail/ NA Agent used emojis in a careful way and according to the situation at hand. These were not in dissonance with the customer's emotional state and did not reflect poorly on Emma. Agent used emojis that were not adequate to the situation. Agent used too many emojis during the communication with the customer. When no emojis were used by the agent. When using emojis, if, by default, the platform does not allow for full, colourful emojis, during text entry, type Windows logo key + . (period). The emoji keyboard will appear. 10 Personalization (O) Pass/ Fail/ NA Agent personalised any written communication with the customer and did not just use the canned replies. Additionally, the agent avoided redundancy. Agent sent the same introductory or closing sentence in two or more emails. Agent failed to acknowledge that he/ her had previously handled a query from this specific customer. Agent failed to adapt any canned responses/ text used to match the specifics of the case. Agent gave redundant information throughout the communication. Agent apologised for something that was not caused by Emma or Emma's partners. Agents should avoid overbranding (mentioning Emma too many times). 15 Written Communication (O) Pass/ Fail/ NA Agent used proper grammar, syntax and punctuation in the written communication sent to the customer. Agent did not use slang, jargon and abbreviations. The text was also properly formatted (font, colors and background, email spacing (excluding signature), etc.) Agent had two or more grammar/ syntax/ punctuation mistakes. Agent used abbreviations. Agent did not use paragraphs to group information pertaining to the same topic. Agent used different font types in the same email. Agent pasted text/ content in the email that was unrelated to the case. Agent had inappropriate/ inconsistent spacing throughout the email. Two mistakes or more will result in the agent failing this metric. 15 6. Soft Skills Empathy and Cognitive Harmony (S) Pass/ Fail Agent showed empathy in a truthful and impactful way. All statements/reactions made during the contact felt genuine, were appropriate to the situation at hand and showed a willingness to connect with the customer. Agent failed to react to the customer's state of mind, especially when the customer was disappointed. Agent said/wrote things that were in cognitive dissonance with the customer's state of mind and the situation at hand. Agent's empathy statements/ reactions should resonate with the customer. The goal here is to amplify a positive occurrence and minimize a poor experience. 10 Respect (O) Pass/ Fail Agent was polite and respectful throughout the contact. Agent did not raise their voice or was passive-aggressive with the customer. Agent was disrespectful towards the customer. Agent made inappropriate comments. Agent laughed/made fun of the customer. Agent left notes in our tools that were characterized the customer in a diminishing fashion. Insulting or cursing at the customer will automatically result in the agent failing this category and the entire monitor. / Leaving notes in the system that are judgemental or diminishing to customers will also result in the agent failing this category. 5 Time Management (S) Pass/ Fail Agent did not take more time than required to handle the interaction and apologised when our reply took longer than the SLA. Agent took longer than expected to handle the situation at hand. Agent did not apologise to the customer when our reply came after the SLA expired. 10 7. Internal Notes Freshdesk/ Freshchat (O) Pass/ Fail/ Critical Fail/ NA Agent left complete notes on Freshdesk/ Freshchat with all relevant information regarding the case, the Review platforms case link along with the original message from the customer and the agent's reply on Review platforms , follow up email ticket number and JIRA ticket number/s, if applicable. Review platforms -> When sending out an outbound email due to a Review platforms case, the agent included the Freshdesk ticket number in the Trustpilot reply. Agent did not leave complete notes on Freshdesk/ Freshchat after doing a follow-up email or making a JIRA ticket, including the ticket number/s. When handling a Review platforms case, if the agent does not include the case link in Freshdesk, the category will be critically failed. When there is no need to insert notes on Freshdesk/ Freshchat. In case the agent does an outbound call, this should be registered in the notes, explaining why it was done, what was discussed and the outcome of the call. 10 Jira (O) Pass/ Fail/ NA Agent added a "cst informed" comment on the Jira ticket, once the final solution for the ticket was reached. Agent didn't add a "cst informed" comment on the Jira ticket, once the final solution for the ticket was reached. When the agent did not open a ticket on JIRA. 5 Magento/ Fluent Commerce (O) Pass/ Fail/ NA Agent left complete notes on Magento and/ or Fluent Commerce with all relevant information. Agent did not leave notes on Magento / Fluent Commerce. Agent's notes were incomplete or in the wrong format. When the contact is not about an order. 10 8. Escalation Category/ Assignment (O) Pass/ Fail/ NA Agent escalated the case to the correct team and selected the correct category for the ticket. Agent selected the wrong team and/or category for the escalation. When no escalation was done. 10 Request Accuracy (O) Pass/ Fail/ NA Agent escalation included all relevant information, was done using the appropriate template and had correct grammar/ sintaxe. Agent left out relevant information from the escalation. Agent's request was not clear. Agent did not use the indicated template for escalations. 10 Sleep Experts (O) Pass/ Fail/ NA When appropriate, agent escalated the case with the Sleep Experts. Agent did not transfer the contact to a Sleep Expert when this was called for. When there is no need to transfer the case to Sleep Experts. 10 9. Closure Wrapping Up (O) Pass/ Fail DM/Phone -> After the initial contact topic had been handled, the agent showed availability to assist further and, if the customer had no other question, thanked the customer for contacting us and bid the customer farewell in a pleasant way. Review platforms -> After the initial contact topic had been handled, the agent showed availability to assist further, in case the customer had other queries in the future. Public contacts -> Agent bid the customer farewell in a pleasant way. Review platforms / DM/ Phone: Agent did not thank the customer for contacting us and/or did not show availability to further assist the customer with any future queries/issues at the end of the contact (if there was space for this) and/or did not bid the customer farewell in a pleasant way. Public contacts: Agent did not bid the customer farewell in a nice way. In case the customer just gave positive feedback, the agent does not need to offer availability to further assist in the future. 10 Signature (O) Pass/ Fail/ NA Review platforms / email -> The agent had the signature used with the right format and spaced correctly from the body of the email. Agent did not use the correct signature format. Signature was not separated from the email body by double spacing. Agent did not use their first name in full in the signature. Signatures should follow the specific instructions included in the KB articles for Online Reputation communication. 5 10. Context and Insight Agent Level (O) Rookie/ Junior/ Senior/ Expert Rookie agent = Agent has been working with us for up to 3 months. Junior agent = Agent has been working with us for 3 to 6 months. Senior agent = Agent has been working with us for over 6 months. Expert agent = A senior agent that qualifies for this category. 0 Difficulty Level (O) Easy/ Medium/ Hard After reviewing the case, the reviewer should indicate the case's difficulty level according to our guidelines. Easy -> Standard question (most times the answer can be found on the FAQ's) and the customer is not unhappy. Medium -> Something did not go as planned and customer is unhappy with our site/ service, etc. Hard -> Customer had already contacted us about this issue and it was not solved, customer is very unhappy. 0 Customer Effort (O) Low/ Medium/ High Low - Customer contacted us once and got someone to handle their issue in a timely manner. Medium - Customer had to contact us twice, because: 1) there was no action on our part; 2) expectations were not properly set; or 3) there was no follow up after the first reply. High - Customer had to contact us multiple times, using different channels, before someone took action to solve the issue. 0 Controllability (O) Controllable/ Uncontrollable/ NA Was the issue controllable from a Customer Service perspective? When the customer contacts just to give positive feedback. 0 Improvement Opportunities (O) Yes/No If the customer gave a suggestion for service / product improvement, that should be registered here by the reviewer. 0 Passing score ≥ 85% File for download vnd.openxmlformats-officedocument.spreadsheetml.sheet Online Rep - Q-Grid v1.2 - 2024 - BPO .xlsx 0.024611473083496094 MB
