title: Ticket Assignment Guide for Supervisors and CE Managers
content: TABLE OF CONTENTS What is Automatic Ticket Assignment? What is Agent Availability? What are Skills? Freshdesk Skill Naming Convention How To's - Ticket Assignment Guide for Supervisors and CE Managers How to add new agents to skills (if you do not have the proper access please contact IT): How to toggle Agent Availability Skill Mapping per Market Load-balanced ticket assignment - Omniroute What is Automatic Ticket Assignment? For each Freshdesk group, we can configure the distribution and balance the number of tickets assigned to agents within the Group. To enable or modify this for your market please submit a ticket to the IT Portal . Round Robin ticket assignment - Assign tickets to agents in a circular order (no special logic) Load balanced ticket assignment - Tickets are assigned based on an agent's load. Configure agent load under Omniroute ™ settings . Omniroute settings can be directly configured by Supervisors. Skill based ticket assignment - Assign tickets to agents based on their skills (see "What are Skills?" below). When a skill is mapped to two or more agents, incoming tickets will be assigned to the agent with a lesser load. Only IT or CE Global team should create Skills. Please log a ticket if needed. Manual (not recommended) - automatic ticket assignment is turned off. Either agents pick from the queue or supervisors assign tickets manually. What is Agent Availability? Agent Availability determines whether or not the agent is available to be assigned tickets. To enable or modify this for your market please submit a ticket to the IT Portal . Allow agents to control their availability status - Agents can choose to go offline for automatic ticket assignment. Allow only admins/supervisors to control agents’ availability status - Only supervisors can change agents' status using the availability dashboard. What are Skills? Skills allow you to easily match tickets to the right agents. You can associate distinct skills to each agent and create rules to make sure that only tickets matching those skills are assigned to them. If the skill mapped to a ticket matches an agent's skill, the ticket will be assigned to the agent. The market can choose to rearrange the Skills depending on priority. Some agents can be assigned more than one skill. Whichever skill is first in order would be prioritized for the agents. The load is computed at a group level i.e. even if the agent is a part of multiple groups, the load that you have set under the Skill-based assignment checks only for the open tickets in that group. Sample (from FR group): The Marketplaces skill is first in order so if Agent A is in both Marketplaces and Post Delivery skills, the agent will be assigned Marketplaces tickets first. Skill sample: FR - Pre Delivery Skill conditions must be existing ticket fields (cannot be Tags, Requester email addresses, or words in the Subject). To enable or modify this for your market please submit a ticket to the IT Portal . Freshdesk Skill Naming Convention Skills should use the following convention: General Skills (main skill for assignment, no specialties) - <Freshdesk Group> - General For one group with specialty: <Freshdesk Grou p> - <Specialty> For multiple groups: <Grou p1><Group2 > - <Specialty> How To's - Ticket Assignment Guide for Supervisors and CE Managers As agreed with BPO Management team, BPO Supervisors are responsible for adding/removing agents to/from Skills. How to add new agents to skills (if you do not have the proper access please contact IT): Go to this link and look for the skill for your market (see table below or refer to this file ). Click on Manage : Click on Add Agent then add as many agents as needed. Click on Done , then Save . How to toggle Agent Availability If you are an agent : Check the upper right corner of your Freshdesk Tickets page: Helpdesk : Bettzeit GmbH (freshdesk.com) . If you are unable to see this icon, this means you are not assigned to a group that is using Automatic Ticket Assig The moon icon indicates that the agent is Unavailable: Click on the icon to toggle agent availability as needed. Available will allow the agent to start receiving tickets. If you are a supervisor: Go to your Freshdesk dashboard: Helpdesk : Bettzeit GmbH (freshdesk.com) Scroll down to the Available agents section and click on View details: Filter by your Market: Look for the agent and click on the dropdown beside the status to toggle: Markets using Shifts - inquiries are automatically assigned only when an agent is available at their shift. Agents are automatically set to Available at the start of their shift, and set to not available upon ending their shift. not all markets use this and shifts are assigned PER AGENT not per GROUP . Refer to the market setup file to check if your market is using them. Skill Mapping per Market Only main/general skills are listed here. For otehr specialties please check the mapping file . Market Main Skills AT AT - 1st Level Auto Assign (primary) AT Sleep Experts DE/AT/CH-DE Sleep Experts AU no skill - contact support AU B2B no skill - contact support BE-FR Sleep Experts BE-FR/CH-FR Sleep Experts BE-NL Sleep Experts NL/BE-NL Sleep Experts CH-DE CH-DE - General CH-DE Sleep Experts DE/AT/CH-DE Sleep Experts CH-FR CH-FR - General CH-FR Sleep Experts BE-FR/CH-FR Sleep Experts DE DE - General DE Sleep Experts DE/AT/CH-DE Sleep Experts DK Sleep Experts DK Sleep Experts ES no agents in skill - contact support ES B2B ES B2B 1st level ES Sleep Experts ES Sleep Experts FR FR - Pre Delivery FR Sleep Experts FR Sleep Experts - Pre Sale IT IT - General IT Sleep Experts IT Sleep Experts NL no skill - contact support NL B2B no skill - contact support NL Sleep Experts NL/BE-NL Sleep Experts Online Reputation no skill - contact support PT no agents in skill - contact support PT Sleep Experts PT Sleep Experts SE Sleep Experts no agents in skill - contact support UK no skill - contact support UK Sleep Experts UK Sleep Experts Load-balanced ticket assignment - Omniroute S upervisors and Performance Managers can set a maximum limit on the number of open conversations your agent groups can handle on each channel at a given time. Freshdesk - Omniroute Settings If you encounter any issues please file a ticket to IT Support .

title: Offline Supervisor's Guide: Reporting Sprinklr Issues
content: TABLE OF CONTENTS ​ Why Structured Reporting Matters How to Report Issues the Right Way A. Summary – Clear & Specific Title B. Category – Choose the Right Type C. Steps to Reproduce – Show the Problem, Step by Step D. Business Impact – Why Does This Matter? E. Attachments – Show, Don’t Just Tell F. Suggested Fix (If Applicable – Optional for Feature Requests) The Impact of Better Issue Reporting Final Checklist Before Submitting an Issue Correct vs. Incorrect Issue Reporting Guide ❌ Incorrect Example ✅ Correct Example ​ A well-structured reporting guideline is essential for clear and effective communication of issues, enabling faster resolutions and optimizing workflow efficiency. This SOP establishes a standardized approach to issue tracking and resolution, ensuring consistency and improved outcomes. Following these best practices will result in a more effective workflow. ​ Why Structured Reporting Matters ✅ Faster Fixes – When devs have complete information, they can start working without delays. ✅ Better Prioritization – Real business impact determines what gets fixed first, not just "High Priority" labels. ✅ Less Manual Work – No need for the project lead to filter or rewrite reports. ✅ Accurate Categorization – Bugs, enhancements, and performance issues require different solutions. Right now, reports go through unnecessary extra steps before reaching devs. By improving reporting, we reduce the workload on everyone and speed up issue resolution. ​ How to Report Issues the Right Way A. Summary – Clear & Specific Title 🚫 Wrong: “Ticket assignment not working properly.” ✅ Right: “Key Account Tickets Not Auto-Assigned to Senior Agents – Requires Manual Supervisor Intervention” Why? A vague title requires more questions. A clear, specific title instantly describes the issue and who is affected. B. Category – Choose the Right Type This ensures the issue is sent to the right team: Bug = Something that was working before but is now broken. Enhancement = A missing feature that should exist to support business needs. Performance Issue = The system is slow, unresponsive, or causing workflow delays. Data Issue = Incorrect, missing, or duplicated information. For this example: ✅ Enhancement – Auto-assignment functionality is missing but should be available to streamline operations. Enhancements can be urgent if backed by a business case. C. Steps to Reproduce – Show the Problem, Step by Step 🚫 Wrong: "Supervisors are manually assigning cases. Can we automate it?" ✅ Right: A Key Account customer submits a case in Sprinklr CRM . Instead of automatically routing to the assigned Senior Agent , the case goes into the general queue. A Supervisor has to manually reassign the ticket to the correct Senior Agent. If the assigned agent is on leave or unavailable , there is no clear backup, causing delays. Expected Behavior: Cases from Key Accounts should be automatically assigned to their assigned Senior Agent in their LOB. If the Senior Agent is out , the case should fall back to another Senior Agent or a Supervisor for reassignment. Actual Behavior: No auto-assignment happens. Supervisors have to manually distribute cases, causing delays. No fallback logic exists for handling agent absences. Why? Without clear steps, developers can’t replicate the issue, making it impossible to fix. D. Business Impact – Why Does This Matter? Every issue can’t be High Priority unless justified. Use real-world impact to determine urgency. 🚫 Wrong: "This is urgent, we need it fixed now!" ✅ Right: ✔ Delays Work – Supervisors must manually assign every Key Account case , increasing their workload. ✔ Work Stoppage – If a Supervisor doesn’t assign a case quickly, customer response times suffer , impacting SLA compliance. ✔ Business-Critical – A lack of automated assignment means high-value accounts aren’t handled efficiently , risking customer dissatisfaction. Why? Just labeling an issue as high priority doesn’t explain its urgency. A strong business case helps ensure it gets fixed faster. E. Attachments – Show, Don’t Just Tell 🚫 Wrong: No screenshot or example provided. ✅ Right: Screenshots of how Key Account cases currently appear in the general queue. Screen recording of a Supervisor manually assigning a case. Example of an error log or workflow rule settings (if available). Why? A clear visual reference helps developers diagnose the issue faster. F. Suggested Fix (If Applicable – Optional for Feature Requests) If you have an idea for how this should work, include it. ✅ Right: “Add a rule that automatically assigns Key Account cases to Senior Agents based on predefined logic. If the assigned Senior Agent is unavailable, route the case to the Supervisor for reassignment.” The Impact of Better Issue Reporting By following this process, we achieve: Faster response times – No extra clarification needed. Better prioritization – Business-critical issues are handled first. Less frustration – BPOs, Supervisors, and Dev teams can work efficiently. More reliable system functionality – Problems are properly tracked and resolved. Final Checklist Before Submitting an Issue ​ ✅ Is the title clear and specific? (No vague “not working” reports) ✅ Did you select the correct category? (Bug, Enhancement, etc.) ✅ Are the steps to reproduce included? (Step-by-step breakdown) ✅ Did you explain the business impact? (Why does this matter?) ✅ Did you attach screenshots or recordings? (If applicable) Correct vs. Incorrect Issue Reporting Guide Scenario: Cases from Key Accounts are not automatically being assigned to Senior Case Agents. ​ ❌ Incorrect Example Title: "Ticket assignment not working." Issue Type: ✔ Bug (Incorrect selection) Agent Information: Role: Supervisor Date/Time: Left blank Number of Affected Users: Unknown Issue Details: Where in Platform? " In the system. " Steps to Reproduce: " Key Account tickets are not going to the right agents. " Expected Behavior: " It should work automatically. " Actual Behavior: " We have to do it manually. " Workaround Available?: " Not sure. " Business Impact: ☐ No Impact ☐ Delays Work ☐ Work Stoppage ☐ System Down (Not selected) Attachments: None attached. ​ ❌ Why is this incorrect? Title is too vague. Misclassified as a bug when it is actually an enhancement. Missing critical details (date/time, affected users, specific steps). No expected vs. actual behavior description. No workaround information. No business impact explanation to justify urgency. No attachments (screenshots, workflow examples, logs). ✅ Correct Example Title: "Key Account Cases Not Auto-Assigning to Senior Agents – Requires Manual Supervisor Reassignment" Issue Type: ✔ Enhancement Agent Information: Role: Supervisor Date/Time: 26/02/2025 – 10:30 UTC Number of Affected Users: Estimated 5+ Senior Agents across multiple LOBs Issue Details: Where in CRM? Sprinklr CRM > Ticket Routing Module Steps to Reproduce: A Key Account customer submits a case through Sprinklr CRM. Instead of automatically routing to the assigned Senior Agent , the case goes into the general queue. A Supervisor has to manually reassign the ticket to the correct Senior Agent. If the assigned agent is on leave or unavailable , there is no automatic fallback to another Senior Agent. Expected Behavior: Key Account cases should be auto-assigned to their designated Senior Agent. If the Senior Agent is unavailable (sick or on leave), the system should auto-reassign the case to another Senior Agent or the Supervisor for manual intervention. Actual Behavior: No auto-assignment exists. Supervisors must manually assign every case , causing delays. No fallback rule for unavailable agents , leading to unassigned or delayed cases. Workaround Available?: Supervisors must check and assign each ticket manually. If a Supervisor is unavailable, tickets remain unassigned until someone manually intervenes. Business Impact: ✔ Delays Work – Supervisors must manually assign every Key Account case , increasing their workload. ✔ Work Stoppage – If Supervisors don’t assign a case quickly, customer response times suffer , impacting SLA compliance. ✔ Business-Critical – A lack of automated assignment means high-value accounts aren’t handled efficiently , risking customer dissatisfaction. Attachments: ✅ Screenshot of a Key Account ticket sitting in the general queue instead of auto-routing. ✅ Screen recording of a Supervisor manually assigning cases one by one. ✅ Example of how routing logic works for standard cases but fails for Key Accounts . ​ ✅ Why is this correct? The title clearly states the problem and its impact. Correctly categorized as an enhancement instead of a bug. Includes detailed steps to reproduce the issue. Clearly outlines expected vs. actual behavior. Provides a valid business impact, justifying priority. Includes attachments to support the report.

title: Agent Capacity Configuration and Case Assignment
content: Table of Content What is Agent Capacity? ​ Who Can Modify Agent Capacity? ​ Understanding the Capacity Configuration ​ Overcapacity Situations ​ Case Assignment ​ ​ -> Automatic Case Assignment ​ -> Manual Case Assignment ​ -> Checking Assignment Type What is Agent Capacity? Agent Capacity in Sprinklr defines how many cases an agent can handle at once across different channels. Each case type is assigned a weight, and agents have a total capacity of 100. The system automatically assigns cases based on this configuration. The standard Emma configuration is called “Emma Agent Capacity - General” . Who Can Modify Agent Capacity? Only the Sprinklr Team and Emma Tech Team are authorized to change agent capacity details. BPO personnel do not have access to these configurations. If you find an Agent without the Capacity set-up as per the image above, please raise a ticket to the Emma IT Team via the IT JIRA Portal . Understanding the Capacity Configuration The total agent capacity is set at 100. And each case type consumes part of this capacity based on its weight. Main Case Types and Weights: Voice Call – 100 Live Chat – 33 Social – 25 Email – 10 Live Chat Deflected – 33 Deflected to Email – 10 Overcapacity Situations Check the scenario in which overcapacity - capacity showing more than 100 - can happen: Deflection from Email to Chat: If a case starts as an Email (10 weight) and then deflects to Live Chat (33 weight), the agent's total capacity may exceed 100. If the total exceeds 100, the overflow function will not work. If deflection happens to a live channel, overflow also won’t work until the case is removed from the agent’s assignment. ​ Manual or Macro Assignment Over 100: If a case is manually assigned, assigned based on stickiness/preferred assignment (pending confirmation) or assigned via macro, it may push the agent’s capacity beyond 100. Case Assignment Automatic Case Assignment Sprinklr automatically assigns cases to agents based on capacity availability: Agents do not handle voice and chat simultaneously; Once an agent’s capacity reaches 100, no more cases will be automatically assigned; An overflow of one additional chat or voice case is allowed only if the agent's capacity is filled with offline cases (email or social); Cases only count as consumed capacity when assigned to an agent; Macros should be used to update case status and remove assignments when necessary, ensuring agents are not overloaded. Manual Case Assignment Cases can be manually assigned to an Agent. However, we don't instruct agents to do it unlesse authorized by the Supervisor. Those are the two ways to manually assign cases: Using the "Assign to X" Macro: Only for Supervisors to use. The Supervisor can apply the macro "Assign to X" and select to which agent the case will be assigned to. Clicking the “Assign to Me” button: Agents can only do it if authorized by the Supervisor. Checking Assignment Type To see how a case was assigned: Open the Queue Monotoring tab. Double-click on the agent’s “Detailed Consumed Capacity” . A side panel will open showing all assigned cases. The last assignment type will be listed at the bottom of each case panel: FAIR_ASSIGNMENT – Assigned via automatic fair routing. PREFERRED_ASSIGNMENT – Assigned based on preferred routing settings. MACRO – Assigned via macro action. MANUAL – Assigned manually by a user.

title: Announcement Feature for Supervisors

title: How to change Agents Skills Configuration
content: This article provides instructions on how to modify Agents' Skills configuration. ​ ​ Table of Content ​ What is Agent Skills configuration? ​ How to check the Skill configuration per agent? ​ What is the expected Skill configuration per Line of Business? ​ When to make changes? ​ How to make changes on Skills configuration ​ ​ -> Changing Line of Business (Skills IDs) for Agents -> Changing Channels/Markets for Agents What is Agent Skills configuration? When a customer has a problem, they want to talk to someone who knows how to fix it. The Skills configuration is what makes sure that the customer's problem goes to the right agent. For this to happen, the Agent needs to have the right Skills set-up, and those skills are: market, language (if applicable), channel, line of business, BPO code. IMPORTANT: The Skills mentioned above are already configured when the user is onboarded at Emma and their account is created, based on the information provided by BPOs to the Emma IT team. How to check the Skill configuration per agent? 1) On the Supervisor Console, you need to open the "Team Monitoring" tab, and there you can check each agent. Next to the agent name, you have to click on the small black arrow that indicates "Open details" and then click on Properties" in the right side menu. 2) After you open the Agent Properties, you have to check the following 4 fields: " Skill IDs" : indicates the Line of Business that the agents supports (i.e.: Support X Online Reputation X Offline, etc) " User Channel Handling ": indicates which channel the agent supports (i.e.: Email X Voice X Chat, etc) " Market ": indicates the market/country the agent supports, and it can be more than one if applicable. " Voice direction ": If the agent supports Voice channel, this field it's irrelevant. However, for agents that support other channel and still have to make calls to customer, this field need to indicate "Outbound". Note: Don't worry if you see different information in other fields like "Channel" and "Line of business" . The only fields that will determine the case assignment are the ones indicated on the list above. What is the expected Skill configuration per Line of Business? ​ D2C Customer Support : “Skills Ids” required: Support and Sleep Experts “User Channel Handling” options: Email and/or Voice and/or Chat Market options: according to the market(s) supported D2C Online Reputation & HLE : “Skills Ids” required : Online Reputation and High Level Escalations “User Channel Handling” options: Social and Email Market options: according to the market(s) supported "Voice Direction" field: mandatory to indicate "Outbound". B2B (Wholesale) “Skills Ids” required: Offline and/ or Marketplaces “User Channel Handling” options: Email and/or Voice Market options: according to the market(s) supported O&O (Store) “Skills Ids” required: Store “User Channel Handling” options: Email and/or Voice (only for ES and PT that Voice is applicable) Market options: according to the market(s) supported "Voice Direction" field: mandatory to indicate "Outbound". Backoffice - N/A - don't use Disclaimer: In case of doubts regarding the correct channels to use per line of business, please reach out to your BPO account manager. When to make changes? Changes can be made for situations such as: - Agent moved to another team. Example: CS agent moved to Online Reputation team; or to Offline team. - Agent is temporarily giving support to another market or channel. Example: Voice only agent for FR is now supporting FR Email queue. ​ Once you make any change to the Agent Skills configuration, it means the agent will now have the criteria of another Queue and only receive the cases related to that Queue. How to make changes on Skills configuration: You will only need to make those changes if one agent will give support to a new/different working queue. The first step indicates how to change the Line of Business; and the second step shows how to modify the channel and/or market. -> Changing Line of Business (Skills IDs) for Agents: ​ Note: After 4th March, the only Skills visible to be changed on that option are: Emma Skills and BPOs . This is the expected behavior. If you need to change other criteria on the agent configuration, check the next part of this article. Please follow the instructions below: At the Supervisor Console, open the "Team Monitoring" option present on the left hand side menu; Select the necessary users; Click on the "Edit/Add Skill"; On the new screen, select the skill category you want to change/edit and add it to the agent. On the option Proficiency , DO NOT change, keep always on 100. ​ IMPORTANT Note: It is MANDATORY TO NOT change anything under the part named "Capacity"! If the Capacity field is empty for any agent, please raise a ticket on the IT Portal asking for the capacity to be configured. -> Changing Channels/Markets for Agents: Then for this, you need to change the Channel and the Market too. For that, check the following instructions: At the Supervisor Console, open the "Team Monitoring" option present on the left hand side menu; Select the necessary users; Click on the "Macro" option and select "Set Agent Fields" macro; Select the relevant Channel, Market and Language (if applicable) to put an agent to diffeent user groups and ultimately putting them to correct work queue. The "Voice Direction" field: If the agent supports Voice channel, this field it's irrelevant. However, for agents that support other channel and still have to make calls to customer, this field need to indicate "Outbound". ​ ​ ​ ​ ​

title: How To: Check Activity of Agents
content: When an agent status goes to "unavailible" - checking the activity of the agent allows you to understand if this is do to connection issues, or a different issue. What could be the cause of a "connection issue?" - headset not in sync - internet issues - agent changing it manually - or a variety of other causes How to check the activity 1. In the Supervisor Console, open “queue monitoring” 2. Select the agent(s) that you need to check 3. Click the three dots next to their name and select "view activity" 4. A pop up window will appear on the right side of the screen. Change the drop down menu to "Admin" 5. In this screen, look for the information under the indication "User avalibility status" and "Avalibility Status Updation Reason" From this, you can understand the issue.

title: Sprinklr tool guide for Quality Analysts
content: Table of content QA Persona Breakdown How to assign tickets for assignment? For Quality Audits For DSAT scrubbing How to perform the evaluations on the tickets assigned to you? QA Persona Breakdown The Quality Analyst persona on Sprinklr contains four tabs, that you can switch through at the top left corner of your screen, and which are, in order of appearance: The Home 🏠 page, where you will have an overview of your completed audits, the ones still pending completion and the cases where agents have disputed the audit score. The Cases tab ©️, where you will be able to filter the tickets you will assign for Quality audits or DSAT scrubbing. The Reports 📈 tab, where you will see several different reports on the already performed audits and where you will also be able to export the raw data * pertaining to these audits. * Note: All raw data tabs will contain data pertaining to a single assessment grid. And, finally, the Knowledge base 📖 tab, which will give you access to all the articles included in our internal Knowledge Base. How to assign tickets for assessment? In order to assign tickets for assessment you will need to go to the Cases tab and apply the filters you want to use for the sampling process. After this the process will split, depending on the type of assessment you want to conduct. -> For Quality audits Filters to be used: - Custom date filter (to sort the tickets from the time period you wish to review); (Usually this will be the previous week, Monday to Sunday, unless asked otherwise by your manager.) ​ - "Last assigned user (Case)" containing "Agent 1", "Agent 2", etc.; (Include all agents that you wish to review.) ​ - "Status (Case)" containing "Closed"; ​ - "Sampled for evaluation (Case)" not containing "Yes"; (Optional filters include "Category (Case)", "Subcategory (Case)" and "Sub-subcategory (Case)", if your weekly assignment includes targetting specific ticket categorizations.) How to assign the tickets for auditing: ​ 1 - After applying all your filters, scroll down to the very bottom of the page (this is very important, because it will allow you to select more than the standard 50 tickets). Then select all tickets from the list, by ticking the very first box above the ticket list: 2 - At the bottom of your screen click on 🪄 Macro , and then on the search bar look for QM: Sample 1/2/3/4 Case/s per agent (the choice here will be based on the number of tickets you want to audit per agent). A pop-up window will then appear with two options. Audit Form , where you will select the assessment grid you want to use for the audits, and a second tab, Calibration Happening , where you will select No . Afterwards, you only need to click Apply . Since this process will require randomization, the tickets will take around 45 minutes to be available to you on the Home page, under the tab Cases Open for Evaluation . -> For DSAT scrubbing Filters to be used: - Custom date filter (to sort the tickets from the time period you wish to review); (Usually this will be the previous week, Monday to Sunday , unless asked otherwise by your manager.) ​ - "Last assigned user (Case)" containing "Agent 1", "Agent 2", etc.; (Include all agents that you wish to review.) - "CSAT - How would you rate your overall experience with our Customer Service team based on your recent interaction?" containing "1", "2", "very bad" and "bad". (Please remember to change the "very bad" and "bad" filters to the language of the market you will be reviewing.) ​ How to assign the tickets for auditing: ​ 1 - Manually select each ticket you want to audit, from the previous filtered ticket list: 2 - At the bottom of your screen click on 🪄 Macro , and then on the search bar look for Assign DSAT Audit Checklist . A pop-up window will then appear with the information of the assessment grid selected for this assignment. Do not change it , and simply click Apply . Since this process will not require randomization, the tickets should be immediately available to you on the Home page, under the tab Cases Open for Evaluation . How to perform the evaluations on the tickets assigned to you? Go to the Home 🏠 page, and follow these steps: 1- Navitage to the Cases Open for Evaluation tab; 2- Click on 👁️ Show All to see all cases open for evaluation or on Evaluate to evaluate a specific case​ straight away from the displayed ticket list; 3- Go through all the questions on the left side pane, as you see the ticket on the right side pane, and once you​ finish click on Review . Additionally, if something happens and you need to pause the audit for some reason, you can always save it as a draft, selecting the drop down arrow next to Review . If you saved the evaluation as a draft, you will be able to find it later in the Drafts Open For Evaluation section on your Home 🏠 page. Note: If you need to access further information about the case that you are evaluating, click on this icon: ​ ​ ​

title: On/Offboarding Agents Process Flow for Sprinklr
content: Please review the process flow below to understand how the onboarding process works. title: Order Outcomes (Refund, Replacement, Add on, Compensation..)
content: TABLE OF CONTENTS Introduction Overview of outcomes Return (Trial Period request) Product Claim Logistic Claim Introduction When managing reverse logistic orders, we may need to trigger specific actions for the order based on the customer outcome. Magento Refund, replacement orders, add-ons, or compensation requests. Let's review the possible orders outcomes in this article. Overview of outcomes IMPORTANT: Compensation is NEVER a reason to create a Supplement Order. The creation of Supplements is ONLY to be done for "Add-on" and "Replacement". Return (Trial Period request) Return + Full refund The customer returns the product and gets his paid money fully refunded Order Management tool: Create a return and trigger a full refund No return + Discount Return is deflected based on return defense strategy (Compensation table discount offered) Order Management tool: Create a discount and provide details of the amount to be refunded. No return + Add on a Return is deflected with an add-on product ( supplement order ) such as comfort layer, pillow, or other free item we may send depending on the market strategy. Order Management tool: Create a supplement order adding related 0 value SKU (product). Product Claim Product Claim: Return + Full refund The customer returns the product and gets his paid money fully refunded Order Management tool: Mark the product claim with the return outcome and trigger a full refund Product Claim: Return + Replacement Customer returns the defective product and we replace the item with a supplement order. Order Management tool: Mark product claims with the return outcome with NO REFUND. Create a supplement order with zero value Product Claim: Compensation (return deflected) Customer agree to keep the claimed product, and we offer monetary compensation based on our compensation table. Order Management tool: Mark product claims with the compensation outcome with NO REFUND. Add a value to the compensation based on the compensation table . Product Claim: Add-on (return deflected) Customer agree to keep the claimed product, and we offer product compensation based on country strategy (as a pillow). Order Management tool: Mark the product claim with the Supplement order as the outcome with NO REFUND. Create a supplement order with zero value with the offered item. Logistic Claim Logistic Claim: Return + Full refund The customer returns the product and gets his paid money fully refunded OR the parcel is considered lost, and the customer wants a full refund. Order Management tool: Mark the product claim with the return outcome and trigger a full refund Logistic Claim: Return + Replacement Customer returns the defective product and we replace the item with a supplement order OR the parcel is considered lost, and we replace it with a supplement order. Order Management tool: Mark product claims with the return outcome with NO REFUND. Create a supplement order with zero value Logistic Claim: Compensation (return deflected) Customer agrees to keep the claimed product, and we offer monetary compensation based on our compensation table OR the parcel is considered lost, and we replace it with a supplement order and offer monetary compensation based on our compensation table. Order Management tool: Mark product claims with the compensation outcome with NO REFUND. Add a value to the compensation based on compensation table . Logistic Claim: Add-on (return deflected) Customer agree to keep the claimed product, and we offer product compensation based on country strategy (as a pillow). Order Management tool: the Mark product claim with the Supplement order as the outcome with NO REFUND. Create a supplement order with zero value with the offered item.

title: The Customer Journey
content: If you think about a recent experience you had with a brand, you’d likely think back to a specific moment, situation, or interaction you had between product research and post-purchase. This timeline is commonly referred to as the Customer Journey. What is Emma's customer journey? More specifically, every time Emma welcomes new customers, those customers go through a specific decision-making process. A customer journey is an entire experience a customer has while communicating with a brand. High-quality customer service is a crucial part of a successful customer journey. The more value we offer to potential clients, the more likely they are to complete the journey: It is about understanding how our customers behave and what they expect. Pre-Sales Stage The pre-sales phase includes all aspects of a customer’s interaction with Emma before a final purchase decision has been made. At this point of the journey, we count on a joint effort of the most diverse Teams. For example, Online and Offline marketing, and User experience. In this phase, customers are aware they have a need and are searching for possible solutions. Awareness: I want to sleep better! This is probably the first thought in the customer's head, before starting to become familiar with Emma. In most cases, they have a problem that our products will be able to solve. Here, the online and offline marketing teams play an important role, they create all the communication that will awaken customers' interest to know our brand. They portray the solutions to our customer's needs. In this way, the customer starts to become familiar with Emma including through channels such as social media, website, advertising campaigns, word-of-mouth, etc. Consideration: Should I get an Emma Mattress? The customer realizes that his need must be met and actively considers whether or not to buy our products. Other competitors can be also considered. Here, the customer tends to navigate our Social Media and especially on our websites. In this stage, the User Experience Team plays an important role in making information clear and easily available to boost customer consideration. Check below some typical touchpoints during this stage. To boost your knowledge and become a sleep expert, please check these categories: CS Sleep Experts Product Knowledge Base During this time, some customers tend to contact our customer support agents to understand more about the Emma 100 nights trial period, referral program, delivery time, discount codes, guarantees, product curiosities, payment details, and more. Pre-Delivery Stage The Pre-delivery stage covers all interactions customers have with Emma after completing the payment until the product arrives at their doorstep. Purchas e: Order completed with success! During this phase, the order confirmation email with the shipping status, the estimated and actual delivery time, and any change of the confirmed order by the customer can be done. At Emma, we manage our orders using an Order Management System. That's how a customer service agent can track and edit any existing order, or solve customers' issues. For example, if the customer wishes to change the delivery address or product after the purchase, we can support that! Post-Purchase Stage The Post-delivery stage covers all interactions customers have with Emma after receiving and using the products purchased. Product Experience: Good news! Your Emma product just arrived! The wait time came to an end, it's time to try your brand new Emma product. In this phase, customers are excited and full of expectations. They will finally pass through all the experiences Emma promised to deliver, from unboxing to actually trying the product. It's time to sleep better! Naturally, in this phase, some of the customers will seek guidance from Emma. It is important to highlight that lot of the hard work that went into encouraging the sale is wasted through poor management of the post-purchase customer experience. In this way, it's required from Emma Customer Service enough skills to manage customers' expectations, solve doubts, and even the ability to deflect a return. It’s significantly easier and approximately five times less expensive to retain customers than it is to bring in new ones. Please check this article: Return Deflection: Making Impact on Returns Retention/Advocacy : You need to try this Emma product! The last step in the journey transforms our regular customers into Emma brand promoters that spread positive word of mouth and enable our continuous growth. Recall the last time you had an amazing experience with a brand, How did you behave? Probably you want all your family and friends to feel the same, so you recommended and listed all the reasons why this brand is great. A customer willingly advocating for Emma is a powerful marketing tool.

title: Meet Emma: Our history
content: Where it all began 2013 The journey began with our two founders, Manuel Muller and Dennis Schmoltzi, who were friends that shared the same vision: to improve people's lives by changing the way they sleep. At that time, the mattress market was still almost entirely based offline and characterized by products that were difficult to differentiate and prices that weren't transparent. As a first step, our founders wanted to ease the shopping process by taking it online. Team members: 7 Yearly revenue: €5.3 thousand It starts small-literally The first move was launching our multi-brand platform Dormando. In the beginning, we only sold other brands and the first sales were two Dunlopillo mattresses. Funnily enough, we ended up buying this brand in 2016. In these early stages. we were a team of just 7 and were working out of a tiny, 14m office which we nicknamed: "The Foxhole". Growth begins 2014 As our business model proved successful, we extend our product portfolio and, already convinced that the long-term solution would be omnichannel, we opened a showroom in Offenbach called Bettzeit. This also became the new office space we desperately needed as we added 13 new members to our team. Team members: 20 Yearly revenue: €538 thousand Emma is born 2015 While busy running and scaling Dormando, we decided to branch out and create our own brand alongside. We had the background needed to develop a great product: Manuel's previous industry experience with medical mattresses and our 2-year market experience with Dormando. Therefore, three months and many late nights later, Emma was born. We'd recognized early on that the principle of "trying it out" is the key to success-an idea that still determines our daily business today. This led us to offer consumers the novelty of mattress trials that lasted 100 nights with free delivery and returns. By now, we are at 55 team members and so we moved once again- this time to a 285 m2 office space. Team members: 55 Yearly revenue: €3 million Expanding into new markets 2016 We've always been ambitious and had our sights set on global growth. So, after launching the Emma mattress in Germany the previous year, we then launched it in Austria, Switzerland, Poland, the Netherlands, and the UK as well. We also acquired Dunlopillo's brand rights for Germany and Austria. Setting the base for further growth by leveraging our ability in creating superior sleep products, we built up an in-house Research & Development team. With a wide variety of skills, this team pushes the boundaries of what material, technology, and neuroscience can do for sleep. Team members: 85 Yearly revenue: €20 million Emma breaks even 2017 This was the year where the Emma mattress won 2 awards: UK's Which? and Netherlands' Consumentenbond. This was proof of the quality of our product and that online mattress suppliers could successfully compete with traditional brands. "Emma is a team with skin in the game" and we value the impact of testing over endless planning-this ensures our accelerated growth. As a result, we expanded into 5 more countries and launched Emma in France, Belgium, Italy, Spain, and Portugal. The decision to expand paid off and our yearly revenue reached 33 million-meaning Emma had now broken even. Team members: 130 Yearly revenue: €33 million Creation of Emma Sleep University 2018 Our growth continued to climb as we launched Emma in Sweden, Denmark, China, the USA, and India. And at 176 people, we had outgrown our office once again and moved to a new 2 061 m2 space. This accelerated growth is largely thanks to the "Emma way" - we're agile, execution-oriented, and move at a fast and efficient pace. We decided we needed a way to transfer this mindset to future Emmies. The solution? We founded Emma Sleep University. Team members: 176 Yearly revenue: €80 million Emma is online in 20+ markets 2019 The year began with us exhibiting at various trade fairs like IMM Cologne (Germany) and Salone del Mobile (Italy). We were on an omnichannel mission to disrupt the sleep industry. As a result, we launched our new Dunlopillo Smart Select Series which introduced our patented graphite technology to the market. Emma was now online in over 20 countries after launching in Ireland, Brazil, Mexico, Australia, and Canada. Intent on becoming a true international player, we opened Emma Southeast Asia in Manila. To stay focused, we decided to close Dormando and exclusively sell our own products. Team members: 290 Yearly revenue: €150 million Exponential growth 2020 Emma was going from strength to strength. In a single year, we sold 1.5 million mattresses and grew our yearly revenue by 170%. With this, we outpaced several competitors and established ourselves as the world's leading D2C sleep brand. Our monumental success didn't go up unnoticed and in April 2020 Emma merged with the Haniel Group. With Haniel as a strong partner at our side, we saw it as an opportunity to move to a whole new level of growth. Team members: 528 Yearly revenue: €405 million Reinventing sleep 2021 The dedicated work of Emma's Research and Development team meant sleep entered a whole new sphere as we launched Emma Motion. the world's most advanced smart mattress. Using innovative and proprietary technology, we now offer customers a product that silently adjusts to their sleeping positions throughout the night. With the launch of this mattress, we took a huge step towards fulfilling our mission: to change the way people sleep. Soon we'll provide an individual sunrise for everyone- stay tuned. Check out & recap your CS Onboarding training presentation: Meet Emma - The Sleep Company by Luma Moreira

title: The Emma DNA
content: This is the overview of our Emma DNA . It describes our culture and the way we work together. We believe that this DNA makes us successful as a company. We are entrepreneurs. We seek opportunities, seize, and maximize them. We encourage calculated risk-taking and new ideas. We take ownership across the company. We don’t recognize territories. We have a can-do mindset. We make an impact. We make change happen. We question the status quo. We discover how to improve. We go beyond what exists. We create leading customer experiences. We are agile. We hypothesize, test, and adapt. We work based on hypotheses. We see failure as a step toward success. We take small steps, review, and adjust. We build processes that support agility where needed. We share early, openly, and broadly. We take rational decisions. We seek what is best for Emma. We make decisions irrespective of our level, background, or tenure. We don’t ask for approval. We decide, share, and act. We are non-hierarchical and non-silo. We measure what needs to be managed. We are honest and direct. We openly address anything we need to. We challenge one another. We give clear personal feedback. We question actions that are inconsistent to our values. We are candid and respectful. We build high-performing teams. We are a high-performing team. We complement each other. We actively build our team. We develop and retain talent. We are one team. We are one team, one dream. We listen to understand. We do not finger point. We are “no company politics” and “no ego.” Find the long version with a detailed description and explanation of what this DNA means for you in everyday working life attached: pdf Emma_DNA.pdf 0.20067214965820312 MB

title: Vision & Mission: It's time to awaken your best.
content: Emma was founded on one basic principle: to enhance people's sleep. But nowadays, it's much more than that . We are on a mission to lead, disrupt, and reinvent the whole sleep industry At Emma, we believe a great night’s sleep is transformational . It can make your waking life much more joyful, productive, and complete. It’s backed up by all the science and is nothing new for us: it is something that we at Emma celebrate and are dedicated to. So, it is time for us to evolve our brand, being part both of the sleeping world and the waking world and celebrating the importance of sleep. It is time to awaken: Emma. Awaken Your Best . Our mission We are transforming the world of sleep, emerging as the #1 global sleep brand. As you could see in our Meet Emma - Our History article, Emma – The Sleep Company is a founder-managed company and the world’s leading Direct-to-consumer sleep brand. Founded in 2013 by Dr. Dennis Schmoltzi and Manuel Mueller in Germany, the company is active in more than 30 countries and achieved a turnover of EUR 645 million (USD 733 million) in 2021, a growth rate of 59 percent from the previous year. Emma® products are sold via an omnichannel approach, including D2C/online, marketplaces and more than 3,500 brick-and-mortar stores. Emma successfully collaborates with over 200 retailers. Emma is on a strong growth trajectory In 2021, Emma grew again 59% to a revenue of EU 645 million. Emma is on a strong growth trajectory We successfully collaborate with more than 200 retail partners; our products are available at more than 3,500 physical stores. Emma is on a strong growth trajectory We develop excellent sleep products and already won more than 75 product awards worldwide.

title: About Foams: Simplified
content: Table of contents E mma Foams What is density? What is compression hardness? Properties of Coldfoam / HRX Properties of viscoelastic foam/ memory foam/ adaptive comfort foam Properties of Gelfoam / Airgocell Properties of Diamond Degree Emma Foams Foams are the product of the reaction of Polyols and Toluoldiisocyanat (TDI). The Emma foams are not heated (cold foam). The Emma foams are stabilized and colored by additives. The Emma foams rolled with high pressure, so all Pores can open. The Emma foams differ in density, resilience, consistency, open pores, and compression hardness. What is density? Density means KG of material per cubic meter. The higher the density, the more stable the mattress. The higher the density, the heavier the mattress becomes. The higher the density, the lower is the breathability of the mattress is. Density is not the decisive factor of the hardness of a mattress but there is an influence. What is compression hardness? Compression hardness refers to the structure created within a foam by the action of pressure inside a foam. At a low compression hardness, the foam structure is neatly arranged on top of each other, the pressure exerted from above is distributed linearly in the mattress and the foam offers little resistance. The result - the mattress is very soft. Although, If you increase the compression hardness, you change the structure of the foam. In a simplified representation, you can imagine the structure as brickwork with staggered stones. The pressure exerted from above is distributed downwards in a pyramid shape and the foam acquires a significantly higher restoring force. The foam is very firm. Core Properties Properties of Cold foam - HRX Ideal support material for mattresses. Stable. Open-pored. High restoring force. Low-pressure relief. Adaptation through various cutting techniques. Properties of viscoelastic foam/ memory foam/ adaptive comfort foam Most adaptable foam. Visco offers the highest-pressure relief. Adapts pressure immediately and ensures a quiet lie. Extremely compact due to high density. Uneven lying behavior depends on the season. Visco has nothing to do with viscose - a textile fiber but describes the material behavior. Properties of Gelfoam / Airgocell More pressure relieving than cold foam, less pressure relieving than Visco. More resilient than Visco - but more elastic than cold foam. Best ventilated foam. Stable and durable. Properties of Diamond Degree Graphite particles are added to the surface of the mattress and topper. Underneath the foam is a graphite layer that dissipates the heat. Demonstrably more heat was conductive! It helps the body to reach the lowered sleeping temperature of 35.5 degrees faster. Relieves pressure like Visco. Conducts heat away in advance. Ideally ventilated. Prolongs restful deep sleep phases by up to 12%.

title: About Springs: Simplified
content: Springs When talking about springs is important to consider that: The higher the spring travel, the more adaptable a spring is! Bonell Spring For Bonell spring cores, the more rounds a spring core makes, the higher its quality. The correct term for this is gears. Bonell springs in the base of Emma Boxspring Beds can be very useful, especially if you want a low-priced but long-lasting product. Although, when choosing a mattress, due to the lack of point elasticity of Bonell Springs, it is more advisable to go for the pocket spring core mattress. All Emma Mattresses with springs use pocket springs . Pocket Springs The pocket spring core belongs to the genus of barrel springs and is characterized by its double conical shape. That is, the spring core is slightly wider toward the center and narrows slightly toward the top and bottom. The barrel spring core is not completely cylindrical. This gives it more elasticity. Because each spring moves individually and is connected only by small pockets, pocket spring cores are considered more point-elastic and adaptable than Bonell spring core mattresses. In addition to the height, the number of springs, and the quality of the springs used are also considered a burr gauge of quality. However, recent studies and tests by Stiftung Warentest show that above 250 springs per square meter there is no noticeable improvement in the lying properties. The materials with which the spring core is padded are more decisive here. Basically, all innerspring are considered to be particularly well ventilated, since more air can circulate within the mattress. Compared to traditional foams, they are the better choice for people who sweat a lot. However, since innerspring is made of steel, the mattresses are on average 20 to 25% heavier than an identical mattress made of foam. This is where you need to weigh things up when making a purchase.

title: How to find your perfect Emma Pillow
content: "How to choose a pillow” is often a question neglected by many people. Mattresses get a lot of attention these days and rightly so. After all, whether you get a good night’s rest will depend be tremendously on the type of foundation where we spend many hours of our lives sleeping. However, people often forget another component that is also extremely important: your pillow. Using a bad pillow can result in you waking up with pain in your neck and shoulders or other areas of your body. It can also affect your ability to fall and stay asleep. Your perfect pillow will depend on your body and sleep habits. Remember, your pillow should be comfortable and support your head, neck, and shoulders. So, how do you choose a perfect pillow? 3 Tips for choosing the perfect pillow Selecting a pillow does come down to individual preferences and your sleeping position, but here are some good tips to consider before you make your purchase: Choose the right filling Feather pillows (down pillows) might be an option for you if you prefer light and soft pillows that come from duck or goose fibres. However, these pillows can be quite expensive and are not hypoallergenic. Microfibre and cotton are options for those that need a hypoallergenic pillow that is also firm. Memory foam is for those that want a pillow that adapts to your specific shape. Memory foam pillows are also ideal for those with head, neck, or shoulder pain since they contour to the specific areas and offer support. Weight and size Depending on how much you move your pillow during the night, weight might be an important issue for you. Cotton and down pillows are lighter than memory foam and latex options. Most people will be happy with standard pillow sizes, which are also easier to find pillowcases for. If you decide to go with a smaller or larger pillow, make sure the case you select is the right size and that you aren’t stuffing your pillow inside the case or letting it lay in a sea of fabric. Breathable and Washable fabric Select a pillow with a breathable and washable pillowcase or cover. A breathable pillowcase will ensure that heat flows from your head to the pillow and out into the atmosphere, so you don’t overheat during the night. No one wants to wake up with sweat all over the neck or head, right? That is why we incorporated moisture-wicking UltraDry technology into our pillow. It guarantees you sleep cool and comfortable. Pillow for different types of sleepers Do sleep positions influence your choice of a perfect pillow? The short answer is YES. The answer is more complicated to explain since we all change positions during the night, so no one is a side or back sleeper all the time. That being said, there are probably some positions that you favour a bit more than others. For example, I rarely ever wake up on my side but more often on my back or stomach. Here are some basic rules that will help you in determining which pillow matches your sleeping style: Pillow For Stomach Sleepers Stomach Sleepers like soft pillows and in some cases, no pillow at all. Instead of having a pillow underneath their heads, front sleepers might opt for a pillow under their stomach and pelvis to attain alignment. Emma pillow is designed with this scenario in mind. The adjustable three-layer foam design makes it possible for you to remove any layer, and keep the one(s) that supports you the best. Pillow For Back Sleepers Back Sleepers usually favour a thinner, flatter pillow for keeping the neck in alignment with the spine. They may also favour a softer pillow. However, if you are already experiencing neck pain, a supportive pillow would also be an ideal choice. In this case, try to find a pillow that still feels soft but also provides sufficient support. With the Emma pillow, you can mix any two layers of foam to get the perfect level of support and comfort. As a back sleeper, I personally like to position the HRX foam layer at the bottom of the pillow, together with the ZeroGravity viscoelastic foam layer on the top of the pillow. While the top part contours my neck and relieves pressure, the bottom part gives enough support to keep my neck well-positioned. The combination is always flexible, treat this as a “Lego game”, you will find your best mix and match. Pillow For Stomach Sleepers Side Sleepers, on the contrary, would prefer a thicker, firmer pillow . According to SleepFoundation.org, a good rule of thumb is to find a pillow that is as thick as the distance between your shoulder and the opposite ear. Thinking about measuring the distance already? No need! At Emma, we believe that the best way to find your perfect pillow is to try it out yourself. Emma offers a 200 night trial period for not just its award-winning mattress , but also for its premium memory foam pillow. Why not take advantage of it and try Emma pillow out? Conclusion Choosing the right mattress means a lot for a night of better sleep, but the pillow also plays an equally important role when improving your sleep quality. It is critical you take your sleep habits into account when choosing a pillow. Besides, the right filling and cover also matter a lot. Most importantly, you should always try the pillow out before making your final decision. Try the Emma pillow , you will not regret it!

title: Temperature and Mattresses
content: TABLE OF CONTENTS Knowledge Tidbits Do innerspring mattresses allow better airflow and temperature regulation than foam mattresses? Knowledge Tidbits Changes in temperature can influence the circadian rhythm (cf. card on "circadian rhythm") that dictates our sleep-wake cycle, and ultimately affect our sleep. Sleep onset usually coincides with the decline in the core body temperature. Therefore, sleep characteristics can be influenced by the thermal property of the mattress. A study showed that young individuals who slept on a high heat capacity mattress (HHCM) have more regular and pronounced sleep cycles over the course of the night as compared to individuals who slept on a conventional mattress. Participants also showed elevated deep sleep values in the second part of the night which is an important sleep stage that enables proper brain functioning and learning. A HHCM is able to efficiently conduct heat and remove excess body heat of the sleeper. This facilitates a reduction in core body temperature, which can enhance the sleep experience. Similarily, a high rise (HR) mattress topper is better at inducing a greater drop in core body temperature in the early stages of sleep than a traditional memory foam mattress. This reduction in temperature was observed regardless of age. Do innerspring mattresses allow better airflow and temperature regulation than foam mattresses? A study (Forrest R. Cannon & Emiel A. DenHartog, 2019) was conducted to assess the effect of an inverted heat plate of 35 °C on three different types of mattresses: innerspring mattress, foam mattress, and foam mattress with phase change materials (PCMs) Surface temperature, heat flux generated, thermal resistance and the time required to reach steady state thermal resistance were considered Differences in the thermal properties of the mattresses were found in the short term (initial 30 minutes) and long term: The innerspring mattress required a significantly higher heat flux to maintain a test plate surface temperature of 35°C after the first 30 minutes and for the rest of the experiment than the foam mattress or the foam mattress with phase change materials --> indicator that heat was released more easily from the innerspring mattress, and retained more strongly in the foam / foam PCMs mattress The innerspring mattress showed a lower average thermal resistance compared to the other mattresses both after the first 30 minutes and for the rest of the experiment --> meaning it released the temperature faster than the foam. This explains why an innerspring mattress might be perceived cooler and more comfortable on hot nights The spring mattress also attained the f astest its steady-state thermal resistance However, it should be borne in mind that this study worked with a heated plate and not with human subjects Humans have a more mixed interface between skin/possible clothing and mattress, with different pressure distributions and air layers between mattress and skin Recommendations by the experts at Emma When purchasing a mattress, comfort, size, and price are common factors considered by customers. However, the material of the mattress, in terms of heat conductance, is aso a crucial factor to consider. We recommend buying a mattress that has a high heat capacitance that can efficiently conduct body heat and reduce the body temperature during the course of the night. It helps to prevent hot and sweaty nights that we spent tossing and turning.

title: The 3 steps for the right Mattress
content: When supporting our customers in finding the right mattress, Emma CS should also focus on raising customer awareness regarding the product by providing clear information related to the following four topics: Ergonomics Pressure Relief Ventilation Ergonomics The healthiest posture for the spine is standing upright. Good mattresses try to bring the spine to a horizontal position during sleep. In the upright position, the vertebrae and intervertebral discs sit on top of each other and distribute the resulting pressure optimally. With load and movement, the intervertebral discs are stressed. Therefore, it is important that the shoulder and pelvis sink into the mattress, the waist finds support and the spine lies straight. Poor ergonomics on a mattress leads to: Frequent turning on the mattress Back pain Neck pain Tensions Headaches Stress Tiredness Sleeplessness Depression. Emma mattresses are ergonomically designed for all body shapes: Pressure relief The more point-elastic a mattress is on the surface, the less pressure on the skin, and the better is the blood circulation . Missing pressure relief can lead to: The hands fall asleep if there is no pressure relief. Circulatory disorders. Pressure pain in the Hip area. Pressure points at the Body. In rare cases, hands and feet can be colder. Emma mattresses with memory foam enable pressure relief: They adapt perfectly to your body shape. People with joint pain will appreciate the conforming ability of a memory foam mattress, as it gives the feeling of hugging the pressure points of the body. Provides spinal support. Memory foam conforms to your body, helping to keep your spine in neutral alignment. This ensures you won’t wake up with a sore back. Ventilation A well-ventilated mattress ensures that moisture is better removed and the sleeper has a better microclimate. Humans lose nearly 1L of body Fluids every night. Half of these are sweating. The other half we lose through the airways. 80% of the sweat-damp is discharged over the duvet. Heavy sweaters should go for a P ocket Spring Mattress , an Emma Diamond , or an Emma Fusion. Emma mattresses mentioned above enable: Temperature regulating. Facilitate the deep sleep phase. How does it work? - Emma Diamond explanation During the 1st hour of sleep: your body temperature reduces by 0.5° The heat of your body is absorbed by the mattress. On a normal mattress, the core warms up. With Emma Diamond, the following happens: Step 1 – The PCM coating on the downside of the top layer absorbs the heat Step 2 – Graphite and diamond particles release the heat away from the mattress to the edges of the mattress, where the extra heat is dissipated. After 1 hour, you will be in the deep sleep phase and your body temperature has dropped by 1.5°C. On a normal mattress, the heat loaded previously will return to you, making the foam under your body warmer. This will disturb your deep sleep phase and could awaken you. On the other hand, thanks to the release of the heat done by the Diamond Degree foam, the foam under your body has the temperature of your body. This will support your body to go into a deep sleep and will lengthen your deep sleep phase. These three points cover all relevant information to improve the customer's sleep in the long term.

title: Weighted Blankets for Sound Sleep
content: Weight blankets may be an effective and safe intervention to foster calm, thus providing an innovative, non-pharmacological approach and a complementary tool to improve sleep quality. However, study evidence here mostly relates to patient groups. The size and weight of the blanket should be individualized to the person using it so that it is neither too heavy nor too light. Scientific evidence on the impact of weighted blankets Studies conducted so far primarily focused on patients suffering from depression, anxiety, ADHS (attention deficit hyperactivity disorder), autism spectrum disorder, for example According to those studies, a weighted blanket can indeed help to feel calm and sleep better. Here’s a brief summary on selected studies: Study 1 (by Ekholm, B., Spulber, S., & Adler, M. (2020)): 120 patients (major depression, bipolar disorder, generalized anxiety, ADHS) slept with either a weighted metal chain blanket or a light plastic blanket for 4 weeks, sleep and daytime activity was monitored by wrist actigraphy After 4 weeks, the weighted blanket showed a significant advantage over the light blanket in terms of patients' insomnia (assessed by the Insomnia Severity Index) with a large effect size (Cohen's d 1.90) Patients who slept with a weighted blanket experienced: better sleep maintenance, higher daytime activity levels, reduced daytime fatigue symptoms depression and anxiety were also reduced in this group Side effects did not occur With continued use of the weighted blanket, the effects persisted during a 12-month follow-up Patients who switched from a light blanket to a weighted blanket later in the study also benefited and showed similar improvements in sleep and symptom reduction Study 2 (by Ackerley, Rochelle & Olausson, Håkan & Badre, Gaby. (2015)): 31 insomnia patients, not suffering from any other mental or physical disorder Following a baseline (pre-test) with their ordinary sleep blanket, study participants slept for 2 weeks with a weighted blanket; afterward, they returned the blanket and slept again for 1 week with their ordinary blanket (post-test) Sleep was measured using continuous actigraphy (Actiwatch) and comprehensive polysomnography (PSG) recordings in the participants’ own home Objective results of the study showed that the use of a weighted blanket compared to an ordinary sleep blanket resulted in: an increase in sleep duration a decrease in nocturnal movements Subjective assessments of the study participants were also documented and showed: that participants liked using the weighted blanket found it easier to fall asleep slept better felt more rested in the morning What’s the magic behind it? What could be the underlying mechanisms for the positive effect of weighted blankets? When we are stressed, our heart beats faster than usual This is accompanied by an activation of the sympathetic nervous system (also responsible for the activation of the fight-or-flight system), and our body is on edge To counteract this, (moderate) pressure may help, because: through pressure, the counterpart to the sympathetic nervous system, namely the parasympathetic nervous system, becomes activated, which results in a lowering of the heart rate This creates a feeling of calm and relaxation A weighted blanket may by this evoke sensations similar to the feeling of being hugged, caressed or held tightly A study (by Reynolds, S., Lane, S. J., & Mullen, B. (2015)) confirmed the effect of pressure stimulation on the activity of the sympathetic/parasympathetic nervous system: In a sample of 50 adults, it was shown that wearing a pressure vest (Vayu Vest) could reduce sympathetic arousal and simultaneously increase parasympathetic arousal after short periods of only 3 minutes In addition, better cognitive performance in brainteasers was observed, which, according to the authors, maybe due to the lower arousal when wearing the pressure vest What’s inside a weighted blanket? Fills can vary according to various parameters (above all, quality, cost and comfort). The most common fillers are steel beads, micro glass beads, sand, pebbles, and grains. Beads of steel are a popular filler for weighted blankets because they are robust, machine washable, and hefty, requiring fewer units to produce the required weight and pressure. Steel beads' primary disadvantage is typically louder than other materials. Glass microbeads are denser than other materials, which means less filler is needed, resulting in a thinner form. Micro glass beads are also machine washable. Sand may be used as a filler material, but it's not particularly popular. Indeed, clumping may be a significant issue when it comes to washing a sand-filled weighted blanket. In reality, following machine washing, specific sand blankets may not return to their former shape. The greatest problem with pebbles is that they are not always comfortable and their use can finally result in a less restorative sleep experience. Weighted blankets, may also be filled with uncooked grains, pasta, and dry beans. Grains and beans are widely accessible and low-cost, making them an appealing material for certain producers. On the other hand, these materials degrade with time, and are so, they are not a particularly long-lasting choice.

title: Dreams: Lucid Dreaming: What Is It and How To Do It?
content: What is lucid dreaming? Have you ever been in a dream where you have realized you are dreaming? Well if you answered yes, you have experienced a lucid dream. Put simply, “a lucid dream is defined as a dream during which dreamers while dreaming, are aware they are dreaming.” References to lucid dreaming date back to ancient times. Aristotle once wrote, “often when one is asleep, there is something in consciousness which declares that what then presents itself is but a dream”. The concept of lucid dreaming is also central to both the Tibetan Buddhist practice of Dream Yoga and the ancient Hindu practice of Yoga Nidra. More recently, Dutch psychiatrist and writer Frederik van Eeden first coined the term ‘lucid dream’ in his academic article entitled ‘A Study of Dreams” . If you have ever seen the movie Inception then you have encountered the concept of lucid dreaming before. The movie shows people possessing the ability to not just control the shape or content of their own dreams, but also of others. Such feats of ‘dream manipulation’ of others may seem too farfetched to be possible in our real lives however, they aren’t totally absent. When do lucid dreams occur? Lucid dreaming occurs during rapid eye movement (REM) sleep. For some, it occurs spontaneously. However, others train themselves to start dreaming lucidly. The degree to which a person can influence their dreams varies. Some people, upon realizing they are dreaming, immediately wake up due to the adrenaline rush produced by the brain. Others may be able to influence their own actions, actions of others, surroundings, and any other aspect of their environment. It isn’t entirely clear how many people experience lucid dreaming. A study in Brazil surveying 3,427 participants with a median age of 25 showed a staggering 77% of respondents saying that they had experienced lucid dreaming at least once before. It is important to note however that a consensus exists that every person is capable, with practice, of lucid dreaming. How do I lucid dream? There are many techniques one could use to induce a lucid dream state. First, a common technique used to induce lucid dreams is one called “reality testing”. For example, during the day, a person may want to ask themselves “am I dreaming right now?” as they try to make their hand pass through their other hand or perhaps a solid wall. The technique purely relies on intention. In real life, the wall will (hopefully) remain solid and impenetrable, whereas in a dream the hand will easily pass through. Another technique is “waking back to bed”. This involves the sleeper setting an alarm to wake up them about 5 to 6 hours after going to sleep. Once awake, the sleeper should remain awake for a while before going back to bed. This technique can immerse the sleeper immediately into REM sleep, drastically increasing the chance of entering a lucid dream state. Another technique that is commonly used among avid lucid dreamers is using a dream journal. A dream journal is exactly how it sounds. It is a book used to record one’s dreams. Keeping a dream journal has been shown to increase one’s ability to remember their dreams when they wake up, lucid or otherwise. Lastly, probably the most effective method of inducing lucid dreams is meditation. Meditation trains people to become more aware of themselves and their surroundings. Many people meditate with the help of binaural beats or isochronic tones. These stimulate your pineal gland to produce the hormone melatonin, which helps regulate biological rhythms such as sleep and wake cycles. The sweet spot for the brain is generally around 40Hz. (you can find countless videos of 2 – 6-hour long binaural beats videos on YouTube). Concerns & Risks One concern people express about lucid dreaming, if they achieve it, is that they may get stuck in a dream and may find it more difficult to wake up. This is not a worrying risk at all. An individual is only able to sleep and dream for a set amount of time every night before the body automatically wakes up. In short, it is impossible for someone to get “stuck” sleeping. One rational concern is to do with sleep paralysis. If you want to induce a lucid dream state through meditation, you may go through the process of sleep paralysis. This is when your body falls asleep but your mind remains conscious and “awake” leaving you effectively, paralyzed. The process is 100% safe but can be quite frightening to sleepers, especially if it is achieved unintentionally. Many people experience pleasurable tingling feelings around the body, but some may experience frightening hallucinations. In Conclusion The mind is a complex thing. The vessel in which it is contained, the brain, is the most complex system in the universe. It is estimated that the brain has at least 100 trillion neural connections. That is at least 1,000 times more than the number of stars in the Milky Way Galaxy. Our planet’s top neuroscientists and psychologists are only beginning to knock on the door of its massive potential. Perhaps over the coming years, we will be able to gain a small insight into nature’s finest creation, and what goes on in it when we shut our eyes at night.

title: Dreams: When, How and Why do we Dream?
content: When do we dream? It may seem unnecessary (but it is not) to point out that we dream while we sleep . Sleep is a multifaceted event characterized (more or less homogeneously) by the lack of processing of external sensory stimuli . Such a condition is comparable to sensory deprivation : a situation characterized by the (voluntary) absence of sensory stimuli to which, very often, correspond very vivid images that can even lead to hallucinations. Why & how do we dream? The brain’s primary purpose is now thought to be consciousness . If that’s the case, consciousness is just the brain’s interpretation and integration of all the data it has access to at any given moment. In this sense, it is possible to claim that dreaming and hallucinations are variants of the same theme , based on the premise that the brain is active in all its states (wakefulness, REM sleep, and NREM sleep). During normal wakefulness, the brain overlooks internally produced activity in favor of sensory input from the outside. Dreaming happens during sleeping because the brain is focused on endogenously evoked activity. The brain attends to external and endogenous activities concurrently under atypical circumstances, such as sleep deprivation, sensory deprivation, or medicine or drug intake, resulting in hallucinations or wakeful dreaming. Numerous neurologic disorders and illnesses that are linked to hallucinations support this theory. From what has been said above, the idea that dreaming includes a reversed sequence of perceptual experiences is derived. Instead of bottom-up (i.e., from sensations to higher cognitive elaborations), top-down is used (i.e., higher cortical levels activating lower levels). Motivational systems in the brain are usually activated in response to goal-oriented activities. However, neural activity shifts away from the perceptual regions and toward the motor areas. Therefore, the dreamer imagines rather than engages in motivated behaviors. In addition, the reflecting system in the limbic brain is inactive, causing the dreamer to mistake the dream for reality. Indeed, damage to this region makes it difficult to tell the difference between dreams and reality when awake. FUN FACT Actually, the neuroscientific conclusions drown above are not so revolutionary. Indeed, Aristotle more than 2400 years ago addressed dreaming faculty as follow: “If, then, the exercise of the faculty of sight is actual seeing, that of the auditory faculty, hearing, and, in general, that of the faculty of sense-perception, perceiving; and if there are some perceptions common to the senses, such as figure, magnitude, motion, etc., while there are others, as color, sound, taste, peculiar [each to its own sense]; and further, if all creatures, when the eyes are closed in sleep, are unable to see, and the analogous statement is true of the other senses so that manifestly we perceive nothing when asleep; we may conclude that it is not by sense-perception we perceive a dream.” REFERENCES 1. Latham, Larry M., "Hallucinations Induced by Sensory Deprivation: Fact or Fiction?" (1972). Honors Theses. 271. 2. Mahowald, M.W., Woods, S.R. & Schenck, C.H. Sleeping Dreams, Waking Hallucinations, and the Central Nervous System. Dreaming 8, 89–102 (1998). 3. “On Dreams” By Aristotle
