title: Handling Interactions coming from the Self-Identification Chatbot
content: TABLE OF CONTENTS What is the Self-Identification Chatbot? What changes for a CS agent / Sleep Expert agent? Go Live Dates How to identify a ticket from ChatBot How to handle Live Chat Inquiries Accessing Chatbot Conversation History Response Time Greetings and Authentication Recategorization Escalation Email Ticket Inquiries Ticket Prioritization Response Protocol Recategorization Ticket Prioritization Seeking Clarifications Phone Call Inquiries Transition to Phone Pre-emptive Information Access Centralizing Customer History Ticket Status Management Refresher on merging Chatbot contacts with Phone contacts Refresher on merging Chatbot tickets with Phone tickets What is the Self-Identification Chatbot? At Emma Sleep, our goal is to provide seamless and efficient customer support. Recognizing the increasing role of automation in enhancing customer service, we've implemented a chatbot, referred to as our Self-Identification Bot , on our website. This intelligent assistant helps categorize customer requests, gathers preliminary information , and in some cases, collects personal details such as name, email address, order number, and phone number. What changes for a CS agent / Sleep Expert agent? The S elf-Identification Bot works as a "pre-chat" in which the customer will provide details, so once the preliminary categorization and data collection are done, the inquiry might be directed to live chat, our email support, or a phone call (based on availability and the customer's preferences). Due to that, it's important to have a look at those previous automatic interactions, so you can be aware of what the customer already informed us and prepare yourself for the new interaction. The goal is to assure our customers feel that they are receiving a complementary and individualized suppport, and that we avoid asking again information that the customer already gave to us. This article is designed to guide our agents on how to handle these post-chatbot inquiries, ensuring a smooth transition and continued exceptional service. Go Live Dates Already Live for: IT | ES | PT | BR | SG | PH | BE | BR WhatsApp | US | CA | CL | MX | NZ | IN | SE | DE | NL | UK | AT | PL | FR How to identify a ticket from ChatBot If you need to identify if a ticket is coming from the ChatBot, you just have to verify the chat icon related to the ticket, as per the above below: Additionally, if you have to filter it, you just need to go to the field "Source" and select "Chat". How to handle Live Chat Inquiries At Emma Sleep, our live chat is a crucial bridge between automated chatbot interactions and real-time human support. The self-identification bot serves as the primary filter, ensuring that when a customer reaches our live chat agents, they are equipped with context and information to provide swift assistance. Here's a guide on how to effectively manage these inquiries: Accessing Chatbot Conversation History Upon receiving a live chat inquiry, agents can view the entire chatbot interaction within Freshchat. This conversation history will appear directly in the chat window. Agents have to review this before engaging, ensuring they are up-to-date with the customer's needs. Response Time Time is of the essence when it comes to live chat. Customers may navigate away from our website quickly, so agents must address inquiries promptly. The expectation is to respond as soon as possible, keeping the customer engaged and providing timely solutions. Greetings and Authentication Always begin by acknowledging the information the customer has already provided. This shows that we value their time and are attentive to their needs. For inquiries related to existing orders, it's crucial to validate the customer's details against our order management system. This step ensures compliance with GDPR regulations and confirms the customer's identity. An example greeting could be: "Hello [Customer Name], I see you have an inquiry about your order #[Order Number]. For security reasons, could you please provide [Specific Detail] to verify your identity?" Recategorization It's possible that the chatbot may not always categorize a customer's inquiry accurately. After reviewing the conversation history and acknowledging the customer's initial request, agents should confirm with the customer that they've understood the inquiry correctly. If a re-categorization is needed, agents can adjust the category within Freshchat. Escalation If an issue cannot be resolved during the live chat, it's important to ensure the customer still feels supported. Agents should obtain the customer's email address, assuring them that we'll be in touch shortly with a resolution. If the customer prefers, agents can also arrange a follow-up phone call. Below you can find an example of how the integration of the conversation via the Chatbot looks like in Freshchat: Email Ticket Inquiries Emma Sleep's commitment to exceptional customer support extends to email interactions. The integration of our flowbot has added another layer to our email ticketing system, providing agents with a richer context before even starting the conversation. Here's how our agents can navigate and utilize these enhanced email tickets: Ticket Prioritization Currently, email tickets originating from the chatbot are treated the same as other tickets in our system. However, it's worth noting that the pre-categorization feature of the chatbot may be utilized in the future to gauge the urgency of inquiries, potentially leading to a prioritization system. Response Protocol Given the enriched context provided by the chatbot, agents have an advantage when addressing these tickets. However, the fundamental approach remains unchanged. Agents should treat these tickets similarly to traditional email or contact form inquiries. The only difference is the added information at hand, ensuring a more personalized and efficient response. Recategorization It's essential to remember that while the chatbot is a powerful tool, it's not infallible. There may be instances where the customer's inquiry wasn't categorized correctly by the chatbot. In such cases, after reviewing the details, agents should adjust the categorization within the ticket to ensure accuracy and that the right department or team addresses the issue. Ticket Prioritization Currently, email tickets originating from the chatbot are treated the same as other tickets in our system. However, it's worth noting that the pre-categorization feature of the chatbot may be utilized in the future to gauge the urgency of inquiries, potentially leading to a prioritization system. Seeking Clarifications Transparency and clarity are paramount. If any aspect of the customer's inquiry isn't clear, agents should acknowledge the information already provided and then seek further clarification. This approach ensures that we're addressing the exact concern of the customer and not making assumptions. Introduction to the Self-Identification bot [Video under construction] Phone Call Inquiries The phone remains an integral channel for customer support at Emma Sleep, providing a personal touch and immediate assistance. Leveraging the data collected by our chatbot, we aim to make phone interactions even more streamlined and efficient. Here's a breakdown of the process for handling inquiries that transition from our chatbot to a phone call: Transition to Phone If a customer opts for phone support at the conclusion of their chatbot interaction (and if it's within business hours), they will be prompted to call our hotline. Simultaneously, a ticket is generated in the system, and the customer is provided with this ticket number. During the call, they should relay this number to the agent. The ticket number serves a dual purpose: it allows agents to quickly pull up the customer's information, and it authenticates the customer since it confirms they've just interacted with our chatbot and provided Order Number, Email Address and Full Name. The agent still needs to validate this info with the info in the OMS (Magento/Fluent). Pre-emptive Information Access Instead of agents making proactive calls based on these tickets, the system is designed for customers to reach out. When they do, agents can use the provided ticket number to instantly access the chatbot's interaction history. This means there's no need to request further authentication details from the customer, making the process smoother and more efficient. Centralizing Customer History To maintain a consolidated customer history, agents must follow a strict protocol. When a customer indicates that they've registered their inquiry through the website's chatbot, agents should: Open the corresponding ticket using the provided ticket number. Add the customer's phone number to their contact details in Freshdesk. This ensures that the ticket arising from the phone call is integrated into the customer's timeline, providing future agents with a comprehensive view of all interactions. Open the customer's profile in Freshdesk from the Ticket view. Locate and click on the 'Edit Contact' option. Input the customer's phone number in the designated field. Save the changes to update the customer's profile. Should there be any discrepancy, like an Aircall ticket not appearing in the timeline, agents should: Copy the phone number displayed in Aircall (removing any spaces). Search for this number in Freshdesk. Locate the Aircall ticket and verify why it isn't linked to the appropriate contact. Ticket Status Management Once a chatbot-generated ticket is created, it initially holds the status "Waiting for Customer". If the customer doesn't call within a stipulated timeframe and the ticket remains unattended, its status transitions to "Open". Agents should then treat it like a regular email ticket. This ensures that even if customers don't follow through with a phone call or opt out of a long wait in the phone queue, their concerns are still addressed in a timely manner. Refresher on merging Chatbot contacts with Phone contacts Refresher on merging Chatbot tickets with Phone tickets

title: [DHL] Drop off label return - CH, BE, NL, DE, AT, UK, FR - Fluent Commerce
content: Table of Contents How to initiate a return Returns via the Returns portal Manual creation of a return with DHL How the refund is triggered When can this case be resolved FAQ 1. How to initiate a return There are two options for creating a return of an accessory with DHL, a) via the Returns Portal (Fluent Commerce orders only) or b) manually. The preferred method is always to use the Returns Portal as this will automate the process without need of manual actions. Step by step guide (read carefully): Ask the customer to enter his/her data and to also add the order nr. in the reference field (this is important to track the return afterwards) If the customer has more than one parcel, ask him/her to create as many return labels as there are parcels using the link. (or do it for the customer) (If you want to take the time and do the customer a favour, you may do steps 2./3. and 4 for the customer and send the customer the finished return label) Ask the customer to print this label and to paste it on the box Some parcel shops also provide a printing service. The customer can review their parcel shop on this page, to see if it offers a printing service for the return label. Inform the customer that product(s) must be returned inside a square-shaped cardboard box or plastic bag with following maximum dimensions, otherwise it might be rejected at the drop-off point. Ask the customer to keep the return receipt until the refund is issued. The customer needs to send us a proof of return. Once we receive the proof of return, you need to manually update the status of the return to 'Complete'. Once the status is set to 'Complete', this will trigger the refund process. If the customer did not receive the e-mail: Provide the customer this link here depending on the market (copy the link as is, do not click in before): DE : https://www.dhl.de/retoure/gw/rpcustomerweb/OrderEntry.action?hash=b74d0a3d3565d92a1fd6166d3d527cb9f65231891d1a9f5557de44052f0fb709 AT : https://www.dhl.de/retoure/gw/rpcustomerweb/OrderEntry.action?hash=a582de6c9ab94d077939c3cde3d606b5df9be8e25dbadab526c3dbd398054947 BE : https://www.dhl.de/retoure/gw/rpcustomerweb/OrderEntry.action?hash=ca377a67ceb65c29b6d3ed70f01c037cac4e045c6b1551a9f33084f9ecacd986 NL : https://www.dhl.de/retoure/gw/rpcustomerweb/OrderEntry.action?hash=468830c161c8f22c1bcb723a69be3b5736812c7e92f9a828216e7d0eef1c954f PL : https://www.dhl.de/retoure/gw/rpcustomerweb/OrderEntry.action?hash=3edff50f0871f4980c149691d7d5b6dd82e3ba0db6ded07294cc3582ba847035 CH : https://www.dhl.de/retoure/gw/rpcustomerweb/OrderEntry.action?hash=84ab809c4a9228587abad89ceb44008d9a071f02c3afa142a2920e0989383ea7 UK : TBD FR : https://www.dhl.de/retoure/gw/rpcustomerweb/OrderEntry.action?hash=da08269d8316fa7775f735341a4363669c80a3deb4165e2b3ad87cc97c1a67cd Only for DE : also offer option to present the QR-code when handing over the parcel (multiple parcels: repeat for every parcel with a different return label. DHL will only accept one-time usage of a label.) ​ Ask the customer to return the parcel thef following ways: DE : DHL parcel shop, pack station or take away from DHL delivery person (further info here: https://www.dhl.de/de/privatkunden/pakete-versenden/retoure.html) The customer also has option to book a pick-up with DHL using the following link, but has to pay the additional fee (currently 3€) him/herself in the booking portal: https://www.dhl.de/de/privatkunden/pakete-versenden/online-frankieren.html?type=Pickup AT : ÖPAG parcel shop, handover to the ÖPAG Postmen or drop-off in parcel locker CH : Swiss post parcel shop or drop-off in parcel locker NL : PostNL parcel shop or handover to the PostNL Postmen (max. 5 items for take away) BE : BPost parcel shop PL : Poczta Polska parcel shop UK : TBD FR : TBD Important note: Product(s) must be returned inside a square-shaped cardboard box or plastic bag with following maximum dimensions, otherwise it might be rejected at the drop-off point.: DE: 120x60x60cm /31.5kg (unpacked possible with certain drop-off points) AT: 100x60x60cm / 31.5kg CH: 120x60x60cm / 30.0kg NL: 120x50x50cm / 30.0kg BE: 120x60x60cm / 30.0kg PL: 120x60x60cm / 31.5kg UK: TBD FR: TBD Ask the customer to keep the return receipt until the refund is issued. 2. How the refund is triggered For Fluent Commerce Once the return is completed via the drop off, the status in Fluent Commerce will get updated automatically to 'Complete'. This status update will then automatically trigger the refund process. 3. When can this case be considered resolved? Once the customer has his/her return label, and they have no further questions, you can close the ticket. 4. FAQ Couldn't find your answer in the FAQ? Please escalate to your supervisor. They will get in touch with Emma to clarify your concerns.

title: [Evri] Drop off returns - UK
content: Evri is the returns carrier for accessories in the UK that weigh up to 10 kg (updated per November 25th, 2024). Because we have the Return Portal, there is no need for the customer to reach the customer support line. If the customer raises a ticket asking to return an accessory, please educate them to use the Return widget. Please check the article " Self-Return Portal " to understand better the actions you have to take. If a customer asks for your help, please help them by creating the return via the return portal. In the UK, accessories that weigh >10 kg are picked up by DPD. Since all accessory returns must go via the Return Portal, there is no difference in the workflow for our support agents. DPD is the returns carrier for toppers and blankets up to 10kgs in France (updated per November 25th, 2024). Because we have the Return Portal, there is no need for the cusotmer to reach the customer support line. If the customer raises a ticket asking to return an accessory, please educate them to use the Return widget. Please check the article " Self-Return Portal " to understand better the actions you have to take. If a customer asks for your help, please help them by creating the return via the return portal. All returns for larger items are managed by Rhenus. If a customer asks for a return of a larger item (beds or mattresses), follow the steps below. First, open Fluent Commerce. Click on "Filter" and then select "Ref." Click on the order number related to the return. When you have opened the order, click on the three dots and choose either "Create Return with Refund" or "Create Return without Refund," depending on the nature of the return. When prompted, click on the (+) button to specify the number of articles you wish to return. Fill in the mandatory fields, using a (-) to indicate required information. Note that the carrier field must be left empty . Once all necessary details are provided, submit the form to initiate the return. What is the status of the return after I create it? The status must be set to 'Return Created'. Never manually move the status to 'Return Organized'. ​ How is the request send to the return carrier? Once you create the return, the return request will automatically be transmitted to Rhenus, our returns partner for larger items. ​ How is the return completed? Once the carrier completes the return, the return will automatically be marked as 'Complete' in Fluent Commerce (note, this is not the case for Magento!). For cancelled returns, you (the agent) should manually mark the return as 'Cancelled' in Fluent. ​ How is the refund triggered? Once the return status gets set to 'Complete', the refund process will be triggered automatically. It will depend on the payment method used how long it takes for the refund to be processed. Usually, this can take up to 14 working days, depending on the payment provider. If the customer has questions about the status of the refund, they can best contact their payment provider directly.

title: [MeteorSpace/DPD] 1MH Returns - IE
content: MeteorSpace is our main 1MH carrier in Ireland. If MeteorSpace cannot collect in the customer's area, they request the collection with DPD. Content Manually creating returns with MeteorSpace How to verify if the return was created correctly How are status updates handled for the return How is the Refund Triggered? When can this return ticket be considered 'Resolved' Manually creating returns with MeteorSpace Step 1 : Check for Active Returns: Ensure there is no active return in Fluent Commerce for the same items (the customer might have already created a return via the portal). Step 2 : Create Return in OMS (Fluent): Carrier field: Fluent Commerce: MeteorSpace (If they reply that DPD is going to service the area, use DPD_IE) Pick up date: Leave empty Return status: Do not move to 'Organized' Step 3 : Please send an E-mail to: "Sikander Mosani" - sikander.mosani@meteorspace.com "Muneeb Qureshi" - muneeb.qureshi@meteorspace.com "Aamir Ghaffar" - aamir@meteorspace.com "Salman Siraj" - Salman.Siraj@meteorspace.com ​ Include in the email: o Order number: <Paste the order number> o Customer name: <Paste the customer's full name> o Address: <Paste the customer's address> o Post code: <Paste the customer's post code> o Contact no.: <Paste the customer's phone number> o Email address: <Paste the customer's email address> o SKU: <Paste the SKU of the item that needs to be returned> o Number of items to be returned: <# of items per SKU> o Product description: <Paste the name of the item that the customer is returning> o Pick-up schedule*: <dd-MM-YYYY> •* note : You must align the pick up schedule with the customer. Please ask the customer for a date maximum 2 working days from now. For example: if the customer calls on Monday, the pick-up date must be either Tuesday or Wednesday. Step 4 : Receive confirmation from the carrier for the appointment schedule. Update the date in Fluent. Step 5 : Insert Tracking Reference: Insert the tracking reference in the OMS. Step 6 : Check Return Status: Follow-up with MeteorSpace in the same email thread to ask about the status of the collection. How to verify if the return was created correctly The customer contact details are correct The return status must be set to 'Created' The pick up date must be left empty (Until confirmed by the Carrier) The carrier field is populated with: MeteorSpace / DPD_IE Note: The return must never be manually set to 'Organized'. If the return status is set to 'organized' manually, the return will not be recognized by our platforms, and it will never be forwarded to the return carrier. Please ensure the return status is 'Created' after you created the return. Note : MeteorSpace (Vanex) does not have a tracking link. Please disregard the 'Open Carrier Trace' link on Parcel Lab How are status updates handled for the return Status updates for Fluent Commerce are not automated. You (the agent) must monitor the return status on the email thread with the carrier on the planned pick-up date. Follow up after one week to ensure the return is processed. Update the return status in the Order Management System (OMS). How is the Refund Triggered? Note: This process applies to returns within the trial period When to Start the Refund Process : The carrier will contact you once the items have been collected from the customer. Start the refund process once the carrier informs you that the product was picked up. If the customer contacts you but does not have the document, please contact the carrier (Meteorspace) via email to verify if the collection has happened. To process the refund , you must complete the Order: In the OMS (Fluent Commerce), mark the return as 'complete' to trigger the refund automatically. Refund timeline : The refund time starts once the order is completed in OMS. Our refunds team (ARD2C) usually releases the refund within 2 working days. After that, it will depend on the customer's own payment provider how long it takes before they see the refund in their bank account. Note: No Proof of Payment: Do not request proof of payment or product pictures from customers or carriers. Unresolved Tickets: For tickets open for more than 14 days, create a JIRA ticket in "Order issue" at the Customer Excellence Portal . When can this return ticket be considered 'Resolved' Once: The customer reported the return was performed AND You have updated the status of the return in the OMS to 'COMPLETE' AND (in case of refunds) You have informed the customer of the expected timeline for the processing of the refund. The return can be considered 'resolved' and you can close the case.

title: [Rhenus] 1 and 2MH Returns - UK - Fluent Commerce
content: All returns for larger items are managed by Rhenus. 1. If a customer asks for a return of a larger item (beds or mattresses), follow the steps below First, open Fluent Commerce. Click on "Filter" and then select "Ref." Click on the order number related to the return. When you have opened the order, click on the three dots and choose either "Create Return with Refund" or "Create Return without Refund," depending on the nature of the return. When prompted, click on the (+) button to specify the number of articles you wish to return. Fill in the mandatory fields, using a (-) to indicate required information. Note that the carrier field must be left empty . Once all necessary details are provided, submit the form to initiate the return. 2. What is the status of the return after I create it? The status must be set to 'Return Created'. Never manually move the status to 'Return Organized'. 3. How is the request send to the return carrier? Once you create the return, the return request will automatically be transmitted to Rhenus, our returns partner for larger items.​ 4. How is the return completed? Once the carrier completes the return, the return will automatically be marked as 'Complete' in Fluent Commerce (note, this is not the case for Magento!). For cancelled returns, you (the agent) should manually mark the return as 'Cancelled' in Fluent. 5. How is the refund triggered? Once the return status gets set to 'Complete', the refund process will be triggered automatically. It will depend on the payment method used how long it takes for the refund to be processed. Usually, this can take up to 14 working days, depending on the payment provider. If the customer has questions about the status of the refund, they can best contact their payment provider directly. 6. Using the Rhenus portal You will sometimes need to work via the portals from the carriers. ​ ​ Link: Rhenus Home Page To access Rhenus' portal, log in using the following credentials: Online Orders Offline Orders Order Number Format: 0006-xxxxx W-0006-xxxxx or M-0006-xxxxx Username: Emma1 Emma Password: Sleep2025! Sleep2025! ​ Tracking the return Once logged in, search for the order by either the web booking reference , which is the tracking number provided in the return on Fluent, or by your reference , which is the order number. Change the pick up address or date To change the pick up address or select a new pick up date, use the designated buttons. Click on " Change Address " to update the delivery address, or " Change Delivery Date " to select a new delivery date.

title: [2024 version] Return Deflection Guideline
content: TABLE OF CONTENTS Introduction Return Deflection How to do a Return Deflection -> Verbal Deflection Deflecting attacks DISCLAIMER This article is only valid for the Sleep Experts agents trained in return deflection after August 2024. Introduction In this article, you can check about the 4 types of deflection techniques used at Emma and see a few examples of arguments to help you during the conversation. Return Deflection Let's start with a question: Why do people send their products back? It's normally a combination of wrong expectations and a lack of knowledge. And the first step to resolving this is to connect with the customer, make questions, and show that you care about their issue and that your goal is to find a solution with and for them. The return process can be a difficult situation for the customer and also for the support team. On the one hand, it is in our best interest to prevent the return, and on the other hand, it is in the customer's best interest to return a product that they do not like. So, it is important to find the right balance in dealing with the customer. Acknowledge their frustration and show empathy, making them feel heard and understood, so they can be open-minded to your suggestions. To understand better how you can make an impact to reduce the returns, please check the article "Return Deflection: Making Impact on Returns" How to do a Return Deflection -> Verbal Deflection How to do it? Explanations about how the product work, harmonization phase; muscular adaptation; the smell is harmful and disappears quickly. Outcome: Customer stays with the product (no money loss). Example of Harmonization phase argument: "The body needs about four weeks to get used to a new sleeping surface. Tension does not come and go immediately." "It is quite normal that the mattress does not feel ideal in the first few weeks. Your body, especially the muscles, have adapted to a possible misalignment. Now the body needs a few weeks to compensate for this. As soon as this has happened, you will sleep wonderfully on your mattress. That's why you should take full advantage of our 100-night sleep trial.” If the reasoning is too soft, the cores of foam mattresses can also be turned over. This does not affect the durability: ”You said your Emma Original was much too soft? Then open the cover, turn the core with the blue side up and you will get a much firmer lying comfort.” The arguments can be applied to pillows, mattresses, box spring beds, and slatted frames. Please read the article " Deflection Arguments " to better understand the explanations you can use with customers. Deflecting attacks How to respond to an “attack”? Below, we have an example of an unhappy and stressed customer, and after 4 tips to better deal with this situation: Imagine the situation in which the customer says: “Your mattresses are the worst I have ever tried! This Emma One is so hard that it deserves its name: you can only spend one night on it! For me, not being able to test it in a store is the biggest problem.” First step –> Praise the customer : "Thank you for taking the time to contact us and provide your honest feedback." Second step -> Show interest in the customer problem : "I admit that it is difficult to find a mattress with the right firmness. Especially with the wide selection of mattresses offered". Third step –> Address the deficiencies : "Unfortunately, trying it out in a store wouldn't have made it easier as well, as you would only be able to spend a few minutes with the mattress. And, as I think you will agree, testing it at home is way more comfortable." Forth step –> Open the door for solutions : "You talked about your mattress being too firm. We have some options to solve this issue, so you can keep the mattress you bought and have a better night's sleep. If you would allow us, we would love to present you with some solutions."
