title: Deflection Arguments
content: TABLE OF CONTENTS Mattresses Boxspring bed Pillows Duvets Introduction The return deflection is the supreme discipline among arguments. It is about selling a product that has already been sold to the customer again. The collection of these arguments is the most common in the area of return defense. However, it is not always possible to ward off a return with individual sentences. For a successful return deflection, some questions must be clarified in the conversation - What arguments convinced the customer to buy the purchased product? What need should the product have met? Is there a complementary product to quickly fulfill the need? Ask these questions to get more underrating about customer's concern: What expectations about the product were unmet? How long have you been testing the product? What kind of discomfort is it about? What is the source of the discomfort? What can we do to convince the customer to stay with and trust the product? Use these arguments for verbal deflection: Mattresses Mattress is too warm, causes sweating "Sweating can have many causes. The mattress only has to process a small part of the moisture released. The rest evaporates. What other materials do you use in your sleeping system?" ->Ask about duvet, bed sheet, room temperature... "Our mattresses are already designed for breathability due to their construction. Unfortunately, even this is sometimes not enough. For these cases, we have also developed products with special heat conduction properties. Have you already seen our Emma Diamond Topper?" "From what you have described to me, I assume that you are sinking a little too deep into the mattress. This means that they are encased. This means that sweat cannot evaporate properly and the humidity under the duvet is too high. I would send you a hard comfort pad, which will solve this problem quickly." Textile fibers usually have a slight crimp that traps air. Our mattress protector has a smoother surface and the materials used are also slightly different, giving you a fresher feeling when lying on the cover. You also protect your mattress and prolong its life. is too firm "Did you have pain before you bought our Emma? Yes? Tension doesn't come in a day and tension doesn't go away in a day. Your body needs 4-6 weeks to get used to a new mattress. Your muscles adapt to the new lying position. This time is called the harmonization phase. That's why we offer 100 nights for testing until you fall in love with Emma." "Is your mattress just slightly too hard or just a little bit?" Sinking into the mattress is determined by the top layers. I can offer you two options. Experience has shown that our Emma Flip/Diamond Topper, which provides additional pressure relief, can solve problems with excessive pressure on the shoulder or in the pelvic region. I can offer you this for xx € instead of xxx €. Alternatively, I can offer you our 2cm high Comfort Layer free of charge. However, our experience clearly shows us that the chance of success is greater with the Topper." "Can you open the cover? In some rare cases, it, unfortunately, happens in production that the mattress core is packed the wrong way around in the cover. The (blue) foam must be at the top" is too soft "Emma mattresses are made with an elastic surface. This is to take pressure off the shoulder and pelvis and support lordosis. Especially if you had a slightly firmer mattress before, this can be a change. Your body needs 4-6 weeks to get used to a new mattress. Your muscles adapt to the new lying position. This time is called the harmonization phase. That's why we offer 100 nights for testing until you fall in love with Emma." "So you feel our mattress is clearly too soft? Our mattresses are progressively constructed, which means they get harder and harder toward the bottom. You can easily open the cover of the mattress and turn the core of the mattress. This should solve your problem in no time." "How old is your slatted frame? A slatted frame is usually made of wood. And wood reacts to moisture and heat, which we give off during sleep, especially over a large period of 10 years. After 8-10 years, even high-quality slatted frames are used up, which can lead to the new mattress not being properly supported." causes pain/discomfort "Do you have more pain in the morning and as soon as you move a little it disappears?"( yes )"Then it is usually due to the sleeping system. If you have orthopedic problems, you are quite painless in the morning and the more you strain your body, the bigger the problems become." "Do you have more pain in the morning and as soon as you move a little it disappears?"( no )"Then it´s an orthopedic problem. Would you tell me more about your back pain? (Ask for symptoms of a herniated disc) "Is the mattress too hard or too soft?" the cover does not have a nice touch "Our Emma One mattress cover is a functional fabric that is comparable to the jersey of your favorite team. The microfibre ensures that moisture is quickly wicked away. Covers from our higher-quality product ranges are additionally padded or peached, giving them a softer feel. Unfortunately, these processes are not available for the Emma One range due to the price." is too complicated to assemble "I will gladly take all the time in the world for you to guide you through all the assembly steps of the Emma Shift." is not warm enough "Our Emma mattresses are designed to provide the best possible ventilation for a refreshing night's sleep. However, the duvet in combination with the bed linen is primarily responsible for keeping you warm!" is too light/ too low density "We work for several reasons with lower densities: 1)The higher the density is, the heavier the mattress becomes. This is how we improve the handling of the mattress 2) The higher the density is, the lower is the breathability of the mattress. Density means dense. Our mattresses are made with open-cored foams. Ventilation is one of our key aspects for building good mattresses. 3) The lower the density is, the fewer carbon emissions we produce. Our Environment is also very important to Emma. Double density also means double CO2 emissions. But we are working with high-performance foams. We guarantee you that you have 10 years with your mattress. If not, we replace your mattress core." is too heavy "Our mattresses have been produced in lightweight construction. If the mattress is too heavy, don't worry. The progressive construction ensures that tedious turning is a thing of the past." "Is covering the mattress too hard for you? ( Yes! ). Then simply use our slatted frame with adjustment. By raising the slatted frame, the distance between the ends of the mattresses is shortened, and covering the bed is made much easier. Even if you have limited mobility." is not improving my sleep Find out if the mattress could improve the customer's sleep at all. If yes -> arguments above. If no -> Sleep Hygiene! Boxspring bed Boxspring bed is too warm, causes sweating "Sweating can have many causes. The mattress only has to process a small part of the moisture released. The rest evaporates. What other materials do you use in your sleeping system?" ->Ask about duvet, bed sheet, room temperature... "A Boxspring bed is already designed for breathability due to its construction. Unfortunately, even this is sometimes not enough. For these cases, we have also developed products with special heat conduction properties. Have you already seen our Emma Diamond Topper?" is too firm "Did you have pain before you bought our Emma? Yes? Tension doesn't come in a day and tension doesn't go away in a day. Your body needs 4-6 weeks to get used to a new mattress. Your muscles adapt to the new lying position. This time is called the harmonization phase. That's why we offer 100 nights for testing until you fall in love with Emma." "I see you are not using a topper. Boxspring beds are a sleeping system that is basically a little firmer. The topper is responsible for relieving the pressure on the mattress, which reduces the pressure on your shoulders and makes the whole sleeping experience more comfortable. You sleep well and relieved!" "Did you see that our Flip-Topper has two sides? One firm, one soft. Which side do you use?" "I can offer you a comfort layer!" is too soft "There is a simple solution to this problem. Simply turn the mattress over in the upper fabric cover. This makes the whole bed firmer and provides better support." "Our Emma mattresses used are already very elastic and designed for ergonomics. As a supplement, the topper can also make the system too soft in rare cases, so I would recommend that you use your bed without a topper." "Did you have pain before you bought our Emma? Yes? Tension doesn't come in a day and tension doesn't go away in a day. Your body needs 4-6 weeks to get used to a new mattress. Your muscles adapt to the new lying position. This time is called the harmonization phase. That's why we offer 100 nights for testing until you fall in love with Emma." causes pain/discomfort "Do you have more pain in the morning and as soon as you move a little it disappears?"( yes )"Then it is usually due to the sleeping system. If you have orthopedic problems, you are quite painless in the morning and the more you strain your body, the bigger the problems become." "Do you have more pain in the morning and as soon as you move a little it disappears?"( no )"Then it´s an orthopedic problem. Would you tell me more about your back pain? (Ask for symptoms of a herniated disc) "Do you think your boxspring bed is too hard or too soft?" The cover does not have a nice touch The covers for our box spring beds are highly functional. It is important for us that the covers are extremely durable, remain in color for a long time and the colors do not show any abrasion. This is only possible with polyester. Cannot adjust the height for me "We have chosen the height of our beds so that everyone between 150cm - 190 cm can easily get in and out of their bed. Are you within this standard range?" Product is unstable Clarify whether it is a claim Is the bed free-standing in the room? Our beds are designed so that the headboard receives support from behind. To facilitate assembly, the headboard is not screwed down. The product is too complicated to assemble Where exactly do you have problems? I will be happy to take the time to help you through the assembly. If you need visual help, I will be happy to send you our installation video. This solves the problems in most cases! Clarify whether it is a claim! Product is not warm enough "Boxspring beds are systems that are very much designed for ventilation, did you have a foam mattress before? - If so, foams tend to retain a little more heat, which in many cases means that the old duvet is no longer an ideal match for the new sleeping system." "If you are using a Diamond Topper, open the cover and turn the core. This will reduce the thermal conductivity of the topper." Product is too heavy "The box spring bed combines several components - bed frame, slatted frame and mattress. To prevent slipping, we require a higher weight for the beds." No improvement in my sleep Find out if the mattress could improve the customer's sleep at all. If yes -> arguments above. If no -> sleep hygiene Pillows A pillow can only work if the mattress fits the customer 100%. If there is already tension in the mattress, the pillow cannot compensate. An exception is, however, if a mattress is too firm. Many people tend to sleep on a pillow that is too high in order to relieve the shoulder. Pillow is too warm, It causes sweating "Which side of the cushion is the top? The blue side is equipped with a so-called Hypersoft foam, i.e. small gel beads are embedded in the foam, which has a cooling effect." (Emma Original) "Which side of the cushion is the top? The grey foam must be on top of this cushion because only then can the cushion develop its heat-conducting effect." (Emma Diamond) "Sweating can have many causes. The pillow only has to process a small part of the moisture released. The rest evaporates. What other materials do you use in your sleeping system?" ->Ask about duvet, mattress, bed sheet, room temperature... is too firm Have you removed already one or two layers from your pillow? (Emma Original, Emma Diamond, Emma Premium Microfiber) is too soft "A mattress and a pillow always form a symbiosis to provide spine alignment. Do you tend to flatten your pillow as much as possible or do you even use a second pillow at the same time? This is an indication that your pillow is not the problem." Customer: "This is already the thousandth cushion I've tried." "How old is your mattress?" <- Symbiosis of products causes pain/discomfort "Is your pillow too high or too low?" change"Did you have pain before you bought our Emma Pillow? Yes? Tension doesn't come in a day and tension doesn't go away in a day. Your body needs around 3 weeks to get used to a new pillow so your muscles can adapt. Also, an important point to consider is if you changed it for a different kind of pillow (passing from a foam one to a feather or the other way round), that can take time to adjust to new format. This time is called the harmonization phase. That's why we offer up to 30 nights for testing until you fall in love with Emma." "What is your preferred sleeping position?" The cover does not have a nice touch "Our covers are made of a special microfibre fabric that transports moisture as quickly as possible to ensure a dry sleeping climate. Do you use a pillowcase for our neck support pillows?" "Why don't you wash the cover of the pillow two or three times? The work done on the thread makes the fabric softer and more supple." Cannot adjust the height for me With our neck support pillows or also the Emma Microfibre Premium pillow, individual layers can be removed by opening the zip. is too light In contrast to a natural pillow with feathers, we use lighter microfiber. This gives comparable support without having to sacrifice the lives of animals. For one kilogram of feathers, you need about 40 ducks or geese. is too heavy To provide sufficient support, pillows need to be denser, as a lot of weight hits a small area. If we reduce the density, it is at the expense of the life span of a neck support pillow of approx. 5 years. No improvement in my sleep "What improvement in your sleep would you have liked to see with the pillow?" What problems do you have? ->Pillow-mattress symbiosis is too small - regular bedsheets are not fitting "By folding the cover inwards, even larger covers (e.g. 80x80) fit on smaller pillows."... Duvets While the comparison with the old mattress makes little sense, the opposite is true for the duvet. Since warmth retention and breathability are mainly regulated by the duvet, the same comparison parameter of the customer should be established. Besides synthetic fibers, duvets made of feathers and down, natural hair, or vegetable fibers are common. Duvet is too warm, causes sweating "Do they use the duvet 365 days a year? Duvets are not really designed for that. Imagine going to a clothing shop and looking for a jumper for the whole year. In winter, it might be a little too cool. In high summer it is too warm. We have the same phenomenon with duvets. Even so-called "all-season duvets with a medium filling weight require that you have a constant temperature in the bedroom all year round". The cover does not have a nice touch "Our covers are made of a special microfibre fabric that transports moisture as quickly as possible to ensure a dry sleeping climate. Do you use a pillowcase for our neck support pillows?" is not warm enough "Do they use the duvet 365 days a year? Duvets are not really designed for that. Imagine going to a clothing shop and looking for a jumper for the whole year. In winter, it might be a little too cool. In high summer it is too warm. We have the same phenomenon with duvets. Even so-called "all-season duvets with a medium filling weight require that you have a constant temperature in the bedroom all year round". is too light If you find the product too light, try our Emma weighted comforter. With a weight of about 7kg in the standard size, the quilt additionally stimulates our nervous system. This provides a feeling of a comforting hug all night long. You can put your other blanket on the cover as a supplement on very cold nights. Or you use it as a duvet for guests. is too heavy Compared to a pure down quilt, the microfiber is slightly heavier. This we know and accept, because microfiber is much easier to wash because here no dryer is needed. Compared to a pure down quilt, the microfiber is slightly heavier. This we know and accept, because for one kilogram of feathers about 40 animals are needed. No improvement in my sleep "What improvement in your sleep would you have liked to see with the duvet?" Can the quilt really solve the problem? Address Sleep Hygiene is too small Clarify if it is a claim. Special case Germany: In eastern Germany, the special size 155x200 is still widespread. Clarify if the bedding has this size! The bedding industry is currently gradually discontinuing its size. is not soft enough Have you previously lain under a down quilt? You are right, a down quilt is a bit softer. However, the advantages of microfiber are different. Besides the much cheaper price, we have improved washability, the quilting of the cover completely avoids slipping and we have uniform heat retention.

title: Return Deflection: Making Impact on Returns
content: TABLE OF CONTENTS Making Impact on Returns Returns Deflection Arguments Let's recap some arguments related to the return reasons Customers may provide to us: TIME ADAPTATION BAD USAGE OF THE MATTRESS BAD MANUFACTURING TOO HARD/TOO FIRM HEAT SENSATION WRONG SIZE COMFORT LAYER SMELL Returns Deflection flowchart Making Impact on Returns Customers can reach us for different reasons requesting to return their recently bought mattress as they have the country Guarantee (a campaign that can offer up to 100-nights of trial period) and the Warranty (right of delivering the product up to 10 years). Always investigate the claim of the customer and identify if there is something to be done to support the product issue and avoid the customer's stress and frustration of returning or replacing the mattress. Our goal is to take all opportunities possible to deflect the return intention by improving our customer experience with their product and making them happy and satisfied with it. ​ First Investigate the reason: What is the problem reported by the customer? Is the claim related to the time adaptation? Is it maybe related to bad usage of the mattress? How is the customer using the mattress? Common reasons upside-down mattress lack of proper slatted frame. Is the claim impacting the usage of the mattress? (e.g. stain or color claim does not impact) Is it clear the product is a manufacturing topic? Returns Deflection Arguments Let's recap some arguments related to the return reasons Customers may provide to us: TIME ADAPTATION Changing mattress is a big difference to your body. It is expected to the customer to feel the difference when start using the new mattress. Explain: other customers have faced this kind of discomfort at the beginning, but it is resolved during the adjustment phase. The body may need a period for the adjustment that can take 3-6 weeks. BAD USAGE OF THE MATTRESS Upside down mattress If the customer is using the mattress on the wrong side you can always recommend him to give time for adaptation using the proper side. Also, using the mattress on the wrong side could also lead to the mattress being too hot because the blue layer ("Airgocell" foam) also drives away heat and moisture. If the blue layer is not on top, this might reduce this effect. Absence of Emma slatted frame / Emma bed The slatted frame is the foundation to support your body, but at the same time, it also provides the first adjustment. The slatted frame makes up approx. 30-40% of the lying comfort. Even with very high mattresses, you can feel the influence of the slat base. For example, if you place a folded folding rule lengthwise between the mattress and the slatted frame, you can immediately notice a change in the way you lie down. The slatted frame should not be more than 8-10 years old, as the mattress follows the sagging slatted frame and sags faster. BAD MANUFACTURING A bad manufacturing claim should always be validated with pictures. Visual claim guide HERE (To the customer: how to take pictures guide ) Validate claim pictures guidebook HERE ​ After validating the pictures and the claim is VALID : Is there anything we can do for the customer to keep the product and avoid the stress of returning/replacing the product? If the customer is willing to keep the product with the defect with a Compensation Compensation Calculator (Country specific - check your team lead) TOO HARD/TOO FIRM A comfort layer is an extra foam layer designed specifically for Emma to adjust the lying sensation. We have two options available: soft or firm comfort layer . HEAT SENSATION Heat sensation ("customer sweat" or "the mattress is too hot" claims are usually due to the hug sensation the Emma mattress can provide. While hugging the customer, the customer may have the body warmed up as the body may sink to the mattress. To avoid the sinking process, customers can add Comfort Layer. Check if the mattress is not being used on the wrong side. It could also lead to the mattress being too hot because the blue layer ("Airgocell" foam) also drives away heat and moisture. If the blue layer is not on top, this might reduce this effect. Use comfort layer deflection only if instructed so! COMFORT LAYER The comfort layer is and remains free of charge for Emma customers and you can always offer it if needed for a better customer's product experience, regardless of whether they are still in the trial period or not. ​ Why is so important to convince the customer to try a comfort layer? To leverage the customer's product satisfaction and avoid the return. On average, 40% of customers refuse to try the comfort layer when they find the mattress too hard/too soft. But…60% of the customers who accept to try the comfort layers, 85% keep the mattress. To achieve the maximum effect: Softest Mattress: Firm inlayer on the top. Hardest mattress: Soft inlayer on the top. ​ SMELL Why does the mattress smell? Most new mattresses will have a certain chemical odor when they are first delivered. This is especially true for those that come in a box, rolled-up and vacuum-sealed because the lack of airflow through the package can cause the “new mattress smell” to become concentrated. When mattresses are vacuum-packed, the VOCs (Volatile Organic Compounds) remain trapped in the mattress. As soon as you open the box and remove the plastic foil, the foam expands and some of the synthetic materials in the mattress break down. These are released as a gas that causes the off-gassing smell (usually also associated with a new car, clothes or shoes) When customers open their mattresses, they will probably notice this odor. This is entirely normal, and the smell should fade within a few days. Solution If still partially packed, suggest the customers finish unpacking their mattresses in a well-ventilated area and tt is needed to airs the mattress. If the customer can leave it like this for a couple of days would be better. Also, washing the mattress cover can help. Returns Deflection flowchart Making Impact on Returns Training Global - Making Impact on returns by Julianna Gava

title: [Online D2C:Global] How to Check trial & Warranty Period
content: Introduction This article will guide you on how to check the start or end date of a warranty or trial period. This can be useful in situations such as when a customer wants to return a product simply because they didn’t like it, or when they make a product claim and we need to verify whether it’s still within the warranty period — among other cases. Table of Content ​ Acess the PDP Check Delivery Date Check the Delivery Date ​ ​ key-words Always add at least 4 keywords (two words max to help identify the article). Examples: replacement; supplement; wrong product; new product; product information Access the PDP (Product Display Page) ​ Firstly , go to the product page. Just below the product description, you’ll find the duration of both the warranty and trial periods (see example below). It’s essential to check this every time , as these timelines may vary by product or market and can be updated over time. Always refer to the product page to ensure you understand the correct trial and warranty periods for each case. Check the Delivery Date The trial and warranty periods begin on the date the product is delivered to the customer . Therefore, it's essential to always verify the product's delivery date . If the product is delivered in multiple shipments , the delivery date of the last component should be used as the start date for both the trial and warranty periods. If the order contains multiple products delivered on different days, each product will have its own trial and warranty start date , based on its individual delivery date. In cases where a supplementary part was required for the item to function properly, the delivery date of the supplement should be considered the start date of the trial and warranty period. You can find the tracking number and carrier information for the order in Fluent . Once you have the tracking number, visit the carrier's website to verify the delivery date . Calculate the Trial and Warranty period Based on the information you've gathered — the trial and warranty durations listed on the website and the product's delivery date — you can now determine when each period ends. The trial period is always calculated in calendar days . For example, if the product page (PDP) indicates a 100-night trial and the customer received the product on June 6, 2025, the trial period will end on September 14, 2025 . This would be the final day the customer can return the product simply because it wasn’t the right fit or they didn’t like it. In the same scenario, if the warranty period is listed as 10 years , it would end on June 6, 2035, this would be the last day the customer could report a product claim and still have it covered at no additional cost, provided the claim is valid.

title: [Online: D2C: EU] Returns: Return Portal: How to Handle Cases from the Return Portal
content: ​ Introduction: This article will guide you on how to process return requests that customers submit through the Return Portal. Note: • These instructions do not cover supplement orders or Magento orders. • The Return Portal is currently unavailable for customers in Ireland (IE) and Italy (IT). TABLE OF CONTENTS What is the Return Portal? Customer Journey on the Return Portal Version by Market & Agent guidelines Austria (AT) Belgium (BE) Switzerland (CH) Germany (DE) Netherlands (NL) United Kingdom (UK) Accessories Bed and/or mattress or large topper France (FR) Portugal (PT) Spain(ES) Accessories Bed and/or mattress or large topper What is the Return Portal? The Return Portal is available to customers in specific EU country , providing a fast, fully self-service way to initiate a return 24/7—no emails, phone calls, or chat sessions required. By enabling customers to manage routine returns on their own, we remove a high volume of low-complexity inquiries and free up our agents for higher-value tasks. This streamlined process also speeds up resolution times, reduces back-and-forth communication, and ultimately delivers a smoother, more satisfying experience—especially for customers who see returns as a normal part of shopping. Customer Journey on the Return Portal Reminder Bear in mind that each country’s return portal works a bit differently—some are fully automated, while others still involve a few manual steps. Always follow the workflow specific to the customer’s location and product. The screenshots in this guide come from our test environment, so the live view may vary slightly from region to region. They’re provided to illustrate the customer journey and give you a clear sense of what the customer sees. Step 1: Customer provides order details Customer will be promped to add the order details to initiate the return such as the order number and email address Step 2 : The customer chooses the item(s) to return and selects a reason The customer now: Picks the item(s) to return. Chooses a return reason. Confirms their contact details. Clicks Proceed. Return reasons Incorrect Order Accidental order Number of Items Size small or big Product unmet expectations Too cold Too hard Too soft Too warm Unstable Too thick Too thin Fabric feel Poor Quality of Components (eg. zippers, metal parts, etc) Spring feel Design Color Extra Instructions not clear / Handling difficulties Product arrived too late Product and Delivery Issues Product is damaged but Delivery box is undamaged Product is defective Part of the product(s) is missing Product and Delivery box are Damaged Wrong product delivered Heads-up on reasons: Outside the trial window: The portal only shows claim-based reasons like “Defective” Inside the trial window: The full menu appears, so the customer can select any reason they like If they select a claim based reason it will promp them to add pictures Step 3: Return Created / Agent Alert Triggered At this stage, the portal checks the item and the customer’s region. If automation-eligible: it finalizes the return and emails the shipping label to the customer. If manual review is required: it sends an email to the CS team for follow-up. Version by Market & Agent guidelines Depending on the customer location, there will be different version of the portal, check below what appliest according to the customers region and product(s). ​ Austria (AT) Belgium (BE) Switzerland (CH) Germany (DE) Netherlands (NL) United Kingdom (UK) Accessory returns run end-to-end through the portal automatically. Returns for items return via 1-man or 2-man still need an agent’s manual action Accessories For accessory-only returns (meaning no other product will be returned), customers can handle the entire process in the Return Portal. Once they click Submit , the portal has an integration with Fluent Commerce and ParcelLab, that automatically creates the return and emails the customer with the label required for the drop-off—no Customer Support involvement is required. If a customer still contacts about an accessory return, agents should: Guide them to the portal and walk them through the steps. or Create the return for them by opening the portal and submitting the request on their behalf. ​ Note: Products considered as accessories for return via drop-off: pillows, bed linens, duvets, mattresses protectors, disassembled/self-assembly slatted frames, baby/kids mattresses, packed toppers or toppers up to 120cm. Bed and/or mattress or large topper When a customer initiates a return for a mattress, bed, or large topper, it will escalate the case to Customer Service / Sleep Experts, via sprinklr ticket, please follow the steps below. Item within its trial period Review the reason for return. Attempt to deflect the return by offering tailored solutions: troubleshooting and setup guidance comfort-adjustment tips supplements or other remedial accessories Approve the return only if no satisfactory solution is possible. If the return reason is a claim , handle it according to the Claims Knowledge Base . Item outside its trial period In the customer portal, the only selectable return reasons will be claim-related. Process these returns strictly under the Claims Knowledge Base guidelines. How to identify return portal request in Sprinklr Return-Portal Tickets in Sprinklr Every ticket created by the Return Portal shows the sender as no-reply@emma-sleep.com . This is a system address, not the customer’s. An automation automatically routes each ticket to the correct market queue. [Example on how the return portal email will look for agents] Step by Step - How to handle return portal requests 1. Identify the ticket Find the Sprinklr ticket created by the Return Portal. Note: Never edit the Contact fields in these tickets. Never click “Reply” or “Forward” inside the Return-Portal ticket. To contact the customer, open a new outbound email instead. 2 .Check product warranty and trail status Item within its trial period Review the reason for return. Attempt to deflect the return by offering tailored solutions: troubleshooting and setup guidance comfort-adjustment tips supplements or other remedial accessories Approve the return only if no satisfactory solution is possible. If the return reason is a claim , handle it according to the Claims Knowledge Base . Item outside its trial period In the customer portal, the only selectable return reasons will be claim-related. Process these returns strictly under the Claims Knowledge Base guidelines. 3. Create return in fluent if deflections did not work and customer is eligible 4 .Send a single follow-up email to the customer that includes: Return confirmation – a brief note that their return has been approved and registered. Relevant return instructions – clear, step-by-step guidance tailored to this order. For example: “Our carrier partner will contact you within x business days to schedule a pickup.” Refund timeline – highlight when they can expect the credit-memo (e.g., “within 14 business days after we receive your parcel”) to set clear expectations. France (FR) Portugal (PT) Spain(ES) Accessory returns are handled end-to-end by the Return Portal—no agent intervention is required. Large-item returns (1-man or 2-man collection) are partially automated : the portal sends an email ticket in Sprinklr, and the agent can create the return directly from that ticket. There is no need to open FluentCommerce manually. Accessories For accessory-only returns (meaning no other product will be returned), customers can handle the entire process in the Return Portal. Once they click Submit , the portal has an integration with Fluent Commerce and ParcelLab, that automatically creates the return and emails the customer with the label required for the drop-off—no Customer Support involvement is required. If a customer still contacts about an accessory return, agents should: Guide them to the portal and walk them through the steps. or Create the return for them by opening the portal and submitting the request on their behalf. ​ Note: Products considered as accessories for return via drop-off: pillows, bed linens, duvets, mattresses protectors, disassembled/self-assembly slatted frames, baby/kids mattresses, packed toppers or toppers up to 120cm. Bed and/or mattress or large topper When a customer initiates a return for a mattress, bed, or large topper, it will escalate the case to Customer Service / Sleep Experts, via sprinklr ticket, please follow the steps below. How to identify return portal request in Sprinklr Return-Portal Tickets in Sprinklr Every ticket created by the Return Portal shows the sender as no-reply@emma-sleep.com . This is a system address, not the customer’s. An automation automatically routes each ticket to the correct market queue. [Example on how the return portal email will look for agents] Step by Step - How to handle return portal requests 1. Identify the ticket Find the Sprinklr ticket created by the Return Portal. Note: Never edit the Contact fields in these tickets. Never click “Reply” or “Forward” inside the Return-Portal ticket. To contact the customer, open a new outbound email instead. 2 . Check product warranty and trail status Item within its trial period Review the reason for return. Attempt to deflect the return by offering tailored solutions: troubleshooting and setup guidance comfort-adjustment tips supplements or other remedial accessories Approve the return only if no satisfactory solution is possible. If the return reason is a claim , handle it according to the Claims Knowledge Base . Item outside its trial period In the customer portal, the only selectable return reasons will be claim-related. Process these returns strictly under the Claims Knowledge Base guidelines. 3. If deflection attempts are unsuccessful and the customer meets the eligibility criteria, initiate the return through the Portal (email in Sprinklr that was generated by the portal). Return portal Agent view When a return submitted through the self-service portal and a Customer Service (CS) review is required, an email notification is automatically sent to CS in Sprinklr. Note: This closes the loop quickly and keeps the customer informed without extra system checks. When you’re ready to approve the request, follow these steps: 1. Click “ Return Portal ” or "Cancel Return" in cases you have sucessfully deflected the return The button in the email launches the return request directly in the portal, pre-filled with the customer’s information. 3. Validate and approve. Verify the item and customer details—along with any other pertinent information—then complete the approval process entirely within the portal by clicking Continue . 4. Confirm the return Validate the return details by clicking on Continue ​ 5. Return Registered When the portal displays the “We have registered your return” confirmation (see example below), your job in the system is complete—there’s no need to double-check the order in OMS. Next step: send a single follow-up email to the customer that includes: Return confirmation – a brief note that their return has been approved and registered. Relevant return instructions – clear, step-by-step guidance tailored to this order. For example: “Our carrier partner will contact you within x business days to schedule a pickup.” Refund timeline – highlight when they can expect the credit-memo (e.g., “within 14 business days after we receive your parcel”) to set clear expectations. This quick email wraps up the process, keeps the customer fully informed, and eliminates unnecessary system checks. ​ ​

title: Europe - Employee Returns, Refunds, and Replacements (RRR)
content: TABLE OF CONTENTS TABLE OF CONTENTS Employee Orders and Return Requests How to handle tickets involving Employee RRR Requests Employee Orders and Return Requests Employees can also become customers if they choose to order products from the company. Here are some reminders on employee return, refunds, and replacement (RRR) for Europe Markets. Products ordered by employees are applicable for the 100-Nights Trial (or the applicable policy in the market). Products ordered by employees are applicable for the 10-Year Warranty (or the applicable policy in the market). How to handle tickets involving Employee RRR Requests Employee RRR Requests are considered high-priority tickets. Employees are instructed to send an email to the CS Team and then inform the Performance Manager of the Order Number. Once the Performance Manager gives the Freshdesk(or Sprinklr) Ticket Number associated with this request to the CS Team, they should immediately prioritize the resolution of this ticket. Check out the steps in handling Employee RRR requests below: Note: Warranty and Trial period times are based per market and the same for Employees and Customers. STEP 1. Is the employee return/refund/replacement request valid? If YES , proceed to STEP 2. If NO , inform the employee customer that the request for return/refund/replacement is not valid. STEP 2. Set-up a collection for the product return. Refer to the process of your market on how return collections are handled. (note:  If applicable, proceed with the supplement in Claim cases. Skip next steps if Refund is not needed.) ​ STEP 3. For refund, Access the AR D2C Portal: Refund Initiation - Order-2-Cash Portal - Jira Service Management (atlassian.net) . Make sure that we mention the Internal Order and the need for "Employee Savings Adjustments". ​ STEP 4. Use the following format for the Summary field: "[Market] Employee RRR - Date Requested". Indicate the ticket number (or Case number in Sprinklr) in the Freshdesk Ticket # field. ​ STEP 5 . Fill out the other necessary information on the Jira ticket. ​ STEP 6. Submit the Jira ticket by clicking Send. Close the Freshdesk ticket (Or Sprinklr Case) only when the Jira ticket is resolved and closed.

title: Returns: Fluent Commerce Return Reasons (categories)
content: This aritcle will guide you throught the reasons categories available and when to use each one of them while managing an order in Fluent Commerce (OMS) Emma Learning Hub Training: here Table of Content Introduction Return Reasons Condition View in Fluent Commerce Return Reasons Examples Introduction When handling a return request is crucial to correctly identify correctly the condition and return reason. This will allow Emma to continuously act upon this feedback and improve the quality of our customer experience. Return Reasons Fluent Commerce counts 14 distinct return reasons, divided into five macro groups: Claims Returns linked to Logistic/Product claims Customer ordered incorrectly Whenever the customer states that they’ve had some doubts about which product to select, as well as: For customer ordering mistakes; Whenever the product information & description on the website did not match the product received (e.g. customer is misinformed, Emma needs to improve on customer education) How to probe: “Was it difficult for you to select which product to buy?” - Customer will typically say Yes Product unmet expectations Whenever the customer states that they were super clear on which product to select, but are unhappy with some of the product characteristics How to probe: “Was it easy to decide which product to buy?” > Customer will typically say Yes Refused at door/Return to Sender (RTS) These are returns refused at the door by customers; This typically happens, for example, in Late Late Cancellation scenarios – when the order is already being delivered and it is too late to cancel Other Reason Usage of this reason should be kept to a minimum (<5%), and should almost never be used . Comments are required and should contain a brief description (max 10 words) of the return reason ​ ​ Condition Packed – Never Used: For items that didn't have their packaging open after being received by the customer. Those can be sent back to the warehouse and resold since they were never used. Packed – Used/Re-Packed: For items that had their packaging open after being received by the customer, but were or will be re-packed by them before the pick-up. Once collected, those items can be refurbished or sent to sent to charity. Unpacked: For items that had their packaging open after being received by the customer. Once collected, those items can be refurbished or sent to sent to charity. ​ View in Fluent Commerce Return Reasons Examples Category Subcategory Description Example Claim Logistic Claims Logistic claim opened beforehand Logistic claim opened beforehand Product Claims Product claim opened beforehand Product claim opened beforehand Customer ordered incorrectly Size Customer ordered incorrectly "The mattress does not fit my bed"; "The pillow is too big"; "My Blanket touches the ground"; "The topper doe not sit right on the mattress" Wrong Item (except size) Customer ordered incorrectly, except when sizing is wrong "I bought the wrong product"; "I wanted a different product" Number of Items Customer ordered incorrectly "I bought the wrong quantity of products" Extras Part of a bundle If a product is returned with another "Topper goes with the mattress back"; "The Mattress goes together with the bed" Delayed delivery (non-canceled) The customer accepted the delivery, however he wants to return because the delivery was to late "Its too late"; "Don´t need it anymore, already got another product" Problems with instructions If a product is returned due to problems with instructions, assembly or customization "Could not assemble the bed"; "Cannot adjust the height of the pillow"; "Guidebook is confusing" Product unmet expectations Unstable Product is unstable "My mattress is too unstable"; "Too bouncy", "My bed is wobbly" Too thick Product is too thick Product is too thick Too thin Product is too thin Product is too thin Too hard Product is too hard Product is too hard Too soft Product is too soft Product is too soft Too warm Product is too warm Product is too warm Too cold Product is too cold Product is too cold Fabric feel The fabric character is not of the customer liking and wants to return "The fabric feels cheap and I don’t want it anymore"; "My Blanket feels weird"; "Unpleasant to the touch" Hardware character The Hardware (Ziper, metal bits and/or wooden parts) presents undesired quality and the customer wants to return because of it "I have difficulties closing the zippers"; "The zipper hurts me"; "The headboard connection to the bed is bad" Design The Design of the product is not as advertised or does not fit the customers expectations "its ugly"; "I don’t like the headboard design"; "It does not fit with my furniture"; Color The Color is of an undesired shade or does not represent the advertisements "I dont like the color"; "The color does not match what was showed in the advertisements" Spring feel The customer can feel the springs and does not like it "The springs are annoying"; "I can feel the springs in the mattress"; "The springs are uneven" Other Other reason This field represents any reasons that were not listed before and also does not correspond to any kind of cancellations. This field should target less then 10% of returns "Do not wish to disclose"; "Financial reasons"… ​

title: Returns: How to Return an order
content: TABLE OF CONTENTS RETURN WITH REFUND x RETURN WITHOUT REFUND Create a Return / Pick up of one item, several items, or Bundle Step by Step IMPORTANT - Customer's phone and address IMPORTANT - ONLY FOR DE, BE and NL Arrange to pick up Return Status Update Statuses Overview Step by step: Return Completed - Refund initiated How to Cancel a Return Return Management Depending on certain outcomes of a request, you may need to trigger a return in the order management system or change its status. e.g. Return (Trial period request), product, or a logistic claim where you may need to replace the product or refund the customer. This article will guide you through the steps of triggering the reverse logistics in the Fluent Commerce system, which at the moment requires three main steps : RETURN WITH REFUND x RETURN WITHOUT REFUND Return with refund means returning the item and triggering a refund of the amount paid by the customer related to the items selected. A Return without refund is a return that does not trigger the refund , for a scenario such as a replacement (supplement order to replace the original item returned). Whenever you want to trigger reverse logistics to order, you will always have to select which one of the two options you would like to proceed with. The steps in the system will be always the same, the difference is only the option you select and the outcome of it ( Should the customer be refunded ?). Create a Return / Pick up of one item, several items, or Bundle Step by Step Under the related order details page: 1. Click on the kebab button Decide if you would like to creat Return with refund or Return without refund. 2. After selecting your return option, a window will pop up. Make sure to REVIEW the customer information available: IMPORTANT - Customer's phone and address MANDATORY STEP: When creating a Return that involves a collection/pick-up it is MANDATORY to have the customer's complete address and phone number (with country code). Most carriers contact the customer only via the phone number, so having it in our system is necessary. If that information is not included in the original order request, please reach out to the customer and ask for confirmation of the email and the phone number. Without it, the return cannot proceed. For drop-odd cases is not needed. 3. Select the related item of the order to be returned For each selected item to return, you will need to provide the following information. 4. Click to Submit. Confirmation will pop up. Overview of the order after the return is submitted. If return with refund is created: a credit memo will automatically be created with the returned item(s) value . if return without refund a credit memo with zero value will be created (no refund). IMPORTANT - ONLY FOR DE, BE and NL ONLY FOR 1MH returns (packed mattress and Unpacked toppers from 140cm wideness) For Returns requests that are 1 Man-Handling, including the Pick-up Date is mandatory . That information must be there so 4PL can send it to the carrier, and without that, the return will not move forward. Agents must ask customers for a date, which must be accommodated a minimum of 3 days ahead of the requested date. However, it's not guaranteed that the pick-up will happen on the day the customer has requested. The carrier will try from the date onwards, between 2-5 days afterward. Example: The CS agent contacts the customer on the 10th of March to ask for a pick-up date, and the minimum timeframe accepted is for the pick-up date to be on the 13th of March. (For any doubts regarding Returns in Central Europe countries, refer to this article: HERE ) Arrange to pick up (up to market / regional procedure) After creating the return in the Order management system, ensure you follow all necessary steps to arrange the pick-up in accordance with your country-related procedures. Review the article for the next steps for your country below: DK Article here MX MX - Return Process CO CO - Return process CL CL - Return process PT PT- Return process ES ES - Return Process FR FR - Return Process IT IT - Return Process Return Status Update After arranging the return with the local logistic partner, you should always ensure the return status is updated to Return Organized. Note: Not applicable for the markets DE, NL,BE, CH, AT ! In this case please leave it at Return Created . Statuses Overview Return will have 3 statuses: If you need to change its status at any time during the return journey, those are the following steps: Step by step: 1. Access the order Related Tab 2. All returns submitted will be displayed. Select the one you would like to manage the status. 3. Click on the button to update the status located in the top right of the window. View of the Return Status WITHOUT REFUND : View of the Return Status WITH REFUND (Credit Memo created): 4. Confirmation will pop up. Click on confirm. A confirmation message will pop up. The status of the return will be updated accordingly: Return Completed - Refund initiated The refund will only be processed after the status of the return status is updated to Completed - and this should happen only after the confirmation of the return done by the customer. You can see the status reflecting the related credit memo - as per How to: Refunds & Credit Memo . CHILE - refund won't work by updating the status. Ensure you escalate the refund request via Refund - Jira escalation . How to Cancel a Return You may face a situation in which is needed to cancel a return that was already created. For that, you can use the "Cancel" button inside the Return order created and select one of the reasons: - Incorrect Return: Return created by mistake. - Customer canceled return: The client decided to cancel the return and keep the product. - Customer "No Response": C ustomer asked for the return, but then stopped replying to us and didn't confirm the return or the return arrangements. - Return Expired: Only to be used by Emma internal. - Customer "Not Encountered": The customer was not at home on the return date and also was not available to contact via phone. - Out of carrier T&C: For when the cancellation happens because of a faulty carrier assignment (can be due to the weight, length, belt-size, unsuitable packaging, item condition, etc). For example, if an agent creates a return for a packed mattress, but when the carrier arrives, the item is unpacked. The carrier cannot collect and inform this reason. Then the return will be cancelled and another one will need to be opened to request the right carrier. Please check below the step-by-step guide about how to Cancel a Return in FluentCommerce:

FAQ 1. How to initiate a return with GLS The return process is streamlined through Robotic Process Automation (RPA). 1.a) First: Initiate Return on Fluent Commerce Fluent Commerce Create a return request on the OMS. To review the basics, visit Fluent Commerce return Make sure the address and contact information of the customer are correctly noted in the OMS. Ask the customer for preferred pick-up date . At least 2 working days in advance, and it cannot be during the weekend. !IMPORTANT! for Returns in Fluent: You must set a pick-up date when creating the Return. If this field is left empty, the return will not get sent to GLS and will stay stuck. Note: we cannot promise GLS will perform the pick up on that same date, see communication tips below. 1.b) Second: Automated Assignment to the Carrier Once the return is created, it is automatically assigned to 4PL, which is our Fourth Party Logistics partner. 4PL then assigns the return shipment to GLS, the carrier responsible for handling 1MH products. 2. Important information for setting customer expectations GLS does not communicate with customers about the pick up date. While we ask for a pick up date, GLS is responsible for organizing the day and time of the pick up. After you have created the return request in the OMS, it will automatically be transmitted to 4PL CS. 4PL CS will schedule a time for collection with the customer within 7 to 10 days. 3. How to verify if the order was created correctly The order for a GLS return with 4PL CS is created correctly if: All the customer information is correct The carrier field is left empty (later, this field might be updated to 'GLS_DE' automatically, this is not an issue) The pick up date field is NOT left empty There must always be a pick up date filled when you create a return with GLS. The status of the return is 'Created' If any of this is incorrect, cancel the return and create a new return. The return must never be manually set to 'Organized' . If the return status is set to 'organized' manually, the return will not be recognized by our platforms, and it will never be forwarded to the return carrier. Please ensure the return status is 'Created' after you created the return. ​ 4. Status updates in the OMS The status updates in the OMS are automatically updated. 5. How the refund is triggered Once the return is completed via the drop off, the status in the OMs will get updated automatically to 'Complete'. This status update will then automatically trigger the refund process. Once the refund is initiated, banks or payment service providers (PSP) will have different deadlines to have the amount available reflected in their account. More detailed timelines per PPS can be found in the article 'Refund request'. If the customer reaches us after we already completed the refund, they should reach out directly to their bank or payment provider company to get further information and more specific deadlines. 6. When can this return ticket be considered 'Resolved'? Once you have successfully created the return and have verified that it was created correctly, you can mark the case as 'resolved'. 7. FAQ You can visit the FAQ here. Because the return is handled by 4PL CS, review the FAQ for returns managed by 4PL CS. Step 3: For Magento, settings: Set Packaging material to 'No'. Step 4: Pick-up date: Leave empty . 2. Important information for setting customer expectations Gebrüder Weiss will contact the customer to schedule a pick-up. Never promise a pick-up date; it must be arranged with the carrier. How to verify if the return was created correctly In Magento The customer contact details are correct The return status must be set to 'Created' The return date must be left empty The carrier field is left empty 4. How are status updates handled for the return? 4PL CS updates the status in the Order Management System (OMS) within 7-10 days. For detailed updates, check 4PL's Optilo platform. Note: B anks or payment service providers (PSP) will have different deadlines to have the amount available reflected in their account. More detailed timelines per PSP can be found in the article 'Refund request'. If the customer reaches us after we already completed the refund, they should reach out directly to their bank or payment provider company to get further information and more specific deadlines. 6. FAQ Note : Since these returns are managed by 4PL, be sure to also check the 4PL documentation if you cannot find your answer here More about 4PL Returns 4PL Information 4PL Central Station (referred to as 4PL or 4PLCS) is an intermediary party between Emma and return carriers. They organize returns for some product categories in some markets for us. TABLE OF CONTENTS What does 4PLCS do? How to request a return from 4PLCS? How to handle customer requests, when 4PLCS manages the return? How to: Status tracking with 4PL CS FAQ How can I cancel the return with 4PL? The customer asks to change the pick up date The customer asks to change the address for the pick up The carrier did not pick up all the items The carrier did not contact the customer The carrier never showed up on the promised pick up date The customer needs packing material, but they didn't receive any How do I get the proof of return? 1. What does 4PLCS do? This company takes over a few tasks: Deciding which return carrier to use for which products Arranging the return with the return carrier Communicating with the carrier when something did not go as planned Tracking the status of the returns Notifying Emma when the product was returned so we can start the refund process 2. How to: Request a return from 4PLCS? In Fluent Commerce , the assigned to 4PL is automatically. In Magento, you will then need to select “4PLCS” as the return method in Magento (including the pick-up date for category 2 items) and then the return will automatically be arranged. 3. How to: Handle customer requests, when 4PLCS manages the return? In the 4PLCS team, there is a team of operations managers who will handle your requests regarding returns. You can reach them via the 4PL Jira Portal [ link to 4PL Jira portal ]. Return cancellation Return adjustment (e.g. change pick-up address or customer contact info) Pick-up re-scheduling Others You will also need to provide the order number and the return ID from the OMS (Magento or Fluent). 4. How to: Status tracking with 4PL CS Status tracking for 4PL returns with Optilo Returns can be tracked using 4PL CS's own system called 'Optilo'. Optilo can be accessed via this link [ OPTILO / Tracking - search ] Note : It can take 2-3 days since the return was created to show up in Optilo. Wait for 2-3 days before checking to get a more reliable insight. Step 1: Access Optilo portal and search order Access the following web page: OPTILO / Tracking - search Depending on the ID you have select the following reference type: These IDs then be found in Fluent and Magento respectively. Complete captcha and then hit 'Search' order. ID Emma Reference name Fluent Return ID: 00xx-xxxx-xxxxx-x Magento return: “Order Number” Sales order no. 2 [MH1] ​ Step 2: Identify the status of the return Identify the order Click on 'No.' and check 'Events' sections. Real date is the actual date To understand the status of the return, use the following table. Status Explanation 100 - Created Return was newly created 250 - Planned Return is planned and waiting for carrier respose 290 - Confirmed by carrier Carrier has confirmed reception of the return to be scheduled on their system 313 - Pickup attempt unsuccessful The pickup was unsuccessful. The reasons might be customer was absent, goods were not ready etc 450 - On the way Carier picked up the return from the customer and the return is on the way to the destination (warehouse or disposal) 600 - Delivered Carier picked up the return from the customer and the return was delivered to the final destination 946 - Cancelled The pick up failed, for some reason 950 - Cancelled The return was cancelled Step 3: In case you can’t find your order, or it has been cancelled Check again the status of the return in Fluent OMS or Magento and verify if return was opened correctly Check open Jira tickets by 4PL to Emma (Many orders are stuck in Jira waiting for a response). Search for Jira tickets on this portal that have the same order number as the one you are working on. 5. FAQ 5.a) How can I cancel the return with 4PL? When cancelling a return that is handled by 4PL, you must cancel the return in the OMS AND cancel the return with 4PL directly. Only when both have been completed, you have correctly cancelled the return. Go to the 4PL Jira portal and raise a 'Request to 4PL'. As the 'Request to 4PL' select 'Return cancellation' Ensure all other fields have been filled Emma Order Number : the order number Return ID : the return order number Market : the market Raise a request for the 4PL Central station to action or clarify (Add Emma Order Number in this field): 'Return cancellation of [put your order number]' Once you receive confirmation on the Jira ticket if the return was cancelled, the return will automatically be cancelled in the OMS too. You must not cancel the return in Fluent Commerce, as that will be done by 4PL. 5.b) The customer asks to change the pick up date The first action must always be to ask the customer to contact the return carrier directly. Only if that is not possible, do the following: For Magento Go to the 4PL Jira portal and raise a 'Request to 4PL'. As the 'Request to 4PL' select 'Pick-up rescheduling' Ensure all other fields have been filled Emma Order Number : the order number Return ID : the return order number Market : the market Raise a request for the 4PL Central station to action or clarify (Add Emma Order Number in this field): 'Change pick up date for [put your order number]' For Fluent Commerce If changing the pick up date is impossible via the return carrier, you must: Tell the customer that the the carrier might already be on the way. You will still attempt to cancel it, but it might be that the carrier will still go to the customer (because the cancellation will not reach them in time). Ask the customer to refuse the pick up when that happens. Ask 4PL to cancel the return (see 'How can I cancel the return') Once the return is cancelled, create a new return but ensure the pick up information is correct. 5.c) The customer asks to change the address for the pick up The first action must always be to ask the customer to contact the return carrier directly. Only if that is not possible, do the following: Go to the 4PL Jira portal and raise a 'Request to 4PL'. As the 'Request to 4PL' select 'Return adjustment' Ensure all other fields have been filled Emma Order Number : the order number Return ID : the return order number Market : the market Raise a request for the 4PL Central station to action or clarify (Add Emma Order Number in this field): 'Change pick up address for [put your order number]' If 4PL informs you that the return has already been scheduled and they cannot change the address, 4PL can sometimes cancel the return. If 4PL informs you that they have cancelled the return, you can create a new return with the corrected address. 5.d) The carrier did not pick up all the items Verify in the OMS if a return was created for all items. If there was no return created for all items, create a return for the additional items. If a return was created for the additional items, proceed with step 2. Verify the status of the return with the carrier. If everything was created correctly but the carrier did not show up yet, file a Jira ticket on the 4PL Jira portal. As the 'Request to 4PL' select 'Incorrect SKU category return' Ensure all other fields have been filled Emma Order Number : the order number Return ID : the return order number Market : the market Raise a request for the 4PL Central station to action or clarify (Add Emma Order Number in this field): Clearly describe the issue with the return. Follow up on the Jira ticket. 5.e) The carrier did not contact the customer Verify in the OMS if a return was created correctly for all items. If you don't know for sure if it was created correctly, review the 'How to verify if the return was created correctly' paragraph on the instruction page for the specific return situation. Be sure to check if the correct return method was picked for the item and condition . Meaning, if a return with 4PL was created but the item is an accessory, it is not the correct method for the return item and condition. Check the status of the return. The status must be set to 'Return created' after you created the return, and must never manually be set to organized. TIP : You can review the Activity log on the returns page, to see who/what changed the return status. If the return was created correctly, the status updates after 'Return created' will always be done by the system (not by an agent). If there was no return created for all items, create a return for the additional items. If a return was created for the additional items, proceed with step 3. Verify the status of the return with the carrier. You can use the instructions in the article 'Status tracking of Returns with 4PL CS'. If the return was not created correctly, please cancel the return and create a new one. Understand this means that the return will be created anew, and inform the customer of the expected timeline for the return. Don't know the timeline? Review the instruction page for the specific return situation. 5.f) The carrier never showed up on the promised pick up date Review the tracking information via Optilo. If you see that there was an issue with the return and the carrier did not show up indeed, do the following: Go to the 4PL Jira portal and raise a 'Request to 4PL'. As the 'Request to 4PL' select 'Other' Ensure all other fields have been filled Emma Order Number: the order number Return ID : the return order number Market : the market Raise a request for the 4PL Central station to action or clarify (Add Emma Order Number in this field): Clearly describe the issue with the return. Follow up on the Jira ticket. 5.g) The customer needs packing material, but they didn't receive any The customer needs packing material, but they didn't receive any Check the tracking information via Optilo, to ensure the packing material has not been delivered yet. It often happens that the packing material has already arrived in the meantime and that the item has been picked up. If this didn't happen, move to step 2. Confirm if the item condition in Fluent Commerce or Magento is set as 'unpacked'. If the status is set to 'packed', no packing material will be sent to the customer as the item is already packed. Check and contact the customer to get the exact item condition. If the item is (unpacked), kindly be informed that the return will be resubmitted. This means that the current return has to be canceled, and a new one will be initiated. Once the return is created correctly, the pickup will be assigned to a carrier within 7-10 normal days from the return creation date. The customer will receive the packaging material in the next days. 5.h) How do I get the proof of return? Only use this option if the customer doesn't have a proof of return themselves. Go to the 4PL Jira portal and raise a 'Request to 4PL'. As the 'Request to 4PL' select 'Other' Ensure all other fields have been filled Emma Order Number : the order number Return ID : the return order number Market : the market Raise a request for the 4PL Central station to action or clarify (Add Emma Order Number in this field): Clearly describe that you need a proof of return. How to initiate a return with Gebrüder Weiss Step 1: Ensure customer details: Phone number, email, and pick-up address must be correct. So the carrier can arrange the pick up. Step 2: Select all the items, inform the quantities, product conditions (packed/unpacked) and return reason. If the customer has to return a big item (mattress or bed) and an accessory, create only 1 return and add all the items. This way all items get picked up by the same carrier and the customer does not need to return any product separatly. Step 3: Pick-up date: Leave empty . Note: Banks or payment service providers (PSP) will have different deadlines to have the amount available reflected in their account. More detailed timelines per PSP can be found in the article 'Refund request'.
