If the return status is set to 'organized' manually, the return will not be recognized by our platforms, and it will never be forwarded to the return carrier. Please ensure the return status is 'Created' after you created the return. How are status updates handled for the return? 4PL CS will automatically update the status in the Order Management System (OMS). It may take 7-10 days to reflect in Fluent Commerce. For detailed updates, check 4PL's Optilo platform (see 'the article about 4PL Returns' article below). If no updates appear in Fluent Commerce after 10 days, please escalate the return status update via the 4PL CS Jira portal . 4. How the refund is triggered Returns are completed automatically in Fluent Commerceonce the carrier picks up the items. Refunds are initiated automatically once the return is marked as complete. Banks or payment service providers (PSP) have different timelines for processing refunds. Check the 'Refund request' article for details. If customers have questions after the refund is completed, they should contact their bank or PSP for more information. 5. When can this return ticket be considered 'Resolved'? Once you have successfully created the return and have verified that it was created correctly, you can mark the case as 'resolved'. 6. FAQ 1. Looking for more info on 4PL returns? Check out the 4PL article . More about 4PL Returns 4PL Information 4PL Central Station (referred to as 4PL or 4PLCS) is an intermediary party between Emma and return carriers. They organize returns for some product categories in some markets for us. TABLE OF CONTENTS What does 4PLCS do? How to request a return from 4PLCS? How to handle customer requests, when 4PLCS manages the return? How to: Status tracking with 4PL CS FAQ How can I cancel the return with 4PL? The customer asks to change the pick up date The customer asks to change the address for the pick up The carrier did not pick up all the items The carrier did not contact the customer The carrier never showed up on the promised pick up date The customer needs packing material, but they didn't receive any How do I get the proof of return? 1. What does 4PLCS do? This company takes over a few tasks: Deciding which return carrier to use for which products Arranging the return with the return carrier Communicating with the carrier when something did not go as planned Tracking the status of the returns Notifying Emma when the product was returned so we can start the refund process 2. How to: Request a return from 4PLCS? In Fluent Commerce , the assigned to 4PL is automatically. In Magento, you will then need to select “4PLCS” as the return method in Magento (including the pick-up date for category 2 items) and then the return will automatically be arranged. 3. How to: Handle customer requests, when 4PLCS manages the return? In the 4PLCS team, there is a team of operations managers who will handle your requests regarding returns. You can reach them via the 4PL Jira Portal [ link to 4PL Jira portal ]. Return cancellation Return adjustment (e.g. change pick-up address or customer contact info) Pick-up re-scheduling Others You will also need to provide the order number and the return ID from the OMS (Magento or Fluent). 4. How to: Status tracking with 4PL CS Status tracking for 4PL returns with Optilo Returns can be tracked using 4PL CS's own system called 'Optilo'. Optilo can be accessed via this link [ OPTILO / Tracking - search ] Note : It can take 2-3 days since the return was created to show up in Optilo. Wait for 2-3 days before checking to get a more reliable insight. Step 1: Access Optilo portal and search order Access the following web page: OPTILO / Tracking - search Depending on the ID you have select the following reference type: These IDs then be found in Fluent and Magento respectively. Complete captcha and then hit 'Search' order. ID Emma Reference name Fluent Return ID: 00xx-xxxx-xxxxx-x Magento return: “Order Number” Sales order no. 2 [MH1] ​ Step 2: Identify the status of the return Identify the order Click on 'No.' and check 'Events' sections. Real date is the actual date To understand the status of the return, use the following table. Status Explanation 100 - Created Return was newly created 250 - Planned Return is planned and waiting for carrier respose 290 - Confirmed by carrier Carrier has confirmed reception of the return to be scheduled on their system 313 - Pickup attempt unsuccessful The pickup was unsuccessful. The reasons might be customer was absent, goods were not ready etc 450 - On the way Carier picked up the return from the customer and the return is on the way to the destination (warehouse or disposal) 600 - Delivered Carier picked up the return from the customer and the return was delivered to the final destination 946 - Cancelled The pick up failed, for some reason 950 - Cancelled The return was cancelled Step 3: In case you can’t find your order, or it has been cancelled Check again the status of the return in Fluent OMS or Magento and verify if return was opened correctly Check open Jira tickets by 4PL to Emma (Many orders are stuck in Jira waiting for a response). Search for Jira tickets on this portal that have the same order number as the one you are working on. 5. FAQ 5.a) How can I cancel the return with 4PL? When cancelling a return that is handled by 4PL, you must cancel the return in the OMS AND cancel the return with 4PL directly. Only when both have been completed, you have correctly cancelled the return. Go to the 4PL Jira portal and raise a 'Request to 4PL'. As the 'Request to 4PL' select 'Return cancellation' Ensure all other fields have been filled Emma Order Number : the order number Return ID : the return order number Market : the market Raise a request for the 4PL Central station to action or clarify (Add Emma Order Number in this field): 'Return cancellation of [put your order number]' Once you receive confirmation on the Jira ticket if the return was cancelled, the return will automatically be cancelled in the OMS too. You must not cancel the return in Fluent Commerce, as that will be done by 4PL. 5.b) The customer asks to change the pick up date The first action must always be to ask the customer to contact the return carrier directly. Only if that is not possible, do the following: For Magento Go to the 4PL Jira portal and raise a 'Request to 4PL'. As the 'Request to 4PL' select 'Pick-up rescheduling' Ensure all other fields have been filled Emma Order Number : the order number Return ID : the return order number Market : the market Raise a request for the 4PL Central station to action or clarify (Add Emma Order Number in this field): 'Change pick up date for [put your order number]' For Fluent Commerce If changing the pick up date is impossible via the return carrier, you must: Tell the customer that the the carrier might already be on the way. You will still attempt to cancel it, but it might be that the carrier will still go to the customer (because the cancellation will not reach them in time). Ask the customer to refuse the pick up when that happens. Ask 4PL to cancel the return (see 'How can I cancel the return') Once the return is cancelled, create a new return but ensure the pick up information is correct. 5.c) The customer asks to change the address for the pick up The first action must always be to ask the customer to contact the return carrier directly. Only if that is not possible, do the following: Go to the 4PL Jira portal and raise a 'Request to 4PL'. As the 'Request to 4PL' select 'Return adjustment' Ensure all other fields have been filled Emma Order Number : the order number Return ID : the return order number Market : the market Raise a request for the 4PL Central station to action or clarify (Add Emma Order Number in this field): 'Change pick up address for [put your order number]' If 4PL informs you that the return has already been scheduled and they cannot change the address, 4PL can sometimes cancel the return. If 4PL informs you that they have cancelled the return, you can create a new return with the corrected address. 5.d) The carrier did not pick up all the items Verify in the OMS if a return was created for all items. If there was no return created for all items, create a return for the additional items. If a return was created for the additional items, proceed with step 2. Verify the status of the return with the carrier. If everything was created correctly but the carrier did not show up yet, file a Jira ticket on the 4PL Jira portal. As the 'Request to 4PL' select 'Incorrect SKU category return' Ensure all other fields have been filled Emma Order Number : the order number Return ID : the return order number Market : the market Raise a request for the 4PL Central station to action or clarify (Add Emma Order Number in this field): Clearly describe the issue with the return. Follow up on the Jira ticket. 5.e) The carrier did not contact the customer Verify in the OMS if a return was created correctly for all items. If you don't know for sure if it was created correctly, review the 'How to verify if the return was created correctly' paragraph on the instruction page for the specific return situation. Be sure to check if the correct return method was picked for the item and condition . Meaning, if a return with 4PL was created but the item is an accessory, it is not the correct method for the return item and condition. Check the status of the return. The status must be set to 'Return created' after you created the return, and must never manually be set to organized. TIP : You can review the Activity log on the returns page, to see who/what changed the return status. If the return was created correctly, the status updates after 'Return created' will always be done by the system (not by an agent). If there was no return created for all items, create a return for the additional items. If a return was created for the additional items, proceed with step 3. Verify the status of the return with the carrier. You can use the instructions in the article 'Status tracking of Returns with 4PL CS'. If the return was not created correctly, please cancel the return and create a new one. Understand this means that the return will be created anew, and inform the customer of the expected timeline for the return. Don't know the timeline? Review the instruction page for the specific return situation. 5.f) The carrier never showed up on the promised pick up date Review the tracking information via Optilo. If you see that there was an issue with the return and the carrier did not show up indeed, do the following: Go to the 4PL Jira portal and raise a 'Request to 4PL'. As the 'Request to 4PL' select 'Other' Ensure all other fields have been filled Emma Order Number: the order number Return ID : the return order number Market : the market Raise a request for the 4PL Central station to action or clarify (Add Emma Order Number in this field): Clearly describe the issue with the return. Follow up on the Jira ticket. 5.g) The customer needs packing material, but they didn't receive any The customer needs packing material, but they didn't receive any Check the tracking information via Optilo, to ensure the packing material has not been delivered yet. It often happens that the packing material has already arrived in the meantime and that the item has been picked up. If this didn't happen, move to step 2. Confirm if the item condition in Fluent Commerce or Magento is set as 'unpacked'. If the status is set to 'packed', no packing material will be sent to the customer as the item is already packed. Check and contact the customer to get the exact item condition. If the item is (unpacked), kindly be informed that the return will be resubmitted. This means that the current return has to be canceled, and a new one will be initiated. Once the return is created correctly, the pickup will be assigned to a carrier within 7-10 normal days from the return creation date. The customer will receive the packaging material in the next days. 5.h) How do I get the proof of return? Only use this option if the customer doesn't have a proof of return themselves. Go to the 4PL Jira portal and raise a 'Request to 4PL'. As the 'Request to 4PL' select 'Other' Ensure all other fields have been filled Emma Order Number : the order number Return ID : the return order number Market : the market Raise a request for the 4PL Central station to action or clarify (Add Emma Order Number in this field): Clearly describe that you need a proof of return. FAQ 1. How to initiate a return with GLS The return process is streamlined through Robotic Process Automation (RPA). 1.a) First: Initiate Return on Fluent Commerce Fluent Commerce Create a return request on the OMS. To review the basics, visit Fluent Commerce return Make sure the address and contact information of the customer are correctly noted in the OMS. Ask the customer for preferred pick-up date . At least 2 working days in advance, and it cannot be during the weekend. !IMPORTANT! for Returns in Fluent: You must set a pick-up date when creating the Return. If this field is left empty, the return will not get sent to GLS and will stay stuck. Note: we cannot promise GLS will perform the pick up on that same date, see communication tips below. 1.b) Second: Automated Assignment to the Carrier Once the return is created, it is automatically assigned to 4PL, which is our Fourth Party Logistics partner. 4PL then assigns the return shipment to GLS, the carrier responsible for handling 1MH products. 2. Important information for setting customer expectations GLS does not communicate with customers about the pick up date. While we ask for a pick up date, GLS is responsible for organizing the day and time of the pick up. After you have created the return request in the OMS, it will automatically be transmitted to 4PL CS. 4PL CS will schedule a time for collection with the customer within 7 to 10 days. 3. How to verify if the order was created correctly The order for a GLS return with 4PL CS is created correctly if: All the customer information is correct The carrier field is left empty (later, this field might be updated to 'GLS_DE' automatically, this is not an issue) The pick up date field is NOT left empty There must always be a pick up date filled when you create a return with GLS. The status of the return is 'Created' If any of this is incorrect, cancel the return and create a new return. The return must never be manually set to 'Organized' . If the return status is set to 'organized' manually, the return will not be recognized by our platforms, and it will never be forwarded to the return carrier. Please ensure the return status is 'Created' after you created the return. ​ 4. Status updates in the OMS The status updates in the OMS are automatically updated. 5. How the refund is triggered Once the return is completed via the drop off, the status in the OMs will get updated automatically to 'Complete'. This status update will then automatically trigger the refund process. Once the refund is initiated, banks or payment service providers (PSP) will have different deadlines to have the amount available reflected in their account. More detailed timelines per PPS can be found in the article 'Refund request'. If the customer reaches us after we already completed the refund, they should reach out directly to their bank or payment provider company to get further information and more specific deadlines. 6. When can this return ticket be considered 'Resolved'? Once you have successfully created the return and have verified that it was created correctly, you can mark the case as 'resolved'. 7. FAQ You can visit the FAQ here. Because the return is handled by 4PL CS, review the FAQ for returns managed by 4PL CS. FAQ 1. How to initiate a return with GLS The return process is streamlined through Robotic Process Automation (RPA). 1.a) First: Initiate Return on Magento Magento : Create a return request on the OMS. To review the basics, visit Magento return Make sure the address and contact information of the customer are correctly noted in the OMS. Ask the customer for preferred pick-up date . At least 2 working days in advance, and it cannot be during the weekend. Note: we cannot promise GLS will perform the pick up on that same date, see communication tips below. 1.b) Second: Automated Assignment to the Carrier Once the return is created, it is automatically assigned to 4PL, which is our Fourth Party Logistics partner. 4PL then assigns the return shipment to GLS, the carrier responsible for handling 1MH products. 2. Important information for setting customer expectations GLS does not communicate with customers about the pick up date. While we ask for a pick up date, GLS is responsible for organizing the day and time of the pick up. After you have created the return request in the OMS, it will automatically be transmitted to 4PL CS. 4PL CS will schedule a time for collection with the customer within 7 to 10 days. 3. How to verify if the order was created correctly All the customer information is correct The carrier field is set to '4PL CS' The pick up date field is NOT left empty There must always be a pick up date filled when you create a return with GLS. The status of the return is 'Created' 4. Status updates in the OMS Thee status updates in the OMS are automatically updated. 5. How the refund is triggered Once the return is completed via the drop off, the status in the OMs will get updated automatically to 'Complete'. This status update will then automatically trigger the refund process. Once the refund is initiated, banks or payment service providers (PSP) will have different deadlines to have the amount available reflected in their account. More detailed timelines per PPS can be found in the article 'Refund request'. If the customer reaches us after we already completed the refund, they should reach out directly to their bank or payment provider company to get further information and more specific deadlines. 6. When can this return ticket be considered 'Resolved'? Once you have successfully created the return and have verified that it was created correctly, you can mark the case as 'resolved'. 7. FAQ You can visit the FAQ here. Because the return is handled by 4PL CS, review the FAQ for returns managed by 4PL CS. All returns containing unpacked big toppers (bigger than 120cm wide), unpacked mattresses and/or beds. This also includes products that are Packed - Used/Re-packed Return instructions 1. How to Initiate a Return with DHL 2MH in Germany For Magento: Step 1 - Verify Customer Details : Ensure the correct phone number, email, and pick-up address are in the order. Step 2 - Select 2MH Service : Choose the 2MH pick-up/return service for all items, including accessories and mattresses. Step 3: Create Return : Quality: Select "Packed" (A), "Unpacked" (B), or "Faulty" (C). Pick-up/return service: Select "4PLCS". Packing Material: Choose "No". Leave comment, pick-up date, and ParcelLab ID fields empty. Step 4 - Inform Customer : Provide important information for setting customer expectations. 2. Important Information for Customers Unpacked Mattresses: Customers will receive packaging material to wrap the mattress. Beds : Customers must disassemble the bed themselves. Scheduling : DHL will contact the customer to schedule a pick-up appointment. Do not promise a specific date. 3. Verifying the Return Magento Ensure customer details are correct, return date is empty, and carrier field is "4PL CS". 4. Status Updates Status updates are automated and reflected in the Order Management System (OMS). It may take 7-10 days for updates to appear in Magento For detailed updates, check 4PL's platform, Optilo. If you see no update after 10 working days, please reach out to 4PL's Jira Portal to request for an update. 5. Refund Process Refunds are initiated automatically once the return is marked as complete. Banks or payment service providers have different timelines for processing refunds. 6. Resolving the Return Ticket Mark the case as "resolved" once the return is created and verified correctly. 7. Link to the DHL 2MH Portal in DE https://www.dhl.de/de/privatkunden.html 8. FAQ More about 4PL Retturns 4PL Information 4PL Central Station (referred to as 4PL or 4PLCS) is an intermediary party between Emma and return carriers. They organize returns for some product categories in some markets for us. TABLE OF CONTENTS What does 4PLCS do? How to request a return from 4PLCS? How to handle customer requests, when 4PLCS manages the return? How to: Status tracking with 4PL CS FAQ How can I cancel the return with 4PL? The customer asks to change the pick up date The customer asks to change the address for the pick up The carrier did not pick up all the items The carrier did not contact the customer The carrier never showed up on the promised pick up date The customer needs packing material, but they didn't receive any How do I get the proof of return? 1. What does 4PLCS do? This company takes over a few tasks: Deciding which return carrier to use for which products Arranging the return with the return carrier Communicating with the carrier when something did not go as planned Tracking the status of the returns Notifying Emma when the product was returned so we can start the refund process 2. How to: Request a return from 4PLCS? In Fluent Commerce , the assigned to 4PL is automatically. In Magento, you will then need to select “4PLCS” as the return method in Magento (including the pick-up date for category 2 items) and then the return will automatically be arranged. 3. How to: Handle customer requests, when 4PLCS manages the return? In the 4PLCS team, there is a team of operations managers who will handle your requests regarding returns. You can reach them via the 4PL Jira Portal [ link to 4PL Jira portal ]. Return cancellation Return adjustment (e.g. change pick-up address or customer contact info) Pick-up re-scheduling Others You will also need to provide the order number and the return ID from the OMS (Magento or Fluent). 4. How to: Status tracking with 4PL CS Status tracking for 4PL returns with Optilo Returns can be tracked using 4PL CS's own system called 'Optilo'. Optilo can be accessed via this link [ OPTILO / Tracking - search ] Note : It can take 2-3 days since the return was created to show up in Optilo. Wait for 2-3 days before checking to get a more reliable insight. Step 1: Access Optilo portal and search order Access the following web page: OPTILO / Tracking - search Depending on the ID you have select the following reference type: These IDs then be found in Fluent and Magento respectively. Complete captcha and then hit 'Search' order. ID Emma Reference name Fluent Return ID: 00xx-xxxx-xxxxx-x Magento return: “Order Number” Sales order no. 2 [MH1] ​ Step 2: Identify the status of the return Identify the order Click on 'No.' and check 'Events' sections. Real date is the actual date To understand the status of the return, use the following table. Status Explanation 100 - Created Return was newly created 250 - Planned Return is planned and waiting for carrier respose 290 - Confirmed by carrier Carrier has confirmed reception of the return to be scheduled on their system 313 - Pickup attempt unsuccessful The pickup was unsuccessful. The reasons might be customer was absent, goods were not ready etc 450 - On the way Carier picked up the return from the customer and the return is on the way to the destination (warehouse or disposal) 600 - Delivered Carier picked up the return from the customer and the return was delivered to the final destination 946 - Cancelled The pick up failed, for some reason 950 - Cancelled The return was cancelled Step 3: In case you can’t find your order, or it has been cancelled Check again the status of the return in Fluent OMS or Magento and verify if return was opened correctly Check open Jira tickets by 4PL to Emma (Many orders are stuck in Jira waiting for a response). Search for Jira tickets on this portal that have the same order number as the one you are working on. 5. FAQ 5.a) How can I cancel the return with 4PL? When cancelling a return that is handled by 4PL, you must cancel the return in the OMS AND cancel the return with 4PL directly. Only when both have been completed, you have correctly cancelled the return. Go to the 4PL Jira portal and raise a 'Request to 4PL'. As the 'Request to 4PL' select 'Return cancellation' Ensure all other fields have been filled Emma Order Number : the order number Return ID : the return order number Market : the market Raise a request for the 4PL Central station to action or clarify (Add Emma Order Number in this field): 'Return cancellation of [put your order number]' Once you receive confirmation on the Jira ticket if the return was cancelled, the return will automatically be cancelled in the OMS too. You must not cancel the return in Fluent Commerce, as that will be done by 4PL. 5.b) The customer asks to change the pick up date The first action must always be to ask the customer to contact the return carrier directly. Only if that is not possible, do the following: For Magento Go to the 4PL Jira portal and raise a 'Request to 4PL'. As the 'Request to 4PL' select 'Pick-up rescheduling' Ensure all other fields have been filled Emma Order Number : the order number Return ID : the return order number Market : the market Raise a request for the 4PL Central station to action or clarify (Add Emma Order Number in this field): 'Change pick up date for [put your order number]' For Fluent Commerce If changing the pick up date is impossible via the return carrier, you must: Tell the customer that the the carrier might already be on the way. You will still attempt to cancel it, but it might be that the carrier will still go to the customer (because the cancellation will not reach them in time). Ask the customer to refuse the pick up when that happens. Ask 4PL to cancel the return (see 'How can I cancel the return') Once the return is cancelled, create a new return but ensure the pick up information is correct. 5.c) The customer asks to change the address for the pick up The first action must always be to ask the customer to contact the return carrier directly. Only if that is not possible, do the following: Go to the 4PL Jira portal and raise a 'Request to 4PL'. As the 'Request to 4PL' select 'Return adjustment' Ensure all other fields have been filled Emma Order Number : the order number Return ID : the return order number Market : the market Raise a request for the 4PL Central station to action or clarify (Add Emma Order Number in this field): 'Change pick up address for [put your order number]' If 4PL informs you that the return has already been scheduled and they cannot change the address, 4PL can sometimes cancel the return. If 4PL informs you that they have cancelled the return, you can create a new return with the corrected address. 5.d) The carrier did not pick up all the items Verify in the OMS if a return was created for all items. If there was no return created for all items, create a return for the additional items. If a return was created for the additional items, proceed with step 2. Verify the status of the return with the carrier. If everything was created correctly but the carrier did not show up yet, file a Jira ticket on the 4PL Jira portal. As the 'Request to 4PL' select 'Incorrect SKU category return' Ensure all other fields have been filled Emma Order Number : the order number Return ID : the return order number Market : the market Raise a request for the 4PL Central station to action or clarify (Add Emma Order Number in this field): Clearly describe the issue with the return. Follow up on the Jira ticket. 5.e) The carrier did not contact the customer Verify in the OMS if a return was created correctly for all items. If you don't know for sure if it was created correctly, review the 'How to verify if the return was created correctly' paragraph on the instruction page for the specific return situation. Be sure to check if the correct return method was picked for the item and condition . Meaning, if a return with 4PL was created but the item is an accessory, it is not the correct method for the return item and condition. Check the status of the return. The status must be set to 'Return created' after you created the return, and must never manually be set to organized. TIP : You can review the Activity log on the returns page, to see who/what changed the return status. If the return was created correctly, the status updates after 'Return created' will always be done by the system (not by an agent). If there was no return created for all items, create a return for the additional items. If a return was created for the additional items, proceed with step 3. Verify the status of the return with the carrier. You can use the instructions in the article 'Status tracking of Returns with 4PL CS'. If the return was not created correctly, please cancel the return and create a new one. Understand this means that the return will be created anew, and inform the customer of the expected timeline for the return. Don't know the timeline? Review the instruction page for the specific return situation. 5.f) The carrier never showed up on the promised pick up date Review the tracking information via Optilo. If you see that there was an issue with the return and the carrier did not show up indeed, do the following: Go to the 4PL Jira portal and raise a 'Request to 4PL'. As the 'Request to 4PL' select 'Other' Ensure all other fields have been filled Emma Order Number: the order number Return ID : the return order number Market : the market Raise a request for the 4PL Central station to action or clarify (Add Emma Order Number in this field): Clearly describe the issue with the return. Follow up on the Jira ticket. 5.g) The customer needs packing material, but they didn't receive any The customer needs packing material, but they didn't receive any Check the tracking information via Optilo, to ensure the packing material has not been delivered yet. It often happens that the packing material has already arrived in the meantime and that the item has been picked up. If this didn't happen, move to step 2. Confirm if the item condition in Fluent Commerce or Magento is set as 'unpacked'. If the status is set to 'packed', no packing material will be sent to the customer as the item is already packed. Check and contact the customer to get the exact item condition. If the item is (unpacked), kindly be informed that the return will be resubmitted. This means that the current return has to be canceled, and a new one will be initiated. Once the return is created correctly, the pickup will be assigned to a carrier within 7-10 normal days from the return creation date. The customer will receive the packaging material in the next days. 5.h) How do I get the proof of return? Only use this option if the customer doesn't have a proof of return themselves. Go to the 4PL Jira portal and raise a 'Request to 4PL'. As the 'Request to 4PL' select 'Other' Ensure all other fields have been filled Emma Order Number : the order number Return ID : the return order number Market : the market Raise a request for the 4PL Central station to action or clarify (Add Emma Order Number in this field): Clearly describe that you need a proof of return. This company takes over a few tasks: Deciding which return carrier to use for which products Arranging the return with the return carrier Communicating with the carrier when something did not go as planned Tracking the status of the returns Notifying Emma when the product was returned so we can start the refund process 2. How to: Request a return from 4PLCS? In Fluent Commerce , the assigned to 4PL is automatically. In Magento, you will then need to select “4PLCS” as the return method in Magento (including the pick-up date for category 2 items) and then the return will automatically be arranged. 3. How to: Handle customer requests, when 4PLCS manages the return? In the 4PLCS team, there is a team of operations managers who will handle your requests regarding returns. You can reach them via the 4PL Jira Portal [ link to 4PL Jira portal ]. Return cancellation Return adjustment (e.g. change pick-up address or customer contact info) Pick-up re-scheduling Others You will also need to provide the order number and the return ID from the OMS (Magento or Fluent). 4. How to: Status tracking with 4PL CS Status tracking for 4PL returns with Optilo Returns can be tracked using 4PL CS's own system called 'Optilo'. Optilo can be accessed via this link [ OPTILO / Tracking - search ] Note : It can take 2-3 days since the return was created to show up in Optilo. Wait for 2-3 days before checking to get a more reliable insight. Step 1: Access Optilo portal and search order Access the following web page: OPTILO / Tracking - search Depending on the ID you have select the following reference type: These IDs then be found in Fluent and Magento respectively. Complete captcha and then hit 'Search' order. ID Emma Reference name Fluent Return ID: 00xx-xxxx-xxxxx-x Magento return: “Order Number” Sales order no. 2 [MH1] ​ Step 2: Identify the status of the return Identify the order Click on 'No.' and check 'Events' sections. Real date is the actual date To understand the status of the return, use the following table. Status Explanation 100 - Created Return was newly created 250 - Planned Return is planned and waiting for carrier respose 290 - Confirmed by carrier Carrier has confirmed reception of the return to be scheduled on their system 313 - Pickup attempt unsuccessful The pickup was unsuccessful. The reasons might be customer was absent, goods were not ready etc 450 - On the way Carier picked up the return from the customer and the return is on the way to the destination (warehouse or disposal) 600 - Delivered Carier picked up the return from the customer and the return was delivered to the final destination 946 - Cancelled The pick up failed, for some reason 950 - Cancelled The return was cancelled Step 3: In case you can’t find your order, or it has been cancelled Check again the status of the return in Fluent OMS or Magento and verify if return was opened correctly Check open Jira tickets by 4PL to Emma (Many orders are stuck in Jira waiting for a response). Search for Jira tickets on this portal that have the same order number as the one you are working on. 5. FAQ 5.a) How can I cancel the return with 4PL? When cancelling a return that is handled by 4PL, you must cancel the return in the OMS AND cancel the return with 4PL directly. Only when both have been completed, you have correctly cancelled the return. Go to the 4PL Jira portal and raise a 'Request to 4PL'. As the 'Request to 4PL' select 'Return cancellation' Ensure all other fields have been filled Emma Order Number : the order number Return ID : the return order number Market : the market Raise a request for the 4PL Central station to action or clarify (Add Emma Order Number in this field): 'Return cancellation of [put your order number]' Once you receive confirmation on the Jira ticket if the return was cancelled, the return will automatically be cancelled in the OMS too. You must not cancel the return in Fluent Commerce, as that will be done by 4PL. 5.b) The customer asks to change the pick up date The first action must always be to ask the customer to contact the return carrier directly. Only if that is not possible, do the following: For Magento Go to the 4PL Jira portal and raise a 'Request to 4PL'. As the 'Request to 4PL' select 'Pick-up rescheduling' Ensure all other fields have been filled Emma Order Number : the order number Return ID : the return order number Market : the market Raise a request for the 4PL Central station to action or clarify (Add Emma Order Number in this field): 'Change pick up date for [put your order number]' For Fluent Commerce If changing the pick up date is impossible via the return carrier, you must: Tell the customer that the the carrier might already be on the way. You will still attempt to cancel it, but it might be that the carrier will still go to the customer (because the cancellation will not reach them in time). Ask the customer to refuse the pick up when that happens. Ask 4PL to cancel the return (see 'How can I cancel the return') Once the return is cancelled, create a new return but ensure the pick up information is correct. 5.c) The customer asks to change the address for the pick up The first action must always be to ask the customer to contact the return carrier directly. Only if that is not possible, do the following: Go to the 4PL Jira portal and raise a 'Request to 4PL'. As the 'Request to 4PL' select 'Return adjustment' Ensure all other fields have been filled Emma Order Number : the order number Return ID : the return order number Market : the market Raise a request for the 4PL Central station to action or clarify (Add Emma Order Number in this field): 'Change pick up address for [put your order number]' If 4PL informs you that the return has already been scheduled and they cannot change the address, 4PL can sometimes cancel the return. If 4PL informs you that they have cancelled the return, you can create a new return with the corrected address. 5.d) The carrier did not pick up all the items Verify in the OMS if a return was created for all items. If there was no return created for all items, create a return for the additional items. If a return was created for the additional items, proceed with step 2. Verify the status of the return with the carrier. If everything was created correctly but the carrier did not show up yet, file a Jira ticket on the 4PL Jira portal. As the 'Request to 4PL' select 'Incorrect SKU category return' Ensure all other fields have been filled Emma Order Number : the order number Return ID : the return order number Market : the market Raise a request for the 4PL Central station to action or clarify (Add Emma Order Number in this field): Clearly describe the issue with the return. Follow up on the Jira ticket. 5.e) The carrier did not contact the customer Verify in the OMS if a return was created correctly for all items. If you don't know for sure if it was created correctly, review the 'How to verify if the return was created correctly' paragraph on the instruction page for the specific return situation. Be sure to check if the correct return method was picked for the item and condition . Meaning, if a return with 4PL was created but the item is an accessory, it is not the correct method for the return item and condition. Check the status of the return. The status must be set to 'Return created' after you created the return, and must never manually be set to organized. TIP : You can review the Activity log on the returns page, to see who/what changed the return status. If the return was created correctly, the status updates after 'Return created' will always be done by the system (not by an agent). If there was no return created for all items, create a return for the additional items. If a return was created for the additional items, proceed with step 3. Verify the status of the return with the carrier. You can use the instructions in the article 'Status tracking of Returns with 4PL CS'. If the return was not created correctly, please cancel the return and create a new one. Understand this means that the return will be created anew, and inform the customer of the expected timeline for the return. Don't know the timeline? Review the instruction page for the specific return situation. 5.f) The carrier never showed up on the promised pick up date Review the tracking information via Optilo. If you see that there was an issue with the return and the carrier did not show up indeed, do the following: Go to the 4PL Jira portal and raise a 'Request to 4PL'. As the 'Request to 4PL' select 'Other' Ensure all other fields have been filled Emma Order Number: the order number Return ID : the return order number Market : the market Raise a request for the 4PL Central station to action or clarify (Add Emma Order Number in this field): Clearly describe the issue with the return. Follow up on the Jira ticket. 5.g) The customer needs packing material, but they didn't receive any The customer needs packing material, but they didn't receive any Check the tracking information via Optilo, to ensure the packing material has not been delivered yet. It often happens that the packing material has already arrived in the meantime and that the item has been picked up. If this didn't happen, move to step 2. Confirm if the item condition in Fluent Commerce or Magento is set as 'unpacked'. If the status is set to 'packed', no packing material will be sent to the customer as the item is already packed. Check and contact the customer to get the exact item condition. If the item is (unpacked), kindly be informed that the return will be resubmitted. This means that the current return has to be canceled, and a new one will be initiated. Once the return is created correctly, the pickup will be assigned to a carrier within 7-10 normal days from the return creation date. The customer will receive the packaging material in the next days. 5.h) How do I get the proof of return? Only use this option if the customer doesn't have a proof of return themselves. Go to the 4PL Jira portal and raise a 'Request to 4PL'. As the 'Request to 4PL' select 'Other' Ensure all other fields have been filled Emma Order Number : the order number Return ID : the return order number Market : the market Raise a request for the 4PL Central station to action or clarify (Add Emma Order Number in this field): Clearly describe that you need a proof of return. Follow up on the Jira ticket Summary More about 4PL Retturns 4PL Information 4PL Central Station (referred to as 4PL or 4PLCS) is an intermediary party between Emma and return carriers. How to Initiate a Return with DHL 2MH in Germany For Magento: Step 1 - Verify Customer Details : Ensure the correct phone number, email, and pick-up address are in the order. Step 2 - Select 2MH Service : Choose the 2MH pick-up/return service for all items, including accessories and mattresses. Step 3: Create Return : Quality: Select "Packed" (A), "Unpacked" (B), or "Faulty" (C). Pick-up/return service: Select "4PLCS". Packing Material: Choose "No". Leave comment, pick-up date, and ParcelLab ID fields empty. Step 4 - Inform Customer : Provide important information for setting customer expectations. 2. Important Information for Customers Unpacked Mattresses: Customers will receive packaging material to wrap the mattress. Beds : Customers must disassemble the bed themselves. Scheduling : DHL will contact the customer to schedule a pick-up appointment. Do not promise a specific date. 3. Verifying the Return Magento Ensure customer details are correct, return date is empty, and carrier field is "4PL CS". 4. Status Updates Status updates are automated and reflected in the Order Management System (OMS). It may take 7-10 days for updates to appear in Magento For detailed updates, check 4PL's platform, Optilo. If you see no update after 10 working days, please reach out to 4PL's Jira Portal to request for an update. 5. FAQ 1. How to initiate a return with GLS The return process is streamlined through Robotic Process Automation (RPA). 1.a) First: Initiate Return on Fluent Commerce Fluent Commerce Create a return request on the OMS. To review the basics, visit Fluent Commerce return Make sure the address and contact information of the customer are correctly noted in the OMS. Ask the customer for preferred pick-up date . At least 2 working days in advance, and it cannot be during the weekend. !IMPORTANT! for Returns in Fluent: You must set a pick-up date when creating the Return. If this field is left empty, the return will not get sent to GLS and will stay stuck. Note: we cannot promise GLS will perform the pick up on that same date, see communication tips below. 1.b) Second: Automated Assignment to the Carrier Once the return is created, it is automatically assigned to 4PL, which is our Fourth Party Logistics partner. 4PL then assigns the return shipment to GLS, the carrier responsible for handling 1MH products. 2. Important information for setting customer expectations GLS does not communicate with customers about the pick up date. While we ask for a pick up date, GLS is responsible for organizing the day and time of the pick up. After you have created the return request in the OMS, it will automatically be transmitted to 4PL CS. 4PL CS will schedule a time for collection with the customer within 7 to 10 days. 3. How to verify if the order was created correctly The order for a GLS return with 4PL CS is created correctly if: All the customer information is correct The carrier field is left empty (later, this field might be updated to 'GLS_DE' automatically, this is not an issue) The pick up date field is NOT left empty There must always be a pick up date filled when you create a return with GLS. The status of the return is 'Created' If any of this is incorrect, cancel the return and create a new return. The return must never be manually set to 'Organized' . If the return status is set to 'organized' manually, the return will not be recognized by our platforms, and it will never be forwarded to the return carrier. Please ensure the return status is 'Created' after you created the return. ​ 4. Status updates in the OMS The status updates in the OMS are automatically updated. 5. How the refund is triggered Once the return is completed via the drop off, the status in the OMs will get updated automatically to 'Complete'. This status update will then automatically trigger the refund process. Once the refund is initiated, banks or payment service providers (PSP) will have different deadlines to have the amount available reflected in their account. More detailed timelines per PPS can be found in the article 'Refund request'. If the customer reaches us after we already completed the refund, they should reach out directly to their bank or payment provider company to get further information and more specific deadlines. 6. When can this return ticket be considered 'Resolved'? Once you have successfully created the return and have verified that it was created correctly, you can mark the case as 'resolved'. 7. FAQ You can visit the FAQ here. Because the return is handled by 4PL CS, review the FAQ for returns managed by 4PL CS. How to handle customer requests, when 4PLCS manages the return? How to: Status tracking with 4PL CS FAQ How can I cancel the return with 4PL? The customer asks to change the pick up date The customer asks to change the address for the pick up The carrier did not pick up all the items The carrier did not contact the customer The carrier never showed up on the promised pick up date The customer needs packing material, but they didn't receive any How do I get the proof of return? 1. What does 4PLCS do? This company takes over a few tasks: Deciding which return carrier to use for which products Arranging the return with the return carrier Communicating with the carrier when something did not go as planned Tracking the status of the returns Notifying Emma when the product was returned so we can start the refund process 2. How to: Request a return from 4PLCS? In Fluent Commerce , the assigned to 4PL is automatically. In Magento, you will then need to select “4PLCS” as the return method in Magento (including the pick-up date for category 2 items) and then the return will automatically be arranged. 3. How to: Handle customer requests, when 4PLCS manages the return? In the 4PLCS team, there is a team of operations managers who will handle your requests regarding returns. You can reach them via the 4PL Jira Portal [ link to 4PL Jira portal ]. Return cancellation Return adjustment (e.g. change pick-up address or customer contact info) Pick-up re-scheduling Others You will also need to provide the order number and the return ID from the OMS (Magento or Fluent). 4. How to: Status tracking with 4PL CS Status tracking for 4PL returns with Optilo Returns can be tracked using 4PL CS's own system called 'Optilo'. Optilo can be accessed via this link [ OPTILO / Tracking - search ] Note : It can take 2-3 days since the return was created to show up in Optilo. Wait for 2-3 days before checking to get a more reliable insight. Step 1: Access Optilo portal and search order Access the following web page: OPTILO / Tracking - search Depending on the ID you have select the following reference type: These IDs then be found in Fluent and Magento respectively. Complete captcha and then hit 'Search' order. ID Emma Reference name Fluent Return ID: 00xx-xxxx-xxxxx-x Magento return: “Order Number” Sales order no. 2 [MH1] ​ Step 2: Identify the status of the return Identify the order Click on 'No.' and check 'Events' sections. Real date is the actual date To understand the status of the return, use the following table. Status Explanation 100 - Created Return was newly created 250 - Planned Return is planned and waiting for carrier respose 290 - Confirmed by carrier Carrier has confirmed reception of the return to be scheduled on their system 313 - Pickup attempt unsuccessful The pickup was unsuccessful. The reasons might be customer was absent, goods were not ready etc 450 - On the way Carier picked up the return from the customer and the return is on the way to the destination (warehouse or disposal) 600 - Delivered Carier picked up the return from the customer and the return was delivered to the final destination 946 - Cancelled The pick up failed, for some reason 950 - Cancelled The return was cancelled Step 3: In case you can’t find your order, or it has been cancelled Check again the status of the return in Fluent OMS or Magento and verify if return was opened correctly Check open Jira tickets by 4PL to Emma (Many orders are stuck in Jira waiting for a response). Search for Jira tickets on this portal that have the same order number as the one you are working on. 5. FAQ 5.a) How can I cancel the return with 4PL? When cancelling a return that is handled by 4PL, you must cancel the return in the OMS AND cancel the return with 4PL directly. Only when both have been completed, you have correctly cancelled the return. Go to the 4PL Jira portal and raise a 'Request to 4PL'. As the 'Request to 4PL' select 'Return cancellation' Ensure all other fields have been filled Emma Order Number : the order number Return ID : the return order number Market : the market Raise a request for the 4PL Central station to action or clarify (Add Emma Order Number in this field): 'Return cancellation of [put your order number]' Once you receive confirmation on the Jira ticket if the return was cancelled, the return will automatically be cancelled in the OMS too. You must not cancel the return in Fluent Commerce, as that will be done by 4PL. 5.b) The customer asks to change the pick up date The first action must always be to ask the customer to contact the return carrier directly. Only if that is not possible, do the following: For Magento Go to the 4PL Jira portal and raise a 'Request to 4PL'. As the 'Request to 4PL' select 'Pick-up rescheduling' Ensure all other fields have been filled Emma Order Number : the order number Return ID : the return order number Market : the market Raise a request for the 4PL Central station to action or clarify (Add Emma Order Number in this field): 'Change pick up date for [put your order number]' For Fluent Commerce If changing the pick up date is impossible via the return carrier, you must: Tell the customer that the the carrier might already be on the way. You will still attempt to cancel it, but it might be that the carrier will still go to the customer (because the cancellation will not reach them in time). Ask the customer to refuse the pick up when that happens. Ask 4PL to cancel the return (see 'How can I cancel the return') Once the return is cancelled, create a new return but ensure the pick up information is correct. 5.c) The customer asks to change the address for the pick up The first action must always be to ask the customer to contact the return carrier directly. Only if that is not possible, do the following: Go to the 4PL Jira portal and raise a 'Request to 4PL'. As the 'Request to 4PL' select 'Return adjustment' Ensure all other fields have been filled Emma Order Number : the order number Return ID : the return order number Market : the market Raise a request for the 4PL Central station to action or clarify (Add Emma Order Number in this field): 'Change pick up address for [put your order number]' If 4PL informs you that the return has already been scheduled and they cannot change the address, 4PL can sometimes cancel the return. If 4PL informs you that they have cancelled the return, you can create a new return with the corrected address. 5.d) The carrier did not pick up all the items Verify in the OMS if a return was created for all items. If there was no return created for all items, create a return for the additional items. If a return was created for the additional items, proceed with step 2. Verify the status of the return with the carrier. If everything was created correctly but the carrier did not show up yet, file a Jira ticket on the 4PL Jira portal. As the 'Request to 4PL' select 'Incorrect SKU category return' Ensure all other fields have been filled Emma Order Number : the order number Return ID : the return order number Market : the market Raise a request for the 4PL Central station to action or clarify (Add Emma Order Number in this field): Clearly describe the issue with the return. Follow up on the Jira ticket. 5.e) The carrier did not contact the customer Verify in the OMS if a return was created correctly for all items. If you don't know for sure if it was created correctly, review the 'How to verify if the return was created correctly' paragraph on the instruction page for the specific return situation. Be sure to check if the correct return method was picked for the item and condition . Meaning, if a return with 4PL was created but the item is an accessory, it is not the correct method for the return item and condition. Check the status of the return. The status must be set to 'Return created' after you created the return, and must never manually be set to organized. TIP : You can review the Activity log on the returns page, to see who/what changed the return status. If the return was created correctly, the status updates after 'Return created' will always be done by the system (not by an agent). If there was no return created for all items, create a return for the additional items. If a return was created for the additional items, proceed with step 3. Verify the status of the return with the carrier. You can use the instructions in the article 'Status tracking of Returns with 4PL CS'. If the return was not created correctly, please cancel the return and create a new one. Understand this means that the return will be created anew, and inform the customer of the expected timeline for the return. Don't know the timeline? Review the instruction page for the specific return situation. 5.f) The carrier never showed up on the promised pick up date Review the tracking information via Optilo. If you see that there was an issue with the return and the carrier did not show up indeed, do the following: Go to the 4PL Jira portal and raise a 'Request to 4PL'. As the 'Request to 4PL' select 'Other' Ensure all other fields have been filled Emma Order Number: the order number Return ID : the return order number Market : the market Raise a request for the 4PL Central station to action or clarify (Add Emma Order Number in this field): Clearly describe the issue with the return. Follow up on the Jira ticket. 5.g) The customer needs packing material, but they didn't receive any The customer needs packing material, but they didn't receive any Check the tracking information via Optilo, to ensure the packing material has not been delivered yet. It often happens that the packing material has already arrived in the meantime and that the item has been picked up. If this didn't happen, move to step 2. Confirm if the item condition in Fluent Commerce or Magento is set as 'unpacked'. If the status is set to 'packed', no packing material will be sent to the customer as the item is already packed. Check and contact the customer to get the exact item condition. If the item is (unpacked), kindly be informed that the return will be resubmitted. This means that the current return has to be canceled, and a new one will be initiated. Once the return is created correctly, the pickup will be assigned to a carrier within 7-10 normal days from the return creation date. The customer will receive the packaging material in the next days. 5.h) How do I get the proof of return? Only use this option if the customer doesn't have a proof of return themselves. Go to the 4PL Jira portal and raise a 'Request to 4PL'. As the 'Request to 4PL' select 'Other' Ensure all other fields have been filled Emma Order Number : the order number Return ID : the return order number Market : the market Raise a request for the 4PL Central station to action or clarify (Add Emma Order Number in this field): Clearly describe that you need a proof of return. If the customer reaches us after we already completed the refund, they should reach out directly to their bank or payment provider company to get further information and more specific deadlines. 6. When can this return ticket be considered 'Resolved'? Once you have successfully created the return and have verified that it was created correctly, you can mark the case as 'resolved'. 7. FAQ Note : Since these returns are managed by 4PL, be sure to also check the 4PL documentation if you cannot find your answer here Magento Accessories only Return method: Drop-off label Carrier: DHL Return Portal available? No PacelLab tracking available? No Return Information Table of Contents How to initiate a return Returns via the Returns portal Manual creation of a return with DHL How the refund is triggered When can this case be resolved FAQ 1. How to initiate a return There are two options for creating a return of an accessory with DHL, a) via the Returns Portal (Fluent Commerce orders only) or b) manually. The preferred method is always to use the Returns Portal as this will automate the process without need of manual actions. Step by step guide (read carefully): Ask the customer to enter his/her data and to also add the order nr. in the reference field (this is important to track the return afterwards) If the customer has more than one parcel, ask him/her to create as many return labels as there are parcels using the link. (or do it for the customer) (If you want to take the time and do the customer a favour, you may do steps 2./3. and 4 for the customer and send the customer the finished return label) Ask the customer to print this label and to paste it on the box Some parcel shops also provide a printing service. The customer can review their parcel shop on this page, to see if it offers a printing service for the return label. Inform the customer that product(s) must be returned inside a square-shaped cardboard box or plastic bag with following maximum dimensions, otherwise it might be rejected at the drop-off point. Ask the customer to keep the return receipt until the refund is issued. The customer needs to send us a proof of return. Once we receive the proof of return, you need to manually update the status of the return to 'Complete'. Once the status is set to 'Complete', this will trigger the refund process. If the customer did not receive the e-mail: Provide the customer this link here depending on the market (copy the link as is, do not click in before): DE : https://www.dhl.de/retoure/gw/rpcustomerweb/OrderEntry.action?hash=b74d0a3d3565d92a1fd6166d3d527cb9f65231891d1a9f5557de44052f0fb709 AT : https://www.dhl.de/retoure/gw/rpcustomerweb/OrderEntry.action?hash=a582de6c9ab94d077939c3cde3d606b5df9be8e25dbadab526c3dbd398054947 BE : https://www.dhl.de/retoure/gw/rpcustomerweb/OrderEntry.action?hash=ca377a67ceb65c29b6d3ed70f01c037cac4e045c6b1551a9f33084f9ecacd986 NL : https://www.dhl.de/retoure/gw/rpcustomerweb/OrderEntry.action?hash=468830c161c8f22c1bcb723a69be3b5736812c7e92f9a828216e7d0eef1c954f PL : https://www.dhl.de/retoure/gw/rpcustomerweb/OrderEntry.action?hash=3edff50f0871f4980c149691d7d5b6dd82e3ba0db6ded07294cc3582ba847035 CH : https://www.dhl.de/retoure/gw/rpcustomerweb/OrderEntry.action?hash=84ab809c4a9228587abad89ceb44008d9a071f02c3afa142a2920e0989383ea7 UK : TBD FR : https://www.dhl.de/retoure/gw/rpcustomerweb/OrderEntry.action?hash=da08269d8316fa7775f735341a4363669c80a3deb4165e2b3ad87cc97c1a67cd Only for DE : also offer option to present the QR-code when handing over the parcel (multiple parcels: repeat for every parcel with a different return label. DHL will only accept one-time usage of a label.) ​ Ask the customer to return the parcel thef following ways: DE : DHL parcel shop, pack station or take away from DHL delivery person (further info here: https://www.dhl.de/de/privatkunden/pakete-versenden/retoure.html) The customer also has option to book a pick-up with DHL using the following link, but has to pay the additional fee (currently 3€) him/herself in the booking portal: https://www.dhl.de/de/privatkunden/pakete-versenden/online-frankieren.html?type=Pickup AT : ÖPAG parcel shop, handover to the ÖPAG Postmen or drop-off in parcel locker CH : Swiss post parcel shop or drop-off in parcel locker NL : PostNL parcel shop or handover to the PostNL Postmen (max. 5 items for take away) BE : BPost parcel shop PL : Poczta Polska parcel shop UK : TBD FR : TBD Important note: Product(s) must be returned inside a square-shaped cardboard box or plastic bag with following maximum dimensions, otherwise it might be rejected at the drop-off point.: DE: 120x60x60cm /31.5kg (unpacked possible with certain drop-off points) AT: 100x60x60cm / 31.5kg CH: 120x60x60cm / 30.0kg NL: 120x50x50cm / 30.0kg BE: 120x60x60cm / 30.0kg PL: 120x60x60cm / 31.5kg UK: TBD FR: TBD Ask the customer to keep the return receipt until the refund is issued. 2. How the refund is triggered For Fluent Commerce Once the return is completed via the drop off, the status in Fluent Commerce will get updated automatically to 'Complete'. This status update will then automatically trigger the refund process. 3. When can this case be considered resolved? Once the customer has his/her return label, and they have no further questions, you can close the ticket. 4. FAQ Couldn't find your answer in the FAQ? Please escalate to your supervisor. They will get in touch with Emma to clarify your concerns. Returns containing Mattresses and/or Beds Return method: 1 or 2 men handling (MH) Carrier: Gebrüder Weiss Return Portal available? No PacelLab tracking available? No Return instructions How to initiate a return with Gebrüder Weiss Important information for setting customer expectations How to verify if the return was created correctly How are status updates handled for the return? How the refund is triggered When can this return ticket be considered 'Resolved'? Have other questions about Gebrüder Weiss returns? 1. How to initiate a return with Gebrüder Weiss Step 1: Ensure customer details: Phone number, email, and pick-up address must be correct. So the carrier can arrange the pick up. Step 2: Select all the items, inform the quantities, product conditions (packed/unpacked) and return reason. If the customer has to return a big item (mattress or bed) and an accessory, create only 1 return and add all the items. This way all items get picked up by the same carrier and the customer does not need to return any product separatly. Step 3: Pick-up date: Leave empty . Step 4: For Fluent Commerce only: Status will be 'Created' automatically. Do not mark the return as 'Organized' manually. 2. Important information for setting customer expectations Gebrüder Weiss will contact the customer to schedule a pick-up. Never promise a pick-up date; it must be arranged with the carrier. Gebrüder Weiss will send one or two employees with a truck for collection. 3. How to verify if the return was created correctly In Fluent Commerce The customer contact details are correct The return status must be set to 'Created' The return date must be left empty (After saving, this might be updated to 'GW_AT' or 'GW_DE' automatically by the tool, this is not an issue) The carrier field is left empty Note : Do not manually set the status to 'Organized'. If the return status is set to 'organized' manually, the return will not be recognized by our platforms, and it will never be forwarded to the return carrier. Please ensure the return status is 'Created' after you created the return. ​ 4. How are status updates handled for the return? 4PL CS updates the status in the Order Management System (OMS) within 7-10 days. For detailed updates, check 4PL's Optilo platform. If no updates after 10 days, escalate via the 4PL CS Jira portal . 5. How the refund is triggered Fluent Commerce: Status updates to 'Complete' automatically trigger the refund. Note: Banks or payment service providers (PSP) will have different deadlines to have the amount available reflected in their account. More detailed timelines per PSP can be found in the article 'Refund request'. If the customer reaches us after we already completed the refund, they should reach out directly to their bank or payment provider company to get further information and more specific deadlines. 6. When can this return ticket be considered 'Resolved'? Once you have successfully created the return and have verified that it was created correctly, you can mark the case as 'resolved'. 7. FAQ Note : Since these returns are managed by 4PL, be sure to also check the 4PL documentation if you cannot find your answer here More about 4PL Returns 4PL Information 4PL Central Station (referred to as 4PL or 4PLCS) is an intermediary party between Emma and return carriers. They organize returns for some product categories in some markets for us. TABLE OF CONTENTS What does 4PLCS do? How to request a return from 4PLCS? How to handle customer requests, when 4PLCS manages the return? How to: Status tracking with 4PL CS FAQ How can I cancel the return with 4PL? The customer asks to change the pick up date The customer asks to change the address for the pick up The carrier did not pick up all the items The carrier did not contact the customer The carrier never showed up on the promised pick up date The customer needs packing material, but they didn't receive any How do I get the proof of return? 1. What does 4PLCS do? This company takes over a few tasks: Deciding which return carrier to use for which products Arranging the return with the return carrier Communicating with the carrier when something did not go as planned Tracking the status of the returns Notifying Emma when the product was returned so we can start the refund process 2. How to: Request a return from 4PLCS? In Fluent Commerce , the assigned to 4PL is automatically. In Magento, you will then need to select “4PLCS” as the return method in Magento (including the pick-up date for category 2 items) and then the return will automatically be arranged. 3. How to: Handle customer requests, when 4PLCS manages the return? In the 4PLCS team, there is a team of operations managers who will handle your requests regarding returns. You can reach them via the 4PL Jira Portal [ link to 4PL Jira portal ]. Return cancellation Return adjustment (e.g. change pick-up address or customer contact info) Pick-up re-scheduling Others You will also need to provide the order number and the return ID from the OMS (Magento or Fluent). 4. How to: Status tracking with 4PL CS Status tracking for 4PL returns with Optilo Returns can be tracked using 4PL CS's own system called 'Optilo'. Optilo can be accessed via this link [ OPTILO / Tracking - search ] Note : It can take 2-3 days since the return was created to show up in Optilo. Wait for 2-3 days before checking to get a more reliable insight. Step 1: Access Optilo portal and search order Access the following web page: OPTILO / Tracking - search Depending on the ID you have select the following reference type: These IDs then be found in Fluent and Magento respectively. Complete captcha and then hit 'Search' order. ID Emma Reference name Fluent Return ID: 00xx-xxxx-xxxxx-x Magento return: “Order Number” Sales order no. 2 [MH1] ​ Step 2: Identify the status of the return Identify the order Click on 'No.' and check 'Events' sections. Real date is the actual date To understand the status of the return, use the following table. Status Explanation 100 - Created Return was newly created 250 - Planned Return is planned and waiting for carrier respose 290 - Confirmed by carrier Carrier has confirmed reception of the return to be scheduled on their system 313 - Pickup attempt unsuccessful The pickup was unsuccessful. The reasons might be customer was absent, goods were not ready etc 450 - On the way Carier picked up the return from the customer and the return is on the way to the destination (warehouse or disposal) 600 - Delivered Carier picked up the return from the customer and the return was delivered to the final destination 946 - Cancelled The pick up failed, for some reason 950 - Cancelled The return was cancelled Step 3: In case you can’t find your order, or it has been cancelled Check again the status of the return in Fluent OMS or Magento and verify if return was opened correctly Check open Jira tickets by 4PL to Emma (Many orders are stuck in Jira waiting for a response). Search for Jira tickets on this portal that have the same order number as the one you are working on. 5. FAQ 5.a) How can I cancel the return with 4PL? When cancelling a return that is handled by 4PL, you must cancel the return in the OMS AND cancel the return with 4PL directly. Only when both have been completed, you have correctly cancelled the return. Go to the 4PL Jira portal and raise a 'Request to 4PL'. As the 'Request to 4PL' select 'Return cancellation' Ensure all other fields have been filled Emma Order Number : the order number Return ID : the return order number Market : the market Raise a request for the 4PL Central station to action or clarify (Add Emma Order Number in this field): 'Return cancellation of [put your order number]' Once you receive confirmation on the Jira ticket if the return was cancelled, the return will automatically be cancelled in the OMS too. You must not cancel the return in Fluent Commerce, as that will be done by 4PL. 5.b) The customer asks to change the pick up date The first action must always be to ask the customer to contact the return carrier directly. Only if that is not possible, do the following: For Magento Go to the 4PL Jira portal and raise a 'Request to 4PL'. As the 'Request to 4PL' select 'Pick-up rescheduling' Ensure all other fields have been filled Emma Order Number : the order number Return ID : the return order number Market : the market Raise a request for the 4PL Central station to action or clarify (Add Emma Order Number in this field): 'Change pick up date for [put your order number]' For Fluent Commerce If changing the pick up date is impossible via the return carrier, you must: Tell the customer that the the carrier might already be on the way. You will still attempt to cancel it, but it might be that the carrier will still go to the customer (because the cancellation will not reach them in time). Ask the customer to refuse the pick up when that happens. Ask 4PL to cancel the return (see 'How can I cancel the return') Once the return is cancelled, create a new return but ensure the pick up information is correct. 5.c) The customer asks to change the address for the pick up The first action must always be to ask the customer to contact the return carrier directly. Only if that is not possible, do the following: Go to the 4PL Jira portal and raise a 'Request to 4PL'. As the 'Request to 4PL' select 'Return adjustment' Ensure all other fields have been filled Emma Order Number : the order number Return ID : the return order number Market : the market Raise a request for the 4PL Central station to action or clarify (Add Emma Order Number in this field): 'Change pick up address for [put your order number]' If 4PL informs you that the return has already been scheduled and they cannot change the address, 4PL can sometimes cancel the return. If 4PL informs you that they have cancelled the return, you can create a new return with the corrected address. 5.d) The carrier did not pick up all the items Verify in the OMS if a return was created for all items. If there was no return created for all items, create a return for the additional items. If a return was created for the additional items, proceed with step 2. Verify the status of the return with the carrier. If everything was created correctly but the carrier did not show up yet, file a Jira ticket on the 4PL Jira portal. As the 'Request to 4PL' select 'Incorrect SKU category return' Ensure all other fields have been filled Emma Order Number : the order number Return ID : the return order number Market : the market Raise a request for the 4PL Central station to action or clarify (Add Emma Order Number in this field): Clearly describe the issue with the return. Follow up on the Jira ticket. 5.e) The carrier did not contact the customer Verify in the OMS if a return was created correctly for all items. If you don't know for sure if it was created correctly, review the 'How to verify if the return was created correctly' paragraph on the instruction page for the specific return situation. Be sure to check if the correct return method was picked for the item and condition . Meaning, if a return with 4PL was created but the item is an accessory, it is not the correct method for the return item and condition. Check the status of the return. The status must be set to 'Return created' after you created the return, and must never manually be set to organized. TIP : You can review the Activity log on the returns page, to see who/what changed the return status. If the return was created correctly, the status updates after 'Return created' will always be done by the system (not by an agent). If there was no return created for all items, create a return for the additional items. If a return was created for the additional items, proceed with step 3. Verify the status of the return with the carrier. You can use the instructions in the article 'Status tracking of Returns with 4PL CS'. If the return was not created correctly, please cancel the return and create a new one. Understand this means that the return will be created anew, and inform the customer of the expected timeline for the return. Don't know the timeline? Review the instruction page for the specific return situation. 5.f) The carrier never showed up on the promised pick up date Review the tracking information via Optilo. If you see that there was an issue with the return and the carrier did not show up indeed, do the following: Go to the 4PL Jira portal and raise a 'Request to 4PL'. As the 'Request to 4PL' select 'Other' Ensure all other fields have been filled Emma Order Number: the order number Return ID : the return order number Market : the market Raise a request for the 4PL Central station to action or clarify (Add Emma Order Number in this field): Clearly describe the issue with the return. Follow up on the Jira ticket. 5.g) The customer needs packing material, but they didn't receive any The customer needs packing material, but they didn't receive any Check the tracking information via Optilo, to ensure the packing material has not been delivered yet. It often happens that the packing material has already arrived in the meantime and that the item has been picked up. If this didn't happen, move to step 2. Confirm if the item condition in Fluent Commerce or Magento is set as 'unpacked'. If the status is set to 'packed', no packing material will be sent to the customer as the item is already packed. Check and contact the customer to get the exact item condition. If the item is (unpacked), kindly be informed that the return will be resubmitted. This means that the current return has to be canceled, and a new one will be initiated. Once the return is created correctly, the pickup will be assigned to a carrier within 7-10 normal days from the return creation date. The customer will receive the packaging material in the next days. 5.h) How do I get the proof of return? Only use this option if the customer doesn't have a proof of return themselves. Go to the 4PL Jira portal and raise a 'Request to 4PL'. As the 'Request to 4PL' select 'Other' Ensure all other fields have been filled Emma Order Number : the order number Return ID : the return order number Market : the market Raise a request for the 4PL Central station to action or clarify (Add Emma Order Number in this field): Clearly describe that you need a proof of return. Follow up on the Jira ticket 1. About different return types In general there are three methods for a customer to return a product: Drop-off at a parcel shop (lowest costs for Emma – 40-50% less than 1mh) The customer brings the product to a parcel shop (e.g. post office) and drops it off there. 1-man-handling (1mh) pick-up (medium costs for Emma) A carrier comes to the customer with a smaller truck and one employee to pick-up a parcel or product. 2-man-handling (2mh) pick-up (most costs for Emma) A carrier comes to the customer with a big truck and (most times) two employees to pick-up a heavy and bulky product. For this return method, the carrier usually schedules the appointment directly with the customer, so never promise a pick-up date. 2. About the different return conditions As you may see, the return conditions change depending on the market and on the products. It is important that you ask from the customer what the specific conditions from the product are, so you can correctly select the required return method. 3. About ParcelLab tracking Do you see that your market allows for ParcelLab tracking, and need to know more? Please revisit the ParcelLab instruction page . 4. Bundle Returns (Partial) returns for bundle returns are allowed in all EU countries. For your country specific guidelines, please review with your supervisor. 5. FAQ 1. What must I do if I cannot create a return, the item is non-returnable in Fluent Commerce? If the returnable quantity of the order is 0 but the order shows to be Delivered already, you have run into a bug in Fluent Commerce. Escalate this case to the Return Logistics Escalation Jira Portal . The instructions can be found here. 2. I cannot create the return because the order is not in the state 'COMPLETE' yet, even though the customer says it is delivered If the item is not marked as COMPLETE, a return cannot be created. You will need to escalate this to AR D2C Jira Portal (formerly Order-to-Cash) under 'Order Management' > 'Order stuck concerns' . 3. The customer claims they returned the product, how can I verify this and trigger the refund? Step 1 : Confirm the status of the return in the OMS. Was the return created correctly? Was the return created as a 'Return with refund'? What is the status of the return? Step 2 : Ask the customer if they have a proof of return. If they provide a valid proof, move on to step 4. ​ Step 3 : Reach out to the carrier, to obtain the proof of return.
