You can find the instructions for contacting the carrier in the folder for the carrier. Don't know where you find it? Use the 'Return carrier matrix'. Please keep in mind that all the communication with the Warehouses and/or carriers should be done in English. ​ Step 4 : Once you have a proof of return, mark the return 'Complete' in the OMS. The refund will be triggered automatically. 4. ​The OMS says the return is 'Complete', but the customer says not everything has been returned Step 1: Confirm the status of the return in the OMS. Was the return created correctly? Was the return created as a 'Return with refund'? What is the status of the return? Step 2: Reach out to the carrier, to obtain the status of the return on their system. You can find the instructions for contacting the carrier in the folder for the carrier. Don't know where you find it? Use the 'Return carrier matrix'. 5. The carrier refused the pick up Step 1: Confirm the status of the return in the OMS. Step 2: Verify if the carrier selection was correct, based on the decision matrix. Don't know where you can check this? Use the table with tabs on the top of this page. Step 3: Confirm the status with the carrier. You can find the instructions for contacting the carrier in the folder for the carrier. Don't know where you find it? Use the table on the top of this page. 6. I created the return incorrectly If you noticed the return has been created incorrectly, cancel the return and resubmit it. Please check if all fields comply with the process for the involved carrier. 7. I cannot create the return because the order status is not 'Complete' If the order status is not set to 'Complete', you cannot create a return. Please escalate this order via the AR D2C (formerly Order-to-Cash) portal under the option " Order Management - Order Stuck Concerns " to resolve it. Once the issue is resolved, you can then create the return in the OMS. 8. Return Process for Bundles ... to be added ...

title: Returns: Return Portal: How to Handle Cases from the Return Portal
content: ​ Note: The Return Portal does not work for supplement orders or for Magento orders . ​ TABLE OF CONTENTS Versions of the Return Portal Version 1: Agent Instructions (Italy and Ireland) Version 2: Agent Instructions (Austria, Belgium, Switzerland, Germany, Spain, Netherlands and UK) Version 3: Agent Instructions (France, Portugal and Spain) ​ Versions of the Return Portal We are rolling out the Return Portal across different markets. While we are in the process of integrating with more carriers in all markets, we maintain different versions of the return portal depending on the country . Please check carefully which option applies to your market : Version 1 : No automation, for any product. Italy (IT) Ireland (IE) Version 2 : Accessory returns are fully automated, 1 or 2 men handling returns need to be fully processed by the agents. Austria (AT) Belgium (BE) Switzerland (CH) Germany (DE) Netherlands (NL) United Kingdom (UK) Version 3 : Accessory returns are fully automated, 1 or 2 man handling returns are semi-automated with integrations with carriers. France (FR, Portugal (PT) Spain (ES) For detailed instructions, jump directly to the version appliccable to your country. Version 1: Agent Instruction Applies to Fluent Commerce returns in Italy and Ireland. For all products (beds, mattress, accessories, etc) First, the request comes from the Customer's side : Customer logs into the return portal, using order number and email address Customer selects the products to return/claim Customer selects the return reason, condition (unpacked/packed) as well as product quantity to return Customer verifies their contact information Customer submits return request After the case is created, Agent's instructions are: Check the automated email / case : Submitted return request will create an automated email to customer service, that provides Agent with a structured overview of the return request and all required information for the next steps Click below on "Email" to see image Email Validate request - Trial Period: ​ If in trial period : the agent should first attempt deflection. Proceed to step 3: Deflection Italy: Until further notice, do not move to step 3. Move directly to step 4 . If not in trial period : The case becomes Product Claim case instead of a Return. Proceed as a Product claim. ​ Trial period validation process Deflection : If the request is validated, you will first attempt deflection, according to your Market. Italy Ireland ​ ​ Italy: Until further notice, do not move to step 3. Move directly to step 4 . ​ Verbal deflection (no supplements): Follow the Verbal Deflection KB: Return Deflection: Making Impact on Returns Note: If deflection is sucessful (either via step 1 or step 2), because the customer accepted to keep their product(s), do NOT create a return on FluentCommerce. ​ Verbal deflection (no supplements): Follow the Verbal Deflection KB: Return Deflection: Making Impact on Returns Note: Only move to step 2 If step 1 is NOT s ucessful ​ Comfort Layer : we can offer a comfort layer as another deflection option. Suplement a Comfort Layer, on the original order, on FluentCommerce if: the first step, Verbal deflection, did not work; and if we're dealing with a return for a Mattress / Bed with a Mattress. If you need help with supplementing the comfort layer you can refer to the KB: 2024 Return Deflection Process Important: If deflection is sucessful (either via step 1 or step 2), because the customer accepted to keep their product(s), do NOT create a return on FluentCommerce. If deflection is sucessful: because the customer accepted to keep their product(s), do NOT proceed to step 4. If deflection is NOT sucessful: proceed to step 4. Create Return on FluentCommerce: if you need help with creating a Return, refer to KB: Returns: Return Instructions per market EU Inform the customer: Create a new email to the customer, on Sprinklr (do not reply to the automatic email created from the return portal) Important : DO NOT click on "Reply" on the Sprinklr ticket from the Return Portal and neither forward to the customer. To contact the customer, you must create a new email, as mentioned above. If you need help creating a new email on Sprinklr, refer to KB: How to: Create new case/Outbound email Version 2: Agent Instructions Applies to Fluent Commerce returns in Austria, Belgium, Switzerland, Germany, Netherlands and UK. Accessories* exclusively**: Instructions For accessory only returns , customers must start the returns by themselves. Every request opened by the customer on the portal, will automatically create a return request and generate a label for the drop-off. No action will be required from the CS agents. The integration between Return Portal, FluentCommerce, and ParcelLab will handle the return automatically. If the customer reaches out to customer support for returning a standalone accessory, you have two options: Direct the customer to the Return Portal and explain them how to use it. OR: Help them by creating the return via the Return Portal on their behalf. *Products considered as accessories for return via drop-off: pillows, bed linens, duvets, mattresses protectors, disassembled/self-assembly slatted frames, baby/kids mattresses, packed toppers or toppers up to 120cm. **Exclusively accessories refers to returns where exclusively accessories are being returned. No other product type are part of the created return. Returns including a bed and/or mattress or large topper: Instructions If the return request opened by the customer is for a mattress or bed, the customer request will be sent for deflection. This will happen with the portal creating a Sprinklr ticket that needs follow-up actions from CS/Sleep Experts. In Sprinklr, you can identify a case from the Return Portal as follows ... All cases coming from the Return Portal will always appear with "from: no-reply@emma-sleep.com". However , it doesn't mean they are related to actual customer cases. An automation assigns them to the right group according to the market from where the order is from. DO NOT edit the Contact fields in the tickets. Please DO NOT click on "Reply" on the Sprinklr ticket from the Return Portal and neither forward this to the customer. To contact the customer, you must create a new email . ​ ​ Important: All cases from the Return Portal appear with "from: no-reply@emma-sleep.com " and "to: support@emma-mattress.co.uk ". They are assigned to the correct group based on the order's market. DO NOT edit the Contact fields in the tickets. DO NOT click "Reply" on the Freshdesk ticket from the Return Portal or forward it to the customer. Create a new email to contact the customer. Step-by-step process Step 1 : Identify the ticket from the Return Portal. Step 2 : Double-check if a request is already open in FluentCommerce to avoid issues with ParcelLab automations. If a return is associated with a carrier on ParcelLab, do not create a return on FluentCommerce. [ Link to ParcelLab ] Situation 1 : If the ticket is found, assign it to yourself and proceed with creating the return. Inform the customer if the ticket is already assigned. Situation 2 : If the ticket is not found, do not create a return on OMS. Inform the customer that everything is as expected and check ParcelLab for email confirmation. Step 3 : Confirm the return in ParcelLab, then check the ticket for "Reason for return" and "Compensation Method" in Freshdesk/Sprinklr. Option 1 (Refund) : Customer wants a refund. Try to deflect the return. If not possible, contact the customer about the return condition. Create a return with a refund in FluentCommerce, send a new email to the customer, and resolve the ticket in Sprinklr. Option 2 (Replace) : Customer wants a replacement. Follow the Logistics or Product Claim processes . Check if the claim is valid and if all images are provided. Create the return in FluentCommerce, send a new email to the customer, and resolve the ticket in Sprinklr. Version 3: Agent Instructions Applies to Fluent Commerce returns in France, Portugal and Spain Accessories* exclusively**: Instructions For accessory only returns , customers must start the returns by themselves. Every request opened by the customer on the portal, will automatically create a return request and generate a label for the drop-off. No action will be required from the CS agents. The integration between Return Portal, FluentCommerce, and ParcelLab will handle the return automatically. If the customer reaches out to customer support for returning a standalone accessory, you have two options: Direct the customer to the Return Portal and explain them how to use it. OR: Help them by creating the return via the Return Portal on their behalf. *Products considered as accessories for return via drop-off: pillows, bed linens, duvets, mattresses protectors, disassembled/self-assembly slatted frames, baby/kids mattresses, packed toppers or toppers up to 120cm. **Exclusively accessories refers to returns where exclusively accessories are being returned. No other product type are part of the created return. Returns including a bed and/or mattress: Instructions If the return request opened by the customer is for a mattress or bed, the customer request will be sent for deflection. This will happen with the portal creating a Sprinklr ticket that needs follow-up actions from CS/Sleep Experts agents. All the steps needed are explained below in this section. Summarized, these are: Identify the ticket from the Return Portal Review the order in OMS and verify if a return for the item has not yet been created Confirm the reason for the return: Trial return or Warranty (claim) return? Try deflection If not deflected: For Trial Period Returns: Confirm if all the items have been selected correctly on the Returns Portal Confirm the customer's address for the collection Submit the return, in the Portal For Warranty Returns: Create the return in Fluent Commerce and process the supplement ​ 1. Identify the ticket from the Return Portal All cases coming from the Return Portal will always appear with "from: no-reply@emma-sleep.com". However, it doesn't mean they are related to actual customer cases. An automation assigns them to the right group according to the market from where the order is from. DO NOT edit the Contact fields in the tickets. Please DO NOT click on "Reply" on the Sprinklr ticket from the Return Portal and neither forward this to the customer. To contact the customer, you must create a new email. ​ 2. Review the order in OMS and verify if a return for the item has not yet been created Double-check if a request is not already open in FluentCommerce to avoid issues like creating a return and blocking automation from ParcelLab. We have faced cases where customers open the request via the portal and end up also calling the support line. If this happens and the agent also creates a return in FluentCommerce, the requests will collide and probably not work correctly. On ParcelLab, if there is a return, the agent can see if it is associated with a carrier or not. And then should never create a return on FluentCommerce in case there is a label of a carrier: ​ Situation 1: In case the agent finds example 1 above, they must search for the ticket on Sprinklr, assign it to themself and proceed with the return approval. If ticket is already assigned, the agent must inform the customer that everything is as expected and an email will go soon; Situation 2: In case agent finds example 2 above, the agent should not create any return on OMS and inform the customer that everything is going as expected and customer will receive an email soon (check ParcelLab to see email send out and confirm if email was already sent). 3. Confirm the reason for the return: Trial return or Warranty (claim) return? After confirming in ParcelLab, go back to Sprinklr and c heck in the ticket the information provided by customers about " Reason for return " , " Item Condition " and " Compensation Method ". At the "Compensation method" field, customer can choose between 2 options: Refund: It means that the customer is not satisfied with the item/items purchased and wants to return and be refunded. You can still try to deflect the return, and if not possible, just proceed as a normal return process. Move to step 5. Replace: It indicates an issue, a claim from the customer regarding their item, and that they want to have a new one. Here, the procedure is to follow the Logistics Claim or Product Claim processes, after investigating the customer issue. Move to step 6. 4. Try deflection (if appropriate for your market) The deflection is to be done after the agents receive the ticket from the Return Portal with the frequent from the customer. So, when agents receive a call with a customer wanting to return, they need to indicate customer to use the Return portal and only once the ticket is received in Sprinklr they will attempt to deflect. 5 - Handle the case for a Trial Period Return : Refund Ensure the support ticket created by the return portal is assigned to you. Ensure all fields are correctly filled out on the ticket: Sub category Order number Product Group SKU Deflected (no) Ticket category Close the Sprinklr ticket that was created by the Return Portal. Follow the same procedure as for any return: when a customer asks for a return in the trial period, we try to: Deflect the Return. For this, create a new outbound email (ticket) to the customer. If not possible to deflect, proceed with the return creation in ParcelLab. In ParcelLab (Return Portal) Find the customer request (see image below). Do this by going to: Tracking Search for the Order Number Open the event called 'Return Registered' On the event, in the notification section, you will see an event called 'EMAIL ReturnToSprinklr' with subject 'Order #[order number] Return Request via Portal'. Open that message, and you will find the email that was sent to the case when the return was created in the portal. Then click the link on the orange button called ' Return Portal ' in the email. This will redirect you to an agent-facing version of the Returns Portal. For an example, see 'How does the Return Portal look for agents', below. On the Returns Portal, ensure that all items that the customer chose to return are selected, the reason, condition and quantity are filled, and 'Submit' the return*. From here on, the return process is automated, so you must not create a return manually in Fluent Commerce, as the portal will do so. The customer will automatically be informed that the return is created successfully, and they will be contacted by the return carrier about the next steps, to align the pick up date and time. After all, ensure all related tickets in Sprinklr / Sprinklr have been correctly filled out, and hit "Resolve" to close the case. * If, for any reason, you have doubts about the return request, you can contact the customer to confirm the return conditions and items. If there is no reason for doubts, you can can just confirm the return as per normal. After the agent's confirmation, the portal will send the return request to the carrier and an email to the customer informing the name of the carrier. The carrier will then contact the customer in the upcoming days to schedule the collection of the items. In ParcelLab, a 2nd item is created with the assigned carrier and the tracking code (as shown in the image below). ParcelLab will also create the return in Fluent and fill it with the carrier name. 6. For Warranty Returns : Create the return in Fluent Commerce and process the supplement Those cases are related to issues with the product, which can be a logistic or a product claim. After identifying the "reason" informed by the customer, please check the Claims articles to follow the correct steps related to each reason (Logistics claims or Product claims) Check if the claim is valid and if all images have already been sent by customers to us. If more information or images are needed, please create a new email to the customer asking for those. If no additional information is needed or if the customer sent everything already , you will proceed with Create the Return via Fluent Commerce, following the normal return submission process. Once the return is created, the customer will be informed by the carrier when the pick-up gets organized. Next, please go to FluentCommerce to create a Supplement. Inform the customer of the created supplement and manage customer expectations related to the new order arrival. After all, please go back to the Sprinklr ticket from the portal, fill in the correct fields in the categorization accordingly, and change the ticket status to "Resolve". IMPORTANT: DO NOT click on "Reply" on the Sprinklr ticket from the Return Portal and neither forward this to the customer. To contact the customer, you must create a new email. ​ What does the Return Portal look for agents ​ What does the Return Portal look for agents ​ V1 / Version 1 only: The email for this version will not have the "Returns portal" & "Cancel returns" buttons, meaning, no ParcelLab Portal link. This email will only include the product & customer information. ​ After clicking the link, you will be taken to the Return Portal. On the portal, the interface is the same as what the customer sees. You will see the information that was pre-filled by the customer. If needed, you can make changes to the return as the customer created it. ​ This is the email you will see in Sprinklr: ​ And what you will see in the return portal: ​ ​ After you click 'Proceed', you will see the details of the Return ​ If you click 'Proceed' again, you will see that the return creation is submitted and the return will be arranged for the customer. ​

title: Returns: Return Self-Service Portal (About article)
content: Release Note: 06/11/2025 - Added IE & IT return portal links The Return Portal is a self-service portal for customers to register returns. It is the main entry point for returns in FR, UK, ES, PT, DE, NL, BE, DE, CH, AT. The Return portal is not available for supplements and/or Magento orders . TABLE OF CONTENTS About the The Return Self-Service Portal Why use the Return Self-Service Portal? How does the return portal work? For accessories For other products and non-standalone accessories For bundles How is the Return Portal for customers? FAQ What if a customer reaches out to us via phone, chat or email? What if the customer insists on doing the return via customer support instead of via the return portal? Process overview (Training porpouses) ​ ​ Live dates and links Links to the return portals Live dates UK - https://www.emma-sleep.co.uk/returns/ 29th February, 2024 IE - https://www.emma-sleep.ie/returns-portal/ October 2025 ES - https://www.emma-colchon.es/devoluciones/ ​ 27th March, 2024 PT - https://www.colchaoemma.pt/devolucoes/ ​ 26th March, 2024 DE - https://www.emma-matratze.de/rueckgabeportal/ 22nd April, 2024 NL - https://www.emma-matras.be/terugkeer-portaal/ October 28th, 2024 BE - https://www.emma-sleep.nl/retour/ October 28th, 2024 CH - https://www.emma-sleep.ch/rueckgabeportal/ October 29th, 2024 AT - https://www.emma-matratze.at/rueckgabe-kontakt/ October 29th, 2024 FR - https://www.emma.fr/portail-des-retours/ October 15th, 2024 IT - https://www.emma-materasso.it/portale-resi/ October 2025 1. About the The Return Self-Service Portal Note: In FR, UK, ES, PT, DE, NL, BE, DE, CH, AT from now on ALL requests for returns should go via the portal . ​ Why use the Return Self-Service Portal? The return portal is an efficient and more customer friendly way to create a return for customers. In this portal, the customers will be able to see all the items in their order and select the ones they want to return. There they will also indicate the reason, the quantity and the condition of the articles. ​ For returns only including accessories , all the requests will be fully automated. For mattresses and beds , the CS agents will still have to take action to approve the return after the deflection. If the customer asks you to create the return, please first guide them through the process of using the return portal. You can help them through the process. ​ When doing this, please check if you can see the related Sprinklr ticket created via the return portal, so you can assist with handling the return. As the ticket may take some minutes to arrive, you can also go directly to ParcelLab portal and see all the requests there in real time. What if the customer insists on creating the return via customer support? See the answer in the FAQ section below this article. ​ ATTENTION The Return portal does not cover Magento orders . For those cases, when receiving a Sprinklr ticket that is related to an order from Magento, please handle it manually like the old process, and DO NOT re-direct customers to the portal. How does the Return Portal work? Note: for the actual step-by-step article click here i. For accessories (standalone items) For accessories (standalone items), customers can start the returns by themselves. Every request opened by the customer on the portal, will automatically create a return request and generate a label for the drop-off. ​ In that scenario, no action will be required from the CS agents. The integration between Return Portal, FluentCommerce, and ParcelLab will handle automatically the returns. ​ Recap: products considered as accessories for the return via drop-off: pillows, duvets, disassembled/self-assembly slatted frames, baby/kids mattresses, packed toppers or toppers up to 120cm. IMPORTANT - STANDALONE X NON-STANDALONE ITEMS: A standalone item is how we refer to a product that has only one SKU and also appears in OMS with only one SKU associated. The non-standalone items will be the ones that have only one SKU, however, due to system issues it will appear in FluentCommerce in the same way as a bundle or composite. But you check it, it is indeed only one item. Example: ii. For other products and non-standalone accessories If the return request opened by the customer is for non-standalone accessories or other product categories (like mattresses or beds), the portal creates a Sprinklr ticket that requires that needs follow-up actions from CS/Sleep Experts agents. All the steps needed are explained below in this article. But it's basically: identify the reason for the return; try deflection; create a return, and inform the customer. ​ iii. For Bundles For most countries, the partial return of bundles is not allowed, with a few exceptions that are related to High-Level Escalations/Online Reputation cases. In those situations, agents need to contact supervisors first and they will escalate this to Performance Managers of the related country/market. ​ Additionally the French market also allow's partial returns. ​ ​ ​ 2. How does it look like for customers? ​ At the Return Portal, the customer will have to input the order number and email address. After that, they will be able to see all the items in the order and select the ones they want to return. Below you can see some examples: ​ ​ 3. FAQ ​ 6. A) What if a customer reaches out to us via phone, chat or email? If the request comes via phone or chat For an accessory only >> redirect the customer to the portal in the webshop. If the customer prefers, you can help them by craeating the return for them via the portal on the webshop. For only mattresses or beds >> agent handles it via normal return process For returns including accessories AND mattress or bed >> agent handles it via normal return process If the request comes via email For an accessory only  >> agent handles it through the portal in the webshop For only mattresses or beds  >> agent handles it For returns including accessories AND mattress or bed >> agent handles it via normal return process ​ 6. B) What if the customer insists on doing the return via customer support instead of via the return portal? If the customer still prefers your support to create the return, you can still create the return via the normal manual process, see description here . Before you do this, always check Fluent Commerce if no return has been created already, so we get double created returns. 4 . Process Overview (Training porpouses) Fig. 1: Process flow for handling tickets created via the Return Portal (source image here - accessible to process managers only)

title: Returns: Wrong items Returned
content: TABLE OF CONTENTS Wrong items Returned to Emma What to do if the package is still with the carrier What to do if the package is already at Emma's Warehouse Wrong items Returned to Emma You may face a situation where the customer requests to return an Emma product but instead, they send another item back by mistake. If this happens, the customer may contact our CS line requesting support retrieving the item returned wrongly. Please check below how to proceed: First, you should check in FluentCommerce the return status and if the package: Situation 1: Has been picked up by the carrier but not yet at the warehouse \ returns operated by charities; Situation 2: Already at the warehouse. What to do if the package is still with the carrier (or charity returns) For situation 1, when it is still on route to the Warehouse, the customer needs to contact the carrier\charity directly. The carrier\charity will then check if it can still be retrieved. Only customers are entitled to recover it from the carrier, as they are the ones listed as sender of the parcel and only the sender can do request it. What to do if the package is already at Emma's Warehouse For situation 2, if the package is already returned and stored in the warehouse (and there is nothing the carrier can do) the customer must contact us. The agent must then open a Jira ticket in the CE Portal so that the market's Performance Manager can reach to the W2D team and try to trace the parcel at the warehouse. ​ The Ticket must contain the following information: - Name on the package; - Tracking number used to return the package; - What item was returned instead of the EMMA products; - Invoice of the product returned; ​ Ideally, the customer must provide some proof that the item was wrongly returned to us (for example: if swapped label, a confirmation from the other company that they received an Emma product for example). If not possible, please leave that information on the ticket. Jira Portal link ("Order Issue"): Order Issue - Customer Excellence Team - Jira Service Management (atlassian.net)

title: Cases Categorization (Guidelines)
content: TABLE OF CONTENTS Introduction FAQ's Effort level per sub-category topic Introduction This article sheds light on some common doubts and questions related to how to categorize customer's contacts ( Cases Categorization (List) ). First, you can check some FAQs and the respective answers, and at the end, you can explore the table showing the tickets categories and the effort level. FAQ's Q. Who is responsible for the accurate categorization of a ticket? The agent that is currently assigned to the ticket. Agents are responsible for categorizing the tickets correctly, even when that means amending an automated categorization done by the IVR, chat bots, etc. Q. For cases marked as "No response required" does the case still need to be categorized? Yes, even interactions marked as "No Response required" are mandatory to be categorized ​ Q. If a ticket is already categorized, can we change its categorization? Agents should only change the ticket categorization if the initial categorization, pertaining to the initial contact reason/s was incorrect. Otherwise, agents should not change the original ticket categorization, even if the contact has now transitioned to a different topic. ​ Q. How many categories can we have in a ticket? A ticket can only have one category selected. Some categories will have sub-categories, and in those cases, selecting a sub-category will be mandatory, but some categories (like "injury Claims", for example) will not have a sub-category. ​ Q. How to categorize an email when there are multiple requests in the same contact? When an email contains more than one request, although it is necessary to reply to both requests, the categorization should always reflect the most important topic (i.e., the one that will take the longest to resolve). For example, in an email where the customer requests an address change for delivery and also inquires "Where is my order (WIMO)", the WIMO topic generally takes longer to resolve, so that would be the appropriate category. (please check the table at the end of the article to understand the "effort" differences between topics) Q. What to do when there are two or more requests in the same email with equal effort scores? When an email has two or more requests with equal effort scores, you may choose one of the topics and categorize it accordingly, but please leave a note explaining that the email contains multiple requests, indicating the other categories that would also apply. ​ Q. What to do when a ticket initially belongs to one category but eventually transforms into another? A common example is when "Where is My Order (WIMO)" inquiries related to delivery delays result in cancellations. In such cases, the correct approach is to maintain the initial category (WIMO), even if the case ends in a cancellation. However, if the follow-up contact results in a new ticket being created (because it happened 72 hours after the initial ticket was closed), a new categorization is possible (in this case, "Cancellation due to Delay"), since this is now a new ticket and the classification is done according to the current contact reason. ​ Q. If a customer sends an email asking about the delivery date on the last day within the Promised Delivery Date (PDD), should we consider a WIMO "Delivery Still on Time" or "Delivery Delay"? In that case it is advisable to check if there is an Updated Delivery Date available in the OMS. If there’s a new Updated Delivery Date, please categorize the ticket as a Delivery Delay and inform the customer accordingly. If not, then categorize it as a Delivery Still on Time. ​ Q. How to categorize a compensation request after a delay? This request should be categorized as "Where is My Order" > "Others." Effort level per sub-category topic ​ Below, we assume that for each type of query, the effort score will be rated on a scale of 1 to 5, with 5 being the most demanding. ​ Category (Level 1) Sub-category (Level 2) Effort level (1-5) Product Information Specific product query 2 Product Comparison 2 Cross-sale Advice 2 Product Characteristics 2 Firmness 2 Material Specifications 2 Product Customization 1 Others (mandatory reason) 3 Services & Store information Payment Options 1 Delivery Information 2 Returns Policy 2 Refund Information 2 Pricing and Promotions 2 Physical Stores and showrooms 1 Others (mandatory reason) 3 Ordering Issues Discount code/ voucher issues 3 Check-out issues 3 Others (mandatory reason) 3 Where is my order? (WIMO) Delivery still on time 2 Delivery delay 5 Others (mandatory reason) 4 Edit Order Update Personal Details 2 Change ordered products 3 Adjust delivery preferences 4 Switch payment methods/conditions 4 Others (mandatory reason) 3 Payment Payment Troubleshooting 5 Payment extension 3 Payment Status discrepancies 4 Others (mandatory reason) 3 Invoice Request Invoice 2 Modify issued invoice 4 Others (mandatory reason) 3 Cancellation Order Cancellation 4 Cancellation due to Delay 5 Delivery rejected 4 Others (mandatory reason) 3 Logistic Claim (provide details under the triggered field (level 3) 5 Product Claim (provide details under the triggered field (level 3) 5 Return Return Request 4 Cancel Return 3 Return modification 4 Return Difficulties 5 Proof of return 2 Others (mandatory reason) 3 Refunds Refund Status 4 Refund Issues 5 Friend Referral 3 Price Match 3 Retrospective discount application 3 Others (mandatory reason) 3 Others GDPR Requests 5 Spam Messages 1 Duplicate or Merged tickets 1 Customer Feedback 2 Collaboration Opportunities 2 Others (mandatory reason) 3 How to use Other's Mandatory Comment for "Other" Cases Agents must provide a brief explanation when selecting "Other" as a category or subcategory unless the case is SPAM . This will help identify gaps and potential new categories. Comments are mandatory. How to Optimize the Existing Categories for Main Topics Customer Service Channels & Process Gaps Chat: If the customer provides information while interacting with the bot before reaching an agent, the agent must categorize the ticket based on the request. "Other" should only be used if no information was provided before the chat turned idle. Phone: If a customer does not provide any information about their inquiry, or there are technical issues (e.g., the customer cannot hear us, we cannot hear them, or they hang up), categorize it as Other – Other . Refund & Compensation Requests Refund Follow-up: If customer is contacting our support to follow-up on their refund request, to chase it or know the status of it, it should be categorized as Refund – Refund Status. Compensation Requests: For any compensation-related inquiries, categorize them as Refunds – Other . Returns & Product-Related Issues Old Mattress Removal Service: If a customer inquiry is about the Old Mattress Removal service , categorize it under Return – Other . Comfort Layer: If a customer requests a Comfort Layer or if it is offered as a return deflection option , categorize it under Return – Other . Missing Items: If the customer is missing a cutter or booklet: Beds: Categorize as Product Claim – Other . Other items: Categorize as Product Claim – Product Type and Component (select Packaging) . If the customer is missing a part of the product or an entire item , categorize it as Logistic Claim – Lost or Stolen – Product SKU . Services Provided If customers inquire about Emma’s services ( Guarantee, Warranty, Assembling, etc. ) and no specific subcategory exists, categorize it as Services and Store Information – Other . Order & Delivery Inquiries Order Confirmation: If a customer has not received an order confirmation email and inquires about the order status, categorize it as Ordering Issues – Other . Cancellation: If Emma sends a mass communication about order cancellations and customers contact us to verify or follow up, categorize it as Cancellation – Other. Delivery Inquiry (Product Name Mismatch): If the name on the box/label differs from what was purchased on the website, categorize it as Product Information – Other . Online Reputation & Escalations If it’s general feedback, use Other – Customer Feedback . Categorize tickets based on the topic raised by the customer. This applies to all Online Reputation channels and whenever a customer asks to speak with a Supervisor (Manager Escalation) . If the complaint is, for instance, about a delayed refund, categorize it as Refund – Refund Issues. Special Handling for Online Reputation Cases When agents need to create a new ticket for Outbound or Follow-up, the original ticket should be closed as Other – Duplicated or Merge . Handling Cases Not Covered by This Guideline If a case does not fit any of the categories listed, agents should identify the main concern and classify it under the most relevant main category – Other .

title: Cases Categorization (List)
content: Article Summary In this article, you will learn about how to do Ticket Categorization and which are the correct options when filling in the field Category on the ACW window . Reminder: It is MANDATORY to categorize the tickets. Ticket Categories and Sub-categories We have 15 Categories as the main options for you to choose from. After selecting one, you will have a Category-related (Level 2) to mark, and in some cases still a Sub-Category (Level 3). The main categories are: Product Information; Services & store information; Ordering issues; WIMO (Where is my Order?); Edit order; Payment; Invoice; Cancellation; Product Claim; Logistic Claim; Return; Refunds; Injury Claim; Legal & Privacy; Others. Please find bellow the detailed table with all Categories available. Category (Level 1) Sub-category (Level 2) Sub-category (Level 3) Explanation Product information Dimensions Height What is the height of the product? Weight What is the weight of this mattress? / Can you tell me the shipping weight of the item? Width What is the width of this bed? Depth What is the depth of these drawers? Size customization Is there an option to adjust the dimensions? Can I order this product in a custom size? Materials Material Properties What materials are used in this product Material Source Are the materials ethically sourced? Allergen Information Is this item safe for people with latex allergies? Durability and Longevity How long can I expect this product to last? Aesthetic Qualities Does this product have a glossy or matte appearance? Care and Maintenance What cleaning methods are recommended for this item? Certifications and Standards Does this product meet any safety certifications? Color Options Available colors or finishes Are there different finishes to choose from? Color customization Is it possible to match the color to my existing furniture? Product Properties/Features Firmness Is this item available in different firmness levels? Thermoregulation Does this product help regulate temperature? Breathability How well does this item allow air circulation? Pressure Relief Is this item good for people with back pain? Motion Isolation Is this mattress suitable for couples who move a lot during sleep? Noise Level Does this bed frame squeak? Weight Capacity Can this item safely hold over 180 kgs? Others Specify Please try to use this option in extreme cases Category (Level 1) Sub-category (Level 2) Explanation Legal & Privacy Data Breach Official Communications For when we receive contacts/documentation from lawyers, official entities, etc. Data Deletion Request For when a customer requests full/partial data deletion. Cancel Marketing Communications For when a customer contacts us to stop received marketing emails and/or SMSs. Data Access For when customers request access to the data we are holding on them. Portability For when customers wish to receive the data we have on them or to port it to another company Restrict Data Processing For when customers request restrictions on the processing of their personal data under certain circumstances. Data Breach For when a customer is reporting a data breach with his information or with another customer’s. Category (Level 1) Explanation Injury Claims For when the customer is informing us that an injury has happened by an Emma Product. Remaining topics overview: Category (Level 1) Sub-category (Level 2) Services & Store information Payment Options Delivery Information Returns Policy Refund Information Pricing and Promotions Physical Stores and showrooms Others (mandatory reason) Ordering Issues Discount code/ voucher issues Check-out issues Others (mandatory reason) Where is my order? (WIMO) Delivery still on time Delivery delay Others (mandatory reason) Edit Order Update Personal Details Change ordered products Adjust delivery preferences Switch payment methods/conditions Others (mandatory reason) Payment Payment Troubleshooting Payment extension Payment Status discrepancies Others (mandatory reason) Invoice Request Invoice Modify issued invoice Others (mandatory reason) Cancellation Order Cancellation Cancellation due to Delay Delivery rejected Others (mandatory reason) Logistic Claim (provide details under the triggered field (level 3) Product Claim (provide details under the triggered field (level 3) Return Return Request Cancel Return Return modification Return Difficulties Proof of return Others (mandatory reason) Refunds Refund Status Refund Issues Friend Referral Price Match Retrospective discount application Others (mandatory reason) Others Spam Messages Duplicate or Merged tickets Customer Feedback Collaboration Opportunities Others (mandatory reason) ________________________________________________________________ Categorization deep dive Now, let's go into the details and understand exactly how to use the Sub-category topics and check some examples of cases applicable: Services and store information -> Inquiries about information or clarification on Emma's services. Sub-category (Level 2) Description Examples Payment Options Inquiries about accepted payment methods, installment options, and other payment-related questions (excluding ongoing payment processes). "Which payment methods are accepted?" "Is it possible to pay in installments?" "Are there any financing options available?" Delivery Information Inquiries about delivery timeframes, carriers, delivery areas, punctuality, and additional services (excluding ongoing shipment processes). Estimated delivery time for a specific location; Carriers used for shipping; Additional services are offered, such as curbside delivery or assembly services. Returns Policy Inquiries about the return process, return fees, and other return-related questions (excluding ongoing return processes). How to initiate a return; Whether the customer is responsible for return shipping fees; Timeframe for processing returns. Refund Information Inquiries about refund policies, processing times, and other refund-related questions (excluding ongoing refund processes). Expected refund processing time Refund method (store credit, original payment method, etc.); Conditions for receiving a full refund. Pricing and Promotions Inquiries about product prices, current or upcoming promotions, discount policies, and coupon codes. Current price of a specific product; Ongoing promotions or discounts; Coupon code benefits and validity. Physical Stores and Showrooms Inquiries about the location, opening hours, and availability of Emma Sleep physical stores, showrooms, or authorized retailers. Location of the nearest Emma Sleep store; Opening hours of a showroom; Authorized retailers for purchasing Emma Sleep products. Others (A comment explaining the contact reason is mandatory) Inquiries that do not fit into any other sub-category. Ordering issues -> Inquiries about issues faced while trying to place the order. Sub-category (Level 2) Description Examples Discount code/voucher issues The customer claims that something is not working with the discount code. A valid code that is not working on the website; A customer that needs help inserting the code correctly. Check-out issues The customer claims that something is not working with placing the order. A Customer having issues with their shopping cart, not being able to successfully finish the payment/checkout process on the website; If the website has a bug, or the website is down, which is keeping the customer from making the purchase. Others (A comment explaining the contact reason is mandatory) Inquiries that do not fit into any other sub-category. WIMO (Where is my order?) -> Inquiries about the status of the order and the expected delivery date. Sub-category (Level 2) Description Examples Dependent field (level 3) Delivery still on time The product is within the time frame specified at the time of purchase. The customer reaches out anyway just to check on the expected delivery time. Mandatory to also fill in the Order number field Delivery Delay The order has not been delivered within the expected promised date. The customer reaches out because they received a notification of delay and wants further information. Mandatory to also fill in the Order number field Others (A comment explaining the contact reason is mandatory) Inquiries that do not fit into any other sub-category. Mandatory to also fill in the Order number field Last mile support -> No longer applicable, should be considered as Logistic Claims! Edit order -> Requests to modify existing orders. Sub-category (Level 2) Description Examples Dependent field (level 3) Update Personal Details The customer requests to update their personal information on an existing order, such as their name, email address, or billing address. Changing the customer's email address due to a typo; Updating the customer's name after a legal name change; Modifying the billing address because the customer has moved. Mandatory to also fill in the Order number field Change ordered products The customer asks to change the ordered product or its specific features, such as its size, firmness, or color. Swapping a 180x200cm mattress for a 160x200cm mattress; Changing the firmness of a pillow from medium to firm; Updating the color of a bedsheet from white to gray. Mandatory to also fill in the Order number field Adjust Delivery Preferences The customer wants to modify the delivery conditions for their order, including the delivery timeline, delivery address, or any special instructions. Delaying the delivery or specifying a fixed delivery date; Changing the delivery address due to a last-minute change in plans; Providing special instructions for the delivery driver, like leaving the package at the back door. Mandatory to also fill in the Order number field Switch Payment Method/conditions The customer wishes to change the payment method associated with their order or wants to change the conditions like switching from pre-payment to payment in installments. Updating the payment method from a credit card to a PayPal account; Changing the credit card on file due to a lost or stolen card. Mandatory to also fill in the Order number field Others (A comment explaining the contact reason is mandatory) Inquiries that do not fit into any other sub-category. Mandatory to also fill in the Order number field Payment -> Inquiries regarding the payment of an existing order. Sub-category (Level 2) Description Examples Dependent field (level 3) Payment Troubleshooting Choose this category for customers experiencing issues with making payments, incorrect charges, or receiving incorrect payment reminders or fees. Difficulties processing payment through the website or payment service provider; Incorrectly charged amounts or double-charged for an order; Receiving payment reminders despite having already paid; Customer disputes a charge from Emma or the payment service provider. Mandatory to also fill in the Order number field Payment extension Use this category for customers requesting a payment extension due to order delays, personal reasons, or other circumstances. Request to delay payment due to financial hardship; Extension needed because of an order delay or product unavailability; Temporary payment arrangement due to unexpected personal events. Mandatory to also fill in the Order number field Payment Status Discrepancies Select this category for customers reporting incorrect payment status, such as orders shown as "pending" or "canceled" even though payment has been made. The payment was made via bank transfer, but the order status is still "pending" on the website; Customer claims to have paid, but the order appears as "canceled" on the website; Delay in updating payment status on the website after successful payment. Mandatory to also fill in the Order number field Others (A comment explaining the contact reason is mandatory) Inquiries that do not fit into any other sub-category. Mandatory to also fill in the Order number field Invoice -> Inquiries regarding the Invoice of an existing order. Sub-category (Level 2) Description Examples Dependent field (level 3) Request Invoice Customer wants / claims he did not receive the invoice. The invoice needs to be sent or re-sent to the customer's email. Mandatory to also fill in the Order number field Modify issued invoice Customer wants to change information. The customer wants to change the VAT number or address information of the invoice. Mandatory to also fill in the Order number field Others (A comment explaining the contact reason is mandatory) Inquiries that do not fit into any other sub-category. Mandatory to also fill in the Order number field Cancellation -> Inquiries for order cancellations or related questions. Sub-category (Level 2) Description Examples Dependent field (level 3) Order cancellation Customer requests to cancel the entire order or just a part of their order. A customer decides they no longer want the products they ordered; A customer realizes they ordered the wrong items and wants to cancel the entire order; A customer mistakenly placed an order and needs to cancel it. Mandatory to also fill in the Order number field Cancellation Due to Delay Customer requests cancellation due to an unacceptable delay in delivery or processing. A customer is unhappy with a significant delay in the delivery date and wants to cancel the order; A customer's order has not been processed or shipped within the promised timeframe, and they wish to cancel; A customer finds an alternative product elsewhere while waiting for their order and decides to cancel. Mandatory to also fill in the Order number field Delivery rejected The customer reaches out to us after refusing the delivery upon arrival to start the refund process. Usually, this will happen in cases in which the customer could not cancel due to the order being too far in the process, and it was instructed to reject the delivery. Mandatory to also fill in the Order number field Others (A comment explaining the contact reason is mandatory) Inquiries that do not fit into any other sub-category. Mandatory to also fill in the Order number field Logistic claim -> Complaints about logistics-related issues, such as delivery or shipping problems. Please check the article "Logistics Claim" to verify the step-by-step about the Freshdesk Categorization. Product claim -> Complaints about defective products within the warranty period, including product quality or performance issues. Please check the article "Product Claim" to verify the step-by-step about the Freshdesk Categorization. Returns -> Requests and follow-up questions regarding returns. Sub-category (Level 2) Description Examples Dependent field (level 3) Return Request Customer wants to start the return process for a product. IMPORTANT: Do not use this category for return requests due to a product or logistic claim. For follow-up tickets that are connected to a return due to a claim, please use the category "Returns - Others". Customer is requesting a return for the first time. Mandatory to also fill in the Order number field Cancel return Customer wishes to cancel an already requested return. Customer changed their mind about returning the product; Customer resolved the issue with the product and no longer needs to return it. Mandatory to also fill in the Order number field Return Modification Customer needs to make changes to an existing return request. Customer wants to update the pickup address for the return; Customer needs to change the contact information for the return carrier; Customer needs to reschedule a pickup that they missed or change the requested pickup date/time. Mandatory to also fill in the Order number field Return difficulties Customer experiences difficulties or issues related to the return process, including pickup problems. Customer is having difficulty with the self-return label; Customer faces issues while dropping off the item for return; Customer reports that the carrier failed to show up for a scheduled pickup; Customer wants to know the available pickup time slots for their location. Mandatory to also fill in the Order number field Proof of return Customer provides evidence of a completed return to initiate or expedite the refund process. Customer submits proof of return, such as a receipt or tracking number; Customer wants to confirm if the returned item has been received. Mandatory to also fill in the Order number field Others (A comment explaining the contact reason is mandatory) Inquiries that do not fit into any other sub-category. Mandatory to also fill in the Order number field Refunds -> Inquiries and issues related to refunds, discounts, friend referral requests, and price adjustments. Sub-category (Level 2) Description Examples Dependent field (level 3) Refund status Customer inquires about the status or details of an ongoing refund process. - Customer requests the status of their refund after returning an item; - Customer asks for the date their refund was processed; - Customer inquires about the payment method used for the refund or proof of the refund; - Customer seeks clarification on the monetary compensation they were promised due to a product or logistic issue; - Customer wants to know if their price match request was approved and how it will affect their refund. Mandatory to also fill in the Order number field Refund issues Customer encounters issues with their refund, such as incorrect or delayed refunds. - Customer claims they received an incorrect refund amount (over or under the expected amount); - Customer reports not receiving a full refund; - Customer complains that their refund is taking longer than the promised timeline; - Customer states that they were charged a restocking fee that was not previously disclosed. Mandatory to also fill in the Order number field Friend referral Customer wants to participate in the referral program and requests the promised bonus. - Customer wants to know how to receive their referral bonus; - Customer requests assistance with redeeming their referral bonus; - Customer inquires about the referral bonus amount and applicable terms; - Customer asks for help tracking the status of their referral bonus after referring a friend. Mandatory to also fill in the Order number field Price match Customer requests a price adjustment due to a sale, promotion, or retailer's lower price. - Customer asks for a retrospective price match due to a sale or promotion; - Customer requests a price match because a retailer is selling the same product at a lower price; - Customer notices a lower price on the company's website shortly after placing their order and requests a price adjustment. Mandatory to also fill in the Order number field Retrospective discount application Customer requests his refund related to discount code that (s)he forgot to apply or that has not worked, as previously aligned with the CS team. - Customer forgot to apply a coupon code and asks for the respective discount; - Discount code did not work in the check-out process and it was aligned with customer service to apply the discount retrospectively after the order was placed. Mandatory to also fill in the Order number field Others (A comment explaining the contact reason is mandatory) Inquiries that do not fit into any other sub-category. Mandatory to also fill in the Order number field Others -> Any other contact reason that does not fit the main categories or their sub-categories, including spam messages, duplicate or merged tickets, data deletion requests (GDPR), and customer feedback. Sub-category (Level 2) Description Examples Dependent field (level 3) GDPR requests The customer makes a Data Subject Request ( article ), asking for data access, data deletion, etc, in compliance with GDPR regulations. Or the customer contacted us to report a data breach. Customer sends an email requesting for all his data to be deleted; Customer submits a request through a web form for data access. Customer had his order or private data shared incorrectly with a third party. Mandatory to also fill in the Order number field Spam Messages The contact is clearly spam and will not be acted upon. This includes unsolicited advertisements, phishing attempts, or irrelevant content. Unsolicited promotional emails; Messages containing suspicious links; Irrelevant or nonsensical content. N/A Duplicate or Merged Tickets The ticket has already been resolved in a different ticket or merged into an existing ticket. This sub-category is used to keep track of redundant tickets. Customer submits multiple requests for the same issue; Two different agents are working on the same issue, and the tickets need to be merged. N/A Customer Feedback Customers provide general feedback (positive or negative) about Emma, which does not necessarily require follow-up action. This includes feedback sent via social media, email, or other channels. A customer shares their positive experience with Emma's products on social media N/A Collaboration Opportunities Inquiries about potential collaborations, partnerships, sponsorships, or affiliate opportunities with Emma Sleep. Also, all communication with charity partners about organizing returns-donations. Influencer collaborations; Charity partnerships; Co-branding opportunities. N/A Others (A comment explaining the contact reason is mandatory) The customer is contacting us for a reason that does not fit into any other main or sub-category. A comment explaining the contact reason is mandatory, clarifying why the ticket could not be categorized elsewhere. title: Using the ParcelLab Portal
content: TABLE OF CONTENTS ParcelLab Access ParcelLab Login to ParcelLab Using to ParcelLab Portal Trackings Trackings: How to find a tracking Trackings: Resend an email Order Confirmation email in ParcelLab IMPORTANT Step by Step of Resending email ParcelLab Customer Service teams can manage information related to customer queries in the parcelLab Portal. This article describes the core concepts of the parcel Lab Portal for Customer Service teams. In the parcelLab Portal, you will be able to: Find and access data for tracked parcels. View tracking pages as they are displayed for your customers. Review email notifications that have been sent to your customers. Access ParcelLab Access Parcel Lab here Login to ParcelLab SSO is available - so you just need to add your emma-sleep email and you will be able to access it. In case you have trouble logging in - reach out your supervisor for support. Using to ParcelLab Portal The following page will display. This landing page consists of four main areas: Global Navigation The most relevant global navigation points for Customer Service teams are Trackings and Communication . Local Navigation In the screenshot above, the local navigation points displayed are Trackings , Watchlist , and Export . These are the subcategories that are nested under the Trackings module in the global navigation. Search Bar and Filters The search filters available depend on the section of the Portal you are using. Results Search results are displayed in the area below the filters Trackings The Trackings module provides an overview of all parcels. There are three local navigation points within the Trackings module. Each of their functions are described below. Trackings: How to find a tracking In cases where you need to retrieve additional information for a customer, such as the delivery status of their parcel, here’s how you can use the Portal’s search functionality. 1. In the search field, fill in any part of the order data associated with the parcel. The following information can be used to search for a parcel: Tracking number Order number Delivery number Recipient's name Recipient's email address Among the results that appear, your search query will be highlighted in the tracking record. In the following example, the tracking number was entered into the search field. 2. Click on the listed tracking The Details tab will open where you can retrieve the full details of the tracking. On this page, there are three main sections: the full tracking record located on the top of the page, and two sections below it, namely Trace and Notifications . 1. In this section, you will find all the tracking details for the parcel. You also have the option to click on the following buttons: Tracking Page : This allows you to view the track and trace page configured and designed for your brand as it is seen by your customers Carrier Trace : This allows you to view the carrier’s tracking page. All shipments of order : This allows you to view all parcels in an order, if the order has been split into multiple parcels. All shipments of recipient : This allows you to view a list of all the recipient’s parcels for the last 90 days. Show details : This will display additional information such as the order date and delivery date. 2. In the Trace section, you can view the selected tracking’s Trace status updates, starting with the most recent one. 3. In the Notifications section, you can view the notifications that have been configured in your brand’s look and feel and automatically sent from parcelLab to the recipient. For each email notification, you can find details on the date and time the email was sent, and if and when it was opened and clicked on. Clicking on an email record will open the email as seen from the customer’s point of view. Step by Step Trackings: Resend an email In cases where a customer may not have received the required information, such as a returns label, here's how you can easily resend an email for the relevant tracking in the Portal. Search for and select the required tracking. For further information, see how Trackings: How to find a tracking The Details tab will open where you can find the email notification to resend. Click the required email record in the Notifications section. The email record will open Click the Re-send email button at the top of the email record. A pop-up window will display to confirm the email address and resend the email. 4. Check and if required update the email address in the field. 5. Click Send . A message will display to confirm you want to send the email to the email address entered. 6. C lick Yes . A confirmation message will display to notify you whether the email was successfully sent or not. When the message is sent, it will be displayed in the Notifications section of the corresponding tracking and have a Resend- prefix. Order Confirmation email in ParcelLab For AU, CH and BE: The "Order Confirmation" emails for customers from Australia, Switzerland, Belgium are now being sent via ParcelLab and they are visible also for the agents via the ParcelLab portal. For the customers, this is a new version of the "Order Confirmation" email that has new features that include: promised delivery dates for each item, pre-authenticated links to the Order Status Page, and a display of payment method. For the agents, it means that via the ParcelLab portal you can also see exactly what and when those emails were sent to customers. Additionally, you can also resend this "Order Confirmation" email via ParcelLab if the customer asks for it. IMPORTANT: You may see other emails inside the ParcelLab portal, however, you CANNOT resend those to the customer via the portal, because they are still in test mode. ONLY the "Order Confirmation" can resend it. Step by Step of Resending email:

title: [Online: D2C: EU] How to: Supplement Order
content: TABLE OF CONTENTS Introduction Supplement Order: General Information What is a Supplement Order? Supplement Reasons When to create a Supplement Order? [For FR agents ONLY] Disclaimer! Supplement Order in fluent: Supplement Order: Step by step Supplement Order Number logic Search for Supplement orders Specific Supplement order Supplement orders (database) Canceling Supplement orders Supplement for Magento Orders How to handle Step-by-step to request the Supplement for Magento Orders key-words supplement order; wrong mattress; replacement; wrong order. Introduction In this article, you will check the cases where a Supplement Order can be created and also how to create it in the Fluent Commerce tool. Supplement Order: General Information What is a Supplement Order? Every time an item should be added to an order with no cost (zero value) to the customer, a Supplement Order should be created and added to the original one. This action on the system will be triggered in specific scenarios in which we need to send an additional item to the customer associated with his original request. When to create a Supplement Order? In the scenarios that the customer is entitled to have a Replacement , or when it's a case for an Add-on . ​ For reasons Replacement, we consider: Logistic claim for wrong product sent (from Emma's side); ​ Logistic claim for lost/stolen; Logistic claim for Carrier Misbehaviour (if there's a lack of consistency in the information provided by carriers and the customer isn't the one to blame for the fact that the order was Returned to Sender); Product claim (any). Examples: Customer ordered a 140x200cm mattress but received a 160x200cm; Or if the product if the customer ordered a bed and didn't receive all the parcels for the assembly; Or if the customer gets a product that has a broken foam or a dimension deviation; Or if the customer states that the carrier didn't appear at their house and product was Returned to Sender (please review on the tracking page if the customer was informed about the delivery attempts. if it was, then no supplement should be done, if it wasn't, then we're ok to supplement). ​ For reasons Add-on, we consider: the products are sent to the customer as an added value to the order or original product. ​ Examples: Sending a comfort layer on return deflection cases. ​ Supplement Reasons​ When creating the Supplement, ensure you always select the correct reason: LC - Carrier Incident Use this when the issue is clearly attributable to the carrier. Examples include: The parcel was returned to sender without reaching the customer. There was a failed delivery attempt due to an address error not caused by us. The package was delayed beyond the acceptable timeframe and was never delivered. LC - Damaged Parcel Select this when the parcel arrives with visible damage Examples include: Torn or crushed outer packaging. Water-damaged boxes. Signs of mishandling (e.g., punctures, dents, or excessive tape from rewrapping). Visible damage that indicated that the product may have been compromised in transit. LC - Lost / Stolen / Incomplete Choose this when the parcel is missing, tampered with, or arrived with missing contents. Examples include: The customer reports non-receipt, and tracking confirms delivery to the wrong address or an unresolved issue. There is no update in the tracking for over 10 calendar days, and item is still not delivered. A package arrives partially opened or with missing items. LC - Wrong Item Select this reason when the customer receives the wrong product due to an error by the carrier, or our warehouse. Examples include: The item delivered has a different SKU, size, color, or model than what was ordered. Indication that the carrier may have switched or misdelivered the parcel during transit. ​ Product Claim Select this when the issue is related to product quality or a manufacturing defect. Examples include: Malfunctioning items out of the box. Faulty or defective components. The product does not match the description or images. Missing items with no damage signs in the outterbox Wrong item received with no evedencice that this was caused by the carrier ​ Return Process Use this for standard return-related supplements. Examples include: Plastic bags when required by process Comfort layers when included in the deflection actions Exceptions (Approval Required) Use this reason when a supplement has already been sent, but a second is required due to a special or complex case. In such situations, escalate to a Senior Agent for approval.Senior Agents must add a clear Fluent note documenting the approval or rejection, along with the reason. If the supplement was initially created by a Senior Agent, Supervisor approval is required. Only in exceptional cases,already escalated to Supervisors,should this be escalated internally. Examples include: The first supplement was received incorrectly or incomplete or damaged. Supplement is taking too long to arrive. Additional items are needed to fully resolve the issue. ​ When NOT to create a Supplement Order? We have certain scenarios in which we SHOULD NEVER create a Supplement Order. Those are the following: If you previously created a supplement that arrived in a condition requiring replacement, please return the entire item for a refund If the customer is upset and unwilling to return the full item for a refund, please escalate the case to a Senior Agent to request approval for providing an additional supplement, ensure to use the correct reasons for the supplement reason " Exceptions (approval required)" @Senior Agents : Ensure you leave a comment in Fluent documenting your approval or rejection of the additional supplement. If the customer does not like his SKU or wants to return it during the trial period (exchange the color of the product, for example); If the customer ordered the wrong SKU (due to a fault of his own); If the customer does not like an SKU that is part of a bundle; Phase out SKUs If the customer bought a “limited stock” SKU that is no longer available. If the customer clearly states that there was damage caused by them (e.g., the mattress was stained by a spill, torn during handling, or damaged by a pet), please make a note of it and remmeber in such cases, the customer will not be eligible for a return during their trial period For those cases above, the correct process is: the original product needs to be returned and the customer refunded; and then the customer can place a new order in the webshop. If SKU being sent is incorrect, please inform your supervisor and our internal team accordingly . If a phased SKU qualifies for a valid claim and the customer chooses an upgrade instead of a return/refund, we’ll supply the nearest equivalent model. Please note that the standard trial-period return right will not apply to this replacement, and it cannot be returned simply because it does not meet personal expectations. This policy is also detailed in our Terms & Conditions. ​ If a full supplement order is to be sent to the customer, ensure the return is only initiated after the supplement has been successfully delivered (request customer to contact back once suplement is received). This prevents the customer from being without the product while awaiting the replacement. IMPORTANT NOTE (UK & EI): Do not send a supplement before confirming pickup. In exceptional cases where this is necessary, please escalate the issue internally before proceeding. In addition to that, please also NEVER create Supplement Orders to unblock orders (any scenario in the order is not on the normal flow). The correct process is: to escalate via JIRA to: Order Management team: AR D2C Portal (formerly Order-to-Cash) - Raise a request - Jira Service Management for the status covered on the "Order Stuck Concerns" choice, or; Back-Office team (if your market has a back-office team). Any other status, inform customer of the expected lead time or offer cancellation and refund. ​ ​ Disclaimer! Supplement Order in fluent: Please be aware, when creating a supplement order in Fluent Commerce and you need to add a composable product (as a bed that has more then one SKU), you need to manually add all related SKUs of the product before placing it. Place the supplement order only once all items were added from the composable product. Do not place supplement orders with separated orders per SKU. Please be aware, For the record: we are already working to update this as soon as possible and the composable product (more then one box / SKUs goes automatically once selected). ​ Please note: you need to select you country related SKU. Review link for specific countries SKU's here Supplement Order: Step by step 1. Check the SKUs that you need to supplement the order in the product page 2. Check if the Masterfile of Phased out Items first . If the item is not there, then check the stock for the SKUs following this instructions , and only proceed with the supplement if it has the minimum amount of stock required. If item is phased out or there's no stock inform the customer that the item is currently unavailable. The options for the customer are: Wait for when there's stock so we can supplement (you can check for the lead time in the website for a "replenishment date") Return product according to the T&Cs If it's a product claim and customer decides to keep it, we can offer a compensation according to the Compensation Matrix. ​ If there's stock: once you gathered the information required, go to the original order of the customer 1. click the kebab button to access the action bar. 2. click on Create Supplement Order A supplement order page will pop up: 3. Select the Name or SKU to be included in the supplement order and click on Next . Search function: You can search by product Name or SKU .When typing the SKU, the search function will display options after 4 characters are typed in. If you are pasting the entire SKU number, try deleting one character for the dropdown options to be shown. 4. Select the quantity that should be added to the supplement order. ​ 5. If you need to add more SKU to the supplement, cancel the previous SKU from the search bar and add the next SKU. ​ The system will keep record of all the SKUs added. ​ ​ 6. click next . 6. Confirm order delivery details based on the original order (in case customers requests to change, follow customers' preference) 7. Click on Next . A summary of the supplement order will pop up. 8. Confirm customer email. 9. Select Supplement reason Replacement Add-on Review the possible outcomes accessing the Order outcome article 10. Submit and Supplement order will be created. You can access the Supplement order by checking the original order " related page ". Supplement Order Number logic The Supplement order number is based on the original order number. It will always start with the original order number, followed by a dash (-), and finally a new Supplement number. The Supplement number is always sequential, so starts with -1, and then goes on to -2, -3, etc, as per screen shot below: Search for Supplement orders Specific Supplement order When accessing the order list page, you can search by Order reference number , and add the original number of the order. You will be able to see all orders and supplement orders related to it as per the screenshot below: Supplement orders (database) You can always search supplement orders by adding a filter search as -1 or -2, as per the naming logic explained above. Canceling Supplement orders For order cancellation, ensure you follow the normal cancellation steps, as per How to: Order cancelation article Supplement Order for Magento Orders Once Fluent Commerce is implemented, we do not ship orders placed in Magento anymore. This means: that in case you receive a customer request that the order was placed in Magento, but now you need to make a Supplement, the supplement CANNOT be opened in Magento. The new order needs to be created in Fluent Commerce, and for it, you must open a JIRA ticket at the Order-2-Cash Portal . How to handle: 1. Submit the JIRA ticket: Provide all information in the ticket form and submit it. 2. Leave a note in Magento related order registering the request has been submitted to Fluent Commerce team. 3. Manage customer expectation . Customer will receive a confirmation email as soon as the order is placed by the team. In case you need visibility of the status of the supplement order, you can always: i.. Search in fluent commerce (use customer email or any available data you may have) ii. Reach out your team lead IMPORTANT: The Order Management Team will handle the request within 5 business days. Please do not open a new request to the Back-Office team. If the timeframe has passed and you didn't get a reply, please reach out to your supervisor so the issue can be escalated internally. Step-by-step to request the Supplement for Magento Orders:
