Missing items with no damage signs in the outterbox Wrong item received with no evedencice that this was caused by the carrier ​ Return Process Use this for standard return-related supplements. Examples include: Plastic bags when required by process Comfort layers when included in the deflection actions Exceptions (Approval Required) Use this reason when a supplement has already been sent, but a second is required due to a special or complex case. In such situations, escalate to a Senior Agent for approval.Senior Agents must add a clear Fluent note documenting the approval or rejection, along with the reason. If the supplement was initially created by a Senior Agent, Supervisor approval is required. Only in exceptional cases,already escalated to Supervisors,should this be escalated internally. Examples include: The first supplement was received incorrectly or incomplete or damaged. Supplement is taking too long to arrive. Additional items are needed to fully resolve the issue. ​ When NOT to create a Supplement Order? We have certain scenarios in which we SHOULD NEVER create a Supplement Order. Those are the following: If you previously created a supplement that arrived in a condition requiring replacement, please return the entire item for a refund If the customer is upset and unwilling to return the full item for a refund, please escalate the case to a Senior Agent to request approval for providing an additional supplement, ensure to use the correct reasons for the supplement reason " Exceptions (approval required)" @Senior Agents : Ensure you leave a comment in Fluent documenting your approval or rejection of the additional supplement. If the customer does not like his SKU or wants to return it during the trial period (exchange the color of the product, for example); If the customer ordered the wrong SKU (due to a fault of his own); If the customer does not like an SKU that is part of a bundle; Phase out SKUs If the customer bought a “limited stock” SKU that is no longer available. If the customer clearly states that there was damage caused by them (e.g., the mattress was stained by a spill, torn during handling, or damaged by a pet), please make a note of it and remmeber in such cases, the customer will not be eligible for a return during their trial period For those cases above, the correct process is: the original product needs to be returned and the customer refunded; and then the customer can place a new order in the webshop. If SKU being sent is incorrect, please inform your supervisor and our internal team accordingly . If a phased SKU qualifies for a valid claim and the customer chooses an upgrade instead of a return/refund, we’ll supply the nearest equivalent model. Please note that the standard trial-period return right will not apply to this replacement, and it cannot be returned simply because it does not meet personal expectations. This policy is also detailed in our Terms & Conditions. ​ If a full supplement order is to be sent to the customer, ensure the return is only initiated after the supplement has been successfully delivered (request customer to contact back once suplement is received). This prevents the customer from being without the product while awaiting the replacement. IMPORTANT NOTE (UK & EI): Do not send a supplement before confirming pickup. In exceptional cases where this is necessary, please escalate the issue internally before proceeding. In addition to that, please also NEVER create Supplement Orders to unblock orders (any scenario in the order is not on the normal flow). The correct process is: to escalate via JIRA to: Order Management team: AR D2C Portal (formerly Order-to-Cash) - Raise a request - Jira Service Management for the status covered on the "Order Stuck Concerns" choice, or; Back-Office team (if your market has a back-office team). Any other status, inform customer of the expected lead time or offer cancellation and refund. ​ ​ Disclaimer! Supplement Order in fluent: Please be aware, when creating a supplement order in Fluent Commerce and you need to add a composable product (as a bed that has more then one SKU), you need to manually add all related SKUs of the product before placing it. Place the supplement order only once all items were added from the composable product. Do not place supplement orders with separated orders per SKU. Please be aware, For the record: we are already working to update this as soon as possible and the composable product (more then one box / SKUs goes automatically once selected). ​ Please note: you need to select you country related SKU. Review link for specific countries SKU's here Supplement Order: Step by step 1. Check the SKUs that you need to supplement the order in the product page 2. Check if the Masterfile of Phased out Items first . If the item is not there, then check the stock for the SKUs following this instructions , and only proceed with the supplement if it has the minimum amount of stock required. If item is phased out or there's no stock inform the customer that the item is currently unavailable. The options for the customer are: Wait for when there's stock so we can supplement (you can check for the lead time in the website for a "replenishment date") Return product according to the T&Cs If it's a product claim and customer decides to keep it, we can offer a compensation according to the Compensation Matrix. ​ If there's stock: once you gathered the information required, go to the original order of the customer 1. click the kebab button to access the action bar. 2. click on Create Supplement Order A supplement order page will pop up: 3. Select the Name or SKU to be included in the supplement order and click on Next . Search function: You can search by product Name or SKU .When typing the SKU, the search function will display options after 4 characters are typed in. If you are pasting the entire SKU number, try deleting one character for the dropdown options to be shown. 4. Select the quantity that should be added to the supplement order. ​ 5. If you need to add more SKU to the supplement, cancel the previous SKU from the search bar and add the next SKU. ​ The system will keep record of all the SKUs added. ​ ​ 6. click next . 6. Confirm order delivery details based on the original order (in case customers requests to change, follow customers' preference) 7. Click on Next . A summary of the supplement order will pop up. 8. Confirm customer email. 9. Select Supplement reason Replacement Add-on Review the possible outcomes accessing the Order outcome article 10. Submit and Supplement order will be created. You can access the Supplement order by checking the original order " related page ". Supplement Order Number logic The Supplement order number is based on the original order number. It will always start with the original order number, followed by a dash (-), and finally a new Supplement number. The Supplement number is always sequential, so starts with -1, and then goes on to -2, -3, etc, as per screen shot below: Search for Supplement orders Specific Supplement order When accessing the order list page, you can search by Order reference number , and add the original number of the order. You will be able to see all orders and supplement orders related to it as per the screenshot below: Supplement orders (database) You can always search supplement orders by adding a filter search as -1 or -2, as per the naming logic explained above. Canceling Supplement orders For order cancellation, ensure you follow the normal cancellation steps, as per How to: Order cancelation article Supplement Order for Magento Orders Once Fluent Commerce is implemented, we do not ship orders placed in Magento anymore. This means: that in case you receive a customer request that the order was placed in Magento, but now you need to make a Supplement, the supplement CANNOT be opened in Magento. The new order needs to be created in Fluent Commerce, and for it, you must open a JIRA ticket at the Order-2-Cash Portal . How to handle: 1. Submit the JIRA ticket: Provide all information in the ticket form and submit it. 2. Leave a note in Magento related order registering the request has been submitted to Fluent Commerce team. 3. Manage customer expectation . Customer will receive a confirmation email as soon as the order is placed by the team. In case you need visibility of the status of the supplement order, you can always: i.. Search in fluent commerce (use customer email or any available data you may have) ii. Reach out your team lead IMPORTANT: The Order Management Team will handle the request within 5 business days. Please do not open a new request to the Back-Office team. If the timeframe has passed and you didn't get a reply, please reach out to your supervisor so the issue can be escalated internally. Step-by-step to request the Supplement for Magento Orders:

title: Glossary - OMS terms library
content: Glossary - Order Management System terms library Below are some of the basic terms to grasp the overall concepts of building up the Order Management System, particularly in Fluent Commerce: Order Management Billing Management Global Inventory Foundation Store Fulfillment Security Shipping Payments Product Availability Order Management Name Description Order An order is created when a customer completes the checkout process and the order, and its details are recorded in both an e-commerce system and the Fluent platform. Article An article represents the physical parcel that transports order items from dispatch to the final destination. Fulfillment A Fulfillment represents one or more items in an order that need to be picked and packed for a customer. Return Order A return order is an order that requires a return to the location of dispatch. A return order can only be created after an order has been created and fulfilled. Return Fulfillment The fulfillment/s is associated with a return order. Customer A customer is an entity that purchases goods or services from a shop or business Composite Products Composite products are shown as one line in the customer, but in FluentCommerce it will be split to it’s components (more than one SKU) e.g. a bed may have 3 boxes with different SKUs, but represent one item. The Billing Management domain facilitates the management of all billing requirements across the Fluent platform. Billing Management Name Description Billing Account The Billing account entity represents financial operations. Billing accounts are responsible for orchestrating all invoices and invoice adjustments (Credit & Debit memos). Additionally, Billing Accounts also manage all associated downstream outcomes including payments, invoice notifications, and ERP integrations. Invoice Represents and itemizes a sales transaction between a buyer and a seller. Invoices also track associated Credit Memos, Debit Memos, and Payments. Credit Memo A memorandum issued from a seller to a buyer as evidence of a reduction or change in a sale. The Global Inventory domain represents aggregations of product inventory across e-commerce systems and the Fluent platform. Global Inventory Name Description Product Catalog A Product Catalog is a grouping of products and any attributes and details associated with each product in the group Category A class or division of product is regarded as having particular shared characteristics. Standard Product The base product is available to customers. Variant Product A variation of a base product. This variation may be in color, size, etc. Group Product A grouping of products is considered to have shared characteristics. Inventory Catalog The inventory catalog consists of inventory positions that can be aggregated from multiple sources. An Inventory catalog holds the on-hand inventory of products, variants, and groups. Inventory Position The Inventory Position entity represents unique records that identify whether stock exists in a location for a specific stock-keeping unit. Inventory Quantity The quantity of inventory of an available product, SKU and/or variant. Virtual Catalog A Virtual Catalog is a collection of subsets of intersections between a product catalog, an inventory catalog, and a set of location networks. Virtual Position The Virtual Position entity represents different virtual catalog and the stock available in each of the positions in each of the virtual catalogs. The Foundation domain represents the setup and configurations needed in order to implement and build experiences using the Fluent Commerce app ecosystem. Foundation Name Description Account Represents an installation of the Fluent platform. An account can consist of multiple retailers. Retailer A business that sells goods to the public. Activity The Activity entity tracks all activities that are recorded across the Fluent platform. Location/Store A location represents a physical place, whether that is a retail store, a warehouse, or even third-party vendor facilities. Network A network defines a named group of locations for the purpose of separating locations into logical or geographic categories. The Store Fulfillment domain provides the foundation for retailers to manage all aspects of order fulfillments. Store Fulfillment Name Description Wave A Wave is the process of grouping orders. The Wave entity holds information about the progress of created waves (completed, started,etc.). T he Security domain represents the users, roles and permissions that are applicable across the Fluent platform. Security Name Description User A user is an entity that is interacting with the system. A user can be assigned roles and permissions. Role A Role is a set of permissions for a user. Roles are assigned to users. Permissions Permissions can be assigned to users. A permission documents abilities. The Shipping domain holds and records shipping details about an order. These details include the chosen carrier and consignment for each article associated with an order. Shipping Name Description Carrier A provider of delivery and shipping services between buyers, sellers, and customers. Consignment A consignment is created when an article has been processed for Home Delivery. There is only ever one consignment per article. Manifest The Manifest entity records and documents all details pertaining to the shipping of an order. These details include name, carrier and location. The Payments domain holds payment details specific to a payment provider and all of Fluent's interactions with that specific identified payment provider. Payments Name Description Financial Transactions A Financial Transaction is a record of financial activity. The Financial Transactions entity holds all financial activities that are recorded across the Fluent platform. The Product Availability domain provides a range of available information for different products. This information is provided by considering custom attributes defined in a business workflow. Product Availability Name Description Fulfillment Option Retrieves and identifies the Fulfilment option for the proposed order. Fulfillment Plan The Fulfillment plan identifies the strategy to be used to fulfill an order. A fulfillment plan may identify multiple fulfillments to complete an order.

title: How to: Handling Order and Fulfillment stucks
content: TABLE OF CONTENTS Introduction Order and Fulfillment fields in Fluent "Action_Required" Orders Action Required: Address error Action Required: Cancelled due to no stock Action Required: Cancelled due to customer requested cancellation Stuck Fulfillments Others Fulfillments stucks Missing fulfillments Returns stucks Introduction In this article, you will learn about different scenarios that can lead to an order being stuck in FluentCommerce, how to identify those cases, and how to proceed or when to escalate depending on the combination of order, fulfillment, and article statuses. Order and Fulfillment fields in Fluent Before we can deep dive into the order issues, it is necessary a previous reading about the normal path of an order , and how to navigate inside an order page in OMS . As a small recap, you can find below images from FluentCommerce interface with important fields highlighted and explained. Order Level view: Fulfillment Level view: Additional note: Fulfillment Location What to do if the Fulfillment Location is "RJT_XXX"? The RJT_XXX only means that the status of the fulfillment is Pending/Waiting_for_stock . So, please just follow the decision flow chart that you will find below as if the scenario is pending or waiting_for_stock. "Action_Required" Orders In certain situations, you may see an order with a red banner disclaimer indicating there is an issue with the order. Those are the ones called "Action_required" Orders. It means the system has recognized the rejection and it is awaiting further action. How to handle Action Required orders: Agents can take action or fix an issue ONLY if the rejection reason is: Address error; Canceled because there is no stock in the warehouse; Canceled because the customer requested cancellation. -> Action Required: Address error Check and confirm that the rejection is due to an address error; Click on "Other Actions"; Click on "Address change"; Include the correct address and click to submit. Note: DO NOT leave any field blank on the address-editing window ; A pop-up window will appear asking to "Confirm Refulfillment", please click to confirm it. -> For UK only In regards to "address error", before following the step 1 mentioned above, you need to check the rejection reason first, which will be indicated in this file . After checking it, you can act according to the explanation. -> Action Required: Cancelled due to no stock Open a JIRA ticket at the Order Fulfillment Concerns portal (OFC). * For AT, BE, CH, DE, N and PL only: If any other rejection reason (that is not the ones mentioned above), please file a ticket in the OFC portal. -> Action Required: Cancelled due to customer requested cancellation Open a JIRA ticket at the ARD2C portal , under the option " Order Management -> Order Stuck Concerns" . Stuck Fulfillments The moment a customer contacts us asking "Where is my order?", the first step is to identify the status of their order in our system. After this, if there is a problem going on with the customer purchase and you need to escalate the issue, the team that can support it will differ according to the different status of the order, the fulfillment, and the article. In this part, you find the explanation of what it means each combination of statutes and when and how to escalate issues with those. IMPORTANT: To confirm if the order is stuck, always check the "Activities Tab" in FluentCommerce and look for the last update there. Based on this information, you will follow the steps below and be able to identify if the order is stuck or not. Order status Fulfillment status Article status Description What agent can do? Created No fulfilments are created for this stage No articles are created for this stage Order is being verified internally. It should move automatically to Booked in less than 1 day If order doesn't move or if customer asks for cancellation, p lease raise a JIRA ticket to O2C Portal. Pending_Fraud_Check (optional) No fulfilments are created for this stage No fulfilments are created for this stage Order could be stuck in pending fraud check because 1) the SKU is not yet uploaded on the OMS, 2) the incorrect SKU was inputted, or 3) the transaction or customer was tagged as fraudulent O2C already has an ongoing process to proactively resolve this issue. But If the issue persists or if the customer asks for cancellation, please raise a JIRA ticket to O2C portal Error (optional) No fulfilments are created for this stage No articles are created for this stage Address inputted might be incorrect and could not identify the coordinates properly. Double-check with the customer regarding their address and change it to the correct one. If the issue persists or if the customer asks for cancellation, please raise a JIRA ticket to O2C portal. Pending No fulfilments are created for this stage No articles are created for this stage Payment for the order is still waiting to be verified by Global Payments. Confirm first with O2C (Global Payments) if order has been verified. If the customer asks for cancellation, please raise a JIRA ticket to O2C portal. Now, you need to use the below presentation as a guide for your next step according to the status. You just have to click on the words related to the order status, then the fulfillment status and then you check the message that indicates the timeframe valid for an order to be considered stuck and where to raise a ticket. Instructions to navigate the presentation from above: - Every time you see that the cursor changes to a "hand" shape it means the box it is clickable and it will re-redirect you to another page or to an external link. Make sure to always click on that. - If you click by mistake and need to try another option, just click on the bottom in the "Back" button. Or if you want to see all the options again, click at "Home". Others Fulfillments stucks Missing fulfillments: Open a JIRA ticket at the ARD2C portal (OTC) , under the option " Order Management -> Order Stuck Concerns" . DO NOT create a Supplement order Returns stucks: If the fulfillment status is COMPLETE , open a JIRA ticket at the Returns Portal . If the fulfillment status is NOT COMPLETE, open a JIRA ticket at the ARD2C portal (OTC) , under the option " Order Management -> Order Stuck Concerns" . Review the Returns escalation information in this article!

title: How to: Navigating Fluent Commerce
content: This article explains the basic navigation for Fluent Commerce, particularly the main pages and headers . If you are looking for more detailed instructions on how to use each feature, please consider checking related Features & Functionalities instead. TABLE OF CONTENTS Set up the Language Main Headers Home Page & Dashboard Navigating the Dashboard Order Management Orders Section Order Details Page Standalone X Non-standalone items Fulfillment tab Comments Tab Additional Tabs Transactions Tab Attributes Tab Activity Fulfilment Section Customers Section Returns Section Billing Accounts Section Credit Memos Section Searching for an Order Set up the Language ALL COUNTRIES : The first step when opening Fluent Commerce is to set up specifically English (AU ) language. Even if you speak a different language or are working for a different country, at the moment, all orders should be managed under this specific setup to ensure you have the most update User Interface in place. Main Headers As you access FluentCommerce, the main headers are shown on the pop-up bar on the left side. There you will be able to access Order Management, Stores & Fulfilments, Inventory & Product, etc. Home Page & Dashboard Order Management Information Availability Products Inventory Stores Insights Admin For customer service, we will focus on the Order management functionalities . Home Page & Dashboard When you open Fluentcommerce, the default home page is the Dashboard: Your Dashboard will display the information regarding your country/market-related orders. Navigating the Dashboard From the dashboard, you can choose from available sets of filters: By clicking, you will be redirected to the list of orders related to the selected filers: Order Management Information Order Management Before deep-diving into all sections of Fluentcommerce - Order Management, take the chance to review the article Order & Fulfilment: Definition, Status & the journey . Orders Section By clicking on the order section you will have access to the main order list in chronological set (last created order first), where you can easily navigate through. By clicking on a specific order reference number, you will be redirected to the Order Details Page . where you can find all information related to the order. Order Details Page Summary / Order information The Summary card displays a brief summary of the order. This summary includes the following information. Order Type: The type of order. An Order can be either of the following types: HD for Home Delivery Orders. CC for Click and Collect Orders. Order Status: The current status of the order. The standard workflow contains the following standard statuses: Pending, Booked, Processing, Shipped, Complete, Canceled , or Returned . More details in the article: OMS Concepts | definitions and logics Customer Information The Customer info card displays information related to the customer that placed the order. Customer Name : This is the name of the customer that has placed the order. Phone Number : This is the phone number of the customer that has placed the order. Email: This is the email of the customer that has placed the order. Ref : is the customer ID (future reference number of customer account) Retailer (Market store information) The Retailer info card displays information related to the retailer (Market). Retailer ID : This is a unique ID that is associated with the retailer that the order has been placed. Retailer : This represents the Country or Market where the order has been placed against. Delivery Information (customer) The Delivery info card displays the delivery information of the order. Pickup Location Ref: This is a reference number that is associated with the store that the order will be picked up from. The 'Pickup Location Ref' is only applicable for Click and Collect orders and will be left blank for Home Delivery orders. Customer Address: This can be either the store address that the order will be picked up from or the customer's address that the order will be delivered to. Order Items The Order Items card displays the following information: Ref : The unique reference number related to the item ordered (SKUs). Product Name : The name of the item ordered Price : The price of the item ordered By default, the Order Item card displays up to 10 items per page. To view more than 10 items, users need to click on the number and select either 25, 50 or 100 items to be displayed. ADDITIONAL INFORMATION - STANDALONE X NON-STANDALONE ITEMS: A standalone item is how we refer to a product that has only one SKU and also appears in OMS with only one SKU associated. The non-standalone items will be the ones that have only one SKU, however, due to system issues it will appear in FluentCommerce in the same way as a bundle or composite. But you check it, it is indeed only one item. Example: Email Sent The Email Sent card displays the following information: Email Category: The type of email sent to the customer. SendOrderConfirmationEmail - email sent once the order status is up to Booked. SendShippingEmail - email sent once the order status is up to Order Shipped . SendOutForDeliveryEmail - email sent once the order status is up to Order Shipped and the order is on the way to the customer's house. SendOrderDeliveredEmail - email sent once the order status is up to Completed . SendInvoiceAsEmail - email sent once the order status is up to Completed . Customer Email: This is the email of the customer that has placed the order. Date & Time: This is the date & time that the customer has placed the order. Delivery Status: Status of the email (Sent). Fulfillment  tab Under the Order page: when viewing the Fulfilments tab, it shows a list of all fulfilments tagged to the Order. Click the specific fulfilment ID and get redirected to the Fulfilment details page : If you would like to review Fulfilment definiton, status and the journey access the article here Related Tab Related Tab is the section of the order that centralizes any supplement or return initiated to the specific order. Returns details: Return Order reference : Unique platform-generated ID associated with the return. Status: Current status of the return. Possible values are: Created Booked Pending Refund (to be validated if it will be included in production) Completed Created: The date the return was created. Comments Tab This tab is where all comments tagged to the order will be shown. If a customer contacts CS and has a request, or if there is any specific information that should be shared related to the order, we should ensure we add a comment to the record. By doing that, you can always review and verify all the previous notes related to the order left by other Emmies. Comments Tab details: Comment: Displays comments updated for the selected order. Created On : Displays the date the comment was created. Updated On : Displays the date the comment was updated. Name : refers to the users' name who posted the comment (Developers are still working on ensuring the NAME OF THE USERS will be added in the comments tab) Leaving comment Step by step on how to leave a comment: 1. Click on the doner button available on the top right of the Order page 2. Click to "Add Comment" 3. Record all the information and Submit Attention When leaving a comment, follow these guidelines: H ow to: Comments in Fluent Commerce : Bettzeit GmbH (freshdesk.com) Video Additional Tabs Transactions Tab You can find all updated information related to the financial transactions of the order, such as payment, refund, compensation, and discounts. The Transaction REF Column shows a line-per-line update regarding this screenshot below. This tab displays the payment type, reference number, date, status, and amount of an order. Transaction Tab details: Ref: This is a unique reference that is associated with the transaction of the selected order. The last part of the ref is regarding its status (i.e. Charged successfully, authorized successfully, refunded successfully, etc.) Created On: This displays the date the transaction was created Status: This displays the transaction status of the order. Type: This displays the type of transaction associated with the order. Card Type: This displays the type of card used for this transaction. Payment Method : This displays the payment method for the transaction. Amount : This displays the amount paid (in $) for a transaction. Attributes Tab Attributes are additional tech information that refers to the order, such as payment provider information, taxes ID; etc. Order Attributes Tab details: The three attribute fields are as follows: Name : This displays the name of the attribute associated with the order. Type: This displays the type of attribute associated with the order. Value: This displays the value of the attribute. Activity Review all order activities in a timely manner: (D evelopers are still working on ensuring the NAME OF THE USERS will be added in the activity tab) Fulfilment Section Fulfillments are the direct equivalents of BARCODES in Magento. Check status, find fulfillment location information & manage the fulfilments under the fulfillment section (e.g. edit / cancel it) The other way of viewing fulfillments was already detailed above in the Navigating - Order management: Fulfilments tab Fulfilment Section details: Fulfilment Ref : This is a unique ID that is associated with the fulfillment Order Ref : the Order number reference where the fulfillment is tagged Customer : Reference of the customer name Fulfilment Status : This displays the fulfillment status of the order Fulfilment Location: This displays the fulfillment location assigned for this fulfilment (warehouse) SKU : what is the SKU related to the fulfilment Retailer name : market related Creation Date : The date when the fulfillment was created By default, the fulfillment tab displays up to 10 items per page. To view more than 10 items, users can click on the number and select either 25, 50 or 100 items to be displayed. Customers Section Once you click on the order details page, inside the customer information on the customer name , you will be redirected to the Customer's details. Information will be displayed such as customer contact information, country related, and how many orders the customer has already created (the whole list of the order). Customer Details: The Customer info card displays information related to the customer that placed the order. Customer Name : This is the name of the customer that has placed the order. Ref : This is the customer code which is the reference in the system Phone Number : This is the phone number of the customer that has placed the order. Email : This is the email of the customer that has placed the order. Returns Section Under the return section, you will be able to visualize all returns in place, shown in a chronological way. Billing Accounts Section The Billing accounts tab shows a list of all billing accounts , which can be filtered accordingly. These billing accounts are tagged to the corresponding customer, showing a history of all financial transactions (currently just Credit Memos, soon will include invoices). Credit Memos Section The credit memos tab shows a list of all credit memos, which can be filtered accordingly. A credit memo is a financial term for a monetary transaction, e.g. a refund to the customer. After an item cancellation, a credit memo is automatically created. You can immediately find it by accessing the Credit memo in the Menu bar and it will be related to the fulfillment ID. The Credit memo (CM) page contains: Credit Note Ref : the unique reference for the CM Order : Order Reference tagged to the CM Amount : Total Value of the CM Date : Date the CM was created Status : Refers to the CM Status, which is described in the table below (Credit Memo Status) Credit Memo status The credit memo will always display the total amount of the transaction & you will be also able to find the status of it, in accordance with our Emma Refunds team update. Status What does it mean? Created credit memo has been created Requested credit memo has been acknowledge PSP Pending credit memo is processing Complete credit memo is completed Failed credit memo has failed Understanding Credit Memo For the naming convention of Credit memos, the credit memo ref is coded as follows: “CM” Code Order Number # for credit memo Credit Memo details page When clicking on a specific credit memo, you will be able to check its details: Searching for an Order Currently, you are able to search for an order by providing relative filters on it: Order reference number Order creation date Order Status Order Type Under the order list section, you can easily add the required filter to narrow down your search. Video: Review How to: Dashboard & Home Page here Check out How to: order Management or access all FluentCommerce articles available here

title: How to: Supplement Order
content: ​ Release Note: 11/11/2025 - Added disclaimer to "Disclaimer!" section (third bullet-point): mandatory to be included in the communications with our customers when a supplement is done: " Disclaimer: Your trial and warranty begin on the delivery date of your first product. If we replace your product under a warranty claim, the replacement will continue with the same remaining trial and warranty time as the original. " ​ TABLE OF CONTENTS Introduction Supplement Order: General Information What is a Supplement Order? Supplement Reasons When to create a Supplement Order? [For FR agents ONLY] Disclaimer! Supplement Order in fluent: Supplement Order: Step by step Supplement Order Number logic Search for Supplement orders Specific Supplement order Supplement orders (database) Canceling Supplement orders Supplement for Magento Orders How to handle Step-by-step to request the Supplement for Magento Orders key-words supplement order; wrong mattress; replacement; wrong order. Introduction In this article, you will check the cases where a Supplement Order can be created and also how to create it in the Fluent Commerce tool. Supplement Order: General Information What is a Supplement Order? Every time an item should be added to an order with no cost (zero value) to the customer, a Supplement Order should be created and added to the original one. This action on the system will be triggered in specific scenarios in which we need to send an additional item to the customer associated with his original request. When to create a Supplement Order? In the scenarios that the customer is entitled to have a Replacement , or when it's a case for an Add-on . ​ For reasons Replacement, we consider: Logistic claim for wrong product sent (from Emma's side); ​ Logistic claim for lost/stolen; Logistic claim for Carrier Misbehaviour (if there's a lack of consistency in the information provided by carriers and the customer isn't the one to blame for the fact that the order was Returned to Sender); Product claim (any). Examples: Customer ordered a 140x200cm mattress but received a 160x200cm; Or if the product if the customer ordered a bed and didn't receive all the parcels for the assembly; Or if the customer gets a product that has a broken foam or a dimension deviation; Or if the customer states that the carrier didn't appear at their house and product was Returned to Sender (please review on the tracking page if the customer was informed about the delivery attempts. if it was, then no supplement should be done, if it wasn't, then we're ok to supplement). ​ For reasons Add-on, we consider: the products are sent to the customer as an added value to the order or original product. ​ Examples: Sending a comfort layer on return deflection cases. ​ Supplement Reasons​ When creating the Supplement, ensure you always select the correct reason: LC - Carrier Incident Use this when the issue is clearly attributable to the carrier. Examples include: The parcel was returned to sender without reaching the customer. There was a failed delivery attempt due to an address error not caused by us. The package was delayed beyond the acceptable timeframe and was never delivered. LC - Damaged Parcel Select this when the parcel arrives with visible damage Examples include: Torn or crushed outer packaging. Water-damaged boxes. Signs of mishandling (e.g., punctures, dents, or excessive tape from rewrapping). Visible damage that indicated that the product may have been compromised in transit. LC - Lost / Stolen / Incomplete Choose this when the parcel is missing, tampered with, or arrived with missing contents. Examples include: The customer reports non-receipt, and tracking confirms delivery to the wrong address or an unresolved issue. There is no update in the tracking for over 10 calendar days, and item is still not delivered. A package arrives partially opened or with missing items. LC - Wrong Item Select this reason when the customer receives the wrong product due to an error by the carrier, or our warehouse. Examples include: The item delivered has a different SKU, size, color, or model than what was ordered. Indication that the carrier may have switched or misdelivered the parcel during transit. ​ Product Claim Select this when the issue is related to product quality or a manufacturing defect. Examples include: Malfunctioning items out of the box. Faulty or defective components. The product does not match the description or images. Missing items with no damage signs in the outterbox Wrong item received with no evedencice that this was caused by the carrier ​ Return Process Use this for standard return-related supplements. Examples include: Plastic bags when required by process Comfort layers when included in the deflection actions Exceptions (Approval Required) Use this reason when a supplement has already been sent, but a second is required due to a special or complex case. In such situations, escalate to a Senior Agent for approval.Senior Agents must add a clear Fluent note documenting the approval or rejection, along with the reason. If the supplement was initially created by a Senior Agent, Supervisor approval is required. Only in exceptional cases,already escalated to Supervisors,should this be escalated internally. Examples include: The first supplement was received incorrectly or incomplete or damaged. Supplement is taking too long to arrive. Additional items are needed to fully resolve the issue. ​ When NOT to create a Supplement Order? We have certain scenarios in which we SHOULD NEVER create a Supplement Order. Those are the following: If you previously created a supplement that arrived in a condition requiring replacement, please return the entire item for a refund If the customer is upset and unwilling to return the full item for a refund, please escalate the case to a Senior Agent to request approval for providing an additional supplement, ensure to use the correct reasons for the supplement reason " Exceptions (approval required)" @Senior Agents : Ensure you leave a comment in Fluent documenting your approval or rejection of the additional supplement. If the customer does not like his SKU or wants to return it during the trial period (exchange the color of the product, for example); If the customer ordered the wrong SKU (due to a fault of his own); If the customer does not like an SKU that is part of a bundle; Phase out SKUs If the customer bought a “limited stock” SKU that is no longer available. If the customer clearly states that there was damage caused by them (e.g., the mattress was stained by a spill, torn during handling, or damaged by a pet), please make a note of it and remmeber in such cases, the customer will not be eligible for a return during their trial period For those cases above, the correct process is: the original product needs to be returned and the customer refunded; and then the customer can place a new order in the webshop. If SKU being sent is incorrect, please inform your supervisor and our internal team accordingly . If a phased SKU qualifies for a valid claim and the customer chooses an upgrade instead of a return/refund, we’ll supply the nearest equivalent model. Please note that the standard trial-period return right will not apply to this replacement, and it cannot be returned simply because it does not meet personal expectations. This policy is also detailed in our Terms & Conditions. ​ If a full supplement order is to be sent to the customer, ensure the return is only initiated after the supplement has been successfully delivered (request customer to contact back once suplement is received). This prevents the customer from being without the product while awaiting the replacement. In addition to that, please also NEVER create Supplement Orders to unblock orders (any scenario in the order is not on the normal flow). The correct process is: to escalate via JIRA to: Order Management team: AR D2C Portal (formerly Order-to-Cash) - Raise a request - Jira Service Management for the status covered on the "Order Stuck Concerns" choice, or; Back-Office team (if your market has a back-office team). Any other status, inform customer of the expected lead time or offer cancellation and refund. ​ ​ Disclaimer! Supplement Order in fluent: Please be aware, when creating a supplement order in Fluent Commerce and you need to add a composable product (as a bed that has more then one SKU), you need to manually add all related SKUs of the product before placing it. Place the supplement order only once all items were added from the composable product. Do not place supplement orders with separated orders per SKU. ​ Mandatory to be included in the communications with our customers when a supplement is done: " Disclaimer : Your trial and warranty begin on the delivery date of your first product. If we replace your product under a warranty claim, the replacement will continue with the same remaining trial and warranty time as the original. " Please be aware, For the record: we are already working to update this as soon as possible and the composable product (more then one box / SKUs goes automatically once selected). ​ Please note: you need to select you country related SKU. Review link for specific countries SKU's here Supplement Order: Step by step 1. Check the SKUs that you need to supplement the order in the product page 2. Check if the Masterfile of Phased out Items first . If the item is not there, then check the stock for the SKUs following this instructions , and only proceed with the supplement if it has the minimum amount of stock required. If item is phased out or there's no stock inform the customer that the item is currently unavailable. The options for the customer are: Wait for when there's stock so we can supplement (you can check for the lead time in the website for a "replenishment date") Return product according to the T&Cs If it's a product claim and customer decides to keep it, we can offer a compensation according to the Compensation Matrix. ​ If there's stock: once you gathered the information required, go to the original order of the customer 1. click the kebab button to access the action bar. 2. click on Create Supplement Order A supplement order page will pop up: 3. Select the Name or SKU to be included in the supplement order and click on Next . Search function: You can search by product Name or SKU .When typing the SKU, the search function will display options after 4 characters are typed in. If you are pasting the entire SKU number, try deleting one character for the dropdown options to be shown. 4. Select the quantity that should be added to the supplement order. ​ 5. If you need to add more SKU to the supplement, cancel the previous SKU from the search bar and add the next SKU. ​ The system will keep record of all the SKUs added. ​ ​ 6. click next . 6. Confirm order delivery details based on the original order (in case customers requests to change, follow customers' preference) 7. Click on Next . A summary of the supplement order will pop up. 8. Confirm customer email. 9. Select Supplement reason Replacement Add-on Review the possible outcomes accessing the Order outcome article 10. Submit and Supplement order will be created. You can access the Supplement order by checking the original order " related page ". Supplement Order Number logic The Supplement order number is based on the original order number. It will always start with the original order number, followed by a dash (-), and finally a new Supplement number. The Supplement number is always sequential, so starts with -1, and then goes on to -2, -3, etc, as per screen shot below: Search for Supplement orders Specific Supplement order When accessing the order list page, you can search by Order reference number , and add the original number of the order. You will be able to see all orders and supplement orders related to it as per the screenshot below: Supplement orders (database) You can always search supplement orders by adding a filter search as -1 or -2, as per the naming logic explained above. Canceling Supplement orders For order cancellation, ensure you follow the normal cancellation steps, as per How to: Order cancelation article Supplement Order for Magento Orders Once Fluent Commerce is implemented, we do not ship orders placed in Magento anymore. This means: that in case you receive a customer request that the order was placed in Magento, but now you need to make a Supplement, the supplement CANNOT be opened in Magento. The new order needs to be created in Fluent Commerce, and for it, you must open a JIRA ticket at the Order-2-Cash Portal . How to handle: 1. Submit the JIRA ticket: Provide all information in the ticket form and submit it. 2. Leave a note in Magento related order registering the request has been submitted to Fluent Commerce team. 3. Manage customer expectation . Customer will receive a confirmation email as soon as the order is placed by the team. In case you need visibility of the status of the supplement order, you can always: i.. Search in fluent commerce (use customer email or any available data you may have) ii. Reach out your team lead IMPORTANT: The Order Management Team will handle the request within 5 business days. Please do not open a new request to the Back-Office team. If the timeframe has passed and you didn't get a reply, please reach out to your supervisor so the issue can be escalated internally. Step-by-step to request the Supplement for Magento Orders:

title: OMS Overview: definitions and logics
content: Table of Content What is FluentCommerce? Apps Available Glossary (Terms library) Order Order definition What is the journey of an order? Order Status Where to check the order status? Fulfillment Fulfillment Definition What is the journey of Fulfillment? Fulfillment Status Where to check the Fulfillment status? Managing orders Cancellation Return Supplement Orders Composite Products Definition Fulfillment Definition Cancellation Product Return & pick up What is FluentCommerce? FluentCommerce is the new order management system of Emma COS. it is a platform that tracks sales, orders, inventory, and fulfillment. It enables the people, processes, and partnerships necessary for products to find their way to the customer who bought them. From a CS point of view, it's the tool we use to identify order status, check customers' information, and take required actions such as handling claims, returns, and refunds. Access FluentCommerce by clicking here Apps Available From different Emma teams' & core partners' points of view, FluentCommerce connects all the dots of the journey of an item to ensure the customer can complete their order on the website, and the product is properly delivered to the address provided. Product Availability Get more control over the stock you have Available to Promise Order Management Automate order management across all your systems and processes Global Inventory Power your business with the ultimate enterprise inventory hub Store Fulfillment Boost store performance and improve your staff experience Glossary (Terms library) Access here our Glossary to learn & review some of the basic terms to grasp the overall concepts of building up the Order Management System, particularly in Fluent Commerce. Order Order definition When a customer is placing an order with us, essential data about it is being generated: While navigating to our website and placing the order, the customer selects specific options (such as product, color, size) and provides core information to ensure the purchase of the product. Each purchase made by the customer via our webshop will become an order in our Order Management System (FluentCommerce). The order will always contain: Order number (generated after the purchase is created in our order management system) Products (SKU) & quantity Customer information (email / personal data) Billing information Shipping information Payment information Order Summary (Total & tax specifications) The order management tool will be connected to other systems, ensuring the information provided by the customer while buying a product on our website, is fully delivered to his home on the expected and agreed time. What is the journey of an order? (Status color will be reflected in Fluent Commerce as per the screenshot below) Order Status Status What does it mean? Pending Order is created but awaiting for successful payment update from the payment service provider (PSP) Booked Order is created and OMS received the successful payment update. Fulfillment is created and has been assigned to a Fulfilment location Processing O ne of the Fulfilments within the order has been transmitted to the assigned Fulfilment Location, hence, the order status moved from BOOKED to PROCESSING Shipped All Fulfilments within the order have been marked as picked up by the delivery carrier Complete All Fulfilments within the order have been delivered and handed over to the end customer Canceled All Fulfilments within the order have has been canceled Returned All Fulfilments within the order have been returned Where to check the order status? Related order detail page: Order list (order database): More of this topic in How to: Navigating Fluent Commerce article Fulfillment Fulfillment Definition Fulfillment is a unique ID to track the journey of a request created in a warehouse, with one or more items, at any point in time. Every time an order is placed in our system, a logic behind will group all items according to their warehouse location, and each of these groups will be assigned a fulfillment ID. What is the journey of Fulfillment? Starting with the order confirmation: the journey of fulfillment (Continue) Fulfillment Status Fulfilment Status What does it mean? Assigned After payment, the order is assigned to our internal system. Waiting for Stock If item is not available in our Inventory - not transmitted to the fulfilment location. Submitted to FL The Fulfilment has been transmitted to the Fulfilment location and waiting for FL's confirmation Received by FL The Fulfilment has been received and confirmed by the FL Picked and Packed by FL The process of fulfillment has been started by the FL Ready for Dispatch The fulfillment process was done and the Fulfilment awaits the pick up from the delivery carrier Dispatched The Fulfilment has been picked up by the delivery carrier and on its way to the customers Arrived at Sorting Centre The Fulfilment has arrived at carrier's sorting center and on its way to the customers Out for Delivery The Fulfilment is loaded to a carrier vehicle and is about to be delivered to the end customer - The tracking label will be available in the OMS once the order reaches this Fulfillment Status. Requested for Delivery Option The customer requested another delivery option to the carrier Complete The Fulfilment has been delivered to the customers Canceled Fulfillment is canceled by an user Where to check the Fulfillment status? Under the related Order page: Under the D etails Tab of the order you can scroll down and find the fulfilments of the order.; or access the Fulfilments tab for more details. More of this topic in How to: Navigating Fluent Commerce article Managing orders Let's quickly review the Journey of the order to review the backend logic that runs in Fluent commerce: The customer will place his order on our online store in accordance with his needs. The information provided while placing the order will be part of the Order details page (delivery and invoice address, payment method, items of the order, etc). From it, orders will be created in the order management system: Fluent Commerce; and the system will communicate directly with the warehouse system (for example - Pulpo) and the related country/region carrier partners; to be finally delivered to our customers. Cancellation Cancellation is possible in our system only before the order is transmitted to the warehouse, which means prior to the Submitted fulfillment status. After submitted to FL you must follow the process available in the related request article: How to: Cancellation Return Return an item is only possible in the order management system after fulfillment status is Sh ipped and the invoice is created . You will find two ways to trigger a return in Fluent Commerce: Create return with Refund an item will always be used when the item should be refunded. Create return without Refund option should be used when item should not be refunded (e.g. in a product claim scenario in which a supplement will be created to replace the product). Supplement Orders A supplement order is an order that can be manually created in Fluent Commerce to add an item to an existing order placed by the customer. Supplement orders are created for Replacement or Add on , and they are always created with zero value. Replacement means we are creating a supplement order to replace an item; e.g. for a product claim or a logistic claim. Add-on is an additional SKU (product) added as a supplement order, such as a comfort layer, or a pillow. Composite Products Definition Composite products are products that consist of several components (e.g. a bed that when packed to be delivered, may contain 3 different boxes (components) with different SKU, that result in one item/product). Products that are sold together (for example: if there is a website promotion, by a bed + pillow with a special price are considered bundle orders, not composite products - as they represent two different products). Fulfillment Definition If any of the components of a composed product are out of stock when being transmitted to the warehouse (when the order is placed), the order won't go through, which means the fulfillment status will be Out of stock; and the order status: pending. After being assigned to the warehouse, each component of the order will have a specific fulfillment and a specific tracking link. E.g. If we look at the example above: 1 bed, 3 components: this means each one of the 3 components will have its own tracking information. Cancellation Cancellation of the item is possible only up to Booked status . When canceling the Composite product item, all components fulfillment will be canceled . Product Return & pick up Return means returning the item and triggering a refund . A pick-up is a return that does not trigger the refund , for a scenario such as a replacement (supplement order to replace the original item returned). The return is possible to be initiated only after all components were shipped.

title: Magento - Tracking Links (Parcel Perform)
content: TABLE OF CONTENTS What is Parcel Perform? Where can I access the Parcel Perform How can this be useful? What is Parcel Perform? Parcel Perform is a platform that combines delivery information from all carriers in a single platform improving customer experience. It collects parcel statuses from all our carriers and then triggers the correspondent transactional email, like shipment confirmation & out for delivery. The best part is that for the customer it will look like an Emma page. The Tracking Link will map the delivery across its different moments, enabling us to help customers follow their order and monitor the different statuses of delivery, seeing what they are seeing. Where can I access the Tracking Links You can find them in two different places in Magento's Order page : In the Shipping & Handling Information block, which includes both the Tracking Link and the link to the carrier’s website. They both show the same information, but with different formats: the Parcel Perform link looks like an Emma page and the carriers website depends on each carrier. In the Purchase Orders section you can see the current status for all the Barcodes (including date and time) next to each product and click on the link. Both options will lead you to the web page with the Parcel Perform widget, where you can see the tracking information : How can this be useful? Now that you know how to reach the Tracking Link page it's time to understand how can this be useful for you. Once you access the Tracking Link you will be able to find information about the order status allowing you to have a better overview of the shipping evolution besides the status description, you will also find time and location stamps. Therefore you should use this: When you need Proof of Shipment regarding Logistic claims, if this is the case access the Tracking Link web page, take a screenshot and attach it to the logistic claim . For Logistic Claim it only applies to Lost & Stolen products and Damaged Products Understand what the customer is able to view on their side Customer receives the confirmation email and several update emails, where he has the option to track the order: After selecting "Track your Order" the customer is directed to the Order status page, where he can check and all the order details and track his order. If the customer selects "Track your order" on the new page he will be able to access the tracking links shown above:

title: Magento Reasons Category
content: This aritcle will guide you throught the reasons categories available and when to use each one of them while managing an order in Magento (OMS) Table of Content 1. Discount Reason 2. Logistic Claim 3. Product Claim 4. Return (Trial Period request & Claim outcomes) 5. Unable to deliver: "Others" (Exceptional Return reason) Review Refund escalation Training: HERE 1. Discount Reason Please use Discount only for incentive campaigns as mentioned below. Attention : If the monetary compensation is due to a customer claim (e.g. delay due to out of stock, delay due to the carrier provided, product claim) please use the proper reason category under Claim Reason Category x Compensation). Reason Reason Category When to Use Coupon Code Coupon code match The customer was not able to use a referral code, discount code, or coupon code during the time of order. The customer forgot to use the code The customer wants to match the discount on their previous coupon VS the current coupon/promo Special Price Adjustment Best price match Price mismatch/Price discrepancy adjustment: customer wants to match their purchase price in website VS store price VS D2C. Return defense Strategy Guarantee/warranty request, not related to a logistic or product claim (i.e. customer ordered the incorrect size, change their mind, etc) The customer intent to return the products but CS agents offered a discount for the customer to keep the products. Friend Referral Friend Referral Friend referral program: customer shared referral code to new customers. Should only be requested when referred customers (1)have completed their orders (shipped and invoiced); (2) referrer and referred friend should keep the products; (3) should meet the required spending Compensation (related to a claim) 2. Logistic Claim Logistic Training is available here Logistic Claims Reason Reason Category When to use Delay Order was not transmitted Order information was not transmitted to the warehouse - system issue either Emma or warehouse Out of Stock Delay in dispatch because the product is not available or out of stock during the time of order, but we are still producing the product Warehouse Delay in the dispatch of the products due to warehouse inefficiency/issues depend on warehouse Delayed Delivery Delay on delivery due to the carrier Damages Package (only) damaged The parcel (package only) was damaged. The product was not affected. Product damaged Product damaged during delivery Incorrect Shipment Wrong Product/SKU Shipped Incorrect Shipment: The entire order received by the customer is incorrect. Incomplete shipment: The product is available in the warehouse but failed to include in the dispatch The incorrect size sent by the WH Incorrect product sent by the WH Lost in Transit Lost or stolen Lost in transit No track available, no information about the parcel Incomplete delivery Incompleted products received (no information available) Carrier Misbehaviour Returned by carrier Failure to send a notification to the warehouse about the products to be returned Additional Service not provided Appointment issues The customer claims bad behavior from the carrier Pick up point no notice Carrier was not able to send a notification to the customer when collecting the product Wrong address/person Delivered to a different person/address Property damaged Damage of the property: customer's property was damaged during the time of delivery or collection of products. 3. Product Claim Product Claim training is available here Quality Guidebook - product claim validation here Product Claim Reason (Product) Possible Component Reason Category Mattress Foam Uneven foam Not properly inflated Dimension deviation Broken foam Dirty foam Color different Smell Glue coming off Spring Springs not aligned Fabric cover Holes Dirty Handles breaking Zipper breaking Shrinking cover Plastic foil open Plastic foil open Color rub off Pillows Foam Uneven foam Not properly inflated Dimension deviation Broken foam Dirty foam Color different Smell Fabric Cover Holes Dirty Zipper breaking Shrinking cover Packaging Plastic foil open Color rub off Sleeves Fabric Cover Holes Dirty Elastic breaking Wrong size Loose stitches Shrinking cover Covers Fabric Cover Holes Dirty Loose stitches Wrong size Shrinking cover Bedding Sheets Fabric cover Holes Dirty Elastic breaking Wrong size Loose stitches Shrinking cover Topper Foam Uneven Foam Not properly inflated Dimension deviation Broken foam Color different Smell Duvets Fabric Cover Holes Dirty Elastic breaking Wrong size Loose stitches Filling coming out Slatted Frame Frame Part doesn't fit Broken part Missing part Noise Beds Frame Part doesn't fit Broken part Missing part Upholstery damaged Wrong variant 4. Return (Trial Period request & Claim outcomes) In our order management system, there are two circumstances where you may need to return an item. 1. It will be a return due to a claim - Logistic or product claim (mentioned above). 2. It will be a return request under the trial period - where you can review the details here Either way, while triggering the return in the OMS you should always ensure you are providing the proper reason category related to it: Return Reason (All products) When to use Return due to a Claim Claim Product Claim Return will be triggered after validation criteria and the product will be replaced (Product Claim has already been flagged as per item 3. Product Claim ) Logistic Claim Return will be triggered after validation criteria and the product or refund will be done. (Logistic Claim has already been flagged as per item 2. Logistic Claim ) Return under Trial Period Request Customer ordered incorrectly Ordered wrong size ordered The customer ordered the wrong size & would like to return/exchange it. Ordered twice The customer placed extra orders, could not cancel on time, need to return. Customer Decision The item is received too late Customer already received the item and doesn't want it anymore because it took too long to be delivered. In this case, a return method will need to be specified for the customer to return the item (dropoff or collection). RTS / Cancellation (RTS = return to sender) Customer is requesting a refund before the item is delivered. Either if it is a Cancellation or Late Cancellation and needs to be refused at the door. In this case, if needed, the delivery carrier will send item back to the sender. Product unmet expectations Product is too warm, causes sweating Customer did not adapt to the product: too warm in his opinion Product is too firm Customer did not adapt to the product: too firm in his opinion Product is too soft Customer did not adapt to the product: too soft in his opinion Product causes pain/discomfort Customer did not adapt to the product: was causing pain or discomfort The cover does not have a nice touch Customer did not adapt to the product: the cover did not feel nice in his opinion Cannot adjust the height for myself Customer did not adapt to the product: the cover did not feel nice in his opinion Product doesn't correspond to my mattress size Product ordered was not correct size for customer's corresponding mattress Product is unstable Product was not stable enough for customer Product is too complicated to assemble Customer did not adapt to the product: was not able to assemble the bed Product is not warm enough Customer did not adapt to the product: was not able to keep him warm Product is too light Customer did not adapt to the product: was too light in his opinion Product is too heavy Customer did not adapt to the product: was too heavy in his opinion No improvement in my sleep Product was not able to improve sleep of customer Product is too small Product was too small for customer Product is not soft enough Customer did not adapt to the product: was not soft enough in his opinion Other Other reasons (the comment is mandatory) When the return reason is not found in the dropdown. Agent must fill in the comment with the real return reason stated by the customer 5. Unable to deliver: "Others" ( Exceptional Return reason) There are scenarios that we are unfortunately, not able to deliver the item to the customer and the item is returned to the warehouse (address was not found, customer rejected the order, etc). Please be aware this situation is not a return , as the order was never received by the customer and we are not triggering a return to pick up an item. This is an unable to deliver scenario . If you need to trigger a refund to the customer, exceptionally, in Magento, you will trigger a return by using Other reasons and adding the relative comment as per description bellow. Return reason Mandatory comment Scenario RTS / Cancellation Reject by customer Customer rejected the parcel upon arrival (e.g. a late cancellation) Other reasons (the comment is mandatory) Unable to deliver Delivery company was unable to deliver the parcel and it has returned to sender - warehouse. (e.g. could not find the address, no answer, etc)
