content: Table of Content TABLE OF CONTENTS Address Correction Incorrect address database Correcting the address Address investigation Steps Dropshipping API orders Packing Slips (Address/ Label Errors) Packing Slips (Attaching a Label) Return Page Pending Label list Add label ID Return page Update Return status Re-trigger return (API) Warehouse Inventory Payone Address Correction Incorrect address database If you need to access the orders we have suck due to address mistake: Sales tab Incorrect address Store - Select related market / country Type - filter the type of orders that should be presented Correcting the address Access the related order page. Click to Edit the Shipping address Review & copy the original information provided by the customer (check Investigation steps below) Change the existing address according to the format in google while also changing the special characters (if any) Save Order address Set delivery note under the order details box Paste the original address provided by the customer and Update note Please note: After updating the address you need to refresh the barcode (to release from the stuck). Check the How to: Packing Slip section in this Magento: back-office article. Address investigation Steps Copy the original information - as you will have to log a Delivery note in the order details with the original information provided by the customer. Make sure that all special characters are replaced with regular characters (ä = ae, ü = ue, ö = oe, ß = s/ss) Copy-paste the existing street address, city, and zip code in google (verify if it is correct) Please note: blank spaces at the end of any information can be the cause of the error. Ensure you remove it. Correct the information as per previous step 2. Note that the customer’s name and street address cannot exceed 35 characters including the spaces. Dropshipping API orders Packing Slips (Address/ Label Errors) Whenever you need to refresh the status of a barcode (Label error), you can do it accessing the related order/barcode on the Packing Slips page: Sales Dropshipping API orders Packing Slips To refresh the status and release the order stuck: Select related barcode/order you have updated the address Actions: Change status (error only) Status: New Submit Packing Slips (Attaching a Label) Search for the related order. Upload label, add track number Save Return Page Pending Label list To access the list of Returns and identify the ones you need to create a label: 1. Catalog 2. Product Returns 3. All Filter: Market-related Shipping Method ( label related options) Status: Expected The label should be created via the related courier portal. Add label ID After creating the label based on the Return request information, you should add the label (tracking id) to the return related (comment) and include pick-up date. Return page Comment section: Add tracking ID number (label) & pick up date Save Update Return status Expected to Completed If there is no API available (integration that automates the change of the return status from Expected to Initiated), sometimes we may need to change the status manually. For that, under the return page: 1. Status: update it to Complete 2. Save Re-trigger return (API) Certain scenarios will require you to restart a return. As an example, 2 Men handling / DHL return is triggered by the API calls, and Magento automatically transmits the request to our partner. To ensure you initiate the return (again) whenever needed you should change it "Customer pick up status (collection). Steps: Under the return related: Change the customer pickup status from " DHL Delivery commissioned" to " Pending " Save. Warehouse Inventory Once opening the Warehouse Stock page, you can narrow down your search by adding the SKU number to its search. Also, you can add a filter related to the Store (market). From it, you can check the combination between warehouse & suppliers and identify the number of SKUs available. You may find scenarios, where one warehouse is out of the stock. Whenever it happens and you have no information about a new SKU available, escalate to your country's Logistic team for further information. Payone Only for Payments tasks If you need to locate a transaction number, you need to access Payone section in Magento. If you work with Payment back-office tasks and have no access to it: reach out to your Team lead.

title: Magento: Cancellation/Refund for an Unable to deliver scenario
content: Please be aware this is a workaround for Magento - and should not be used for scenarios in Fluent Commerce. For Fluent Commerce Unable to deliver scenarios, ensure you follow this article: Late Cancellation & Refuse at door cases - Submit a Cancellation request When delivering orders to the customers, our delivery companies may face scenarios that unfortunately, we are unable to deliver the item to the customer. Some companies will try to reship the items, or communicate with the customer directly to resolve the situation. But by the end, there are parcels that will ended up returned to the warehouse. Please be aware this situation is not a return , as the order was never received by the customer and we are not triggering a return to pick up an item. This is an unable to deliver scenario . If you need to trigger a refund to the customer on those scenarios, exceptionally, in Magento, you will trigger a return by using Other reasons and adding the relative comment as per description bellow. Return reason Mandatory compulsory comment Scenario RTS / Cancellation Reject by customer Customer rejected the parcel upon arrival (e.g. a late cancellation) Other reasons (the comment is mandatory) Unable to deliver Delivery company was unable to deliver the parcel and it has returned to sender - warehouse. (e.g. could not find the address, no answer, etc)

title: Magento: The journey of an Item
content: Table of Content Order Order definition What is the journey of an order? Order Status - Meaning Where to check the order status? Barcode Barcode Definition What is the journey of Barcode? Barcode Status Where to check the Barcode status? Order Changes / Cancellations requests Order Order definition Each purchase made by the customer via any of our channels becomes an order in our Order Management System (FluentCommerce). While navigating to our website and placing the order, the customer selects specific options (such as product, color, and size) and provides core information to ensure the purchase of the product. The order will always contain: Order number (generated after the purchase is created in our order management system) Products (SKU) & quantity Customer information (email / personal data) Billing information Shipping information Payment information Order Summary (Total & tax specifications) All this data will be centralized in our Order Management Tool. The order management tool will be connected to other systems, ensuring the information provided by the customer while buying a product on our website, is fully delivered to his home on the expected and agreed time. What is the journey of an order? From the purchase to delivery: Order Status - Meaning Order Status What does it means? Pending The order is waiting for the receipt of payment (depending on the payment method) Payment Received the payment has been received by the system and is being sent to the warehouse Processing (not always) but it means the order is in the process by the warehouse Completed The system was updated by the warehouse as the package is ready to be shipped / on the way to the customer. Cancel Requested The order has been canceled and waiting to be processed by the refund team Canceled Cancellation has been pushed through, and refund (if applicable) is being processed by the system Refunded The refund has been processed on our end and the funds have been released from our account Where to check the order status? You can find the Order Status under the details of the order related: Barcode Barcode Definition When an order is created in our system, every item of the order will have a related fulfillment ID. Every item of the order will have a related Barcode ID. The barcode (fulfillment) is a unique ID to track the journey of an Item at any point in time. What is the journey of Barcode? Starting with the order confirmation: the journey of an item: (Continue) Barcode Status Where to check the Barcode status? You can find the Barcode Status under the Order Details: Order Changes / Cancellations requests Once the information of the order has been transmitted to the warehouse/carrier, we can't take it back. This means modification/cancellation can only be placed in the system up to barcode Prepared for Export . After it, we will try workarounds to stop the journey of the order, but we won't be able to do it through our system. You can review how to proceed accessing the CS Processes (Customer Inquiries) related article.

title: Offline Global: Magento |What & How to
content: TABLE OF CONTENTS Magento: Order Management System Access Magento Home Landing Page Orders Search for an Order Order Page Order status Barcode Status Barcode & SKU Delivery Note How to: Order Confirmation Resend Order Confirmation Download Order confirmation (PDF) How to: Edit an order Customer email Update Delivery information Custom delivery date - Up to Prepared for Export Address/ Telephone details - Up to Prepared for Export Custom delivery date / Address/ Telephone details - After to Prepared for Export - up to Order/ Customer Shipped How to: Cancellation Order Cancellation Partial Cancellation Barcode Update for Partial Cancellation After cancellation How to: Supplement Order Supplement Order: Replacement Supplement Order: Add on Complimentary SKU How to: Discount How to: Compensation (monetary compensation) How to: Product Return Returns Information Return page: reading it Status of the Return: Status of the Refund: Customer pick up status: How to: Product Claim How to: Logistic Claim How to: Invoice Create an Invoice Download the invoice Find an invoice in Magento How to: Discount code list Reminder : Whenever any action regarding an order is taken, a comment in "customer inquiries" must be left in the original order . Magento: Order Management System Magento is the order management system we have been using to manage orders until 2022. With Emma COS , we are switching from Magento to Fluentcommerce. Check out the CS Tools: OMS - Fluentcommerce (EmmaCOS) folder for more information related. If your country has already migrated to Fluentcommerce, you may receive customer orders from the past that were placed via Magento. As an order management tool, Magento is a platform that centralizes all order information placed by the customer. It tracks sales, orders, inventory, and fulfillment (barcodes). It enables the people, processes, and partnerships necessary for products to find their way to the customer who bought them. From a CS point of view, it's the tool we use to identify order status, check customers' information, and take required actions such as handling claims, returns, and refunds. Access Magento Access Magento here If you are based in one of our Contact center partners, reach out your Team Lead in case you have trouble loging to Freshdesk. If you are an Emmie and have no credentials, open a request here Home Landing Page When you open Magento, the default page is the Home Landing Page: You can set up the language according to your preference. Orders To access and manage the orders, you should click on the Sales Tab and Orders, and a list of the orders will be displayed in Magento. Search for an Order You can localize an order by its order number . We can also narrow down the filter by adding the Store (country) related. You need to click on Search button on the right side (as per screenshot below). Once the result loads up, click on it to open up the order. Order Page Order status You can find the order status in a specific order page , inside the order information section : The status of the order will be automatically updated in accordance to the package journey Order Status What does it means? Pending The order is waiting for the receipt of payment (depending on the payment method) Payment Received the payment has been received by system and is being sent to the warehouse Processing (not always) but it means the order is in the process by the warehouse Completed The system was updated by the warehouse as the package is ready to be shipped / on the way to the customer. Cancel Requested The order has been canceled and waiting to be processed by the refund team Canceled Cancellation has been pushed through, and refund (if applicable) is being processed by the system Refunded The refund has been processed on our end and the funds have been released from our account Barcode Status Barcode is an Identification number related to each item of the order. Its status of it will change in accordance with its journey. You can find the order status in a specific order page , inside the Details of the order section: Barcode & SKU SKU Code or Stock Keeping Unit is the key information to control and manage the warehouse stock. SKU is a unique reference number related to a specific Emma Product, in agreement with the record of it in our Magento Inventory. Delivery Note Search for the order number in Magento + click on “shipments” in the left side of the page Now click on the line you need. More lines might appear if more shipments in the same order Now click on “print” in the top right corner. A PDF file will now open. This file you need to save on your computer. This is the delivery note. Lieferschein = Delivery note How to: Order Confirmation Resend Order Confirmation If there is a need to resend an order confirmation due to any email modification: 1. Resend confirmation email by clicking: Send Email button. Download Order confirmation (PDF) If there is a need to Download the Order confirmation in a PDF Format: 1. Click on PRINT button 2. Download the PDF 2. Send it via email to the customer (using the related Freshdesk ticket or a new one, if not existing). How to: Edit an order Customer email Customer email can be changed at anytime. However, remember that, in countries where GDPR applies, this change can only be done after authenticating the customer, using 3 other factors of identification (name under which the order was placed, order number, billing/shipping address or phone number). Update Delivery information Custom delivery date - Up to Prepared for Export Whenever the customer would like to change the delivery schedule time , is possible only up to Prepared for Export . Important information The custom delivery date you will change the date the barcode will be transmitted - not the arrival date of the order. This means you should always customize the date counting with the estimated delivery time . Let's see in practice: Example : customer would live the order to be delivered on the 30 of June. Estimated delivery time 3-5 days. Custom date should be the 25th of June. Count of days should be only business days - never include weekends or local holidays. Address/ Telephone details - Up to Prepared for Export Address Telephone Delivery scheduled time (Custom delivery date) Order details modification related to the address is only possible up to Prepared for Export (same as a cancellation) as any change need to be done before the information of the order is transmitted to the warehouse. Custom delivery date / Address/ Telephone details - After to Prepared for Export - up to Order/ Customer Shipped If delivery with Label Modification may be possible directly with the carrier company: upon tracking link availability, the customer can access it directly via the carrier company portal and try to add new address information to it. If it does not work, when delivering failure, the carrier request will be open to us to confirm the address of the customer and we will be able to modify it. Please note: Always leave a note with the new address requested by the customer as in case the Carrier company reaches us, we are able to collect information easily. If delivery with 2 Man Handling (2ML - e.g. beds or heavy packages) Escalate the case (Country related) Your back office or Team lead to request contact directly with the carrier company to try modification directly. How to: Cancellation Order Cancellation Cancel an order in Magento is only possible up to the barcode Prepared for Export. When the order status changes from it to the next status (Order submitted to the warehouse), it means the order has been transmitted to the warehouse and the cancellation in the system is not possible, as it won't stop the processing steps. 1. Check barcode status of the items. If the order is up to the Prepared for Export , the Cancel button will be available under the Order Action bar. After clicking on the Cancel button, a window will pop up to add related cancellation request details: Partial Cancellation (details below) Or If whole order cancellation: select reason Select outcome: No Refund or Refund or cancel payment (based on customer payment method) Sent Send email to customer (always select the option) Partial Cancellation Choose partial cancellation if you want to cancel a single or several items of the order, but not the whole order. If partial cancellation, the following window will pop up: Select the items you want to cancel. Select the cancellation reason in the drop-down Select the customer should receive a confirmation of the cancellation (should always be the case). Select whether the items to be canceled should be refunded. Click on 'Cancel selected items'. Barcode Update for Partial Cancellation For partial cancellation only: After cancellation request has been created, barcodes should be updated to ensure that the cancelled products will not be shipped and/or delivered to customers. Note: When updating the barcode, it is important that the cancellation request has been initiated first to avoid error in creating the cancellation request. 1. Go to Catalog > Barcodes > Manage Barcodes 2. You will be routed to Barcodes screen. Search for the order which the barcode needs to be updated. You can search as many orders as needed. 3. Select the item that needs to be updated, usually the barcode of the parcel/item that needs to be cancelled is Requested Cancel. Choose Change Status on the Actions dropdown. 4. Choose Cancelled and click Submit. 5. Notification will be shown once the update was updated, and you can see the change of barcode status to Canceled. After cancellation If the cancellation has been requested and has been placed in Magento, it will end up in the Cancel Requested queue and the cancellation button will turn gray and can no longer be clicked. When the cancellation request has been confirmed by Order Management (Refunds), the refund is initiated. Barcodes and Order Status update during and after cancellation has been processed: Cancellation Type Upon Cancellation Request After Cancellation Barcode Order Status Barcode Order Status Partial Cancellation Other parcels not yet shipped Requested cancel Cancel Requested Cancelled Cancel Requested/ Payment Received Other parcels are already shipped Requested cancel Cancel Requested Cancelled Payment Received Bundled order (beds) Requested cancel Cancel Requested Cancelled Payment Received Full Cancellation Single parcel Requested cancel Cancel Requested Deleted Cancelled Multiple parcels Requested cancel Cancel Requested Deleted Payment Received Bundled order (beds) Requested cancel/ Packing Cancel Requested Deleted Payment Received How to: Supplement Order Every time an item should be added to an order with no cost (zero value) to the customer, a S upplement Order should be created and added to the original one. This action on the system will be triggered in specific scenarios in which we need to send an additional item to the customer associated with his original request. When to create a Supplement Order? In the scenarios that the customer is entitled to have a Replacement (product is defective and we should replace it), or when it's a case for an Add-on (we are sending a pillow to the customer as a claim compensation due to a delay). 1) For reasons Replacement, we consider: Logistic claim for wrong product sent (from Emma's side); Logistic claim for lost/stolen; Product claim (any). Examples: Customer ordered a 140x200cm mattress but received a 160x200cm; Or if the product if the customer ordered a bed and didn't receive all the parcels for the assembly; Or if the customer gets a product that has a broken foam or a dimension deviation. 2) For reasons Add-on, we consider: The products are sent to the customer as an added value to the order or original product. Examples: Sending a pillow as an extra due to a delay case; Or sending a comfort layer on return deflection cases. When NOT to create a Supplement Order? We have certain scenarios in which we SHOULD NEVER create a Supplement Order. Those are the following: If the customer does not like his SKU or wants to return it during the trial period (exchange color of the product, for example); If the customer ordered the wrong SKU (due to a fault of his own); If the customer does not like an SKU that is part of a bundle; If the customer bought a phased-out SKU; If the customer bought a “limited stock” SKU that is no longer available; -> The correct process is: the original product needs to be returned and the customer refunded; and then the customer will have to place a new order in the webshop. In addition to that, please also NEVER create Supplement Orders to unblock orders (any scenario that the order is not on the normal flow). The correct process is: to escalate via JIRA to the Order Management team or to the Back-Office team (if your market has a back-office team). How to Supplement Order: Replacement At the moment, as we are transitioning all orders to FluentCommerce, we NO LONGER create Supplement orders in Magento. If you need to create a supplement for an order that is still placed in Magento, please check the section "Supplement for Magento Orders" in the article "How to: Supplement Order" . How to: Discount We may need to provide a monetary discount to an existing order from a customer as an example, when a cupon code does not work properly and the order is confirmed with no discount applied. We can always trigger a refund over the paid amount by the customer via Magento by creating a Discount. Before we proceed, let's recall some core information related to the Refund Escalation Guideline . Access Refund escalation article here. As per the screenshot above, The discount should always be applied to the ROW total of the order, with exception of Forgot the coupon code or Best Match claim. For those two reasons, you should always apply the discount only for the related product and not for the whole order. Creating a Discount: With the order opened, click on the Discount button and wait for the new form to load. Refers to Item: Entire order or Specific SKU (only in case of Forgot the coupon code or Best price Match claim). Select the Discount Reason category based on the Magento Reasons Category guideline. Acess Magento Reason category article here Select Specific Discount Reason Add comments related to the discount Access Note article here Add pictures (if required) Finally, Save the changes. How to: Compensation (monetary compensation) A possible outcome of an order claim could be compensation, which means a percentage of money paid by the guest back to its original payment method (monetary compensation). How to: Product Return There may be different scenarios in which customers may request to return their product after having received it. Reason can be related to the 100-night-trial , as an example, based on customer adaptation or even hardness preferences. Or it can be also linked to a defective product we may need to change. Either way. the way to trigger the return of a product in Magento will always be the same. Access the order-related page, and for triggering the refund you should provide related information about it to ensure the country operations team takes the proper steps to it. With the order opened, click on the Return button and wait for the new form to load. Return Products: Select the related item to be returned in the first collum. Quality: select if the mattress is packed or unpacked (as this will directly influence the pick-up logistic. if packed : the mattress returns to the warehouse if unpacked : the mattress will be picked up in accordance to the country police (donation/refurbishment / etc). Refund to the customer: select if the customer should receive a full refund or no refund at all. Pickup/Return-Service : select the pick-up company based on your country. Reason for the Return : select a related reason for the return. Follow the return Reasons guideline - access Handling Return article here Comments : add related return information (include pick-up day if appointment) and follow the Notes guidelines. Follow the Notes guideline - access article here Finally, Save Order. After triggering the return in Magento, you may need to create labels or arrange the pickup appointment. Check your country-related article if there are any pending steps to ensure the return is triggered properly. Returns Information You can always find return information by easily accessing it in 2 ways: Searching it under the Return database: Accessing it directly through the order: Return page: reading it Under the return detail page, you will always find the information provided by the CS agent who triggered the refund (as per the steps above on How to: Product Return ). Status of the Return : Status of the Refund : Customer pick up status : How to: Product Claim Product claims are complaints of the customers related to the quality or de production of our EMMA Products. Claims can lead to different outcomes such as a return, replacement, or even monetary compensation (which is a possible refund of a certain amount of the cost paid by the guest, based on the country-specific Compensation Matrix ). Remember, all steps should be followed before registering the claim in the system. Ensure the claim is validated as per our Product claim Guideline - article here With the order opened, click on the Product Claim button and wait for the new form to load Select the related product from the order Select the component of the product related to the claim Select the related claim reason Acess Magento Reason category article here Add validated pictures Add comments related to the claim Access Note article here Define outcome: View order , Supplement Order , Return the product, or Compensation . How to: Logistic Claim With the order opened, click on the Logistic Claim button and wait for the new form to load Select the related Item related Select the Phase (reason) of the claim: Delay (if the order is already out of the expected delivery date Carrier Misbehaviour (if customer has a claim related to the carrier behaviour) Damages (if the package/product has arrived damaged) Lost in transit Incorrect Shipment Select the related Reason Category Acess Magento Reason category article here Add validated pictures Add comments related to the claim Access Note article here Define outcome: View order , Supplement Order , Return the product, or Compensation . How to: Invoice Create an Invoice If you need to manually create an invoice: 1. Invoice button 2. Select the related SKU 3. Amount: Capture online option 4. Submit Invoice You can see the confirmation in the Magento system notes. Download the invoice Click on " Invoices “ section Select the invoice you want to send (you may need to open it to see which item it is). Related invoice will open. Click on ' Print ' and download the invoice. Then you can send it to the customer via Freshdesk ticket. Find an invoice in Magento You search the order in Magento, and you go to “invoices” in the left side of the page. Now click on the line you need. Then click on “print” A PDF will now open. This you can download and save, and send the the customer, carrier or whoever requested it. How to: Discount code list Whenever you need infomartion regarding a discount code, you can always check it conditions & expiration date by checking our Discount code (Coupon code) data base. Promotions action bar Coupon code Search for the related discount code and check the information as per the example below:

title: 2025 Public Contact Guidelines
content: T his article is only applicable for contacts made through public messages on Facebook, Instagram, Trustpilot and Yotpo. ​ Purpose These guidelines support Emma’s international Customer Excellence Agents in communicating consistently with our brand voice while remaining empathetic and human. They complement the existing Sprinklr Guidelines and focus on initiative, tone, and personalization. Mindset & Initiative From script to voice: Templates are a starting point, not a final answer. Use them as guidance but always adapt replies into your own words. Confident adaptation: Adjusting wording and phrasing is encouraged, as long as our brand values remain intact. Empathy over efficiency: An authentic, warm reply is more valuable than copy-paste speed. Guideline: Use templates for inspiration, but always rewrite replies so they sound empathetic, friendly, and human. Encouraging Personalization Name & situation: Address the customer by name and paraphrase their concern. Add context: Include small, relevant touches (e.g., week, month, season-dependend. Balance: Personal, but never casual or unprofessional. Guideline: Show that you truly understood the customer’s situation by paraphrasing it and adding small contextual details. Translation & Localization Principles Never literal , always translate for meaning and tone, not word-for-word. Local expressions: Use phrases that sound natural and authentic in the target culture. Consistency check: Ask yourself: “Does this sound like Emma?” Link to Sprinklr Guidelines Sprinklr Guidelines provide the structure (Greeting, Empathy, Resolution, Closure). These additional guidelines emphasize initiative, warmth, and tone as essential layers on top of that structure. Summary Our customers should always feel that there are real people behind Emma (and our responses everywhere) – people who listen, understand, and provide solutions. Every reply is an opportunity to build trust and reinforce our brand values: optimistic, friendly, competent – and always human. Introduction and disclaimer This article is meant to act as a guideline on what we expect a reply to a public social media contact with Emma to look like. However, it is not meant to be seen as a set of restraints, but rather a platform on which agents can build upon. Our main goal will always be to have our contacts come as close as possible to an actual conversation between two human beings. Hence, why allowing agents to find their voice and be naturally empathic is so important. We want contacts to be fluid and personalized. Emma is a very agile company, so the agents representing us should never be (or sound) rigid. As Emma representatives, we want to show that we are humans, and humans are not perfect. We always acknowledge the complicated bits, so we can honestly and authentically give solutions. ​ Public contacts structure breakdown The four major dividers in a public contact are: Identifying the level of escalation Initial greeting and acknowledgement Resolution Closure Identifying the level of escalation Opening the contact and understanding the issue* Note : the levels of escalation are applicable to 1–2-star reviews. According to the user research, consumers use reviews to assess how well the company handles customer inquiries or concerns to gauge overall user experience and satisfaction. They look for the reviews that articulate the effectiveness of the company's unique selling propositions (USPs), including adherence to return policies, adept problem-solving and the efficiency of cashback processes. When publicly contacting the customer, we establish indicators of our service quality. Not only we try to create a positive experience for the reviewer, but also showcasing our authenticity and reliability for the rest of the consumers. We know that some cases are more concerning than others, and some customers might be more sensitive depending on their issue. Some of them might have tried to solve their issue with us several times and couldn’t, causing a lot of frustration. Some might have even contacted a lawyer to take legal action against us. And others might be frustrated with the product they received. All cases are important and should be treated as such. But depending on the level, we should take different actions and reply in different ways. Here is a quick way to identify the levels of escalation: Level 1 – Mild Frustration / Disappointment Level 2 – High Frustration / Anger Level 3 – Extreme Frustration / Outrage What is this level of escalation? Mild complaints about product or service quality where we can still turn it into a neutral/positive experience with the right reply and action. High levels of frustration, more damaging to our reputation and need to be sent faster to internal handling. Possibly longer complaints with more than one paragraph, use of caps lock, and mentions of other unsuccessful attempts of contact. Highest level of frustration that can possibly lead to serious company damage. Possibly longer complaints with more than one paragraph, use of caps lock, and mentions of other unsuccessful attempts of contact. Specific alarming keywords are used that can give us a hint that the customer will take some action against the company. How to identify the level of escalation? If any of these words are used: "musty smell", "sagging mattress", "disappointed", "uncomfortable", "discomfort", "generic excuses" If any of these words are used: "nightmare”, "joke", "appalling", "terrible", "laughable", “unethical”, “shocking”, “disgusting”, "shocking service", "awful company", "absolute shambles," "incompetence” If any of these words are used: "legal advice", "lawyer”, “fraud”, “scam”, “illegal”, “bankrupt” After identifying the customer's level, you can now act accordingly following the next steps. To show contrition and empathy, our tone shifts from more lighthearted to more apologetic as we move up the customer frustration levels. Our responses will also be lengthier at each stage, so that we can give customers the required information. The following templates provide a guide for tone and content, but agents should bring their own personality to their responses, as this will be more sincere and thoughtful. Agents are, however, welcome to mix and match the responses (always checking that the grammar is correct once they combine responses). ​ 2. Initial greeting and acknowledgement Being empathetic and getting the context* Note : always greet the customer; by the first name, unless the customer's username on the platform is a nickname. In those circumstances just use a generic greeting without using any name. Negative Sentiment Level 1 – Mild Frustration / Disappointment Negative Sentiment Level 2 – High Frustration / Anger Negative Sentiment Level 3 – Extreme Frustration / Outrage Direction At level 1, although the customer is annoyed, we can still showcase a bit of personality while acknowledging our shortcomings. This can help to ease the tension and build goodwill. Blue bracket : Summarise what the issue is. Green bracket: Offering a lighthearted observation. This can be about sleep (check our recent comms for more insights), contextual, or general. At level 2, we should apologize and show empathy and understanding by acknowledging the customer’s frustrations. Blue bracket: Summarise what the issue is. Green bracket: Paraphrasing the customer’s main pain points e.g. frustration, time consuming, hassle. At level 3, the important thing is to apologize sincerely and assure the customer that their issue is of the highest priority and is being treated as such. Green bracket: Paraphrasing the customer’s main pain points e.g. frustration, time consuming, hassle. Purple bracket: Assuring the customer that you’re dealing with the issue personally. Reply examples Hi John Sorry to hear [your mattress hasn’t arrived] . I’m here to help! We definitely want you to enjoy your Emma mattress, [which includes not losing sleep over when it’ll be delivered]. <— observation on sleep Hi John Sorry to hear [your refund hasn’t been processed] . I’m here to help! [Mondays are hard enough] without having to wait around for refunds. <— contextual observation that Mondays suck Hi John Sorry to hear [you aren’t loving your new mattress] . I’m here to help! [There’s nothing better than getting a good night’s sleep] and we want to make sure we pair you up with just the right mattress to do so. <— general observation Hi John I’m so sorry you’ve had to deal with this. I understand that [wondering when your mattress will be delivered] is terribly [frustrating and time consuming] . Hi John I’m really sorry to hear this. I understand that [you’ve contacted us repeatedly about your refund] and I can only imagine how [disrespected you must feel]. Hi John I’m so sorry about these issues. I understand that [your mattress hasn’t met with your expectations] and that must be [extremely frustrating, and uncomfortable]. Hi John I’m really sorry we’ve caused you [so much inconvenience and frustration] . Please accept my sincere apologies on behalf of Emma. [I’m looking into this immediately] . Hi John I completely understand your [frustration and anger] . On behalf of Emma, I really apologise. [I have escalated this issue with the rest of our team] . Hi John I want to start by saying how sorry I am for your experience. I understand that we’ve caused you [a lot of stress and discomfort] , and we sincerely apologise for this. Please know that [we are taking this matter very seriously] . 3. Resolution Being honest and sharing as much as we can about how are we working on the issue* ​ Order number not available: Negative Sentiment Level 1 – Mild Frustration / Disappointment Negative Sentiment Level 2 – High Frustration / Anger Negative Sentiment Level 3 – Extreme Frustration / Outrage Direction We can take a lighthearted approach when asking for missing information, so that the customer doesn’t feel like the issue is their fault. At this stage, we should politely build in the request for missing information as a vital step in getting the issue resolved. While reassuring the customer that we are doing everything we can to resolve this high priority issue, we must also ask them to provide the information so we can help them faster. Trustpilot reply examples I have requested your order information here on Trustpilot, could you please share it so I can look into this immediately? I have requested your order information here on Trustpilot, when you have a minute, could you please share it with me, and I’ll sort this out for you immediately. To fast-track this issue, please send the order information we requested here on Trustpilot. I have just requested your order information here on Trustpilot, would you be able to send it so I can look into this for you? I need this information to track your order. May I ask you to send your order information as I have requested here so I can sort this out for you as soon as possible? I need this information to track your order. I have requested your information here on Trustpilot, could you send it to me so I can track your order? I will do everything I can to put things right. Would you be able to send the info we requested here on Trustpilot so I can look into this further? I need this information to track your order. I want to assure you that this issue is high priority, and is being treated as such. May I ask you to send your order information I have requested here on Trustpilot so I can sort this out for you as soon as possible. I need this information in order to track your order. I understand how serious this issue is and I’ll do my best to resolve it for you quickly and satisfactorily. Could you please send the order information we requested here on Trustpilot so I can track your order? Order number available: Negative Sentiment Level 1 – Mild Frustration / Disappointment Negative Sentiment Level 2 – High Frustration / Anger Negative Sentiment Level 3 – Extreme Frustration / Outrage Direction We should provide a brief explanation of how we’re dealing with the issue and invite the customer to contact us on our main channels if they need further assistance. Blue bracket: Quick summary of what’s happened so far, including steps taken to rectify situation. Blue bracket: Clearly explain the steps that have been taken so far. Green bracket: Emphasize that one of the team has reached out. Send the customer an email using this format . In case the team have tried to contact the customer, so it should be highlighted in our response. Blue bracket: Clearly explain the steps that have been taken so far. Green bracket: Emphasize that one of the team has reached out. Send the customer an email using this format . Purple bracket: Politely ask for the customer’s preferred platform for communication. In case the team have tried to contact the customer, so it should be highlighted in our response. Trustpilot reply examples I see that [the delivery company missed you on Monday, but they will make another attempt to deliver on Thursday] . I’ve sent you an email with the details and next steps of your order. Please kindly check your spam folder in case you haven’t received it. It looks like [your refund has been logged and should reflect in the next 5 working days] . I’ve sent you an email with all the details. Please kindly check your spam folder in case you haven’t received it. You can definitely return your mattress during your 200 night free trial if you’re not happy with it. Closure Negative Sentiment Level 1 – Mild Frustration / Disappointment Negative Sentiment Level 2 – High Frustration / Anger Negative Sentiment Level 3 – Extreme Frustration / Outrage Direction We have already invited customers to reach out during the paragraph above, so we can sign off by thanking them for their patience and wishing them a good day. title: Online Reputation - Facebook
content: TABLE OF CONTENTS Introduction What is Facebook and why is it important? What does the customer see? How to access the Facebook tickets What kind of tickets can be created How to handle a Facebook ticket (step by step) How to handle Direct Messages How to handle Comments on Posts Mandatory fields to fill in before solving the request: Communication guidelines Our user names on Facebook Introduction This article is meant for the agents working in the Online Reputation team. It summarizes why we use Facebook, how we answer customer queries via this platform, and how to log in Sprinklr. What is Facebook and why is it important? Facebook is a website that allows users, who sign-up for free profiles, to connect with friends, work colleagues or people they don't know, online. With Facebook, users can not only post comments and photos, but they can also look through their local news feeds, create live videos, make an event plan, send messages to friends, ask for recommendations, and buy or sell items. Facebook tends to have a wider audience than most social media sites. Of all the social networks, Facebook is the largest and most recognized social media network worldwide . It exposes our business to the broadest audience and offers the most comprehensive set of business tools. These tools help us build our online brand, create meaningful connections with customers and potential employees. What does the customer see? Customers will have access to Emma's Facebook page, all the posts and comments, according to the selected domain. How to access the Facebook cases Meta/Facebook is already integrated with Sprinklr, caseswill be created automatically following a customer's direct message or comment on one of our Facebook pages. What kind of cases can be created Customers can either send us a Direct message or reply to a post or leave a commemt on Emma page. How to handle a Facebook ticket (step by step) The main goal is to provide good customer experience: you are Emma's voice and it falls on you to understand how you can improve this customer experience by empathizing, relate to him and, in the end, provide a solution. Usually customers who use Social Media platforms such as Facebook are looking for a fast answer, either for pre-sale questions, as for post-sales issues, you will have to assess what the customer needs and provide an answer for it. How to handle Direct Messages DMs may lead to a longer interaction than a post comment. The customer is looking for more than just a one shot conversation, and not just stating something, he is looking for a reply. When you are replying you can see the conversation history and a broader view over the issue. If the customer provided his email and that information was already logged in Freshdesk, you will be able to see all his information, such as previous orders and/ or tickets. In the Reply box, besides being to write a reply and post it, you will also have canned responses, you can attach files, look for suggestions, and if, that is the case, send a link for a survey. Keep in mind that this is a public platform and all information is easily sharable or made public, remember to use tone of voice and comply with GDPR guidelines. How to handle Comments on Posts Unlike DMs, posts are visible to everyone, they automatically portray customers' feelings and how we react to either good and bad feedback. In the same way, our reply will also be public, so it is a good opportunity to turn a bad experience into a better one and to showcase our care in customer service to other people who will visit the page. As in other platforms, positive comments are easier to handle , usually there's no further intervention needed than to appreciate the customers' feedback, thanking for choosing Emma's products and the effort it took him to publicize the good experience. So, what to do here: In your reply be empathetic, address the customer by name, thank the customer for choosing our brand and appreciate his effort If there are additional questions make sure to provide answers or solutions If needed, ask the customer to send us a DM so you can take the topic on a private channel You can use emojis to easily portray emotions Create your own set of canned responses so it will be easier and faster to reply to simple situations and keep using different replies and portray a more customized approach. In contrast, negative comments will most likely always demand further analysis and a follow up . Customers will use FB exposure to force us to provide a faster and a more convenient solution. when you encounter a negative comment always: Keep Emma's tone of voice, address the customer by its name, acknowledge the issue and sympathize with his problem Request the customer to send more details via DM so you can analyze the situation more thorough. Add the customer email to the ticket for Freshdesk to integrate previous tickets and orders information to the customer block. You can still use emojis but more soft as the customer is already unhappy and requesting immediate Canned responses do not work as well here as you will have to adapt to multiple situations Once again, is crucial that you remember of the importance of a good Online Reputation and that you will publicly represent Emma. ​ Our user names on Facebook NL Emma.Sleep.nl BE Emma.Sleep.be OF Emma.Matratze.de AT Emma.Matratze.de CH Emma.Matratze.de MIN Emma.Madras HERSELF Emma.Madrass

title: Online Reputation - Instagram
content: TABLE OF CONTENTS Introduction What is Instagram and why is it important ? Instagram cases Communication guidelines What does the customer see? Our usernames on Instagram Introduction This article is meant for the agents working in the Online Reputation team. It summarizes why we use Instagram, how we answer the customer queries via this platform and how to log it in Freshdesk. What is Instagram and why is it important? Instagram is a hugely popular photo and video-sharing social media platform. Users can share photo or video posts; temporary Stories that live on your profile for 24 hours; Reels, which are 15-second-max short-form videos; IGTV videos, and can even shop directly from e-commerce brands through the app. The app can be downloaded for free and is available on iPhone and Android. Using Instagram for business can drive brand awareness, boost sales, and build and track audience engagement . It can be distinguished from other social media platforms by its focus on visual communication. Instagram is an effective way to advertise a product, as a picture speaks a thousand words . Instagram cases We receive notifications from direct messages, comments made on posts and mentions and reactions on stories. All of them will create a Sprinklr case. See in the picture below the different types of interactions: Direct message Comment ​ ! There are also mentions of Emma in (potential) customer's stories/posts/reels. Solve customer's issue if there are any. What will be the content of those conversations: Pre-sale questions regarding products, sizes, delivery times, campaigns, discount codes... Pre-Delivery: "Where is my order", order changes, payment options, cancellations... Post-Delivery: product claims, returns and refunds, logistic claims and others Influencers and collaboration proposals Conversations that fit description 1, 2 and 3 should be handled in the same way as a regular case. Got a pre-sales/return deflection request? Redirect the case to an agent with Sleep Expert skills. Influencers and collaboration proposals should be dealt with in a different way: Communication guidelines For Instagram communication guidelines, please see this article. ! If the chat case is out of SLA, only apologise after 5 minutes. ! Remember that a social media platform has high visibility, everything sent via Instagram can be easily shared, trendable and go viral. ! Whenever needed, try and transfer the conversation to a more traditional channel such as email. ! When replying to a customer, remember to keep the Emma tone of voice. Please refresh your memory on Emma's tone of voice via ​ ​ this article . ​ Tip: After 2 minutes of no answer from the customer, you can move to the next case. Do NOT ask the customer if they are still there, as this is not a regular chat. When the customer comes back, the chat will open again. How to handle Instagram cases ​ If a Comment: Assess Tone and Frustration Level: Evaluate the level of frustration expressed in the comment. Use the appropriate tone and language based on the guidelines. Reply to the Comment: Acknowledge the issue and inform the customer that you’ve sent a direct message to gather more details and investigate further Example message, personalize first: Hey @instagram_handle . We're sorry to hear about the trouble with your order. We've sent you a direct message to sort this out. If you could share your order number there, we’d be happy to help you resolve the issue. Thanks! Send a Direct Message: Reach out to the customer via direct message to request additional information (e.g., order details, contact info). Investigate the Issue: Gather all necessary information, check the customer’s history, and review any previous interactions to understand the context (if available). Resolve and Confirm: Resolve the issue and confirm with the customer that it has been addressed. Apply ACW: categorize the case & mark the case as closed in the system. ​ If a Direct Message: Treat the direct message as a standard case and process it accordingly. ​ If a Story/Post/Reel Mention: Review the Content: If Negative: Reach out to the customer to request more details. Process the case as a standard issue. If Positive: Show appreciation by thanking the customer for their mention in a friendly and professional manner. If Related to a Store Order: Process the case as a standard store order issue. If you’re unsure about the next steps, escalate the case internally with all relevant details. What does the customer see? Anyone who has Instagram can see our page, as they are open pages. Taking the German Instagram page as an example, this is what someone sees on our profile: When scrolling down, they will see our posts: They can like our posts: They can also leave a comment underneath the post: On the some of our Instagram pages, users can shop via our Instagram page: Last but not least, users can send us a direct message (dm): Our usernames on Instagram NL @emmasleepnl BE @emmasleep.be DE @emma_matratze AT @emma.oesterreich CH @emmaswitzerland SE @emma_madrass DK @emma_madras PL @materac_emma

title: Online Reputation - Trustpilot
content: TABLE OF CONTENTS Introduction What is Trustpilot and why is it important? What the customer sees How to access the platform How to handle a Trustpilot review Process Step by step What to do after a reply Special customer requests (GDPR) FAQs Introduction This article is meant for the agents working in the Online Reputation team. It summarizes why we use Trustpilot, how we answer the customer queries via this platform and how to log it in Sprinklr. What is Trustpilot and why is it important? Trustpilot (TP) is a digital platform that allows customers to review a business from which they've purchased a product or service. Trustpilot reviews drive growth by helping our company get seen, build trust with potential customers and get better. The TP business tools make it easy to get more reviews, promote your best feedback, engage with customers, and analyze the results to improve. Through this tool, we send surveys to customers inviting them to provide feedback to help us to improve our services, that when responded, are displayed to the country-specific Emma Trustpilot page (profile), providing the rate we are scoring and the reviews provided by the customer. What the customer sees When users search for our shop on Trustpilot, they have an overview of: The name of the profile (in this case, the German platform), the number of reviews, the TrustScore (the TrustScore is not only the average score of all reviews, but also takes other factors into account, such as the number of reviews and how revent the reviews are. Whether a company actively invites customers to leave a review also affects the TrustScore.) and if this is a verified company. A direct link to our online shop. The option to write a review. The business activity. The different reviews, sorted by experience. Reviews, written by customers. This is the customer's journey ​ How can you positively impact Customer's experience and improve Emma's Online Reputation? By tracking positive and negative reviews, we can ensure we are addressing any presented need and having the chance to improve and make an impact to the customer experience with us. ​ There are three sources of reviews: Organic reviews - the customer went proactively to the Trustpilot page and left us a review does not provide any customer information (unless he manually added it) are usually bad reviews from unhappy customers Automatically invitations - the customer received an invitation to leave us a review through Trustpilot directly it will come with the customers' email and order number Basic invitations - the customer received an invitation to leave us a review from a source outside Trustpilot (example: link in the end of NPS survey) there is no order number or customer information associated but the review is verified (it can't be flagged as not being genuine) ​ How to access the platform To handle reviews you need to access Trustpilot's business platform via the link Trustpilot Business ( https://businessapp.b2b.trustpilot.com/dashboard ). This link leads you to your markets landing page : (if you are handling more than 1 market you will see which one you are currently in in the top left) To manage reviews you need to go into the Menu bar >> select Reviews >> select Service Reviews You can then prioritize reviews by rating, as it is always better to address bad reviews first! Customers usually check Trustpilot to find out about bad customer experiences and to understand how the company handled them. So it is crucial that we reply to all bad reviews. Good star rating (as 4 and 5 stars) are also important and should answer all reviews, but as bad experiences are the biggest driver to decide to go forward or not with a purchase you should start with those. ​ When handling reviews you have to consider the 2 main goals: Address the customer issue Improve Trustpilot score How to handle a Trustpilot review So, what should you always consider when you are replying to a review? Always keep the Emma tone of voice - please refresh your memory on Emma's tone of voice via this article . For more guidelines, see this article . Reply according to GDPR procedures - check this article for further information regarding GDPR. ​ How to reply to positive reviews (4-5 stars reviews): Engage with the customer, appreciate the fact that we are also pleased by providing a good experience Check if there is anything something you can help with Try to not always use the same reply, customers value being acknowledged, so don't always use the same sentence. Since "happy" reviews don't need any particular intervention they will be faster to reply, create a file with a sample of possible replies and use it to be more efficient and still portray a customized approach. Examples: "Hello (customer name), thank you very much for taking the time to leave us a review, your opinion helps us to improve our services, thank you for trusting Emma!" "Thank you (customer name) for your message. We are glad to hear that the quality of your sleep has improved with our products and we wish you sweet dreams!" "Hi (customer name), thank you very much for sharing your experience with Emma. We are glad you are enjoying our products, and we hope you continue to do so for many years to come. Thank you for your trust in Emma!" "Hello (customer name), thank you very much for your positive feedback, we hope you enjoy your products Emma!" How to reply to negative reviews (1-3 stars reviews): ​ ​ More GUIDELINES ​ How to reply These reviews are harder to handle as they will require more time and effort on your side It is like a regular CS ticket but with higher visibility on a public platform You should provide a reply as soon as possible even if just to acknowledge we will reach out and solve the problem Replies can be edited so once you have a definitive solution just update it What should always be included: Start by greeting the customer & sympathize with him and acknowledge the problem "Thank you for bringing the issue to our attention..." apologize and explain that the issue is not a standard at Emma "We are sorry to hear that..." "What happened is not in accordance with Emma's standards..." identify the next steps: either collect more customer information for follow up or specific actions that will improve the situation "I have requested your information here on Trustpilot, could you send it to me so I can track your order?" Note: Please read the next section for a more detailed process description. Step-by-Step Process 1. Assess the level of frustration and use the appropriate language. (Check guidelines) ​ 2. Did a customer provide order information? - YES (order information provided): Investigate the issue In Sprinklr Trstpilot case: ‘Set email' of the cst (We need this to be able to connect TP and Outbound email cases) Store orders: If the case is related to the store order, process it as a usual case. If you are not sure about the required actions - escalate internally. 3. Send an outbound email to the cst. Choose the right sender email. 4. Leave a response in Truspilot (e.g. Hi John! I’m so sorry you’ve had to deal with this. I understand that [wondering when your mattress will be delivered] is terribly [frustrating and time consuming]. I see that [the delivery company missed you on Monday, but they will make another attempt to deliver on Thursdsay. I’ve sent you an email with the details and next steps of your order. Please kindly check your spam folder in case you haven’t received it. ) 5. After you completed the email/your TP reply, don't forget to note any actions you took in Magento/Fluent Commerce. 6. When you are able to provide a good solution for a customer's problem, assess if he is willing to upgrade is review rating and provide feedback about your support. Send one more email: " Dear (customer name), We are so glad we were able to solve your issue and that everything worked out with your order. We hope you are glad about our resolution too. If that is the case, we kindly ask you to consider editing your Trustpilot review about Emma so it reflects your entire experience with us. Your feedback is really important to us! We hope you enjoy your Emma products and have wonderful nights with them. Best Wishes, Emma Team" 7. Close both TP and outbound cases. Consider them resolved. - NO order information provided: Request customer info via Truspilot and leave the Sprinklr Case in " Awaiting Response " Status. Leave a response in Trustpilot saying that you have requested info. If after 3 days, the customer does not provide the information – drop the case (this is done in the TrustPilot Platform, ensure to regularly check the platform for these cases) . Leave a comment on Sprinklr and close the case. After customer provided information: In Sprinklr Trustpilot case: ‘Set email' of the cst (We need this to be able to connect TP and Outbound email cases) Investigate the case and send an outbound email to the customer. Choose the right sender email 6. Edit your response in Trustpilot: indicate that you have sent an email to the customer. 7. After you completed the email&your TP reply, don't forget to note any actions you took in Magento/Fluent Commerce. 8. When you are able to provide a good solution for a customer's problem, assess if he is willing to upgrade is review rating and provide feedback about your support. Send one more email: " Dear (customer name), We are so glad we were able to solve your issue and that everything worked out with your order. We hope you are glad about our resolution too. If that is the case, we kindly ask you to consider editing your Trustpilot review about Emma so it reflects your entire experience with us. Your feedback is really important to us! We hope you enjoy your Emma products and have wonderful nights with them. Best Wishes, Emma Team" 9. Close both TP and outbound cases. Consider them resolved. ​ What to do after a reply After you received customer infomation and left a reply on Trustpilot (for unverified customers), please use "Set Email" on the ticket fields in Sprinklr and add customer's email there. This would allow us to have a 360* customer profile. Customer's profile would include both Trustpilot review and the outbound case you created. After you completed the outbound email, don't forget to note any actions you took in Magento/Fluent (if you have the customer information). ​ When to flag reviews We ask you to flag a review only in one scenario: The review does not belong to this market. How to understand this: Review in a different language & The format of the order is not from your market. IF this is true, please follow these steps: Flag a review -- Reason: About a different business --- About one of my other domains --- Select a domain Special customer requests (GDPR) What to do if a customer asks to stop receiving Trustpilot invites? Or what if the customer asks to have his data deleted from Emma and/or Trustpilot? ​ 1. Unsubscription requests Trustpilot doesn’t allow us to unsubscribe customers, neither can we create automation to prevent Redshift from adding them to an invitation list if they buy from us again. Important: So, if you as an agent ever face this type of request, you should reply by saying something like the example below and send an email to privacy@emma-sleep.com identifying the request. Example: “We are sorry to hear that you want to you no longer want to receive our Trustpilot emails …[fill in or complete according to the situation] Unfortunately, Trustpilot doesn't allow us to unsubscribe customers, that request has to be done by the customer itself. There are two ways you can stop receiving these notifications: ​ either click the unsubscription link available on the emails sent with the Trustpilot invite (check the example below, you can take a snip in your market language by scrolling down the template’s preview) send an email to Trustpilot Support requesting unsubscription from Emma's invites: privacy@trustpilot.com.” ​ 2. Data Deletion requests Important: If you as an agent ever face this type of request, you should reply by saying something similar to the example below and follow the process explained in this article . Example: “We are sorry to hear you no longer wish to receive Trustpilot invites from Emma. We will comply with your request and delete all data from Trustpilot within 3 working days.” FAQs 1. How to identify level of frustration? ​ ​ ​ ​- Check this article​ ​ Public Contact Guidelines. ​ 2. Do we flag reviews on TrustPilot if the customer does not reply within 3 days? - No, because Trustpilot is no longer removing them. Rather than flagging, ask the customer for the order number & focus on personalization. 3. Do we respond to a review that is posted on the wrong market? -Yes, if you noticed that the review belongs to another market, flag the review & aknowledge customer's issue by replying to the review. 4.Should we suggest a customer to contact CS support? - No, customers are likely leaving a review because they are not receiving sufficient support from CS. Please handle the Trust Pilot case following these guidelines. 5. How to handle 3 star reviews regarding product quality? -Respond thanking customer for their feedback, and tell them we are always working on improving the quality of our products, and remind them we do have 100 nights trial and 10 year warranty. Do this publicly on a review, AND create an outbound email (if there is customer information) saying we have seen the review and ask if they need any help. All 1 to 3 star reviews should be handled via outbound email (when cst info is available).

title: Online Reputation at Emma
content: ​ this article can be used for training purposes ​ What is Online Reputation and why is it important to us? Online Reputation Management Online reputation management is how we describe the actions we take to monitor, address, analyze, and shape the perception customers have of our brand. One of the crucial elements of online reputation management is tracking and handling Emma's mentions across different digital touchpoints, which may include social media platforms; marketplaces, product review sites; complaint websites, among many others. Now that consumers shape brands as much as companies do, it’s critical to understand how positive online reviews attract potential customers, how negative ones drive them away, and what you can do to turn satisfied customers into online advocates. What is a good online reputation? A good online reputation is a positive perception of a person or business based on the information that appears about them online. A good online reputation means more customers will be open to buying our products and trusting our company. It also means that we proactively reach out to our customers, establish a relationship with them, and have them become our promoters . Review our Customer Journey article to recall the importance of the customer fanbase to our business

title: Yotpo Moderation Guidelines
content: Release Note: updated as of 25/08/2025 - Article revamped | Article's title changed | Added steps for If the case requires additional CS support on Step by step processing instructions TABLE OF CONTENTS Índex 1. Introduction ​ 2. What are Yotpo reviews and why are they so important? ​ 3. How to process Yotpo cases 3.1 Summary - Golden Rules ​ ​ 4. Publish vs Reject ​ 5. Reply Rules (Private vs Public Replies) ​ 6. Using the Email template on Sprinklr ​ ​ 7. Step-by-Step Processing Instructions - Steps 1 -5 [only from September 2025 onward]​ If customer requires CS support: - (only if customer requires CS support) Steps 6 and 7 ​ 8. Examples ​ 8.1 If you publish a review (“Yes” in Step 3) 8.2 If you reject a review (“No” in step 3) ​ 9. Decision table and examples ​ 10. Special customer requests (GDPR) 10.1 Unsubscription requests 10.2. Data Deletion requests 1. Introduction This article is meant for the agents working in the Online Reputation team. It summarizes why we use Yotpo for Product Reviews and how we answer the customer queries via Sprinklr. ​ 2. What are Yotpo reviews and why are they so important? ​ Yotpo is a digital platform that allows us to collect product reviews and display them in our website directly . ​ Showcasing p roduct reviews in our own websites will help us grow, as it increases customer trust and confidence on the product. Yotpo templates will increase the number of reviews we collect, they allow customers to upload products' pictures or videos and to better engage with customers as they can leave a review directly in the invitation email. Once a customer replies and leaves a review, it falls on Emma to reply to it and decide to whether publish it or not. As mentioned above, all published reviews will be showcased on our own website, providing a scoring specific for each product. ​ How can you positively impact customer's experience and improve Emma's Online Reputation? By replying to negative Yotpo reviews, providing help and addressing customers' potential needs. 3. How to process Yotpo cases We use Yotpo to display product reviews on our websites. ​ What you can do with a review is either publish it or reject it: ​ Publish → the review will be displayed publicly on our websites Reject publishing → the review won’t be displayed publicly on our websites ​ 3.1 Summary - Golden Principles ​ Default to publish when the review contains any genuine product opinion and no disallowed content or service complaints alone. Reject if it contains disallowed content or service complaints only (see Publish vs Reject ) Reply choice follows moderation choice: If Published → Public reply only If Rejected → Private reply only No personal information in replies and never ask for order details publicly. ​ 4. Publish vs Reject Click to understand when to publish and when to reject ​ Publish vs Reject When to reject a review? ​ Reject A review has to be rejected when it contains one or more of the following : ​ Legal transgression: The review contains information that cannot legally be published, for example, a person’s financial, medical, or personal file information or a company’s trade secrets. Profanity / Inappropriate: The review contains libelous, harassing, abusive, vulgar, obscene, or sexually explicit language, and/or the review is inappropriate concerning race, gender, sexuality, ethnicity, or other intrinsic characteristics. Private information: The review contains confidential or private information. Off topic, service only content: the review is completely unrelated to the product and only mentions experience with the service, such as delivery, customer support and/or returns. False or misleading: the review makes favorable performance claims that are clearly false or misleading and that you could not make yourself. Fake: You have actual proof allowing you to say with a reasonable degree of certainty that the review is fake and not written by a real customer. ​ When to publish a review? ​ Publish All reviews that include the customer’s honest opinion of the product (e.g. “I don’t like it”, “Mattress was too firm”, “The mattress didn’t help with my backpain”) must be published. ​ Important note ​ Remeber: you can only reject a review if there is a valid reject reason as per the list above. ​ ​ 5. Reply Rules (Private vs Public replies) Now, let us understand the rules for replying ​ Reply Rules (Private vs Public Replies) Yotpo allows you to either leave a private or public reply. ​ What is the difference? Private comment : your answer to the review won’t be displayed publicly on the website Public comment : your answer will be displayed publicly on the website ​ ​ When the review is Published → Public reply only When the review is Rejected → Private reply only 6. Using the Email template on Sprinklr See our Email template on Sprinklr ​ Using the Email Template on Sprinklr The reviews email you will see on Sprinklr contains three text sections and the original review (example below): ​ ==========Write below this line to comment in private========== ​ ​ ==========Write below this line to comment in public========== ​ ​ ==========Publish the review yes/no========== ​ ​ ​ ============================================= ​ Review score: 3 reviews Review title: Didn’t like it Review body: Unfortunately, the mattress did not meet my expectation. Reason for escalation: Reviews Star Rating Reviewer name: John Doe Reviewer email: john@doe.com Product url: https://www.emma-sleep.co.uk/mattresses/emma-hybrid-thermosync-mattress/ ​ ​ ​ 7. Step-by-Step Processing Instructions ​ Step-by-step - Processing Instructions 1. Review the Customer Submission Scroll to the bottom of the ticket to read the customer review content. 2. Decide: Publish or Reject Copy the complete review template into your reply. Use the guidelines in Step 1 and Step 5 to determine whether the review should be published or rejected. Publish if the review: Meets policy guidelines Contains a clear product opinion ​ Reject if the review contains: Personally identifiable information (PII) Profanity, hate speech Spam or irrelevant/off-topic content Service-only content (no product reference) Illegal or abusive content 3. Log the Decision In Text Field 3 , set “ Publish the review: Yes/No ” based on your decision: a.      Yes = Review will be published b.      No = Review will be rejected 4. Choose the Correct Reply Format a.      For published reviews: Use Text Section 2 : “Write below this line to comment in public.” Leave Text Section 1 blank. b.      For rejected reviews: Use Text Section 1 : “Write below this line to comment in private.” Leave Text Section 2 blank. 5. Important Reminder a. ✅ If Published → Use Public reply only b. ❌ If Rejected → Use Private reply only ​ [only from September 2025 onward] ​ Addititional CS support If the case requires additional CS support , follow these steps: 6. Use the “Set Email” function to manually input the customer’s actual email address instead of the Yotpo unique review identifier email. This ensures that your CS colleagues can send a direct reply to the customer’s personal inbox. 7. Use the “Assign to Senior” macro to escalate the case to the Customer Service team for further handling and resolution. ​ 8. Examples ​ 8.1 If you publish a review (“ Yes ” in Step 3) 1. Write your reply in the public reply section (Step 2) 2. Leave section 1 empty ==========Write below this line to comment in private========== ​ ==========Write below this line to comment in public========== ​ Your reply ​ =========Publish the review yes/no========= ​ yes ​ ============================================= Review score: 3 reviews Review title: Didn’t like it Review body: Unfortunately, the mattressdid not meet my expectations. Reason for escalation: Reviews Star Rating Reviewer name: John Reviewer email: john@doe.com Product url: https://www.emma-sleep.co.uk/mattresses/emma-hybrid-thermosync-mattress/ 8.2 If you reject a review (“ No ” in step 3) 1. Write your reply in the private reply section (Step 1) 2. Leave section 2 empty ​ ​ ==========Write below this line to comment in private========== ​ Your reply ​ ​ ==========Write below this line to comment in public========== ​ ​ ​ =========Publish the review yes/no========= ​ ​ No ​ ​ ============================================= Review score: 3 reviews Review title: Mattress never arrived Review body: I never received my mattress as the delivery is still late. Reason for escalation: Reviews Star Rating Reviewer name: John Reviewer email: john@doe.com Product url: https://www.emma-sleep.co.uk/mattresses/emma-hybrid-thermosync-mattress/ ​ ​ 9. Decision Table and Examples Decision Category Definition Examples Action Reply Type Reject Profanity / Hate / Harassment Vulgarity, slurs, threats, demeaning content toward protected traits. “F*** you”, “[slur] company” Reject Private Reject PII / Sensitive info Personal contact, full address, phone, personal email, order IDs, tracking links, financial/medical documents, faces of minors. “Call me at +49… for refund”, photo of ID Reject Private Reject Spam / Fraud / Ads Promotions, referral links/codes, malware/phishing, copypaste bot text. Crypto promos, discount codes Reject Private Reject Off‑topic (service‑only) Delivery/CS rant with no product opinion. “Support ghosted me.” (no product content) Reject Private Reject Illegal / Dangerous content Explicit illegal activity or instructions; doxxing; credible threats. “I’ll post your address…”, drug sales Reject Private Publish Honest product opinion (incl. negative) Fit/feel, comfort, quality, performance, price/value opinions without abuse. “Too firm”, “Sleeps hot”, “Foam feels cheap” Publish Public Publish Comparisons Mentions competitors in passing. “Better than my old Simba” Publish Public Publish Mixed: service + product Contains any product opinion alongside service comments. “Delivery slow, but mattress comfy” Publish Public Publish Customer originated medical claim Reviewer states a health outcome as their personal experience “Helped my back pain” Publish Public 10. Special customer requests (GDPR) ​ What to do if a customer asks to stop receiving Yotpo invites? Or what if the customer asks to have his data deleted from Emma and/or Yotpo? 10.1. Unsubscription requests Yotpo allows customers to unsubscribe directly on review invites, however, it is not connected to our other databases. Important: So, if you as an agent ever face this type of request, you should send an email to privacy@emma-sleep.com identifying the request. 10.2. Data Deletion requests Important: If you as an agent ever face this type of request, you should reply by saying something similar to the example below and should send an email to privacy@emma-sleep.com identifying the request. ​ Example: “We are sorry to hear you no longer wish to receive Review invites from Emma. We will comply with your request and delete all data within 3 working days.” Release Note: updated as of 25/08/2025 - Article revamped | Article's title changed | Added steps for If the case requires additional CS support on Step by step processing instructions
