title: Escalation Logic for BPOs
content: ​ ​ ​ Version up-to-date as of: 8th of August 2025 - Added process & workflow for agent escalations Purpose : The goal of this page is to help you understand how cases move between teams and stakeholders, so you always know who’s responsible for what and what to expect at each step. You’ll find a breakdown of the most common types of tickets and escalations, who owns each one, and how the workflow works behind the scenes. ​ Article Use Case(s ) Escalate cases to the right teams faster; Avoid back-and-forth or delays; Make sure customers get the help they need, quicker. ​ ​ Article Dashboard ​ Types of Escalation Cases Escalation Definitions Regular BPO Escalation High Level Online Reputation C-Level ​ ​ What is an escalation, what are the escalation types and when to escalate ​Escalated cases : ​Legal Cases : ​ Complex Cases : ​ ​ Table of Contents The table of contents is a collapsible section. The titles (bold) should follow a sequential, logical flow, related to the articles' contents. ​ Index 1. Global Process & Workflow ​ 1.1 | Overview 1.2 | Roles 1.3 | Types of Escalated Cases 1.4 | How to escalate a case 1.4.1 | Escalate a case 1.4.1a | For who escalates a case 1.4.1b | For who handles an escalated case 1.5 | Visual Diagram ​ 2.  Frequently Asked Questions ​ ​ ​ ​ 1. Global Process and Workflow ​ Global Process and Workflow / Market specifics : Is your market present? Yes : Click your Market tab, ignore Global Process. No : refer to the Global Process and Workflow. Global Process and Workflow 1.1 Overview The process flow outlines the movement between teams and roles based on the type of escalation and the source that initiated it, ensuring a clear understanding of responsibilities and actions. If you have to escalate one of your cases, do it manually according to the following flow. ​ ​Let's start by understanding roles: ​ 1.2 Roles Different intervenients have different roles for an escalated ticket. Role Description Junior Agent Level 1 Agents: First contact with customer. ​ OR only : OR Agents are not responsible for resolving issues that came in through social channels (Meta, IG, TP) — only for public replies and case creation. ​ OR agents perform content moderation. They reply to interactions with customers. e.g.: Customer : "Hey, I love Emma, haven't sleep this good in years!" OR Agent's reply : "Great to hear such feedback, makes us sleep much better too!" ​ If at any point the customer needs customer support or assistance, escalate to a Senior Agent, Level 2 Senior Agent Level 2 Agent : Experienced agent (Email cases); for OR - Investigates and resolves reputation-related cases Escalations Squad Level 3 support : alternative support team for Legal and Complex cases. Supervisor Level 3 support : Last line of support, when Level 2 support can't solve an issue / situation. ​ Exception : HLE cases from Emma stores escalate from HLE Agent straight to a Supervisor. ​ 1.3 Types of escalated cases Now that we understand who does what, let's find out the different possible types of escalated cases: Tab Escalated Cases Legal Cases Complex Cases Content Moderation Cases C-Level Occurs when a customer cannot resolve their issue with customer service and customer requests higher-level intervention (ex. ask for a supervisor on and on, express extreme dissatisfaction on +3 emails, and threten us to go to press, overly rejects the the given solution - 4 emails, etc). ​ Escalates to : Level 2 Agent or (Exception: if HLE agent and needs to escalate a non-complex case, escalates directly to a Supervisor) ​ The legal team receives a court letter or an email from a customer’s lawyer about a legal case against Emma. ​ Cases already involving legal action or reputational risks (ex. court letters, lawyers contacting Emma, GDPR breaches and cases that seem to require urgent attention from higher management or legal teams). ​ Note: if a customer simply threats to take us to court, but does not present an official document, it is not considered a legal case. Apply your best effort to aknowledge their situation and strive for a solution. If need be, escalate. ​ Escalates to : Escalation Squad. Complex cases happen when a customer’s issue remains unresolved despite repeated contact, requiring intervention from other teams beyond the initial support level (exceptional situations: tried to follow standard process multiple times and it's not working, lack of information on Knowledge base to address the case, lack of responsiveness of internal team, possible errors from internal teams). ​ Examples: Logistic claim/product claim/refunds/returns/order delays that we don't have a solution and issue is on hold > 5 days. Tried to supplement an SKU more than one time and the wrong product arrives Quality issues that are persistent on the same product again and again, etc. ​ Escalates to : BPO -> Senior Agent (if Level 2 cannot resolve -> Escalation Squad ). HLE -> Escalation Squad OR only : OR agents perform content moderation. They reply to interactions with customers. e.g.: Customer : "Hey, I love Emma, haven't sleep this good in years!" OR Agent's reply : "Great to hear such feedback, makes us sleep much better too!" ​ If at any point the customer needs customer support or assistance, escalates to : a Senior Agent, Level 2 CEOs and Heads are contacted by customers. ​ Important: C-level Escalations it will enter automatically in the Escalations Squad Queue (no interaction from support agents). If the Escalations Squad do not have capacity to handle the C-level escalations or in case of Backlog the C-level cases go to HLE agents, the fallback process involves including the team responsible for resolving TP 1-star reviews and HLE to ensure escalations are addressed effectively. ​ ​ 1.4 How to Escalate a case Find here the flow to escalate a case: 1.4.1 Escalate a case 1.4.1a For who escalates a case Acknowledge the customer’s concern ​ Respond with empathy and confirm that you understand their issue. Explain that their case will be reviewed by another team, an internal team, or a supervisor (e.g., Senior Agents, Escalation Squad). Example: “I understand how frustrating this must be for you. I’ll forward your case to our specialized team for further review.” ​ Verify customer information Ensure all details are accurate (e.g., order number, customer name, email address). Document the reason for escalation Add clear and concise case details in the Collaboration Note , explaining why further escalation is required. Ensure an email is linked to the case If the case is not already associated with an email, click Set Email and add the customer’s email address. Assign to the correct team For internal review: Assign to Escalation Squad/Senior Agent . For supervisor review: Assign to [Supervisor Name or Queue] . ​ 1.4.1b For who handles an escalated case ​ Review the case history Check the case notes and the escalation justification before taking action. Investigate the issue Gather all relevant information to understand the customer’s concern fully. Contact the customer Provide a clear, empathetic, and complete response, ensuring their issue is resolved or next steps are clearly communicated. What to do if you disagree with the Escalation Record your feedback Add your reasoning in the Case Notes . Report the case During the Hypercare (first weeks of implementation) we will have an excel file for you to report this cases, please request the file to your team leader ​ Resolve situation - We still want to make sure the situation is resolved for the customer ​ ​ ​ 1.5 Visual Diagram ​ ​ Note: C-level Escalations it will enter automatically in the Escalations Squad Queue (no interaction from support agents). If the Escalations Squad do not have capacity to handle the C-level escalations or in case of Backlog the C-level cases go to HLE agents, the fallback process involves including the team responsible for resolving TP 1-star reviews and HLE to ensure escalations are addressed effectively. ​ ​ 2. Frequently Asked Questions You can help expand this: reach out to your trainer with your questions. ​ FAQ ​ You can help expand this: reach out to your trainer with your questions. ​ ​ ​ ​ Previous Versions: Last updates: 8th of August 2025 - Added process & workflow for escalations 31 July 2025 - Article revamp

title: How to add Canned Responses
content: This article indicates how you can search, select, and add a Canned Response to reply to a customer. IMPORTANT: At this moment, we only have Canned Responses in English inserted into the system. How to add a Canned Response to reply to a customer? With the case open, go to the bottom-left side where we have the Reply Box, where the message can be written and sent to the customer. There is a line with a few icons, the one you need looks like a notepad. Click on the Canned Responses button; Search for the keywords you need; 3. Look at the number next to the Topics-Titles. title: How to create JIRA ticket in Sprinklr
content: DISCLAIMER: At the moment, this process is available only on the following markets: NL, BE-NL, DE, AT, and CH-FR, FR, IT, PT and BE-FR . And only works for the JIRA Portal: ARD2C. More markets and Portals will follow soon, after this launch-testing phase. In this article, you can find the explanation about JIRA integration with Sprinklr and how to create a JIRA ticket directly from the case. Key-words: JIRA; JIRA ticket; JIRA Portal; JIRA escalation. Table of Contents ​ What is the JIRA integration on Sprinklr? ​ ​ Creating a JIRA ticket in Sprinklr (step by step) ​ ​ Handling the case with a JIRA ticket created ​ ​ -> How to add comments and attachments: ​ ​ -> How to open attached files: ​ ​ -> How to check the status of the JIRA ticket: ​ ​ FAQs ​ What is the JIRA integration on Sprinklr? The JIRA integration is a new feature that connects Sprinklr with the JIRA system, allowing Agents to open JIRA tickets directly from Sprinklr, eliminating the need to open the JIRA Portal separately. Check below the principal changes & key rules of using the JIRA integration: Whenever a JIRA ticket is created, it gets linked to the case in Sprinklr; Any agent will be able to see and work on the same JIRA ticket; Any action needed on the JIRA ticket can be done directly via Sprinklr (check comments, attachments, and status); Whenever an Emma team works on the JIRA ticket and send it back to Agents, the tickets goes automatically to the queue and will be assigned to the next available agent. Creating a JIRA ticket in Sprinklr (step by step) In your Case Console, open the case you are handling in the extended mode and then click on "View Case Details" on the top right; ​ ​ Scroll down the Case Overview, click on " Link a Jira Ticket" , then click the "Create Jira Ticket" button; ​ A new window will open in Sprinklr and this is where you must input all the relevant information to open the JIRA ticket. On the right side, you can continue navigating the case, viewing the conversation and customer interactions, and even search on the Knowledge Base. And on the left side of your screen, is where you can fill in your request to the internal team: ​ ​ 3.1) During the Jira Ticket creation: Do not change the Application field → it must stay as Emma (this may change in the future). 3.2) Select the "JIRA Project Type" and "JIRA Issue Type" dropdowns as needed followed by your specific process. On the images used here we have as example a ticket creation on the ARD2C portal. 3.3) MANDATORY and IMPORTANT step : The "Reporteer field" must be always: sprinklr-agent@emma-sleep.com (Regardless of who is submitting the request — this ensures visibility for all agent users). 3.4) MANDATORY step : The "Summary" field represent the title of the ticket, and from now on, we must follow this structure: Case number + type of request Examples: C ase 12345 - proof of refund request //  Example 2: Case 78903 - invoice request ​ ​ 3.5) Fill in the Jira Ticket details based on your specific request following the regular process for raising tickets. All fields depending to your request are mandatory. If not filled in, you will receive an error. If you leave Sprinklr, you will lose the current edit. 3.6) If relevant to your case, to add attachments use the field "Media" . Please use only files in the following formats: PNG, JPG, JPEG, PDF, Excel (XLSX, CSV). 3.7) After the ticket is created with all details, click on " Create Ticket" at the bottom right. Sprinklr should display a confirmation pop-up saying: “I've sent the case to CRM”. ​ Go back to the Case view and click on View Case Details . You should now see the linked Jira ticket. ​ Click on the Jira ticket — all the info you entered should appear as a summary, including the status of the JIRA ticket. **Disclaimer: DO NOT click on the button “View in Jira”, as will not work for Agents (only Supervisors will have access to it). If you need to check or add comments to the JIRA ticket, you can do it from the section "Case Collaboration". This is explained below on this article. ​ ​ Handling the case with a JIRA ticket created -> How to add comments and attachments: After a Jira ticket is created, Agents can collaborate directly with Emma internal team through Sprinklr using the widget "Case Collaboration" . This means you don’t have to open Jira separately to reach out to the Emma Team resposible for the ticket. Any comment or attachment posted by you in the Sprinklr case will sync to JIRA ticket, and vice versa. You can comment, attach files, or request more information for the Emma team handling the Jira ticket via " Case Collaboration" , on " Add a Case Note" section. In the Sprinklr case, go to Case Collaboration, click Add Note, write your comment and post it. To add attachments, click on the clip icon to the left, select your file and send the message. -> How to open attached files: For the situations when the Emma team needs to send you an attachment, you will also be able to see it via the “Case collaboration” section. However, you must follow the below steps to open correctly the file/image: Go to the Sprinklr case; Find the message that contains the file link in blue color (it usually starts with https://...). ⚠️ If the agent clicks the link directly, it may show a "blocked" message — hence copying it manually is required. ​ Click Edit to view the raw link: ​ ​ ​ Now look for the part of the link that starts with: https:// and stops right before the part that says |smart-link]; Example: If you see: [ https://emma-files.com/doc123456 |smart-link] ➡️ Copy only: https://emma-files.com/doc123456 ​ ​ ​ Paste it in your browser and open the file. Then you can download it and sent to customer, if applicable. The files will be named under the Order Number. Example for a Proof of Refund request: 0015-EMMHNS_POR IMPORTANT: If after following the indication below you still cannot open the image, please inform your Supervisor. -> How to check the status of the JIRA ticket: To see the status of the Jira ticket created, go to the Jira case summary. The status should appear in the bottom right corner. See image below: ​ FAQs Q. How can I check previous Jira tickets? Only one Jira ticket can be linked per case at a time. You can create another Jira ticket after the case is resolved . You can also unlink a ticket and link a new one to the same case if needed. Once a Jira ticket is unlinked from the case, you cannot see the summary of it, but you'll still see the notes in the case collaboration section. -> If you need to check something from previous tickets: Go to the Case Collaboration section: all past tickets reference numbers and comments remain visible there. Agents must share the ticket number with Supervisor Supervisor can access the ticket content with the reference number. Q. How will I know if the Emma team replies to my ticket? You do not need to check Jira manually. When the internal team replies, their message will appear in the case collaboration section in Sprinklr. The case will also return to your queue automatically. Q. How does Jira Ticket status work? ​ For Agents, after the JIRA ticket is created correctly and the ACW is applied with Case Status as "On Hold" (as per the process), no extra action is needed.  When the internal team works and replies to the JIRA ticker, the Sprinklr case gets updated and goes automatically to the  queue. Close the case only once the issue with the customer is fully resolved. Q. What should I do if the Jira ticket is not submitting? Check that all mandatory fields are filled out correctly. This includes the Application, Reporter, Summary, and any other required fields for your request type. Q. What should I do if the attachment won’t upload? Make sure you are using a supported file type such as PNG, JPG, PDF, XLSX, or DOCX. If the file size is too large, compress it and try again. Q. What if the Jira ticket is not visible in Sprinklr after I create it? Click on "View Case Details" again to refresh the view. Also double-check that the Reporter field was set to the correct email: sprinklr-agent@emma-sleep.com.

title: How to leave Internal Notes on Sprinklr
content: ​ DISCLAIMER: NEW PROCESS for D2C AGENTS WILL BE LIVE ON 16TH JUNE ONWARDS! This content explains where and how to leave Internal Notes on Sprinklr. Key-words Notes; Internal Notes; How to leave Notes; Notes on Sprinklr; Profile Collaboration; Case Collaboration What is the new process? Old process: All Agents leaving Internal Notes on the section "Case Collaboration". New process: For D2C cases (Support, Sleep Experts, Online Reputation, HLE): Internal Notes must be added to the section "Profile Collaboration" for all cases that we have a customer profile. If the profile is from carriers, partners, returnal portal, etc, we keep using "Case Collaboration" to register the internal notes. For B2B (Wholesale) and O&O (Stores): No changes. Agents leaving Internal Notes on the section "Case Collaboration" . How to leave an Internal Note? IMANDATORY: Check in which scenarios it is mandatory to leave Notes on Sprinklr: "System Notes" . Leaving Notes on "Profile Collaboration": Step 1: Prepare your template that MUST be use when leaving notes on this scenario: CN: _______________ (Sprinklr Case number) ON: ______________ (Order Number) ENQ: _____________ (Enquiry) ACT: ______________ (Actions taken) JIRA: ______________ (JIRA ticket number) [if applicable] Step 2: When you have a case open, click on the person icon that indicates the "Customer 360" button on the right side menu: Step 3: On that page, in the middle column, you will find a section called "Profile Collaboration". ​ ​ ​ ​ Step 4: Use the bar that indicates "Add a profile note" to type and add your Internal Notes and just click to post it. Leaving Notes on "Case Collaboration": The "Case Collaboration" feature appears in the middle column when you have a case open and reflects all internal notes related to that case. ​ You can either type directly from the "Case Collaboration" on the space named "Add a case note", or you can make the note from the conversation space with the customer, on the bottom right, by clicking on "Add note". The notes will appear consolidated all under the "Case collaboration" box.

title: How to remove Notifications in Sprinklr
content: If you are receiving email notifications from Sprinklr and wish to stop them, please follow the instructions below. ​ ⚠️ Important: This configuration must be adjusted individually by each user. It cannot be changed centrally or by an administrator. Unfortunately, we cannot change this configuration on our side, because it needs to be changed on a User level. This means that you need to open Sprinklr with your account and manage the notifications to block those emails for you. I t's very simple, just check the steps below (and the images): 1) Log in to Sprinklr Access the platform using your personal user credentials. ​ 2) Go to Notification Settings Click on your profile icon (usually located in the top-right corner). Select “Settings” from the dropdown menu. Navigate to the “Notifications” section. ​ 3) Adjust Email Preferences ​ Locate the email notification options. Uncheck or disable the types of notifications you no longer wish to receive. Save your changes. ​ 4) Confirmation You should stop receiving the selected email notifications shortly after saving your preferences. ​ ​

title: How to: Create outbound email / new case
content: In this article, you can find the step-by-step guide about creating a new case or an outbound email for when you need to reach out to a customer who doesn't have a case open yet. ﻿ ​ Key-words: outbound email; new case; case creation; outbound creation. Table of context How to create Outbound Email from the Case Console -> Illustrative video How to create Outbound Email from the Home Page Console How to create Outbound Email from the Case Console Step 1: At the Console, when you have a case open, you can check the top right corner for a button named "Create new case". ​ Step 2: After clicking on the button, a pop-up window will appear and there you have to proceed as the following: ​ - Customer Email Address: insert the email of to who you want to send the message; ​ - Emma Email From: Select the Emma email related to your market/Line of Business. It's MANDATORY to select the correct email address to avoid the customer reply being sent to the incorrect queues/agents. After selecting the email, below it will appear a message indicating the Line of Business related to the email, so you can verify if the email sleected is the correct one; ​ - Assignment: This option is automatically marked and cannot be removed. This will guarantee that the new outbound email created is assigned to the agent that is creating it. ﻿ Then, click on "Next" to proceed. ﻿ ﻿ ​ ​ Step 3: Next, a new pop-up window will appear showing the new case number created and the case will be automatically assign to you . There is no need to manually assign the case to you, as the system already does it. You can copy the new case number just to guarantee, and then click on "Next". ​ ​ ​ The new case will not automatically open on your screen, but instead it goes to the left side bar on the "Assign to me" list , as indicated in red on the image below. Like this, if needed, you can navigate from one case to the other. ﻿ Step 4: . Now is the moment to write the email, and send it to the customer from the contact box as normal. ﻿ Note: Please make sure to review and select the correct Account Email address related to your market/line of business from the option "To" address option. ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ Illustrative video ​ ​ ​ How to create Outbound Email from the Home Page Console ﻿ Step 1: Go to the Agent Console Home page, and on the left side just below your name you can see the blue button indicating "Create Outbound Email": ﻿ ﻿ ﻿ Step 2: After clicking on the button, a pop-up window will appear and there you have to proceed as the following: ​ - Customer Email Address: insert the email of to who you want to send the message; ​ - Emma Email From: Select the Emma email related to your market/Line of Business. It's MANDATORY to select the correct email address to avoid the customer reply being sent to the incorrect queues/agents. After selecting the email, below it will appear a message indicating the Line of Business related to the email, so you can verify if the email sleected is the correct one; ​ - Assignment: This option is automatically marked and cannot be removed. This will guarantee that the new outbound email created is assigned to the agent that is creating it. ﻿ Then, click on "Next" to proceed. ﻿ ﻿ Step 3: Next, a new pop-up window will appear shwing the case number created and you just have to click on "Next" to be automatically re-direct to the case page. Click and wait a couple of seconds. ​ ​ ﻿ Step 4: After that, the case is created and a profile as well (or the case will be automatically assigned to a pre-existent profile, as per the image below). Now is the moment to write the email, and send it to the customer from the contact box as normal. ﻿ Note: Please make sure to review and select the correct Account Email address related to your market/line of business from the option "To" address option. ​ ​ ​ ​ Step 5: To finalize, right down the email message to the customer and click on "Send" (example bellow). ​ ​ ﻿ ﻿ ﻿ ﻿ ﻿ ﻿ ﻿ ﻿

title: How to: Modify Customer's Email address
content: In email cases, this can be done with this button at the top: However, changing this DO NOT mean that the email on the “TO” will be changed as well. Please be careful and review the email address on the “TO” before emailing the customer. Implementation Details A new panel has been added to the "Set Email" guided path. Agents will now see three options when setting an email: Case Level Only – Updates the email only for the selected case without affecting the profile. Profile Level Only – Updates the email for the profile but keeps the case email unchanged. Both Case and Profile – Updates the email for both the case and the profile. How to Use the Updated "Set Email" Function Navigate to the case requiring an email update. Click the Set Email button located at the top right of the page. Select one of the three options based on the situation: Case Level Only if the email should change only for this specific case. Profile Level Only if the customer's email should be updated for all cases under their profile. Both Case and Profile if the email correction applies to both levels. Confirm the selection and save the changes. ​

title: How to: Open and navigate on the Knowledge Base
content: In this article, you'll find instructions on accessing the complete version of the Knowledge Base, opening articles, and searching for specific articles or folders. IMPORTANT: Remember that we also have the KB widget, which you can access to search for articles directly from the customer case you are handling. Check the article about the Widget HERE Table of content ​ Knowledge Base Overview ​ Search Bar and Filters ​ How to open an article? ​ How to open an article while handling a case? Knowledge Base Overview You’re already familiar with your home page on Sprinklr, the Agent Care Console. On the left side menu, you can find the button directly to open the Knowledge Base. That’s the KB Home Page. There, you’ll be able to see the search bar, filters, categories and articles. The home page may not show all the "Categories" folders at once, so please make sure to click in "Show All". Search Bar and Filters At the Home Page, you have the option to overview all articles published, as indicated on the image above. And right at the top of the page, you’ll find the search bar that can find any article in the entire Knowledge Base.  . There, you can look up key-words, articles or folder names. Using “Sprinklr” as an example, the system provides all the articles and folders with this key-word. Related to search of processes, we recommend to type between 2 to 3 words to make the search more accurate. Example: Prefer to type "make a return" or " how to return" instead of just using just "return". In addition to that, we recommend to use the Filters option to narrow down your search. The filters are pretty straight-forward and easy to navigate. On the top right, you have your standard configuration filters, being “Sort By”, “Manage Columns” and “Hide Filters”. Then, you have your search filters. There, you can either filter by Category, Status or Language, or create your custom “Quick Filter”. Category: Those are the main Folders organized per topics, each of them have sub-categories. This filter makes it easier for you to filter directly by sub-category, if you prefer. Status: Always and only search and read the articles with the status "Approved". Language: We have 60 language options in our “Language” filter. However, the majority of the articles are (and should) be in English, since this is the Emmie's universal language. We have very few exceptions, but always look for information with the English option. ​ How to open an article? Always open articles in Third Pane button, directly from the article list view below in the screenshot. ​ In this option, the article will open on a smaller pane, and you’ll be able to navigate through the KB simultaneously. ​ DO NOT open the article from the button "View Article". Unfortunately that option don't show the right visualization of the article in terms of medias and technical layouts. How to open an article while handling a case? At this part you can check how to search for KB articles while having a case open and handling the customer contact. At the Case page, you have the customer interaction place on the left and at the middle you can find the widget called "Smart Assist". And that's from there that you will start to follow the steps indicated bellow: Step 1: Click on the button "Show All" at the Smart Assist Widget: ​ Step 2: ​A new window side will open and there you need to click where says "Knowledge Base": ​ Step 3: On the top you have the search bar, where you should insert the key-words related to the topic you want to find information about. Type what you need and click "Enter". Then, you will see a list and the number of articles available that are related to that topic. You can scroll up and down to check for the one more appropriate for your need (indicated in yellow at the image below). ​ ​ Step 4: After finding the article that suits you, just click on it to open. The article will appear on the right side of your Case page, and then you can access the customer interaction and still read the KB article:

title: How to: Search for customer or case information
content: This article shares instructions on using the Sprinklr Search Bar and gives best practices for finding customer and case information. Table of Content Search Bar ​ Using Search Bar options: Case Message Profile Search Bar On the Agent Care Console, you have the "magnifying glass" button that by clicking it opens a pop-up window where searches can be done. On that part, you need always and only use the following options for search: "Case", "Message" or "Profile". The other options are not relevant to Emma's search. Step 1: Select the option that suits you best. Step 2: Type the content. Using Search Bar options As mentioned, you will only use either "Case", "Message" or "Profile" for the searches. Now let's see which information you should input in each case to make your search more accurate. Case: You need to have the case number in order to find it on the system. At the example below, in red you can see the "case" option select and the case number that was typed, and on yellow the case that was found. Message: If you need to search for a more detailed level of information, like specific key words that were used in the case. This is more usefull for Non-Voice cases (live-chats, emails, social media). If the search is done with key-words it is mandatory to use quotation marks ( " " ) at the begining and at the end, in order to make the search accurate for that expression, sentence. IMPORTANT: Searching by Order Number only works if the customer mentioned the order number in their contact with us (via email or live chat). The search by Order number is not integrated with FluentCommerce or Magento.  Or even postal code, address, or phone number. However, the search like that will only work if tha information was mentioned in written in the communication form the customer to us. ​ ​ ​ Profile: If you have the name of the customer (order placeholder) you ned to select the option "Profile" and type the name. Then the system will show  you all the different channels on which the customer have reached out to us. You can also use the customer e-mail address to search for their profile. Then, from the Profile, you can open all the cases and conversation history from that customer.

title: KB Smart Assist Widget
content: Table of content What is the KB Smart Assist Widget? Using the KB Smart Assist Widget? What is the KB Smart Assist Widget? ​ This widget is where you can access the knowledge base without having to leave your case! ​ Besides allowing you to search the knowledge base, for all the interactions in English the Artificial Intelligence suggests Knowledge Base Articles accordingly to the conversation between agents and customers. It gets key-words from the conversation and search for articles with the same words, and recommends the articles for you during the case handling. ​ The suggested articles will appear on Live-chat, Voice and Social Medias, but not on Emails. And on this first version, it works for English conversations only. ​ ​ For the AI suggestions check the short demonstration on the video below for the normal KB you have more steps bellow: Using the KB Smart Assist Widget? During the interaction you can search for KB articles, however the visibility will be limited: By clicking in "Show all" you will be able to access larger quantity of KB options. PLEASE evaluate if the article suggested was relevant or not for the case you had. Please mark as a "thumbs Up" if was good, or with a "Thumbs down" if was not accurated. This will help improvements to be done on the widget.

title: Macros: What is it and What is the Logic?
content: What is a Macro in Sprinklr? A Macro in Sprinklr is an automated workflow that allows users to perform repetitive tasks quickly and efficiently. Macros help streamline processes by executing predefined actions or rules based on specific conditions. They are primarily used in customer service management to ensure consistency and reduce manual effort when handling similar types of inquiries or requests. ​ Purpose of Macros Automate repetitive actions. Improve response time and agent efficiency. Maintain consistency in customer interactions. Reduce human error. Enable faster resolution of customer issues. ​ Logic Behind Macros This is similar to the "Create a Rule" function in Freshdesk, but in this case, you need to manually execute the macro. You must click to apply the macro for the rule to take effect. Macros in Sprinklr work on a trigger-action/rule basis. When a predefined condition (trigger) or a certain rule is met, the system executes a series of actions automatically. ​

title: Macros: Which Ones and How to use?
content: In this article, you can find information about which Macros are available for CS Agents to use and what is the functionality of each one of them. A Macro in Sprinklr is an automated workflow that allows users to perform repetitive tasks quickly and efficiently. Check this article to understand the logic of a Macro on Sprinklr: HERE ​ Below are the Macros available for CS agents currently: Assign to Me: Only to be used with the supervisor's approval. It is used when the TL is reassigning the cases to them from the agent's bucket if the capacity of the agent is overflowing. It is also used when the agent is creating an outbound email and the case needs to be assigned to them or if the case is unassigned to them automatically by the system. ​ ​ Change LOB/Market/Language or unassign: (use this with supervisor's approval). It is used when the CS Team lead or agent needs to reassign the case to the correct market or country. ​ Create JIRA: NOT IN USE FOR THE MOMENT. And, please, don't use it. ​ No Response Required: To be used in Spam cases. This is used in case the customer's inquiry is already answered by a different agent on a related resolved Case. Trigger ACW: To apply case tagging and case status. To be used in exceptional cases the button “Trigger ACW” does not appear on the top right.

title: Agent Effort Score
content: ​ Version up-to-date as of: 3 September 2025 ES, FR, and PT markets information added for survey along with BE and UK. Purpose : This article intends to inform UK and Belgium agents of a 10-second ACW survey they will be asked that includes two questions .​ The ES, FR, and PT markets were added. What is agent effort score: To measure you efforts while handling customer requests we will now have a questions appearing at the end of the interaction with our customers. This will only happen to 10% of the cases, so don't expect it to happen regularly. What is the question? "On a scale from 1 to 5, how easy was it to resolve this case considering the available tools and processes? (1 = very difficult, 5 = very easy) ​ ​ ​ ​ (Updated) ES, FR, & PT Agents in FR, PT, and ES must now complete the AES survey for every resolved case, following the new structure: ​ Q1: Rate the ease of resolution Rate the ease of resolution (1 = very difficult, 5 = very easy). This is mandatory and must be entered as a digit. Q2: If Q1 is 3 or below, select the main driver of effort from the provided list: Unclear Process System Issues Missing Information Permission Restriction Delayed on Internal Hold Delayed on External Hold Other (only if none of the above apply) Ensure responses are accurate and reflect the true driver of effort. If unsure which driver to select, consult your team lead or refer to the provided examples in the KB. ​ ​ ​ Release Note: KB updated to include ES, FR, and PT markets in survey. ​ Why AES Matters: Boosts Agent Satisfaction High-effort tasks reduce productivity. Lower effort supports a healthier work environment. Enhances Customer Experience When it’s easier for agents, it’s usually easier for customers too. Reduces Churn Difficult interactions frustrate both agents and customers, risking loyalty. Drives Process Improvement AES highlights inefficiencies in systems, enabling targeted optimizations. ​ ​ ​ Previous Versions: Last update: Update with image and question information 1st Update : Articled created on 17 July 2025.

title: How to: Agent Status
content: Introduction In this article, you can find information about all the Agent Status that you have for your disposable at the system and in which cases to use them. Agent Status on Sprinklr STATUS DEFINITION WHEN TO USE Available Automatic status that means the user is logged in to the platform, and ready to work. The system will automatically change to Available once a case is closed. Unavailable The user is logged in to the platform, but is not yet available to work. At the end of your work day, before clicking on logged out. Occupied The user is logged in to the platform and is on an inbound call. The system will automatically change to Occupied when you accept a case. Manual Outbound calls The user is logged in to the platform and is on an outbound call. If you have to perform an outbound call to a customer. Training The user is on a training session. Only if your Supervisor/QA or Trainer have requested it. Coaching The user is receiving a coaching from a supervisor or from a quality analyst. Only if your Supervisor/QA or Trainer have requested it. IT issues The user is unable to work due to technical issues. Only if indicated by a Supervisor. Meeting The user is having an internal (BPO) meeting. Only if your Supervisor/QA or Trainer have requested it. Lunch The user is on lunch break. Exclusively for your 1h lunch break. Break The user is on short break. Exclusively for the 15min short break during your work day. Overtime The user is doing overtime as requested by Emma. Only if your Supervisor/QA or Trainer have requested it. Backoffice The user is working on pending ACW queue after the initial ACW time was exceeded. The user is finishing up a case (that could not be resolved during ACW) or is working on pending tickets, with the permission of the supervisor. Only if indicated by a Supervisor. Working in external platform The user is logged in to the Sprinklr platform but is answering cases that are not on Sprinklr. Only if indicated by a Supervisor. Floor support The user is providing floor support to colleagues. Only if indicated by a Supervisor.

title: How to: Case Status
content: Introduction In this article, you will find instructions on Case Status and which one to use after handling a customer request. Case Status options According to the customers' request and the follow-up actions, you need to inform the system of the outcome by inserting the correct status related to the case. In Sprinklr we have 5 cases statuses: Awaiting Response On Hold / Internal Hold Pending Resolution Confirmation Closed No Response Required Customer Closed When to use each Case Status: Case Status Definition Notes Examples Awaiting Response To be used after the Agent replied to the customer, and now is awaiting response from customer in order to proceed. For email cases: The customer will receive automatic reminder emails after 48 and after 96 hours. If there is no reply within 168 hours (7 days), the case will be auto-closed and a CSAT survey will be triggered. In a Product Claim scenario, when you have asked customer to send picture; In any query when customer didn't provide enough nformation for you to find the order on the system. On Hold / Internal Hold On Hold: appears on the ACW window & Internal Hold appears when you check the status of the case. But they are the same thing. To be used when the case resolution is pending on a 3rd party reply (ie. Partners - WHs/Carriers, Emma Internal - CE/OM/AR D2C, etc) This status will occur when an Agent manually  changes the status of a case as part of the process of escalating to 3rd parties or internal Emmies. On this status, if the Customer replies anytime during the case being on “Hold”, the case will go back to the queue to be assigned. In a Refusal upon Delivery scenario, when you have to open a refund request via JIRA ticket; or when you need to edit an order and raised a ticket to AR D2C. Pending Resolution Confirmation Use this status if you consider the case as resolved for the customer, but an active confirmation of resolution from the customer is needed. FOR EU MARKETS ONLY: To be used when the Agent has resolved the customer query satisfactorily and the case is resolved. ​ If within 72h on this status the customer doesn't reply, the status will automatically be set as "Closed" and a CSAT Survey will be triggered. FOR EU MARKETS ONLY: For LiveChat, moving the case to "Pending Customer Resolution" will automacatilly trigger the CSAT Survey to the customer. In a Return scenario, when you have done all actions needed and now have just informed customer about return date and refund timeline. Closed (This Status is no longer Available for EU Markets) To be used when the Agent has resolved the customer query satisfactorily and the case is resolved. Attention: The customer has to actively confirm that the matter is resolved for them. For Email and Chat cases: Moving the case to the "Closed"-status will automatically trigger a CSAT Survey to the customer. For Voice cases: In the ACW you only have the option to move the case status to ""Closed"" if you sent the customer to the Survey IVR before disconnecting the call. If you missed this, make sure to update the Customer profile in Sprinklr with the email address and move the status to "Pending Resolution Confirmation". --> Bear in mind that if you did not solve the customers' issue and still move the case to "Closed", you might get a bad rating in the CSAT survey. So when in doubt, rather use "Pending Resolution Confirmation". Agent has resolved the customer’s concern, confirming that the issue has been addressed and no further steps are required. No Response Required To be used when no reply is sent to the customer. It can only be triggerd by Macro (please check the Macro article). -- For Spam/Unactionable cases and no answer to customer is needed. Customer Closed User actively closed the chat conversation on the website This status is automatically applied to a chat case when the User actively closes the the chat conversation on the website. ​

title: How to: Check cases assigned to me / pending ACW
content: Introduction In this article you have instructions about how to find on Sprinklr all your cases: assigned to you; pending; closed, etc. How to find "all my cases" on Sprinklr Step 1: From the homepage of the Agent Care Console, click on the button that indicates Console ​ ​ Step 2: Click on the small arrow: Step 3: Click on the second "My work" and a drop-down menu will appear and then you click on "All my cases" . Step 4: Here you will be able to see the numbers of your cases according to the Case Status. How to check cases with "Pending ACW" ACW means "after case working" and is related to the actions and information you must input after handling a case. Especially after handling Phone calls, a pop-up window will appear named "Execute ACW" where you have to add the case status, case category and other information. If you don't fill it in time, the case will count as pending and you will have to finish it later. For you to find those "pending ACW" cases, please follow the next steps. Step 1: From the homepage of the Agent Care Console, click on the button that indicates Console ​ ​ Step 2: Click on the small arrow: Step 3: Click on the first "My work" and a drop-down menu will appear and then you click on "Pending ACW" .

title: How to: Child-ticket Workaround
content: Introduction In this article, you can find the temporary solution for when you need to connect one case with the other, what we normally refer to as "child-ticket". This feature is not yet deployed on Sprinklr, so for the moment we need to handle it as explained below. When to do this? This is for when you have the customer's case open and need to send an email to a third party (carriers, charities, etc.), but the communication needs to be related to the customer's case. Or for when APAC agents need to contact the customer after receiving a return request from the Typeform tickets. In situations like: - Communication with Carriers; - Communication with Warehouses; - Communication with Charities; - Handling Typeform/ Returns in APAC  (check at the end of the article how the cases will look like). How to proceed? Step 1: Go to the on the button on the left-side menu and click on Create an Email case : Step 2: Insert the details to be able to create the Email Case. Step 3: After that, a case will be automatically created and a profile as well. And you can write and send the Email to the third party from the contact box as normal. Step 4: Open again the case from here the request originally came from, and leave a note on "Case collaboration" indicating the actions done and the email sent in the other case number. For APAC Markets ONLY Example of how the Typeform tickets will look like on Sprinklr:

title: How to: Create new case/Outbound email
content: Introduction In this article, you can find the step-by-step guide about how to create a new case or an outbound email for when you need to reach out to a customer that doesn't have a case open yet. How to proceed? Step 1: Go to the button on the left-side menu and click on Create an Email case : Step 2: Insert the email addres of the customer, first name and last name. Step 3: Then, a new page will open with more fields, please fill them accordingly: SUBJECT: Write down the Subject of your email message. DESCRIPTION: This is NOT the content of the email. DO NOT write the email here . Leave this option in blank. This will be for the creation of the case, it is not the email to customer yet. IMPORTANT: You have to write the Email message on the area indicated at the Step 4 below. If you insert the Email Message under "Description", the customer will NOT receive anything. Step 4: After that, a case will be automatically created and a profile as well (or the case will be automatically assigned to a pre-existent profile). Now is the moment to write the email, and send it to the customer from the contact box as normal. Note: Please make sure to review and select the correct Account Email address related to your market/line of business from the option "To" address option.

title: How to: handle Anonymous cases
content: IMPORTANT: DO NOT edit an Anonymous profile, don't insert any customer information or order information. You must follow the steps indicated in this article. What are Anonymous cases? An Anonymous case is when the customer reaches out as an unidentified contact . This means that their name, phone number, email will not appear on our system once the case is created. And what is the impact of those cases? ​ Technically, all the Anonymous cases get register in the same Anonymous profile, no matter the market or the language.  This means the same profile can have information from different customers and orders numbers, and those conflict information will make difficult for everyone to really understand the request. ​ That's why is PROHIBITED TO EDIT anything on an anonymous profile when receiving an anonymous incoming contact. Agents must instead follow the steps indicated in this article. ​ How to identify an Anonymous case in Sprinklr? On the moment you the case opens for you on the system, you need to identify if the Incoming contact (Voice or Live-chat) shows an indication as Anonymous. Check the example below: Phone calls: Live chats: How to handle Anonymous cases? After indentify and confirm that the contact is Anonymous, please follow the steps: Step 1: Inform the customer that the incoming case is showing as Anonymus is our system and confirm if the customer allows you to save the information on the system and identify himself/herself. Please explain that this will create a profile on the system that register all the interactions they have with us and facilitates when looking for previous cases. If customer says NO : you cannot save their information on the profile. Step 2: If customer allows, it is MANDATORY that you create a new case/outbound email in order to be able to register the customer information in a new case, and not in the one that was open during the incoming contact. Note: Check here the article "How to create new case/email outbound" . Step 3: You have to send the outbound email when still in the call/live-chat with the customer. Because the outbound email will create a new case, and automatically a new profile, in which you can add the customer information correctly. After that, on the "case collaboration" column, you need to leave a note explaining the case was originally from an Anonymous incoming contact and put the original case number just for reference. But everything else from that customer, will be handled form the new profile created.

title: How to: Handle non-voice cases
content: TABLE OF CONTENTS Handling Social/Email Cases Viewing All Cases Using Canned Responses Authentication & Set Email Features Authentication Set Email Trigger ACW Macro Switching Dashboards Macros I should apply on social/email cases How to send Outbound emails The basic non-voice cases workflow and tools remain consistent with voice case handling. You will still need to change the platform status and open the Care Console to see your cases (social channels or emails), and you can add comments in your cases. You will also interact with the same Care Console layout, including: Case Queue Conversation History Third Pane Handling Social/Email Cases Viewing All Cases Click in the Console option in the left panel; Select My Work → My Works ; In the My Works Dashboard , all cases will be visible regardless of the channel (voice, social, or email); Select the case you want to work on. Using Canned Responses You can also add canned responses in Sprinklr, to expedite your work. For more information on how to add canned responses, refer to this article . Important: Always remember to edit and adapt the canned responses before sending, to avoid robotic messages. ​ Handling the case IMPORTANT: We DO NOT transfer the case to another agent even if the customer is asking to speak with another colleague or if the case was previous handled by a colleague. When you receive the case, you have the onwership to handle it from now onwards. Make sure that you review the previous interactions and get a understanding of what was happen before. Authentication & Set Email Features The Authenticate and Set Email features functions in the same way as they do for voice cases: Authentication Click on the "Authentication" button located in the top-right of the Care Console; Fill in all the necessary fields to be able to authenticate the customer → Next ​; Sprinklr will then make an API call to check if the details are correct​; If the process is successful, you should see the Authenticated status​. Set Email Click on the "Set Email" button located in the top-right of the Care Console​; Enter customer’s name and email address; By doing this, in the Reply Box you will get another option to reach out to the customer via email​. This is specially useful when you need to follow-up about the customer’s query in the future. Trigger ACW Macro You must apply the Trigger ACW macro to non-voice cases. This will change the status of the cases as necessary, after you’ve answered the customer. Click Trigger ACW in the top right corner → Trigger ACW ; Select the Case Status ; Select the correct case category and fill out all relevant fields → Next . Switching Dashboards To view cases you have under different statuses, switch to the My Cases Dashboard . Macros I should apply on social/email cases Assign To X : this macro will change the status of cases to Assigned and assign cases to the agents/supervisors that you select in the drop-down menu​; Create JIRA : this macro is pending and not ready to use yet. The goal is to direct you directly to the Jira Portal. Send To Team : this macro is used to send cases to different departments​; Trigger ACW : this is the macro that you will use to:​ Put cases on Awaiting Response ​ When you move cases to this queue and the customer replies, the system will assign the case back to you if you have capacity to handle it; If you do not have capacity to handle it, the system will assign the case to the next available agent​; If the customer takes more than 7 days to reply after putting the case on Awaiting Response, the system will auto-close the case​; Put cases On Hold ​ You need to ensure that you clear the on-hold cases before the end of the day​. Put cases on Pending Resolution Confirmation ​ Close ​ Fully close cases​. Note: as soon as you apply any of the above macros, the cases will move to their respective queues (e.g. Awaiting Response, On Hold). To be able to see these cases, you will have to open the My Cases Dashboard. ​ ​ How to send Outbound emails Access the "Create Case Email" Option From the left-side menu, click on the "Create Case Email" button. Fill in the customer’s e-mail, first name and last name; Click Next ; Fill in the e-mail subject; Click Create , in the bottom-right of the page. Open the Case in the Care Console After the case is created, click on 'Open Case in the Care Console' to access the case in the Console. Write and Send the Email Write the body of the email in the "Reply Box"; Once the email is complete, review it and click Send to deliver the email to the customer.​ Your e-mail will then be visible in the case.

title: How to: Handle voice cases
content: This article shows how to accept and handle the navigability of incoming customer calls. ​Table of content Answering the Call ​ Handling and Ending the Call ​ 1) Hold and Mute Features ​ 2) Call Recording ​ 3) Call Transfer ​ 4) Ending the Call ​ Triggering the ACW ​ Case Console during a Call handling ​ 1) Adding Internal Notes ​ 2) Historical Case Information ​ 3) Case Details Answering the Call You have 15 seconds before the call is auto-answered. After this period, the call will be answered automatically, and you cannot decline it. You can see the countdown in the incoming call window: IMPORTANT: You can NOT use the "Decline" button. Rejecting a call is never a procedure. Handling and Ending the Call Signaled in red below, you can see the Call Console. This is an interactive bar that allows you to: Put the customer on Hold & Mute yourself; Pause/resume the Call recording; Transfer cases; End the call (this option should not be used). 1) Hold and Mute Features You have the option to manage the call with the following actions: Put on Hold : The customer will hear hold music, and the call will remain in the queue. For that, you must click on the “Pause” icon. To return to the call, simply click in the “Play” icon. ​ As per procedure, while on Hold, agents need to give the customer feedback every 2 minutes. If the agent feels the situation will take longer than expected to sort out, the agent should give the customer the option to receive a follow-up contact at a later date. You can review all communication guidelines on the related Quality Grids: HERE Mute : The button allows you to temporarily mute your microphone while continuing to listen to the customer. IMPORTANT: We avoid the use of this feature as it can lead the customer into thinking the call has dropped or that the CS agent is not listening to them. If you need to check information with a colleague or a supervisor, please use the Hold button and inform customer accordingly. Note: These actions are recorded in the Conversation History . 2) Call Recording Call recording begins automatically once the customer gives consent during the IVR. Stopping Recording : If the customer requests to stop the recording, you can pause it by clicking Record Call → Secure Pause . Resuming Recording : To resume the recording, you must click on Record Call → Record . Note: Always inform the customer when recording starts or stops to comply with legal requirements. 3) Call Transfer IMPORTANT: We DO NOT transfer the case to another agent even if the customer is asking to speak with another colleague or if the case was previous handled by a colleague. When you receive the case, you have the onwership to handle it from now onwards. Make sure that you review the previous interactions and get a understanding of what was happen before. If you need to transfer the call to another market or line of business, you must click on the “Transfer” option: You have two options when transferring the call: Warm Transfer : Put the customer on hold and speak with the other agent or supervisor first. Once you’re ready, transfer the customer to the other agent or queue. Blind Transfer : Directly transfer the customer to the other agent or queue without any communication with your colleague. 4) Ending the Call ​ After you handle the case and the conversation is coming to an end, you need to properly inform customer about transfering them to the CSAT Survey. The customer will hear a few questions, and the call will automatically be closed once it is completed. MANDATORY : Before transfer customer to the survey, inform them accordingly to this template: ​ "In that case, I will then finalize our contact and redirect you to a one-question service survey. If this is not okay with you, you may end the call. Thank you for calling and have a nice day." Transfer to Survey IVR Click the Transfer button in the left-hand menu. Select Internal from the drop-down options 3. In the second drop-down, choose Survey IVR → Transfer Call . After transferring the call, you will be required to complete the After Call Work (ACW) . Triggering the ACW After transferring the call, the After Call Work (ACW) window will pop up. Click on Trigger ACW to enter all necessary information and finalize the case. Example of the ACW option when you transfer the call to the Survey IVR : Example of the ACW option when you or the customer hung up the call or you trigger the ACW manually ​: Note: If you need to call back to the customer, you can click in the Redial option, it the top right corner. ​Case Console during a Call handling Let's check some buttons and options that you can use during a call handling. 1) Adding Internal Notes Internal Notes can be added at both the Case and Profile levels. You can use @mentions to tag agents or supervisors for visibility and collaboration. 1.1) Profile Notes: You can add your note directly in the Omni-Channel Interaction window. Make sure to include all relevant details, then click Send once you're finished. Once submitted, your note will appear in the Profile, indicated by the red arrow below. 1.2) Case Notes: To add a note to a case, please refer to the article "Sprinklr Internal Notes: Case Colaboration" . 2) Historical Case Information The Historical Cases section in the Care Console provides visibility on the number of times a customer has contacted support using the same phone number. This might be useful to identify the customer’s previous cases and expedite the troubleshooting. To see this information, you need to simply roll down the page: 3) Case Details On the this section, you can see the case’s history and overall information. To access detailed case information, click on Show All , which will direct you to the Properties page. This will display the full set of case properties, including: Case Number ; Status (e.g., Open, Pending, Resolved); Categorization ; Customer's Phone Number ; Customer History : Past interactions history from the customer. Under the Case Content section, you'll see the ticket's categorization, which provides additional context to the case. The Overview panel offers additional information regarding the recording consent and associated timeframes.

title: How to: Merge Cases
content: Article content: ​ When is it possible to Merge cases? ​ Why should cases be merged? How to merge cases (step-by-step) When is it possible to Merge cases? 1) On Email cases ONLY . 1.1) It is NOT possible to merge Phone and Live-chat cases. For those, you have to handle and close each one of them. If during the live interaction, you find that on the "historical cases" that the customer request was already addressed and solved, please inform the customer about it and then finalize the interaction. 2) On the emails cases sent from the same customer with the exact same request and about the same order number . How to merge Email cases (step-by-step) Step 1: Identify if Merge is applicable ​ After checking the Emails cases, you find that indeed the same customer has 2 emails cases (or more) open with the same request related to the same order, you can proceed with the merge. ​ Step 2: Select the option "Merge Cases" The merge logic is: the new/open case is the one to be merged with the old/first email case. So, you need to open the old case, click on the 3 dots and then on the option "Merge Cases". On the example below, the case #2422376 (circle in green) is the new case; and the case #2366362 (yellow circle) is the old/first email case. ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ Step 3: Search and selected the case to be merged ​ After clicking on the button, a new page will appear and there you can see the old/first case on the right side. And on the left side you have a search bar in which you have to type the case number and click on enter. ​ Following that, the case will appear for you on the list and you must select it on the box and click on the "merge" button.

title: How to: Transfer Cases
content: Table of Contents Introduction When to transfer How to transfer cases For Non-voice cases For Voice cases Amazon cases: how to handle Introduction This article shows which scenarios to transfer cases and how to do this action in Sprinklr. When to transfer a case? You can transfer a case in 3 scenarios: - Case from a Line of Business that you do not support; - Case from a Market that you do not support; - Case from a Language that you do not support. IMPORTANT: If you need to transfer the case, but it is related to an Emma Store topic, please follow the instructions in the article "How to: Transfer Cases to Emma Store agents" . How to transfer cases? IMPORTANT: We DO NOT transfer the case to another agent even if the customer is asking to speak with another colleague or if the case was previous handled by a colleague. When you receive the case, you have the onwership to handle it from now onwards. Make sure that you review the previous interactions and get a understanding of what was happen before. DISCLAIMER: We don't have all Markets available on Sprinklr yet. This means we don't have all CS agents using this tool so in certain cases, you cannot transfer the case in Sprinklr. Please check this article to know how to proceed per market and line of business. After confirming that it is indeed possible to transfer the case inside Sprinklr, please follow the next steps according to the channel: ​ 1) For Non-Voice cases (Email, Live chat, Social media): Step 1: Apply Macro It is mandatory to transfer a case via the option "Apply macro", that you can find in the 3 dots button in the window from the case conversation. Step 2: Select the macro named "Change LOB/Market/Language or unassign" Step 3: Fill the properties accordingly to the transfer you need. The fields "Market" and "Line of business" are MANDATORY. And the fields "Change Channel Type" and "Emma Store" are only to be used when transfering a Emma Store case (please refer to this article ). ​ 2) For Voice cases (Phone calls): If you have to transfer a call to other queues, always inform the customer about it and choose the option "warm transfer" (customer is put on hold and you talk to the person before transferring the call). ​ Note: Make sure to check our Communication Guidelines: HERE ​ Step 1: You have to handle the customer phone call and explain to the customer that their call needs to be transfer to the correct line and for this they will be placed on hold and need to wait on the line. After this, click on the Transfer button on the Voice Console; ​ Step 2: Make sure the option "Internal" is selected; ​ Step 3: Go to "Select Queue" and choose the line related to the market/language of the customer. Step 4: Click on "Warm transfer" option as you must inform your colleague about the transfer. ​ Amazon cases: how to handle? How to understand that the case is about an Amazon Order Look for these signs in the customer’s message: Mentions “Amazon” directly. Order number/invoice format does not match Emma D2C . Refers to order in the Amazon app/website . Email, invoice, or attachments show Amazon branding . States the purchase was made via Amazon marketplace , not emma-sleep.com. If any of these apply, classify the case as an Amazon case and send a reply using the template below, adust to your market language. "Dear customer, Thank you for contacting Emma. After looking into your contact, it looks like your order was not placed through our webstore but directly through Amazon. Please note that, for Amazon orders, due to our system setup, customer support is handled directly through Amazon's app or website. As such, if your order was placed through them, we would kindly ask you to make your support request there, so that we are able to help you. Thank you for your understanding on this matter. We look forward to assist you with your request through the Amazon platform, and we truly appreciate your patience and collaboration on this matter." Agent Action After Sending Template Close the case. Do not trigger CSAT (as the resolution is redirected to Amazon support)

title: How to: Transfer Cases related to Emma Stores
content: Table of Contents Introduction When to transfer How to recognize an Emma Store customer? How to transfer cases to Emma Store support-agents ​ 1) For Email cases 2) For Live Chat or Social Media cases 3) For Phone call cases Introduction This article focuses on transferring Emma Store cases to the designated Store Agents . Please have a look at the scenarios in which you have to transfer a case to the Store Agents and also how to do this action on the system. ATTENTION: We only have Emma Stores in the following countries: PT, ES, DE, NL and UK.  In case you need more information about the Stores, please check the articles HERE . When to transfer? If you are a CS agent who handles only orders bought directly from Emma's website and received a customer request related to an order bought at one of the physical Emma Stores in Europe.  In those situations, you must transfer the case to Store agents by following the indications presented below. IMPORTANT: If you need to transfer the case, but it is NOT an Emma Store related topic, please follow the instructions in the article "How to: Transfer Cases" . -> How to recognize an Emma Store customer?​ Please check this article to make sure you provide the best service possible. How to transfer cases to Emma Store support-agents? DISCLAIMER: The Emma Store support-agents can only handle Email cases, due to this we need to make sure the cases are transfered following the guidelines below to guarante they will be properly handled. 1) For Email cases: If you receive a customer email with a request related to Store order, just transfer to the correct Line of Business (LOB) by clicking on "Apply Macro" and then on "Change LOB": 2) For Live Chat or Social Media cases: Step 1: You must handle the customer interaction and explain to the customer that their order was purchased at an Emma Store, and due to this, the request needs to be handled by the designated support team, and for this you will transfer the case internally and the team will reach out to the customer via e-mail. You can also share the store support team contacts (listed above) with the customer. Step 2: Make sure the customer email address is available at the custome profile at Sprinklr. Check this before transfering the case. If there is no email there, please ask customer to provide their email address. Step 3: Finalize the interaction with the customer and then click to "Apply Macro". DO NOT fill the ACW information on this scenario. You need to Transfer the case first, and after the ACW will not be needed. ATTENTION: It is MANDATORY that when filling the Macro to transfer the case, you select the "Channel Type" as EMAIL, even if the case was originally a livechat or any other. It has ALWAYS to be transfered as "Email" type. 3) For Phone call cases: Step 1: You have to handle the customer phone call and explain to the customer that: their order was purchased at an Emma Store and due to this the request needs to be handled by the designated support team, and for this you will transfer the case internally and the team will reach out to the customer via e-mail. You can also share the store support team contacts (listed above) with the customer. Step 2: It is MANDATORY to have the customer email address available at the custome profile at Sprinklr. Check this before transfering the case. If there is no email there, please ask customer to provide their email address. Step 3: Leave a note on the "Case Collaboration" section summarizing what was discussed/requested from customer on the call with you. Please write down important information that will be needed to the other colleague be able to handle the case properly. Step 4: Finalize the interaction with the customer and then click to "Apply Macro". ( DO NOT fill the ACW right now, we must apply the macro first, the ACW will be the next step). ATTENTION: It is MANDATORY that when filling the Macro to transfer the case, you select the "Channel Type" as EMAIL, even if the case was originally a livechat or any other. It has ALWAYS to be transfered as "Email" type. Step 5: After the macro is applied, it is mandatory to fill in the ACW information. You can check your cases pending under the "Pending ACW". On the ACW window, you must select "YES" under the option "Sent to Store" and add the customer email address. It is MANDATORY to select this for cases related to Emma Store. title: How to: Use order search feature
content: What is the Order Search Feature? The Order Search feature enables you to quickly find and access cases associated with a specific order reference directly from the Sprinklr Care Console. This help you gain complete context about a customer's interactions and improve resolution times, regardless of the channel the customer used previously. key-words Sprinklr; Search; Order; Reference Why Use Order Search Quickly find all related customer cases. Gain full context about previous customer interactions. Improve efficiency and customer satisfaction. How to Use the Order Search Feature (Step-by-Step Navigate to the Order Search Button In the Agent Care Console, locate and click the Order Search button at the top right. ​ Enter the Order Reference In the pop-up window, enter the customer's order reference number and click Next . ​ Review the Related Cases A list of cases related to the entered order reference will appear, including information like: - Case Number - Creation Date - Channel - Initial Channel - Market - Status - Category ​ ​ Select the Relevant Case Click the radio button next to the case you want to view in detail. ​ Open the Selected Case After selecting the relevant case, click Next to open it directly within the Sprinklr Care Console. Note: You will see cases from all markets but can only open cases for markets assigned to your profile.
